results.name: blatant
results.english: very obvious and intentional, when this is a bad thing
results.example1: a blatant lie  彌天大謊
results.example2: The whole episode was a blatant attempt to gain publicity.  整個事件完全是旨在宣傳的露骨炒作。

results.name: intentional
results.english: planned or intended
results.example1: Did you leave his name out by accident or was it intentional? 你漏掉了他的名字，是無意的還是有意的？

results.name: smash
results.english: to cause something to break noisily into a lot of small pieces
results.example1: Rioters ran through the city, smashing windows and looting shops.  暴動者穿過市中心，砸碎商店櫥窗，掠劫店鋪裡的東西。
results.example2: She dropped her cup and watched it smash to pieces/to smithereens on the stone floor.  她掉了杯子，看著它在石地板上摔得粉碎。

results.name: machete
results.english: a large knife with a wide blade, used for cutting trees and plants or as a weapon
results.chinese: 大砍刀（用以砍伐或充當武器）

results.name: burst
results.english: to break open or apart suddenly, or to make something do this
results.example1: I hate it when balloons burst. 我討厭氣球突然破的時候。
results.example2: Suddenly the door burst open (= opened suddenly and forcefully) and police officers rushed in. 門突然被撞開了，員警衝了進來。

results.name: rabbi
results.english: a religious leader and teacher in the Jewish religion
results.chinese: 拉比（猶太教領袖和經師）
results.example1: Rabbi Jonathan Sacks  喬納森．薩克斯拉比
results.example2: [as form of address] Good morning, Rabbi. 早安，拉比。

results.name: Hanukkah
results.english: a Jewish religious holiday lasting for eight days in December
results.chinese: （猶太教的）獻殿節，光明節（在十二月，爲期八天）

results.name: went on a rampage
results.english: violent and usually wild behaviour
results.chinese: 橫衝直撞；撒野；狂暴行爲
results.example1: Rioters went on a/the rampage through the city. 暴亂分子在城中橫衝直撞，胡作非為。

results.name: an assailant
results.english: a person who attacks another person
results.example1: Can you describe your assailant? 你能描述一下襲擊你的人嗎？

results.name: coalition
results.english: the joining together of different political parties or groups for a particular purpose, usually for a limited time, or a government that is formed in this way
results.chinese: （不同政黨或不同群體的人為特定目標而暫時形成的）聯盟，同盟，聯合體
results.example1: Government by coalition has its own peculiar set of problems.  聯合政府有其自身特有的一系列問題。
results.example2: By forming a coalition, the rebels and the opposition parties defeated the government. 叛亂者與反對黨結成聯盟，擊敗了政府。

results.name: dilemma
results.english: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do
results.example1: The president is clearly in a dilemma about/over how to tackle the crisis.  對於如何化解危機總統明顯處於兩難境地。
results.example2: She faces the dilemma of disobeying her father or losing the man she loves. 她面臨著要麼違抗父親要麼失去心上人的兩難境地。

results.name: counteract
results.english: to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect
results.example1: Drinking a lot of water counteracts the dehydrating effects of hot weather.  大量飲水可緩解炎熱天氣引起的脫水。

results.name: offset
results.english: to balance one influence against an opposing influence, so that there is no great difference as a result
results.example1: The extra cost of travelling to work is offset by the lower price of houses here.  這裡低廉的房價抵消了因上班路途遠而產生的額外費用。
results.example2: UK He keeps his petrol receipts because petrol is one of the expenses that he can offset against tax (= can show to the government as being a business cost, and so not pay tax). 他保留著他的汽油費收據，因為汽油費是可以抵扣稅款的一項開支。

results.name: insulation
results.english: the act of covering something to stop heat, sound, or electricity from escaping or entering, or the fact that something is covered in this way
results.example1: The animal's thick fur provides very good insulation against the arctic cold. 動物的厚皮毛是防禦極地嚴寒的絕好材料。

results.name: debut
results.english: to perform or be introduced to the public for the first time
results.chinese: 首演，首次登臺；首次亮相
results.example1: The Broadway show debuted last year to great acclaim. 這個百老匯節目去年首次演出就受到了廣泛讚揚。

results.name: in secrecy
results.english: the state of being secret or of keeping something secret
results.example1: The content of her report is shrouded in secrecy (= being kept secret).  她的報告內容依然保秘。
results.example2: I'd love to tell you about it, but Martin's sworn me to secrecy (= made me promise not to tell anyone).  我想告訴你，可是馬丁命令我發誓保守秘密。

results.name: amid
results.english: in the middle of or surrounded by
results.example1: On the floor, amid mounds of books, were two small envelopes.  地板上的書堆裡有兩個小信封。
results.example2: The new perfume was launched amidst a fanfare of publicity. 這種新香水在一陣大張旗鼓的廣告宣傳下推出市場。

results.name: consensus
results.english: a generally accepted opinion or decision among a group of people
results.example1: The general consensus in the office is that he can't do his job.  辦公室成員一致認爲他無法勝任工作。
results.example2: Could we reach a consensus on this matter? Let's take a vote.  我們能在這件事上達成共識嗎？我們來表決吧。

results.name: become weak at the knees
results.english: If you go weak at the knees, you lose your strength and feel you are going to fall over, usually because of seeing or talking about either someone you are very attracted to or because of something unpleasant or frightening.
results.chinese: （通常指因看到或談到非常喜歡的人或讓人害怕的事而）膝蓋發軟的，腿發軟的
results.example1: The thought of kissing him made me go weak at the knees. 吻他的念頭令我膝蓋發軟。

results.name: be doomed to
results.english: certain to fail, die, or be destroyed
results.chinese: 註定失敗（或滅亡、毀滅）的
results.example1: This is a doomed city. 這是一座註定要毀滅的城市。

results.name: skulk
results.english: to hide or move around as if trying not to be seen, usually with bad intentions
results.example1: I thought I saw someone skulking in the bushes - maybe we should call the police. 我好像看見有人藏在灌木叢裡——也許我們應該報警。

results.name: well-fed
results.english: having a lot to eat
results.example1: It should be possible to be warm and well-fed, and to enjoy all the good things of life, while respecting the needs of the planet. 在兼顧地球自身需要的同時，滿足人們吃飽、穿暖並享受生活中所有美好事物的需求，是完全有可能的。

results.name: homely
results.english: plain or ordinary, but pleasant
results.example1: The hotel was homely and comfortable.  這家飯店簡潔樸素，令人感覺舒適愜意。

results.name: bombard…with
results.english: to direct so many things at someone, especially to ask them so many questions, that they find it difficult to deal with them
results.chinese: 拿…圍攻…；（尤指）向…大量提問
results.example1: The children bombarded her with questions. 孩子們連珠炮似地問了她許多問題。

results.name: clear-cut
results.english: clear or obvious without needing any proof
results.chinese: 清楚的；明白無誤的；顯而易見的
results.example1: She has clear-cut evidence that the company cheated her.  她有確鑿的證據證明公司欺騙了她。

results.name: fertility
results.english: (of animals and plants) the quality of being able to produce young or fruit
results.example1: a fertility symbol  生殖力的象徵
results.example2: declining fertility rates  下降的生育率

results.name: a bias towards
results.english: the action of supporting or opposing a particular person or thing in an unfair way, because of allowing personal opinions to influence your judgment
results.example1: The senator has accused the media of bias. 參議員指責新聞媒體有偏見。
results.example2: There has always been a slight bias in favour of/towards employing liberal arts graduates in the company.  公司內部一直有點偏向聘請文科畢業生。

results.name: manifest
results.english: to show something clearly, through signs or actions
results.example1: The workers chose to manifest their dissatisfaction in a series of strikes. 工人決定藉一連串罷工來表達他們的不滿。
results.example2: Lack of confidence in the company manifested itself in a fall in the share price. 人們對公司缺乏信心表現為股價下跌。

results.name: crooked
results.english: not forming a straight line, or having many bends
results.example1: You have to drive slowly on these crooked country roads.  在這些彎彎曲曲的鄉間小路上開車得慢點。
results.example2: His front teeth are crooked.  他的門牙長得歪歪扭扭。

results.name: procreate
results.english: to produce young

results.name: undertake
results.english: to do or begin to do something, especially something that will take a long time or be difficult
results.chinese: （開始）做，承擔，從事（尤指耗時或困難之事）
results.example1: Students are required to undertake simple experiments.  要求學生們做些簡單的實驗。

results.name: exude
results.english: If you exude love, confidence, pain, etc., you show that you have a lot of that feeling.
results.chinese: 明顯地流露，充分顯露（愛、自信、痛苦等）
results.example1: She just exudes confidence.  她顯得信心十足。

results.name: femininity
results.english: the fact or quality of having characteristics that are traditionally thought to be typical of or suitable for a woman
results.example1: Long hair was traditionally regarded as a sign of femininity.
results.example2: The flowers and cream lace of the dress indicate femininity and delicacy.

results.name: fluid
results.english: If situations, ideas, or plans are fluid, they are not fixed and are likely to change, often repeatedly and unexpectedly.
results.chinese: （情況、想法或計劃）不固定的，易變的
results.example1: The military situation is still very fluid.  軍事局勢依然很不穩定。

results.name: delicate
results.english: needing careful treatment, especially because easily damaged
results.example1: Peaches have delicate skins which are easily bruised.  桃子的表皮很嬌嫩，容易碰傷。
results.example2: Delicate plants need to be kept in a greenhouse during the winter.  嬌貴的植物需要在溫室裡過冬。

results.name: hour-glass figure
results.english: If a woman has an hourglass figure, she has a very small waist.
results.chinese: 形容女生的「前凸後翹曲線」

results.name: starvation
results.english: the state of having no food for a long period, often causing death
results.example1: 20 million people face starvation unless a vast emergency aid programme is launched. 若不啟動大型緊急援助專案計劃，兩千萬人將有餓死的危險。

results.name: vitality
results.english: energy and strength
results.example1: According to the packet, these vitamin pills will restore lost vitality. 據包裝上的說明，這些維他命片可以恢復活力。

results.name: barbaric
results.english: extremely cruel and unpleasant
results.example1: She found the idea of killing animals for pleasure barbaric.  她認為為了取樂而獵殺動物的想法非常殘忍。
results.example2: barbaric acts of violence  野蠻的暴力行為

results.name: earlobe
results.english: the soft round part at the bottom of the ear

results.name: in vogue
results.english: a fashion or general liking, especially one that is temporary
results.example1: In the 1920s, short hair for women became the vogue.  20世紀20年代，女性留短髮成為時尚。
results.example2: The postwar vogue for tearing down buildings virtually destroyed the city's architecture.  戰後盛行的拆毀建築行為實際上破壞了該城市的建築風格。

results.name: cosmetic surgery
results.english: any medical operation that is intended to improve a person's appearance rather than their health

results.name: tummy tuck
results.chinese: 收胃手術、把胃或屁股收起來。是不正式的用法, 可以解讀說「肚肚」XD

results.name: implant
results.english: an organ, group of cells, or device that has been put into the body in a medical operation
results.chinese: 醫生整形時, 放到胸部或屁股裡的那個填充物
results.example1: breast/heart valve implants  乳房填充物／人工心臟瓣膜

results.name: tadpoles
results.english: a small, black creature with a large head and long tail that lives in water and develops into a frog or toad

results.name: transient.
results.english: lasting for only a short time; temporary
results.chinese: 短暫的，轉瞬即逝的；暫時的
results.example1: A glass of whisky has only a _____ warming effect. 一杯威士卡只能使人暖和一會兒。
results.example2: The city has a large _____ population. 這個城市有大量暫住人口。

results.name: evaporate
results.english: to cause a liquid to change to a gas, especially by heating
results.example1: The high concentration of sugars forms a syrup when the sap _____s. 當樹汁中的水分蒸發時, 糖分就濃縮成糖漿。
results.example2: Plants keep cool during the summer by _____ing water from their leaves. 夏天植物透過葉子蒸發水分保持清涼。

results.name: nursery
results.english: a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work
results.example1: Does Jake go to a nursery or a childminder? 傑克是去托兒所還是由家庭保育員照顧？

results.name: overnight
results.english: for or during the night
results.chinese: 一夜間（的）；在夜間（的），在晚上（的）
results.example1: an _____ stop in Paris 在巴黎停留過夜
results.example2: You can stay _____ if you want to. 要是你願意, 可以住一晚。

results.name: a brood
results.english: a group of young birds all born at the same time
results.example1: The blackbird flew back and forth to its _____. 畫眉飛來飛去的, 忙於哺育幼雛。

results.name: jack-o-lantern
results.english: a light made from a hollow pumpkin with holes cut into the sides like the eyes and mouth of a person's face, inside which there is a candle
results.chinese: 萬聖節那顆被挖空的南瓜殼, 有著恐怖笑臉的那顆

results.name: devour
results.english: to eat something eagerly and in large amounts so that nothing is left
results.example1: The young cubs hungrily _____ed the deer. 幼獅們貪婪地吞食著鹿肉。

results.name: nourish
results.english: to provide people or living things with food in order to make them grow and keep them healthy
results.example1: Children need plenty of good fresh food to _____ them. 孩子們需要大量的新鮮食物來提供營養。
results.example2: She looks happy and well _____ed. 她看起來很快樂, 且營養良好。

results.name: you're in good company.
results.english: to have the same problem as many other people
results.example1: I can't play tennis - I'm hopeless at it! Oh well, you're in good company.  「我不會打網球——我對網球一竅不通！」「噢，是嗎，像你這樣的大有人在。」

results.name: counterproductive
results.english: having an effect that is opposite to the one intended or wanted
results.chinese: 産生相反效果的；産生相反作用的；事與願違的，適得其反的

results.name: cull
results.english: When people cull animals, they kill them, especially the weaker members of a particular group of them, in order to reduce or limit their number.
results.chinese: （為減少或限制數量而對動物）選擇性宰殺，剔除（尤指病弱動物）
results.example1: The plan to cull large numbers of baby seals has angered environmental groups. 選擇性捕殺大量小海豹的計劃引起了環保組織的強烈憤慨。

results.name: bolster or bolster up
results.english: to support or improve something or make it stronger
results.example1: More money is needed to bolster the industry. 需要更多的錢來扶持該行業。
results.example2: She tried to bolster my confidence/morale (= encourage me and make me feel stronger) by telling me that I had a special talent. 她説我有特別的才能，想要增強我的信心。

results.name: precarious
results.english: in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly
results.chinese: 「危險的」, 特別指那種暫時沒事, 但隨時很可能會毫無預警GG的狀態

results.name: last-ditch attempt
results.english: an effort or attempt that is made at the end of a series of failures to solve a problem, and is not expected to succeed
results.chinese: 最後一招，最後一根救命稻草；孤注一擲
results.example1: He resigned in a last-ditch attempt to save his party from electoral defeat. 為了避免他所在的政黨在大選中失利，他使出了最後一招——辭去了領導職務。

results.name: rather
results.english: more accurately; more exactly
results.example1: She'll fly to California on Thursday, or rather, she will if she has to.  她將於週四飛去加州，更確切地說，如果她不得不去的話。
results.example2: He's my sister's friend really, rather than mine.  確切地說，他是我妹妹的朋友，而不是我的。

results.name: outgrow
results.english: to grow bigger than or too big for something
results.chinese: 長得比…大；長得太大（而不再需要）
results.example1: My seven-year-old got new shoes in April, and he's already outgrown them (= his feet have grown too large for them).  我七歲的兒子四月份剛買了雙新鞋，現在已經穿不下了。
results.example2: The company outgrew (= became too large for) its office space.  公司擴充發展後，辦公室不夠用了。

results.name: predation
results.english: the fact that an animal hunts, kills, and eats other animals
results.chinese: 生物裡的用法, 一方總是補食另一方的這種「關係」

results.name: an indiscriminate terrorist
results.english: not showing careful thought or planning, especially so that harm results
results.chinese: 不加思考的，未加計劃的，任意的（尤指帶來不良後果）
results.example1: an indiscriminate terrorist attack on civilians  對平民肆意的恐怖襲擊
results.example2: The indiscriminate use of fertilizers can cause long-term problems.  濫用化肥可能導致長期的問題。

results.name: forage for
results.english: to go from place to place searching for things that you can eat or use
results.example1: The children had been living on the streets, foraging for scraps. 那些孩子露宿街頭，四處尋找殘羹剩飯。
results.example2: The children had been living on the streets,  _____ing ___ scraps. 那些孩子露宿街頭, 四處尋找殘羹剩飯。

results.name: offspring
results.english: a person's children
results.chinese: (人的) 後代, 子女, 子嗣
results.example1: Tom's sister came over on Saturday with all her _____. 湯姆的姐姐星期六帶著她的一大群子女過來串門。

results.name: a handful of
results.english: an amount of something that can be held in one hand
results.example1: He pulled out ___ _____ ___ coins from his pocket. 他從口袋裡掏出一把硬幣。

results.name: juvenile
results.english: relating to a young person who is not yet old enough to be considered an adult

results.name: clutch
results.english: a small group of eggs produced by the same bird, especially in a nest

results.name: snack
results.english: to eat small amounts of food between meals
results.chinese: (在正餐之間) 吃零食, 吃零嘴
results.example1: I've been _____ing all day. 我吃了一天的零食。

results.name: hatchling
results.english: a young bird or animal that has recently come out of its egg:
results.chinese: 剛被孵出來的小雞, n

results.name: eerie
results.english: strange in a frightening and mysterious way
results.example1: She heard the eerie noise of the wind howling through the trees.  她聽到風吹過樹叢發出怪異而可怕的呼嘯聲。
results.example2: He had the eerie feeling that he had met this stranger before. 他有種恐怖而奇異的感覺，覺得以前見過這個陌生人。

results.name: predator
results.english: an animal that hunts, kills, and eats other animals
results.chinese: 捕食性動物, 食肉動物
results.example1: lions,  wolves,  and other _____ 獅子、狼及其他食肉動物

results.name: be receptive to + V-ing
results.english: willing to listen to and accept new ideas and suggestions
results.chinese: (對於新思想和建議) 樂於接受的, 從善如流的
results.example1: The government is not _____ ___ the idea of a Freedom of Information Act. 政府對制定《資訊自由法》的意見充耳不聞。

results.name: mate
results.english: to have sex and produce young, or to make animals do this
results.example1: Tigers _____ repeatedly over a period of several days. 老虎在幾天裡多次交配。

results.name: maggot
results.english: a creature like a very small worm that is found in decaying meat and other foods and later develops into a fly

results.name: scramble up the rocks
results.english: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you
results.example1: She scrambled up the steep hillside and over the rocks.  她爬上了陡峭的山坡，翻過岩石。
results.example2: He scrambled into his clothes (= put them on quickly) and raced to get help. 他匆匆套上衣服，跑去尋求救援。

results.name: somersault
results.english: a rolling movement or jump, either forwards or backwards, in which you turn over completely, with your body above your head, and finish with your head on top again
results.example1: She was so happy she turned three somersaults on the lawn. 她太高興了，在草坪上連翻了三個筋斗。

results.name: abdomen
results.english: the lower part of a person's or animal's body, containing the stomach, bowels, and other organs, or the end of an insect's body
results.chinese: （人或動物的）腹（部）；（昆蟲的）腹部

results.name: the fray
results.english: an energetic and often not well-organized effort, activity, fight, or disagreement
results.chinese: （常指亂糟糟的）幹勁十足的努力，充滿活力的活動；激戰；激烈爭吵
results.example1: With a third country about to enter (= take part in) the fray, the fighting looks set to continue.  由於有第三國要加入衝突，戰鬥看來很可能會繼續下去。
results.example2: A good holiday should leave you feeling refreshed and ready for the fray (= ready to work) again.  好好度一個假應該能使人感到精神振奮，為重新投入忙碌的工作作好準備。

results.name: pantry
results.english: a small room or large cupboard in a house where food is kept
results.chinese: 食品貯藏室，食品儲藏櫃

results.name: sink our teeth into
results.chinese: 很深很專注地involve在某件事裡
results.example1: I sank my teeth into the sandwich.

results.name: right out/off the bat
results.chinese: 某某電玩比賽，XXX玩家一出場就「直接俐落的」連拿2場勝利

results.name: attribute to
results.english: to think that someone or something has a particular quality or feature
results.chinese: 將（某種特質）歸屬於（某人）；認為（某人）有（某種特性）
results.example1: I wouldn't dream of attributing such a lack of judgment to you. 我做夢也想不到你會如此缺乏判斷力。

results.name: sleek
results.english: (especially of hair, clothes, or shapes) smooth, shiny, and lying close to the body, and therefore looking well cared for; not untidy and with no parts sticking out
results.chinese: (尤指頭髮、衣服) 平滑發亮的, 整潔的；(外形) 線條流暢的
results.example1: The cat had _____ fur. 那隻貓的皮毛油光發亮。
results.example2: Who owns that _____ black car parked outside your house? 停在你房子外面的那輛造型優雅的黑色汽車是誰的?

results.name: stigma
results.english: a strong feeling of disapproval that most people in a society have about something, especially when this is unfair
results.chinese: 恥辱, (尤指不公正的) 惡名
results.example1: There is no longer any _____ to being divorced. 離婚不再是甚麼恥辱的事了。
results.example2: Being an unmarried mother no longer carries the social _____ that it used to. 未婚媽媽不再像過去那樣在社會上背負惡名了。

results.name: inconspicuous
results.english: not easily or quickly noticed or seen, or not attracting attention
results.chinese: 不顯眼的，不引人注目的
results.example1: This type of bird is very inconspicuous because of its dull feathers. 這種鳥因其羽毛灰暗而毫不起眼。
results.example2: At parties, he always stands in a corner and tries to look inconspicuous. 在聚會上他總是站在角落裡，盡量不惹人注意。

results.name: subtle
results.english: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
results.chinese: 隱約的；暗淡的；不易察覺的，不明顯的；微妙的
results.example1: The room was painted a subtle shade of pink.  房間被刷成了淡粉色。
results.example2: The play's message is perhaps too subtle to be understood by young children.  這部戲的內涵過於隱晦，小孩子可能難以理解。

results.name: a plume of
results.english: a tall, thin mass of smoke, dust, or similar substance that rises up into the air
results.example1: After the explosion, a plume of smoke could be seen in the sky for miles around. 爆炸發生後，方圓幾英哩都能看得見天空中的煙霧。

results.name: stripped-down
results.english: Something that is stripped down has been reduced to its simplest form.
results.example1: [before noun] I think the stripped-down version of your proposal has more chance of being accepted. 我認為你簡化過的提案比較有可能被接受。

results.name: set sb/sth apart from
results.english: If a quality or characteristic sets someone or something apart, it shows him, her, or it to be different from, and usually better than, others of the same type.
results.example1: What set her apart from the other candidates for the job was that she had a lot of original ideas.她與其他求職者不同的地方在於，她有許多獨特的見解。

results.name: testimonial
results.english: a statement about the character or qualities of someone or something

results.name: unregulated
results.english: An unregulated type of business or activity is not controlled and directed by fixed rules or laws.
results.chinese: （企業或活動）未加監管的，缺乏規範的
results.example1: Parents have the right to expect information to guide them through a growing, yet unregulated market (place).  家長們有權獲知相關資訊，從而可以正確把握這一規模日益擴大但缺乏監管的市場。

results.name: prime
results.english: to tell someone something that will prepare them for a particular situation
results.chinese: 事先給（某人）提供情況，使有所準備
results.example1: I'd been primed so I knew not to mention her son. 因為事先得到提醒，所以我知道別提起她的兒子。

results.name: substance abuse
results.english: the use of a drug to get pleasure, or to improve a person's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it

results.name: a potent weapon
results.english: very powerful, forceful, or effective
results.chinese: 強有力的, 強大的；有效力的
results.example1: Surprise remains the terrorists' most _____ weapon. 突襲仍是恐怖分子最強有力的武器。
results.example2: The Berlin Wall was a _____ symbol of the Cold War. 柏林圍牆是冷戰的有力象徵。

results.name: irritating
results.english: making you feel annoyed
results.example1: an irritating habit 煩人的習慣

results.name: allege
results.english: to say that someone has done something illegal or wrong without giving proof
results.example1: [+ (that)] The two men allege (that) the police forced them to make false confessions. 這兩名男子聲稱警方逼迫他們作假口供。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] She is alleged to have been at the centre of an international drug ring. 據稱她一直是某國際販毒集團的核心人物。

results.name: pledge
results.english: a serious or formal promise, especially one to give money or to be a friend, or something that you give as a sign that you will keep a promise
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] All the candidates have given/made pledges not to raise taxes if they are elected.  所有的候選人都保證當選後不增稅。
results.example2: Thousands of people made pledges (= promised to give money) to the charity campaign.  數千人承諾捐款給救助兒童慈善運動。

results.name: pod
results.english: a long, narrow, flat part of some plants, such as beans and peas, that contains the seeds and usually has a thick skin
results.example1: seed pods  心皮
results.example2: a pea/vanilla pod 豌豆莢／香子蘭莢

results.name: confetti
results.english: small pieces of coloured paper that you throw at a celebration, especially over two people who have just been married
results.chinese: （尤指結婚等慶典時拋撒的）五彩碎紙

results.name: be skeptical about
results.english: doubting that something is true or useful
results.example1: Many experts remain skeptical about/of his claims.  很多專家對他的主張仍然持懷疑態度。

results.name: spawn
results.english: to cause something new, or many new things, to grow or start suddenly
results.example1: The new economic freedom has spawned hundreds of new small businesses. 新的經濟自由催生了上百家新的小企業。
results.example2: Her death spawned countless films and books. 她的去世促成了無數電影和書籍面世。

results.name: abundant
results.english: more than enough
results.example1: an abundant supply of food  充足的食品供應
results.example2: There is abundant evidence that cars have a harmful effect on the environment.  有充分證據顯示，汽車對環境有害。

results.name: suffocate
results.english: to (cause someone to) die because of not having enough oxygen
results.example1: The report said that the victims had suffocated in the fumes. 報告說那些受害者是被煙熏死的。
results.example2: She suffocated him by holding a pillow over his head. 她用枕頭壓在他的頭上，把他悶死。

results.name: respiration
results.english: breathing
results.example1: Her respiration was slow and difficult.  她呼吸緩慢、吃力。
results.example2: The diaphragm is the principal muscle of respiration.  膈膜是主要的呼吸肌。

results.name: ferment
results.english: If food or drink ferments or if you ferment it, the sugar in it changes into alcohol because of a chemical process.
results.example1: You make wine by leaving grape juice to ferment until all the sugar has turned to alcohol.  釀葡萄酒是讓葡萄汁發酵，直到所有的糖分都轉化為酒精。

results.name: apocalypse
results.english: a very serious event resulting in great destruction and change
results.example1: The book offers a vision of the future in which there is a great nuclear apocalypse. 這本書描述了未來核戰爭帶來的滅頂之災。

results.name: obliterate
results.english: to remove all signs of something, either by destroying it or by covering it so that it cannot be seen
results.example1: The missile strike was devastating the target was totally _____ed.  這次導彈襲擊是毀滅性的——目標蕩然無存。
results.example2: All of a sudden the view was _____ed by the fog.  突然之間霧氣淹沒了這片景象。

results.name: oblivion
results.english: the state of being completely forgotten
results.example1: He was another minor poet who was consigned to oblivion. 他又是一位湮沒無聞的小詩人。
results.example2: These toys will be around for a year or two, then fade/slide/sink into oblivion. 這些玩具會風行一兩年，然後漸漸被人遺忘。

results.name: crust
results.english: a hard outer covering of something
results.example1: pie crust (= the cooked pastry on top) 餡餅皮
results.example2: the earth's crust 地殼

results.name: landfill
results.english: the process of getting rid of large amounts of rubbish by burying it, or a place where rubbish is buried
results.example1: 90 percent of American rubbish is dumped in landfill sites. 美國90%的垃圾都是傾倒進垃圾掩埋場。

results.name: sustainable
results.english: able to continue over a period of time
results.chinese: 可持續的，能長期保持的
results.example1: That sort of extreme diet is not sustainable over a long period. 那種極端的飲食方式無法長期堅持。

results.name: anaerobic
results.english: not needing or without oxygen
results.example1: Some bacteria can only live in anaerobic conditions.  有些細菌只能在無氧條件下生存。
results.example2: anaerobic exercise 無氧運動

results.name: unaccounted for
results.english: If a person is unaccounted for, it is not known where they are or whether they are still alive.
results.example1: A fire on the ship killed a hundred or more passengers - some likely victims are still unaccounted for.  船上的大火讓一百多名乘客喪生，可能還有些人生死未知。

results.name: sewage
results.english: waste matter such as water or human urine or solid waste
results.example1: Some cities in the world do not have proper facilities for the disposal of sewage. 世界上的某些城市沒有適當的污水處理設施。
results.example2: Raw/untreated sewage is being pumped into the sea, from where it pollutes our beaches.  未經處理的污水被排入大海，污染了我們的海灘。

results.name: biogas
results.english: a gas containing methane that can be burned as a fuel, produced by dead plants and animals as they decay

results.name: aflame
results.english: burning
results.example1: The whole village was aflame. 整個村子都陷入一片火海中。

results.name: aggregate
results.english: something formed by adding together several amounts or things
results.chinese: 聚集體，集成體；總數，合計
results.example1: They purchased an aggregate of 3,000 shares in the company. 他們總共買了這家公司的3000股股票。
results.example2: Snowflakes are loose aggregates of ice crystals.  雪花是冰晶鬆散的凝聚體。

results.name: wear on
results.english: If a period of time wears on, it seems to pass very slowly.
results.example1: She felt less confident about finishing the work as the week wore on. 隨著這一週的時間慢慢過去，她更加覺得沒有信心完成這項工作。

results.name: granular
results.english: made of, or seeming like, granules
results.chinese: 由顆粒構成的；顆粒狀的
results.example1: a granular texture 粒狀結構

results.name: To put it in perspective
results.english: to compare something to other things so that it can be accurately and fairly judged
results.chinese: 客觀地比較；客觀地審查
results.example1: Total investments for this year reached $53 million, and, to put this into perspective, investments this year were double those made in 2013.  今年的總投資額達到5300萬美元，客觀地來看，這是2013年的兩倍。

results.name: ease off
results.english: to gradually stop or become less
results.example1: At last the rain began to ease off. 最終雨勢開始減弱了。

results.name: carousel
results.english: a large machine at a fair that turnsround and has wooden or plastic animals or vehicles on which children ride

results.name: trait
results.english: a particular characteristic that can produce a particular type of behaviour
results.example1: His sense of humour is one of his better _____s. 具有幽默感是他更討人喜歡的特點之一。
results.example2: Arrogance is a very unattractive personality/character _____. 傲慢是一種非常令人討厭的性格特點。

results.name: flee
results.english: to escape by running away, especially because of danger or fear
results.example1: She fled (from) the room in tears. 她哭著跑出房間。
results.example2: In order to escape capture, he fled to the mountains. 為了免遭俘虜，他逃到了山裡。

results.name: value
results.english: to consider something important
results.example1: I've always valued her advice. 我對她的建議一向很重視。

results.name: level-headed
results.english: calm and able to deal easily with difficult situations

results.name: overwhelm
results.english: to cause someone to feel sudden strong emotion
results.chinese: （強烈的感情）充溢，使難以承受，使不知所措
results.example1: They were overwhelmed with/by grief when their baby died. 嬰兒夭折時他們悲痛欲絕。
results.example2: I was overwhelmed by all the flowers and letters of support I received. 收到這些鮮花和支持者的來信令我激動得不知所措。

results.name: getting caught up in
results.english: to become involved in something, often without wanting to
results.example1: They were having an argument and somehow I got caught up in it. 他們在爭論，不知怎麼把我捲了進去。

results.name: devise
results.english: to invent a plan, system, object, etc., usually using your intelligence or imagination
results.chinese: 巧妙構思；巧妙設計；發明
results.example1: He's good at _____ing language games that you can play with students in class.他善於設計可供師生在課堂上使用的語言遊戲。
results.example2: The cartoon characters Snoopy and Charlie Brown were _____ed by Charles M. Schultz.卡通人物史諾比和查理‧布朗是由查爾斯‧M‧舒茲設計的。

results.name: cope with
results.english: to deal successfully with a difficult situation
results.example1: It must be really hard to cope with three young children and a job.  要照顧三個小孩還要工作肯定不容易。
results.example2: It's only been a year since he died - how's she coping?  他過世剛一年時間——她的情況怎麼樣？

results.name: rigid
results.english: stiff or fixed; not able to be bent or moved
results.chinese: 僵硬的；固定的；不能彎曲的
results.example1: a rigid steel and concrete structure 堅固的鋼筋混凝土結構
results.example2: I was rigid with (= stiff and unable to move because of) fear. 我被嚇得呆若木雞。

results.name: empathetic
results.english: having the ability to imagine how someone else feels
results.chinese: 表示同情的；有同感的，産生共鳴的
results.example1: a kind and empathetic friend
results.example2: programmes training doctors to be empathic

results.name: a sense of despair
results.english: the feeling that there is no hope and that you can do nothing to improve a difficult or worrying situation
results.example1: a sense of _____ 絕望的情緒／感覺
results.example2: They're in _____ over the money they've lost. 他們對找回丟失的錢已經不抱任何希望了。(絕望)

results.name: gut feeling、gut instinct
results.english: a strong belief about someone or something that cannot completely be explained and does not have to be decided by reasoning
results.example1: I have a gut feeling that the relationship won't last. 我有種直覺，這段關係不會太長久。

results.name: when it comes to...
results.chinese: 要是(如果) 怎樣怎樣的話

results.name: pitch-dark, or pitch-black
results.english: extremely dark
results.example1: a moonless, pitch-black night 沒有月亮的漆黑夜晚

results.name: stunts
results.english: an exciting action, usually in a film, that is dangerous or appears dangerous and usually needs to be done by someone skilled
results.example1: It's a typical action movie with plenty of spectacular stunts.  這是部典型的動作片，有很多精彩好看的特技。
results.example2: Tom Cruise has performed his own stunts for Mission Impossible 2, defying warnings from professionals. 湯姆‧克魯斯不顧專業人員的警告，在《不可能的任務 2》中親自表演自己角色的特技動作。

results.name: regardless
results.english: despite; not being affected by something
results.chinese: 不管怎樣，無論如何；不管，不顧
results.example1: The plan for a new office building went ahead regardless of local opposition. 儘管遭到當地居民的反對，新建高層辦公大樓的計劃還是付諸實施了。
results.example2: This job is open to all, regardless of previous experience. 這份工作任何人都可以應聘，不管其以前的工作經歷如何。

results.name: stand out
results.english: to be much better than other similar things or people
results.example1: We had lots of good applicants for the job, but one stood out from the rest. 我們這個職位的申請者有很多都不錯，但是其中一個人格外出眾。

results.name: an autocratic style
results.english: relating to an autocrat
results.chinese: 獨裁的；專制的；獨斷專行的；專橫的
results.example1: an autocratic ruler/regime  獨裁統治者／政體
results.example2: an autocratic style of government/leadership/management  獨斷專行的統治方式／領導風格／管理方法

results.name: hazy
results.english: Hazy air or weather is not clear, especially because of heat.
results.chinese: 霧濛濛的，空氣不清晰的（尤指熱天）
results.example1: hazy sunshine 霧濛濛的日光
results.example2: the hazy days of summer 霧濛濛的夏日

results.name: elaborate on
results.english: to add more information to or explain something that you have said
results.example1: The congresswoman said she was resigning,  but refused to _____ ___ her reasons for doing so. 這位國會女議員說她要辭職, 但拒絕說明辭職的原因。

results.name: impose
results.english: to officially force a rule, tax, punishment, etc. to be obeyed or received
results.example1: Very high taxes have recently been imposed on cigarettes. 最近對香煙開徵很高的稅。
results.example2: The council has imposed a ban on alcohol in the city parks. 市政會禁止在城市公園中飲酒。

results.name: mandatory
results.english: Something that is mandatory must be done, or is demanded by law.
results.chinese: 強制的；必須履行的；法定的
results.example1: The minister is calling for mandatory prison sentences for people who assault police officers.  部長呼籲把襲警者須受的懲罰定為強制監禁。
results.example2: Athletes must undergo a mandatory drugs test before competing in the championship.  運動員在參加錦標賽前必須接受強制性藥檢。

results.name: contingency
results.english: something that might possibly happen in the future, usually causing problems or making further arrangements necessary
results.chinese: 可能發生的事；意外事件，不測事件
results.example1: You must be able to deal with all possible contingencies.  你必須能應付一切可能發生的意外事件。
results.example2: Have you made any contingency plans?  你們制訂應急方案了嗎？

results.name: deplete the resources
results.english: to reduce something in size or amount, especially supplies of energy, money, etc.
results.chinese: 消耗；耗費 (資源、金錢、精力等)
results.example1: If we continue to _____ the earth's natural resources,  we will cause serious damage to the environment. 如果我們繼續消耗地球上的自然資源, 將對環境造成嚴重的破壞。
results.example2: The illness _____s the body of important vitamins.這種疾病會消耗人體中重要的維他命。

results.name: diminish
results.english: to reduce or be reduced in size or importance
results.example1: I don't want to diminish her achievements, but she did have a lot of help.  我不想貶低她的成就，但她確實得到了很多幫助。
results.example2: These memories will not be diminished by time.  這些記憶不會隨著時間的流逝而淡漠。

results.name: withhold
results.english: to refuse to give something or to keep back something
results.example1: to withhold information/support 拒絕提供消息／給予支援
results.example2: She withheld her rent until the landlord agreed to have the repairs done. 她拒付房租，直到房東答應進行維修。

results.name: force majeure
results.english: an unexpected event such as a war,  crime,  or an earthquake which prevents someone from doing something that is written in a legal agreement
results.chinese: 你愈是答應人家要做到什麼, 就愈有一股力量阻止你辦到, 那股力量叫xxxxx xxxxx

results.name: tedious
results.english: boring
results.example1: a tedious job  單調乏味的工作
results.example2: The problem is I find most forms of exercise so tedious.  問題是我覺得大多數形式的鍛煉都很乏味。

results.name: feasibility
results.english: the possibility that can be made, done, or achieved, or is reasonable
results.example1: We're looking at the feasibility of building a shopping centre there.  我們正在考慮在那裡興建一個購物中心的可行性。

results.name: adhere to
results.english: to continue to obey a rule or have a belief
results.example1: They failed to adhere to the terms of the agreement/treaty. 他們沒有遵守協議／條約的條款。
results.example2: The translator has obviously adhered very strictly to the original text. 顯然，譯者嚴格忠實於原文。

results.name: be prone to
results.english: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
results.chinese: 易於遭受(疾病)的；有(消極)傾向的
results.example1: I've always been _____ ___ headaches.我總是容易頭痛。
results.example2: He was _____ ___ depression even as a teenager.甚至在青少年時期他就容易情緒抑鬱。

results.name: garner
results.english: to collect something, usually after much work or with difficulty
results.chinese: （通常指做大量工作或經歷很多困難而）收集，積累，獲得
results.example1: Coppola garnered several Oscar awards for The Godfather. 哥普拉以其執導的電影《教父》獲得數項奧斯卡奬。

results.name: get bogged down
results.english: to be/become so involved in something difficult or complicated that you cannot do anything else
results.example1: Let's not get bogged down with individual complaints我們不要被個別人的投訴束縛住手腳。
results.example2: UK Try not to get too bogged down in the details. 盡量不要被細節問題捆住手腳。

results.name: reconcile
results.english: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are opposed to each other can agree and exist together
results.example1: It is sometimes difficult to reconcile science and religion.有時很難調和宗教和科學之間的矛盾。
results.example2: It's difficult to reconcile such different points of view. 差別如此懸殊的觀點是很難達成一致的。

results.name: beware of
results.part: (v) [ I or T ] [ only in infinitive and imperative ]
results.english: used to warn someone to be very careful about something or someone
results.example1: You should beware of undercooked food when staying in hot countries. 留在氣候炎熱的國家裡，小心別吃未煮熟的食物。
results.example2: Beware of falling asleep while sunbathing. 曬日光浴時當心睡著。

results.name: conform
results.english: to behave according to the usual standards of behaviour that are expected by a group or society
results.chinese: 順從；遵從；隨大流，順應習俗
results.example1: At our school, you were required to conform, and there was no place for originality.  我們學校要求每個人循規蹈矩，容不得創新求變。

results.name: cluster
results.english: [+ sing/pl verb] a group of similar things that are close together, sometimes surrounding something
results.example1: Have a look at the cluster of galaxies in this photograph. 看看這張照片上的星系群。
results.example2: There was a cluster of fans around him, asking for autographs. 一大群仰慕者圍著他，找他簽名。

results.name: ravage
results.english: to cause great damage to something
results.example1: The area has been ravaged by drought/floods/war. 這一地區飽受乾旱／洪水／戰爭的蹂躪。

results.name: creep
results.english: to move slowly, quietly, and carefully, usually in order to avoid being noticed
results.chinese: （通常指爲避免注意而）緩慢行進，悄悄移動，潛行
results.example1: She turned off the light and crept through the door. 她關上燈，悄悄溜出門。
results.example2: Someone was creeping around outside my window. 有人在我的窗戶外躡手躡腳地走動。

results.name: collaborative
results.english: involving two or more people working together for a special purpose
results.example1: The presentation was a collaborative effort by all the children in the class. 演出是全班孩子共同努力的成果。

results.name: ascertain
results.chinese: 弄清, 確定, 查明
results.example1: The police have so far been unable to _____ the cause of the explosion. 警方到目前為止尚未查明爆炸原因。
results.example2: Have you _____ed whether she's coming or not? 你問清楚了嗎, 她來還是不來？

results.name: appraisal
results.english: the act of examining someone or something in order to judge their qualities, success, or needs
results.example1: The newspaper gave an editorial appraisal of the government's achievements of the past year.  這家報紙發表社論，對政府在過去一年的功績作出評價。

results.name: in compliance with
results.english: the act of obeying an order, rule, or request
results.example1: It is the job of the inspectors to enforce compliance with the regulations. 強制人們遵守法規是督察的責任。
results.example2: The company said that it had always acted in compliance with environmental laws. 該公司稱其一向遵守環境法。

results.name: downtime
results.english: the time during which a machine, especially a computer, is not working or is not able to be used
results.chinese: （尤指電腦等機器的）停止工作期

results.name: hold someone back
results.english: to stop someone or something developing or doing as well as they should
results.example1: She felt that having children would hold her back. 她覺得生小孩會阻礙她發展事業。

results.name: anomaly
results.english: a person or thing that is different from what is usual, or not in agreement with something else and therefore not satisfactory
results.chinese: 異常的人（或事物）；不規則；（同一種類中的）畸形
results.example1: Statistical anomalies can make it difficult to compare economic data from one year to the next. 統計上的不規範會使年與年之間的經濟數據難以互相比較。
results.example2: The anomaly of the social security system is that you sometimes have more money without a job. 社會保障制度下的反常現像是，失業有時反而拿錢更多。

results.name: walkthrough
results.english: an occasion when you practise something, for example a performance, without an audience being present

results.name: tally sth up
results.english: to calculate the total of something
results.example1: If the game's over I'll tally up. 如果比賽結束了的話，我就計算總分。

results.name: the pipe branched off from the main ...
results.english: If a road or path branches off, it goes in another direction.
results.example1: We drove down a narrow track that branched off from the main road. 我們行駛在一條從大路上分岔出來的窄路上。

results.name: trade surplus
results.english: a situation in which the value of goods a country exports (= sells to other countries) is greater than the value of goods it imports (= buys from other countries), or the size of this difference

results.name: facilitate
results.english: to make something possible or easier
results.example1: The new ramp will facilitate the entry of wheelchairs.  新的坡道將可方便輪椅進入。
results.example2: The current structure does not facilitate efficient work flow.  當前的體系不利於實施高效的工作流程。

results.name: illustrate
results.english: to show the meaning or truth of something more clearly, especially by giving examples
results.example1: The lecturer illustrated his point with a diagram on the blackboard.  講師在黑板上用圖表來說明自己的觀點。
results.example2: This latest conflict further illustrates the weakness of the UN.  最近的這次衝突進一步說明了聯合國的軟弱。

results.name: downside
results.english: a disadvantage of a situation
results.example1: The downside of living here, of course, is that it is expensive. 在這裡生活的不利因素當然就是生活費用很高。
results.example2: Unemployment, inflation, and greater inequality are often the downside of a market economy. 失業、通貨膨脹和不平等的加劇常常是市場經濟帶來的不利一面。

results.name: life and limb
results.example1: She risks life and limb every day in her job as an undercover investigator.

results.name: upfront
results.english: speaking or behaving in a way that makes intentions and beliefs clear
results.example1: She's very upfront about why she wants the job - she'd earn a lot more money. 她毫不掩飾自己想要獲得這份工作的原因——她想賺更多的錢。

results.name: laissez-faire
results.english: unwillingness to get involved in or influence other people's activities
results.chinese: 置之不理，不管不問，放任自流
results.example1: The problems began long before he became CEO, but they worsened with his laissez-faire approach/attitude. 這些問題在他當執行長之前就早已出現了，但由於他採取了放任自流的態度，結果變得更加嚴重了。

results.name: cohesiveness
results.english: the situation when the members of a group or society are united
results.example1: social/national cohesion 社會／國家凝聚力
results.example2: The lack of cohesion within the party lost them votes in the election. 黨內缺乏凝聚力使他們在選舉中失去了選票。

results.name: acquisition
results.english: the process of getting something
results.example1: The acquisition of huge amounts of data has helped our research enormously.  獲得的大量數據對我們的研究有莫大的幫助。
results.example2: Language acquisition (= learning a language without being taught) starts at a very young age.  語言習得始於幼年。

results.name: perception
results.english: a belief or opinion, often held by many people and based on how things seem
results.chinese: 見解, 觀念, 看法
results.example1: My _____ of the problem is quite different. 我對這個問題的理解則完全不同。
results.example2: These photographs will affect people's perceptions of war.  這些照片會影響人們對戰爭的看法。

results.name: exponentially
results.english: An exponential rate of increase becomes quicker and quicker as the thing that increases becomes larger.
results.chinese: （增長率）越來越快的，呈指數階（增長）的
results.example1: We are looking for exponential growth in our investment. 我們希望投資能夠呈指數增長。
results.example2: There has been an exponential increase in the world population this century. 本世紀世界人口一直呈指數增長。

results.name: yield
results.english: an amount of something positive, such as food or profit, that is produced or supplied
results.example1: Crop yields have risen steadily. 農作物產量穩步增長。
results.example2: Yields on gas and electricity shares are consistently high. 天然氣與電力股票的收益一直很高

results.name: municipal
results.english: of or belonging to a town or city
results.example1: He is in charge of the _____ housing project. 他主管該市建房計畫。
results.example2: municipal tennis courts  市立網球場

results.name: paramount
results.english: more important than anything else
results.example1: There are many priorities, but reducing the budget deficit is paramount/is of paramount importance. 很多事情要優先解決，但當務之急是減少預算赤字。

results.name: disperse
results.english: to spread across or move away over a large area,  or to make something do this
results.example1: When the rain came down the crowds started to _____.  雨下來時人群開始四處散開。
results.example2: Police _____ed the crowd that had gathered.  員警驅散了聚在一起的人群。

results.name: ground rules
results.english: the principles on which future behaviour is based
results.example1: In all relationships a few ground rules have to be established.  要保持任何一種關係，都必須確立一些基本原則。

results.name: count on sb
results.english: to be confident that you can depend on someone
results.example1: You can always count on Michael in a crisis. 在危急關頭你總能依靠邁克爾。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] I can count on my parents to help me. 我可以指望父母來幫我。

results.name: hostility
results.english: an occasion when someone is unfriendly or shows that they do not like something
results.example1: They showed open (= obvious) hostility to/towards their new neighbours. 他們對新鄰居公然表現出敵意。

results.name: pinnacle
results.english: the most successful or admired part of a system or achievement
results.chinese: (常形容事業) 極點；頂點, 頂峰
results.example1: By the age of 32 she had reached the pinnacle of her career.  她在32歲時事業達到巔峰。
results.example2: The pinnacles of the Himalayas were visible above the clouds.  喜馬拉雅山脈的諸峰顯現在雲端之上。

results.name: adjourn
results.english: to have a pause or rest during a formal meeting or trial
results.example1: The meeting was adjourned until Tuesday. 會議延期至星期二。
results.example2: Shall we adjourn for lunch? 我們暫停先去吃午餐好嗎？

results.name: sloppy
results.english: not taking care or making an effort
results.example1: Spelling mistakes always look sloppy in a formal letter.  在正式信函中出現拼寫錯誤總讓人感覺寫信者草率馬虎。
results.example2: Another sloppy pass like that might lose them the whole game.  再來一次那樣的草率傳球, 他們可能會輸掉整場比賽。

results.name: tangible
results.english: real and not imaginary; able to be shown,  touched,  or experienced
results.example1: We need tangible evidence if we're going to take legal action.  如果我們要採取法律行動, 就需要有實實在在的證據。
results.example2: Other tangible benefits include an increase in salary and shorter working hours.  其他實實在在的好處包括加薪和縮短工作時間。

results.name: genuine
results.english: If something is genuine, it is real and exactly what it appears to be.
results.chinese: 真正的；非僞造的；名副其實的
results.example1: genuine leather 真皮
results.example2: If it is a genuine Michelangelo drawing, it will sell for millions. 如果這幅畫是米高安哲羅（米開朗基羅）的真跡，它的售價將會達數百萬。

results.name: subordinate
results.english: having a lower or less important position
results.example1: subordinate status  從屬地位
results.example2: The individual's needs are subordinate to those of the group.  個人需求從屬於集體需求。

results.name: set out/forth
results.english: to give the details of something or to explain it, especially in writing, in a clear, organized way
results.example1: The board has set out its goals/plans/proposals for the coming year.  董事會闡述了下一年的目標／計劃／建議。
results.example2: Your contract will set out the terms and conditions of your employment.  你的合約會詳細說明聘任條款。

results.name: cerebral palsy
results.english: a physical condition involving permanent tightening of the muscles that is caused by damage to the brain around or before the time of birth

results.name: adverse
results.english: having a negative or harmful effect on something
results.example1: The match has been cancelled because of adverse weather conditions. 由於天氣惡劣，這場比賽已被取消。
results.example2: They received a lot of adverse publicity/criticism about the changes. 這些變化為他們招致種種負面報導／非議。

results.name: rigorous
results.english: careful to look at or consider every part of something to make certain it is correct or safe
results.example1: rigorous testing/checking/methods 精確的測試／嚴格的檢查／嚴謹的方法

results.name: accommodate
results.english: to provide with a place to live or to be stored in
results.chinese: 為…提供住宿；容納；為…提供空間
results.example1: New students may be accommodated in halls of residence. 新生可以住在學校宿舍裡。
results.example2: formal There wasn't enough space to accommodate the files. 沒有足夠的空間存放這些檔案。

results.name: downplay
results.english: to make something seem less important or less bad than it really is
results.example1: The government has been trying to downplay the crisis. 政府一直在盡力淡化此次危機的嚴重性。

results.name: interpersonal
results.english: connected with relationships between people
results.example1: The successful applicant will have excellent interpersonal skills.  成功的申請人應具有出色的人際交往技巧。

results.name: slush
results.english: snow that is lying on the ground and has started to melt

results.name: coercive
results.english: using force to persuade people to do things that they are unwilling to do
results.example1: The president relied on the coercive powers of the military. 總統依賴軍隊的高壓手段。
results.example2: coercive measures/tactics 強制措施／手段

results.name: referent
results.english: the person, thing, or idea that a word, phrase, or object refers to
results.example1: The obvious textual referent in this movie is Shakespeare's Hamlet. 這部電影在文本上明顯所指的是莎士比亞的《哈姆雷特》。

results.name: artifact
results.english: an object that is made by a person, such as a tool or a decoration, especially one that is of historical interest
results.chinese: （尤指具有史學價值的）人工製品，製造物，手工藝品
results.example1: The museum's collection includes artefacts dating back to prehistoric times. 這家博物館的藏品包括一些史前器物

results.name: morale
results.english: the amount of confidence felt by a person or group of people, especially when in a dangerous or difficult situation
results.chinese: （尤指險境或困境下的）士氣，精神面貌
results.example1: A couple of victories would improve the team's morale enormously. 如果能取得幾次勝利，隊伍的士氣就能大大提高。
results.example2: There have been a lot of job losses recently so morale is fairly low. 近來裁員很多，所以士氣很低。

results.name: verbal
results.english: spoken rather than written
results.example1: a verbal agreement/description/explanation 口頭協議／描述／解釋
results.example2: Airport officials received a stream of verbal abuse from angry passengers whose flights had been delayed. 航班被延誤，機場的官員們遭到了憤怒的乘客們的語言攻擊。

results.name: concise
results.english: short and clear,  expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words
results.example1: Make your answers clear and concise. 回答要言簡意賅。

results.name: at the mercy
results.english: to be in a situation where someone or something has complete power over you
results.chinese: 任由…的擺布，完全受…的支配
results.example1: Poor people are increasingly at the mercy of money-lenders. 窮人受放債人擺布的情況日益嚴重。

results.name: coherent
results.english: If an argument,  set of ideas,  or a plan is coherent,  it is clear and carefully considered,  and each part of it connects or follows in a natural or reasonable way.
results.chinese: 一致的、連貫的 設計、話術
results.example1: If someone is coherent,  you can understand what that person says. （講話）條理清晰的, 清楚明白的
results.example2: When she calmed down,  she was more coherent (= able to speak clearly and be understood).  她冷靜下來後, 講話有條理多了。

results.name: modality
results.english: a particular way of doing or experiencing something
results.example1: A variety of modalities of communication can be used to transmit health warnings to the public.  有多種傳播模式可用來將健康警報傳遞給公眾。

results.name: swath
results.english: a long strip or large area especially of land
results.chinese: 長條區域，大塊區域；（尤指）長條田地，大塊田地
results.example1: Huge swathes of rainforest are being cleared for farming and mining.  為了耕種和採礦，大片大片的雨林被砍伐。

results.name: blast
results.english: to explode or destroy something or someone with explosives,  or to break through or hit something with a similar,  very strong force
results.example1: A tunnel was to be blasted through the mountains.  要在群山中開鑿一條隧道。
results.example2: They heard the guns blasting away all night. 他們聽到槍炮聲響了一整夜。

results.name: acknowledgment
results.english: the fact of accepting that something is true or right
results.chinese: 承認；認可…的屬實或存在
results.example1: All I want is some acknowledgment that his behaviour is unreasonable. 我只要你們承認他的行為是無理取鬧就好。

results.name: ethnicity
results.english: a particular race of people, or the fact of being from a particular race of people
results.example1: Ethnicity is not considered when reviewing applications.
results.example2: Our students have many different nationalities, religions, and ethnicities.

results.name: narrative
results.english: a story or a description of a series of events
results.example1: It's a moving narrative of wartime adventure. 這是對戰時經歷的感人描述。
results.example2: a first-person/third-person narrative  第一人稱／第三人稱敘述

results.name: by and large
results.english: when everything about a situation is considered together

results.name: devastate
results.english: to destroy a place or thing completely or cause great damage

results.name: cadence
results.english: the regular rise and fall of the voice

results.name: escalate
results.english: to become or make something become greater or more serious
results.chinese: （使）增強；（使）擴大；（使）加劇；（使）惡化
results.example1: The decision to escalate UN involvement has been made in the hopes of a swift end to the hostilities. 已決定加大聯合國介入的程度，以期盡快結束敵對。
results.example2: The escalating rate of inflation will almost certainly bring escalating prices. 通貨膨脹率的不斷上升幾乎肯定會導致物價攀升。

results.name: exacerbate
results.english: to make something that is already bad even worse
results.example1: This attack will exacerbate the already tense relations between the two communities.  這次襲擊將令兩個原本已經處於緊張狀態的團體關係更加惡化。

results.name: set forth
results.english: to give the details of something or to explain it, especially in writing, in a clear, organized way
results.chinese: 某個正式文件當中都有詳細的說明

results.name: provision
results.english: the act of providing something
results.chinese: 在某旅程上, 給予 資源、糧食…等
results.example1: The provision of good public transport will be essential for developing the area.  提供良好的大眾運輸對該地區的發展極為重要。
results.example2: Of course there's provision in the plan for population increase.  當然這項計劃裡有應對人口增長的措施。

results.name: apprehensive
results.english: feeling worried about something that you are going to do or that is going to happen
results.chinese: （對將要做的事情）擔憂的，擔心的
results.example1: I'm very apprehensive about tomorrow's meeting. 想到明天的會議，我就有些惴惴不安。

results.name: keep abreast of sth
results.english: to make sure you know all the most recent facts about a subject or situation
results.chinese: 了解…的最新情況；跟上…的最新進展
results.example1: I try to keep abreast of any developments. 我努力了解所有新的進展情況。

results.name: blanket
results.english: to cover something completely with a thick layer
results.example1: Outside the fields were blanketed in fog.  外面，田野被濃霧籠罩著。

results.name: fluctuation
results.english: a change, or the process of changing, especially continuously between one level or thing and another
results.example1: fluctuations in share prices/the exchange rate/temperature
results.example2: weight fluctuations

results.name: remedy
results.english: a successful way of curing an illness or dealing with a problem or difficulty
results.chinese: 療法，治療；補救（辦法），糾正（辦法）
results.example1: an effective herbal remedy for headaches 用草藥治療頭痛的有效療法
results.example2: The best remedy for grief is hard work. 排解憂傷的最好辦法就是努力工作。

results.name: facet
results.english: one part of a subject,  situation,  etc. that has many parts
results.chinese: 看事情的 面相、觀點、角度
results.example1: She has so many facets to her personality. 她的性格具有多面性。

results.name: disseminate
results.english: to spread or give out something,  especially news,  information,  ideas,  etc.,  to a lot of people
results.example1: One of the organization's aims is to disseminate information about the disease.  該組織的宗旨之一就是宣傳關於這種疾病的知識。

results.name: be slated
results.english: to be expected to happen in the future or to be expected to be or do something in the future
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] Jeff is slated to be the next captain of the team.  傑夫預計會成爲球隊的下一任隊長。
results.example2: The meeting is slated for (= the chosen day is) next Thursday.  會議定於下星期四舉行。

results.name: recurring
results.english: happening many times, or happening again
results.chinese: 反復出現的；再次發生的；重新產生的
results.example1: Francis suffered all his life from a recurring nightmare that he was trapped in a falling house.  法蘭西斯一生中老是做同樣一個惡夢：被困在一所正在倒塌的房子裡。
results.example2: The father-daughter relationship is a recurring theme in her novels.  父女關係是她小說中一再出現的主題。

results.name: utmost importance
results.english: used to emphasize how important or serious something is
results.example1: a matter of the utmost importance  一件至關重要的事
results.example2: The situation needs to be handled with the utmost care.  這種局勢需要極其小心地處理。

results.name: pontiff
results.english: formal for pope (= leader of the Roman Catholic Church)

results.name: ambiguous
results.english: having or expressing more than one possible meaning, sometimes intentionally
results.chinese: 含糊不清的；引起歧義的，模棱兩可的；不明確的
results.example1: His reply to my question was somewhat ambiguous. 他對我的提問回答得有些含糊不清。
results.example2: The wording of the agreement is ambiguous. 該協議的措辭模棱兩可。

results.name: resilience
results.english: the quality of being able to return quickly to a previous good condition after problems
results.chinese: 回復力, 回復本來健康、強度的能力
results.example1: The resilience of the economy has come as a surprise to some.

results.name: empower
results.english: to give someone official authority or the freedom to do something
results.chinese: 給（某人）做…的權力；授權；使自主
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] This amendment empowers the president to declare an emergency for a wide range of reasons. 這一修正案授權總統可在一系列情形下宣佈進入緊急狀態。
results.example2: The first step in empowering the poorest sections of society is making sure they vote. 幫助社會最貧困階層掌握自己命運的第一步就是要確保他們能夠參加投票。

results.name: innovation
results.english: (the use of) a new idea or method
results.chinese: 新觀念；新方法；（新觀念或方法的）創造，使用
results.example1: the latest innovations in computer technology 電腦科技最新的發展

results.name: womb
results.english: the organ in the body of a woman or other female mammal in which a baby develops before birth
results.example1: Researchers are looking at how a mother's health can affect the baby in the womb. 研究人員正在觀察母親的健康會對子宮中的胎兒產生何種影響。

results.name: incremental
results.english: in a series of amounts
results.example1: Most research proceeds by small incremental advances.  大多數的研究是漸進式的。

results.name: do not hinder him in his work
results.english: to limit the ability of someone to do something, or to limit the development of something
results.example1: High winds have hindered firefighters in their efforts to put out the blaze.  強風妨礙了消防隊員撲滅大火。
results.example2: Her progress certainly hasn't been hindered by her lack of experience.  經驗不足當然沒有妨礙她的進步。

results.name: garbled
results.english: If words or messages are garbled, they are not clear and are very difficult to understand, often giving a false idea of the facts.
results.chinese: （話或資訊）含混不清的，引起誤解的
results.example1: There was a strange garbled message on my voicemail.  我電話答錄機上的留言含混不清。

results.name: dormant
results.english: Something that is dormant is not active or growing but has the ability to be active at a later time.
results.example1: The long-dormant volcano has recently shown signs of erupting. 休眠了很久的火山最近出現了要噴發的跡象。
results.example2: These investments have remained dormant for several years. 這些投資好幾年都沒有甚麽動靜。

results.name: propinquity
results.english: the fact of being near something
results.example1: Don't let geographical propinquity determine your choice. 不要讓地理上的鄰近程度主導你的選擇。

results.name: imminent danger
results.english: coming or likely to happen very soon
results.example1: imminent disaster/danger  迫在眉睫的災難／危險
results.example2: A strike is imminent. 一場罷工即將來臨。

results.name: mitigate
results.english: to make something less harmful, unpleasant, or bad
results.example1: It is unclear how to mitigate the effects of tourism on the island. 人們還不清楚如何減低旅遊業對這個島嶼的影響。

results.name: residual
results.english: remaining after most of something has gone
results.example1: I still felt some residual bitterness ten years after my divorce.  離婚十年後，我仍然可以感到餘痛。

results.name: a punchy speech
results.english: expressing something effectively and with power
results.example1: a short punchy presentation/speech 富有感染力的簡短報告／演講
results.example2: The article is written in his usual punchy style. 這篇文章延續了他一貫富有感染力的風格。

results.name: sanitation
results.english: the systems for taking dirty water and other waste products away from buildings in order to protect people's health
results.example1: Many illnesses in these temporary refugee camps are the result of inadequate sanitation. 這些臨時難民營中許多疾病都源於排汙設施不完善。

results.name: gauge
results.english: a device for measuring the amount or size of something
results.example1: a fuel/rain/temperature gauge  燃料表／雨量計／溫度計

results.name: regulatory
results.english: controlling
results.example1: a regulatory body/organization  監管部門／組織

results.name: addendum
results.english: something that has been added to a book, speech, or document

results.name: pilgrim
results.english: a person who makes a journey, often a long and difficult one, to a special place for religious reasons

results.name: inflation
results.english: a general, continuous increase in prices

results.name: sleazy bars
results.english: dirty,  cheap,  or not socially acceptable,  especially relating to moral or sexual matters
results.chinese: 骯髒邋遢的, 烏煙瘴氣的；(尤指)低級趣味的, 墮落的
results.example1: This part of town is full of sleazy bars and restaurants.  鎮上這個地區滿是烏煙瘴氣的酒吧和餐廳。

results.name: condominium (or condo)
results.english: an apartment building in which each apartment is owned separately by the people living in it, but also containing shared areas

results.name: the court has no jurisdiction
results.english: the authority of a court or official organization to make decisions and judgments
results.example1: The court has no jurisdiction in/over cases of this kind. 該法庭無權審判此類案件。
results.example2: School admissions are not under/within our jurisdiction. 我們無權批准入學。

results.name: stall
results.english: If an engine stalls, or if you stall it, it stops working suddenly and without you intending it to happen.
results.example1: A car may stall due to the driver braking too suddenly. 司機踩刹車過猛可能會導致汽車熄火。
results.example2: I stalled the car twice during my driving test but still managed to pass. 我在路考時兩次把車弄熄火，不過還是勉強通過了考試。

results.name: denounce
results.english: to criticize something or someone strongly and publicly
results.example1: The government's economic policy has been denounced on all sides.  政府的經濟政策受到了各方面的譴責。
results.example2: We must denounce injustice and oppression. 我們必須對不公和壓迫現象予以譴責。

results.name: he issued an appeal to...
results.english: a request to the public for money,  information,  or help
results.chinese: (尤指向公眾的)呼籲, 籲請, 求助, 懇求
results.example1: They're launching (= starting) an appeal to raise money for famine victims.  他們正在呼籲社會為饑民捐款。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] The police have issued an appeal to the public to stay away from the area over the weekend. 員警呼籲公眾在週末遠離這一地區。

results.name: acoustic
results.english: relating to sound or hearing
results.example1: The microphone converts acoustic waves to electrical signals for transmission. 麥克風把聲波轉換成電信號進行傳送。

results.name: litigation
results.english: the process of taking a case to a court of law so that a judgment can be made
results.example1: The company has consistently denied responsibility, but it agreed to the settlement to avoid the expense of lengthy litigation.  公司一直在推卸責任，但同意這一調解方案以避免漫長的訴訟所帶來的花費。

results.name: to no avail
results.english: without any success or any effect
results.chinese: 沒有成果; 完全無用
results.example1: The students asked the school to help them raise the money, but to no avail.

results.name: unilateral
results.english: involving only one group or country
results.example1: The party leader has actually declared her support for unilateral nuclear disarmament (= giving up her country's nuclear weapons without first waiting for other countries to do the same). 該黨領導人實際上已經宣佈了她支援單方面核裁軍的決定。

results.name: fixture
results.english: a permanently fixed piece of furniture in a house, such as a bath, that would not be taken by someone when moving to a new home
results.example1: All fixtures and fittings are included in the house price. 所有固定裝置和可拆除設備都包括在房價裡。
results.example2: figurative They've been together so long he's become a permanent fixture in her life. 他們在一起太久了，他已經成為她生活中不可缺少的一部分。

results.name: pesky kids
results.english: annoying or causing trouble
results.example1: Those pesky kids from next door have let the air out of my car tyres again! 隔壁那些討厭的孩子又放了我汽車輪胎的氣！

results.name: collateral damage
results.english: connected but less important, or of the same family although not directly related
results.chinese: 附帶的，次要的；（親戚）旁系的，非直系的
results.example1: collateral senses of a word 詞語的次要意義
results.example2: a collateral branch of the family 家族的旁系

results.name: clause
results.english: a particular part of a written legal document, for example a law passed by Parliament or a contract (= an agreement)
results.example1: They have added/deleted/amended a clause in the contract which says the company can make people redundant for economic reasons.  他們在合同中增加／刪除／修改了一項條款，該條款稱公司可以因為經濟原因裁減人員。
results.example2: Clause 4 of the constitution is thought to be the most important section. 憲法第四條被認為是最重要的部分。

results.name: bureaucracy
results.english: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organization that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully
results.chinese: 官僚作風；官僚主義；官僚體制
results.example1: I had to deal with the university's bureaucracy when I was applying for financial aid.  我申請助學金時不得不應對大學裡的官僚體系。

results.name: backlash (against)
results.english: a strong feeling among a group of people in reaction to a change or recent events in society or politics
results.chinese: （社會或政治方面的）強烈反應；強烈反對
results.example1: the 60s backlash against bourgeois materialism 60年代對資產階級物質主義的強烈抵制
results.example2: the backlash against feminism 對女權主義的強烈反對

results.name: exert
results.english: to use something such as authority, power, influence, etc. in order to make something happen
results.chinese: 運用；行使（權威、權力等）；施加（影響等）
results.example1: If you were to exert your influence they might change their decision. 如果你可以施加你的影響，他們或者會改變決定。
results.example2: Some managers exert considerable pressure on their staff to work extra hours without being paid. 一些老闆向員工施加巨大的壓力迫使他們無薪加班。

results.name: stake
results.english: to risk an amount of money
results.example1: At the roulette table, he staked $10,000 on number 21. 他在輪盤賭臺上押了一萬美元賭21號。

results.name: the salient points
results.english: The salient facts about something or qualities of something are the most important things about them
results.example1: She began to summarize the _____ features/points of the proposal. 她開始總結提議中的重點／要點。
results.example2: The article presented the _____ facts of the dispute clearly and concisely.  這篇文章簡明清楚地介紹了這場爭端中的主要事實。

results.name: legitimacy
results.english: the quality of being legal
results.example1: The lawyers expressed serious doubts about the legitimacy of military action.  律師們對軍事行動的合法性表示強烈懷疑。

results.name: procurement
results.english: the process of getting supplies
results.example1: a substantial budget for the procurement of military supplies 用於採購軍需品的巨額預算

results.name: retrospective
results.english: relating to or thinking about the past
results.chinese: 涉及以往的；追溯的；回顧的
results.example1: a retrospective album of solo Freddie Mercury tracks  弗雷迪．墨丘利獨唱歌曲回顧專輯

results.name: tactic
results.english: a planned way of doing something
results.example1: These bomb attacks represent a change of tactics by the terrorists. 這些炸彈襲擊事件表明恐怖分子改變了策略。

results.name: overlook
results.english: to fail to notice or consider something or someone
results.example1: I think there is one key fact that you have overlooked. 我認為你忽略了一個重要的事實。
results.example2: No one will be overlooked when we select players for the team. 在組隊時不會忽略任何人。

results.name: disembark
results.english: to leave a ship, aircraft, etc. after a journey

results.name: oversight
results.english: a mistake made because of a failure to notice something
results.example1: They claimed it was simply (an) oversight. 他們聲稱這不過是個疏忽。

results.name: subsidiary
results.english: used to refer to something less important than something else with which it is connected
results.example1: a subsidiary role/factor 輔助角色／次要因素

results.name: governance
results.english: the way that organizations or countries are managed at the highest level, and the systems for doing this
results.chinese: （機構或國家最高層的）管理體系
results.example1: We aim to promote and maintain the highest standards of directorship and corporate governance. 我們致力於推廣和保持最高水準的董事和機構管理。

results.name: elicit
results.english: to get or produce something, especially information or a reaction
results.chinese: 引出，探出，誘出（尤指資訊或反應）
results.example1: Have you managed to elicit a response from them yet?  你設法探到他們的反應了嗎？
results.example2: The questionnaire was intended to elicit information on eating habits.  該調查問卷旨在收集人們飲食習慣方面的資訊。

results.name: groom
results.english: to clean an animal, often by brushing its fur
results.example1: Polly spends hours in the stables grooming her pony. 波莉在馬廄裡刷洗她的小馬，一洗就幾個小時。

results.name: refinement
results.english: a small change that improves something
results.example1: These refinements have increased the machine's accuracy by 25 percent. 經過這些改進，機器的準確率提高了25%。
results.example2: Clearly, the hypothesis does need some refinement, in the light of these surprising results. 很顯然，從這些令人驚訝的結果來看，該假設確實需要進一步完善。

results.name: meteorologist
results.english: someone who studies meteorology

results.name: neutral
results.english: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war
results.example1: If there's an argument between my daughter and her mother, it's important that I remain neutral. 如果我女兒和她母親發生爭吵，我保持中立是很重要的。
results.example2: The peace conference would have to be held in a neutral country. 和平會議必須在一個中立國舉行。

results.name: composition
results.english: the parts, substances, etc. that something is made of
results.example1: the composition of the atmosphere  大氣的成分

results.name: unanimous
results.english: If a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about one particular matter or vote the same way, and if a decision or judgment is unanimous, it is formed or supported by everyone in a group.
results.chinese: （團體）意見一致的；（決定或裁決）一致通過的，獲得全體支援的
results.example1: The jury returned a unanimous verdict of guilty after a short deliberation.  陪審團經過短時間商討後一致裁決有罪。
results.example2: After a lengthy discussion we reached a unanimous decision on the proposal.  經過長時間討論，我們對這一提案作出了一致決定。

results.name: have/win a plurality
results.english: to receive more votes in an election than any other person or party, but not more than the total number of votes that the other people or parties have received
results.example1: He won a 48 percent plurality of the vote rather than an outright majority. 他獲得了48%的相對多數票，而非絕對多數。

results.name: dictatorship
results.english: a country ruled by a dictator
results.example1: a military dictatorship 軍事獨裁統治國家

results.name: affinities between two paintings
results.english: a close similarity between two things
results.example1: There are several close affinities between the two paintings. 這兩幅畫有多處非常相似的地方。

results.name: gimmick
results.english: something that is not serious or of real value that is used to attract people's attention or interest temporarily, especially to make them buy something
results.chinese: （尤指為誘人購買而搞的）花招，把戲；（誘人購買的）華而不實的東西，金玉其外的東西
results.example1: a publicity gimmick  廣告宣傳花招
results.example2: They give away free gifts with children's meals as a sales/marketing gimmick.  他們給兒童套餐搭配免費禮品作為促銷／ 行銷伎倆。

results.name: prefabricated
results.english: Prefabricated buildings or objects are built from parts that have been made in a factory and can be put together quickly.
results.example1: a prefabricated house 預鑄住宅，組合式房屋

results.name: incorporate
results.english: to include something as part of something larger
results.example1: Suggestions from the survey have been incorporated into/in the final design. 調查中取得的建議已被納入最終的設計之中。
results.example2: This aircraft incorporates several new safety features. 這種飛機具有幾個新的安全功能。

results.name: deteriorate
results.english: to become worse
results.example1: She was taken into hospital last week when her condition suddenly deteriorated.  她是在上周病情突然惡化時被送進醫院的
results.example2: The political situation in the region has deteriorated rapidly.  該地區的政治形勢已急劇惡化。

results.name: stem from sth
results.english: to start or develop as the result of something
results.example1: Her problems stem from her difficult childhood. 她的問題主要是由艱苦的童年生活造成。
results.example2: Their disagreement stemmed from a misunderstanding. 他們的分歧源自誤會。

results.name: deem
results.english: to consider or judge something in a particular way
results.example1: [+ obj + noun/adj] The area has now been deemed safe. 該地區現在被認為很安全。
results.example2: [+ noun/adj] We will provide help whenever you deem it appropriate. 無論何時只要你認為合適，我們就會提供協助。

results.name: she captivated them
results.english: to hold the attention of someone by being extremely interesting, exciting, pleasant, or attractive
results.example1: With her beauty and charm, she captivated film audiences everywhere. 她的美貌和魅力迷倒了各地的電影觀眾。

results.name: alignment
results.english: an arrangement in which two or more things are positioned in a straight line or parallel to each other
results.example1: The problem is happening because the wheels are out of alignment with each other.  出現這個問題是因為車輪定位不正。

results.name: a grueling week
results.english: extremely tiring and difficult,  and demanding great effort and determination
results.chinese: 使人精疲力盡的；艱辛的；讓人受不了的
results.example1: Junior doctors often have to work a gruelling 100-hour week.  資歷較淺的醫生經常必須承受艱巨的工作量, 一星期工作100小時。
results.example2: He eventually won the match after five gruelling sets.  經過五局艱難的拼殺, 他終於贏得了比賽。

results.name: explicit
results.english: clear and exact
results.chinese: 清楚明白的；明確的；不含糊的
results.example1: I gave her very explicit directions how to get here.  我明確地告訴她這裡怎麼走。
results.example2: She was very explicit about (= said very clearly and exactly) what she thought was wrong with the plans. 她明確地指出了計劃中她認為有誤的地方。

results.name: tacit
results.english: understood without being expressed directly
results.example1: tacit agreement/approval/support  默契／默許／暗中支持

results.name: nifty
results.english: good, pleasing, or effective
results.chinese: 絕妙的；有吸引力的；俐落的
results.example1: a nifty piece of work/footwork 傑作／乾淨俐落的步法
results.example2: a nifty little gadget 精巧的小器具

results.name: hurl stones
results.english: to throw something with a lot of force, usually in an angry or violent way
results.example1: In a fit of temper he hurled the book across the room. 他一怒之下把書本扔到房間的另一邊。
results.example2: Youths hurled stones at the soldiers. 年輕人向士兵們投擲石頭。

results.name: deflect
results.english: to (cause to) change direction,  or to prevent something from being directed at you
results.example1: The ball deflected off my shoulder,  straight into the goal.  球打在我的肩膀上反彈進了球門。
results.example2: The crowd cheered as the goalkeeper deflected the shot.  當守門員把球擋出去的時候人們歡呼了起來。

results.name: outlay
results.english: an amount of money spent for a particular purpose,  especially as a first investment in something
results.chinese: (尤指用於第一次投資的)開支, 費用
results.example1: For an initial outlay of 2, 000 to buy the equipment,  you can earn up to 500 a month if the product sells well.  買這套設備首筆花費為2000美元, 要是產品賣得好, 你每月可以賺得500美元。

results.name: defer
results.english: to delay something until a later time
results.example1: [+ -ing verb] Can we defer making a decision until next week? 我們可以延緩到下週再決定嗎？

results.name: obnoxious
results.english: very unpleasant or rude
results.chinese: 可憎的，令人討厭的；粗魯無禮的
results.example1: Some of his colleagues say that he's loud and obnoxious. 他的一些同事說他這個人又愛出風頭又惹人討厭。
results.example2: When she's in a bad mood she's obnoxious to everyone. 她發脾氣的時候，人人都很討厭她。

results.name: ecstasy
results.english: a state of extreme happiness, especially when feeling pleasure
results.example1: She threw her head back as if in ecstasy. 她仰著頭，一副飄飄欲仙的樣子。
results.example2: sexual ecstasy 性快感

results.name: drill
results.english: an activity that practises a particular skill and often involves repeating the same thing several times, especially a military exercise intended to train soldiers
results.example1: In some of these schools, army-style drills are used to instil a sense of discipline.  這些學校中有一些利用軍訓來培養紀律觀念。
results.example2: a spelling/pronunciation drill  拼寫／發音練習

results.name: replenish
results.english: to fill something up again
results.chinese: 補充；把…再備足；重新裝滿
