results.example1: Food stocks were replenished by/with imports from abroad. 糧食儲備透過從國外進口得到了補充。
results.example2: Does your glass need replenishing? 你的酒杯要不要再斟滿？

results.name: electrolytes
results.english: a substance, usually a liquid, that electricity can go through, or that separates into its parts when electricity goes through it

results.name: got cramp in my foot
results.english: a sudden painful tightening in a muscle, often after a lot of exercise, that limits movement
results.chinese: 痙攣，抽筋（常出現在大量運動後）
results.example1: I've got cramp in my foot. 我的腳抽筋了。
results.example2: stomach cramps 胃痙攣

results.name: a thug
results.english: a man who acts violently, especially to commit a crime
results.example1: Some thugs smashed his windows. 幾個惡棍打碎了他的窗戶。

results.name: lid
results.english: a cover on a container, that can be lifted up or removed
results.example1: Can you get the lid off this jar? 你能把罐子的蓋打開嗎？
results.example2: Put a lid on the saucepan. 給平底深鍋蓋上蓋子。

results.name: smidgen
results.english: a very small amount
results.example1: Could I have a smidgen more wine?  我能再來一點酒嗎？
results.example2: It was five years since I'd last seen him, but he hadn't changed a smidgen. 我有五年沒見到他了，但他一點都沒變。

results.name: viable
results.english: able to work as intended or able to succeed
results.chinese: 可以實施的；可望成功的
results.example1: In order to make the company viable, it will unfortunately be necessary to reduce staffing levels. 很遺憾，為使公司繼續運轉下去，將不得不裁員。
results.example2: I am afraid your plan is not commercially/economically/financially/politically viable. 恐怕你的計劃在商業／經濟／財政／政治上行不通。

results.name: capitalize on sth
results.english: to use a situation to your own advantage
results.example1: She capitalized on her knowledge and experience to get a better job. 她憑藉自己的學識和經驗謀求了一份收入更高的新工作。

results.name: perceive
results.english: to come to an opinion about something, or have a belief about something
results.example1: How do the French perceive the British? 法國人是如何看待英國人的？
results.example2: Women's magazines are often perceived to be superficial. 人們往往認為女性雜誌內容膚淺。

results.name: combat
results.english: to try to stop something unpleasant or harmful from happening or increasing
results.chinese: 與…戰鬥；與…作鬥爭；打擊；制止
results.example1: to combat crime/terrorism/inflation/disease  打擊犯罪／打擊恐怖主義／抑制通貨膨脹／與疾病搏鬥
results.example2: The government is spending millions of dollars in its attempt to combat drug abuse.  政府正斥資數百萬美元打擊濫用毒品的行為。

results.name: gauge
results.english: to calculate an amount, especially by using a measuring device
results.chinese: （尤指用測量儀器）測量，計量，測算
results.example1: Use a thermometer to gauge the temperature.  用溫度計測量一下溫度。
results.example2: I tried to gauge (= guess) the weight of the box.  我試著估量箱子有多重。

results.name: stellar
results.english: Stellar people or activities are of an extremely high standard.
results.example1: a stellar performance/player/ team 精彩的演出／優秀的選手／出色的球隊

results.name: cater to
results.english: to satisfy a need or desire that is unusual or unacceptable
results.chinese: 滿足，投合，迎合（尤指不受歡迎或難以接受的需求）
results.example1: Why should you cater to his every whim? 為什麼他不管什麼樣的一時興致你都要滿足？
results.example2: This legislation simply caters to racism. 該法規完全是迎合了種族主義。

results.name: spike
results.english: to rise to a higher amount,  price,  or level,  usually before going down again
results.chinese: (通常指在下跌前)上升至非常高的數量(價格或程度)
results.example1: The jobless rate in October spiked to a five-year high.  十月份的失業率上升至五年來的最高點。

results.name: outperform
results.english: to do well in a particular job or activity compared to others of a similar type
results.example1: The company has consistently outperformed its rivals this season. 這一季，這家公司的表現一直優於競爭對手。

results.name: intent
results.english: the fact that you want and plan to do something
results.example1: I spent half the morning on the phone,  which wasn't really my _____.  我半個早上都花在了打電話上, 這可不是我真正想做的。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] It was not his _____ to hurt anyone. 他的本意並不是想傷害誰。

results.name: contemplate
results.english: to spend time considering a possible future action,  or to consider one particular thing for a long time in a serious and quiet way
results.example1: [+ -ing verb] I'm _____ing going abroad for a year.  我打算出國一年。
results.example2: They were _____ing a move to California.  他們打算搬到加利福尼亞去。

results.name: throw me off
results.english: To surprise someone in a way that leaves them confused or shook.
results.example1: My girlfriend brought chicken wings to pizza night and it really threw me off.
results.example2: I wanted to wear my slides to soccer practice just to throw off the coach.

results.name: wind turbine
results.english: a tall structure with blades that are blown round by the wind and produce power to make electricity

results.name: undergo
results.english: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change
results.chinese: 經歷，經受（令人不快的事或變化）
results.example1: She underwent an operation on a tumour in her left lung last year. 她在去年做了一次左肺腫瘤切除手術。
results.example2: Playing board games is undergoing a revival in popularity. 圖版正經歷著一場復興。

results.name: be leery of sth
results.english: not trusting someone or something and usually avoiding him,  her,  or it if possible
results.chinese: 不信任的；戒備的, 防備的
results.example1: I've always been a little leery of authority figures.  我對權威人物一直存有戒心。

results.name: run out of steam
results.english: to suddenly lose the energy or interest to continue doing what you are doing
results.chinese: 忽然失去動力；頓時洩氣；突然沒了興趣
results.example1: The peace talks seem to have run out of steam. 和談好像突然失去了動力。

results.name: dictate
results.english: to give orders,  or tell someone exactly what they must do,  with total authority
results.chinese: 命令, 下(令)；決定, 規定
results.example1: The UN will _____ the terms of troop withdrawal from the region.  聯合國將決定軍隊從該地區撤軍的條件。
results.example2: [+ question word] He disagrees with the government _____ing what children are taught in schools.  他不同意由政府來決定孩子在學校學習哪些課程。

results.name: pastime.
results.english: an activity that is done for enjoyment
results.example1: Do-it-yourself is the nation's most popular pastime. 自己動手是該國最流行的消遣活動。
results.example2: figurative Suing people, especially doctors, is becoming a national pastime (= common activity) in America. 在美國，提出訴訟——尤其是控告醫生——是一種全民熱衷的尋常事。

results.name: renowned
results.english: famous for something
results.example1: The region is _____ for its outstanding natural beauty.  該地區因其秀美壯麗的自然風光而享有盛譽。
results.example2: Marco Polo is a _____ explorer/is renowned as an explorer.  馬可‧孛羅是著名的探險家。

results.name: splendor
results.english: great beauty that attracts admiration and attention
results.example1: They bought a decaying 16th-century manor house and restored it to its original splendour. 他們買了一幢破敗的16世紀莊園宅邸，經過整修使它恢復了先前的富麗堂皇。

results.name: roar
results.english: to make a long, loud, deep sound
results.example1: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo.
results.example2: 我們可以聽到獅子在動物園的另一端咆哮。

results.name: track sb/sth down
results.english: to find something or someone after looking for it, him, or her in a lot of different places
results.example1: He finally managed to track down the book he wanted. 他終於找到他要的書。

results.name: a pride of
results.english: a group of lions

results.name: be composed of sth
results.english: to be formed from various things
results.example1: Air is composed mainly of nitrogen and oxygen. 空氣主要由氮和氧組成。
results.example2: The committee is composed of MPs, doctors, academics and members of the public. 委員會由議員、醫生、學者和普通民眾組成。

results.name: tranquilize
results.english: to make an animal or person become unconscious or calm, especially with a drug
results.example1: a tranquillizing drug  安定藥
results.example2: The dogs were tranquillized with a dart gun and taken to a shelter. 這些狗中飛鏢麻醉槍昏迷後，被送到一個動物收容站。

results.name: wildebeest
results.english: a large African animal with a long tail and horns that curve to the sides that lives in areas covered in grass

results.name: snap off
results.english: to suddenly break something with a short loud noise, or to be broken in this way
results.example1: When the rope snapped, Davis fell into the water.
results.example2: snap (sth) off: Ken snapped off the smaller branches.

results.name: whereabouts
results.english: the place where a person or thing is
results.chinese: （某人或某物的）行蹤，下落，去向
results.example1: Trupin is thought to be in the Caribbean, although his exact whereabouts are/is a mystery. 有人認為特呂潘在加勒比海，但他的確切下落仍是一個謎。

results.name: amped
results.english: excited
results.example1: This is the videogame that has everyone so amped.

results.name: serum
results.english: the thin yellowish liquid part of the blood
results.example1: cholesterol levels in blood serum 血清中的膽固醇標準

results.name: startle
results.english: to do something unexpected that surprises and sometimes worries a person or animal
results.chinese: 使大吃一驚；使受驚，使嚇一跳
results.example1: She was concentrating on her book and his voice startled her.  她正在聚精會神地看書，被他的聲音嚇了一跳。
results.example2: The noise of the car startled the birds and the whole flock flew up into the air.  汽車聲把一大群鳥驚嚇得振翅飛了起來。

results.name: growl
results.english: to make a low, rough sound, usually in anger
results.chinese: （通常指因為憤怒）發出低沉的吼叫，咆哮
results.example1: The dog growled at her and snapped at her ankles.  那隻狗咆哮著在她腳踝上咬了一口。
results.example2: [+ speech] Not now, I'm busy, he growled.  「現在不可以，我正在忙。」他吼道。

results.name: flowing
results.english: Flowing hair and clothes are long and hang down loosely.
results.example1: I remember her as a young girl with flowing black hair. 我記憶中的她是個留著飄逸黑髮的年輕女孩。
results.example2: Everyone on stage was dressed in flowing white robes. 舞臺上所有人都身著飄逸的白袍。

results.name: unprecedented
results.english: never having happened or existed in the past
results.chinese: 史無前例的, 空前的；絕無僅有的
results.example1: This century has witnessed environmental destruction on an unprecedented scale.  環境在本世紀遭到了空前的破壞。

results.name: carcass
results.english: the body of a dead animal, especially a large one that is soon to be cut up as meat or eaten by wild animals
results.chinese: （尤指大型動物的）屍體；（供野生動物食用的）畜體
results.example1: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting carcass of the deer. 禿鷹在天空盤旋等待著啄食鹿漸漸腐爛的屍體。
results.example2: slang Move your great carcass (= your body) out of that chair! 把你龐大的身軀從那把椅子上移開！

results.name: cling to
results.english: to stick onto or hold something or someone tightly, or to refuse to stop holding it, him, or her
results.example1: They clung together in terror as the screams grew louder. 尖叫聲越來越大，他們驚慌地緊緊抱在一起。
results.example2: She clung to the handrail as she walked down the slippery steps. 她沿著滑溜溜的臺階往下走時緊緊抓住扶手。

results.name: spring into action
results.english: to jump or move in a particular direction, quickly and with a lot of energy
results.example1: ‘Let’s get going,’ my father cried, springing into action.
results.example2: The young man turned to hit him, but Corbett sprang back.

results.name: dart
results.english: a small, thin object with a sharp point that is thrown by hand in a game, shot from a gun, or blown from a tube when used as a weapon

results.name: intimidating
results.english: making you feel frightened or nervous
results.example1: an intimidating array of weapons  大量令人膽戰心驚的武器
results.example2: an intimidating manner  令人懼怕的態度

results.name: succumb to
results.english: to lose the determination to oppose something; to accept defeat
results.chinese: 屈從，屈服；放棄抵抗；承認失敗
results.example1: The town finally succumbed last week after being pounded with heavy artillery for more than two months. 在遭受了兩個多月的猛烈炮火轟擊後，小鎮最終在上星期放棄抵抗。
results.example2: I'm afraid I succumbed to temptation and had a piece of cheesecake. 我還是沒抵擋住誘惑，吃了一塊乳酪蛋糕。

results.name: time is of the essence
results.english: said to encourage someone to hurry
results.chinese: （催促某人時用）時間是關鍵，時間很寶貴

results.name: apex
results.english: the highest point or top of a shape or object
results.example1: the apex of a triangle/pyramid 三角形的頂點／金字塔的塔尖

results.name: mane
results.english: the long, thick hair that grows along the top of a horse's neck or around the face and neck of a lion

results.name: latch
results.english: a device for keeping a door or gate closed, consisting of a metal bar that fits into a hole and is lifted by pushing down on another bar

results.name: trachea
results.english: the tube in the body that carries air that has been breathed in from the upper end of the throat to the lungs

results.name: hoax
results.english: a plan to deceive someone, such as telling the police there is a bomb somewhere when there is not one, or a trick
results.example1: The bomb threat turned out to be a hoax. 那次炸彈恐嚇結果發現是場惡作劇。
results.example2: He'd made a hoax call claiming to be the president. 他搞了個惡作劇，打電話自稱是總統。

results.name: froth
results.english: small, white bubbles on the surface of a liquid
results.example1: I like the froth on the top of the coffee.  我喜歡咖啡表面的那層白沫。

results.name: appendage
results.english: an arm, leg, or other body part
results.chinese: 附肢；附（屬）器（指臂、腿或身體其他部位）
results.example1: He had a tattoo on every visible appendage. 他四肢裸露的地方都刺有紋身。

results.name: adrenalin
results.english: a hormone produced by the body, for example when you are frightened, angry, or excited, that makes the heart beat faster and prepares the body to react to danger
results.example1: These arguments always get my adrenalin going (= make me excited or angry). 這些爭論總是讓我腎上腺素上升（讓我激動或惱怒）。

results.name: landscape
results.english: a large area of countryside, especially in relation to its appearance
results.chinese: 鄉間，野外；（尤指鄉村的）風景，景色
results.example1: The landscape is dotted with the tents of campers and hikers. 鄉間散佈著宿營者和遠足者搭起的帳篷。
results.example2: The cathedral dominates the landscape for miles around. 大教堂在方圓數英里的鄉間高高聳立著。

results.name: biometric data
results.english: referring to detailed information about someone's body, such as the patterns of colour in their eyes, that can be used to prove who that person is
results.chinese: 生物測定的；生物統計的
results.example1: biometric data 生物統計數據
results.example2: a biometric passport 生物特徵辨識護照

results.name: coloration
results.english: the fact of colour being present on an animal or plant and the pattern that the colour makes
results.chinese: （動物或植物的）顏色，色彩，花紋

results.name: administer or administrate
results.english: to cause someone to receive something
results.example1: to administer medicine/punishment/relief  給藥／施加懲罰／發放救濟品
results.example2: Tests will be administered to schoolchildren at seven and twelve years.  7歲和12歲的學生將接受測試。

results.name: savanna or savannah
results.english: a large, flat area of land covered with grass, usually with few trees, that is found in hot countries, especially in Africa
results.chinese: （尤指非洲等熱帶國家的）稀樹草原

results.name: inflict punishment
results.english: to force someone to experience something very unpleasant
results.example1: These new bullets are capable of inflicting massive injuries. 這些新型子彈可以造成重創。
results.example2: The suffering inflicted on these children was unimaginable. 這些孩子遭受的痛苦無法想像。

results.name: molar
results.english: one of the large teeth at the back of the mouth in humans and some other animals used for crushing and chewing food

results.name: a serrated blade
results.english: having a row of sharp points along the edge
results.example1: You really need a knife with a serrated edge for cutting bread. 你真的需要一把有鋸齒刃的刀子來切麵包。

results.name: shears
results.english: very large scissors
results.example1: gardening/dressmaking shears 園藝／裁縫剪刀
results.example2: They use electric shears for sheep shearing. 他們使用電動大剪刀剪羊毛。

results.name: diligent
results.english: careful and using a lot of effort
results.chinese: 認真刻苦的，勤奮的，勤勞的
results.example1: a diligent student  用功的學生
results.example2: Leo is very diligent in/about his work.  利奧工作非常勤奮。

results.name: proficiency
results.english: the fact of having the skill and experience for doing something
results.example1: The job ad said they wanted proficiency in at least two languages.
results.example2: Photographs entered in the contest will be judged on originality and technical proficiency.

results.name: prospective sb
results.english: people who are expected to buy something,  employ someone,  become parents,  etc.
results.chinese: 潛在的(客戶)／可能成為(僱主)的人／即將成為(父母者)的
results.example1: We've had three sets of prospective buyers looking at the house.  已經有三批可能買我們房子的人來看過房子了。

results.name: entitle
results.english: to give someone the right to do or have something
results.example1: Being unemployed entitles you to free medical treatment.  失業時，你有權享受免費醫療。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] The employer is entitled to ask for references.  僱主有權索取推薦信。

results.name: payroll
results.english: a list of the people employed by a company showing how much each one earns
results.chinese: （公司員工的）在職人員工資表，工資名單
results.example1: a payroll tax 薪水稅，工資稅
results.example2: The company is growing fast, adding another 100 employees to its payroll over the last year. 公司發展迅速，在職員工在去年內又增加了100人。

results.name: attire
results.english: clothes, especially of a particular or formal type
results.chinese: （尤指特定樣式或正式的）服裝，衣著
results.example1: I hardly think jeans are appropriate attire for a wedding.  我覺得穿牛仔褲去參加婚禮不怎麼合適。

results.name: comply with
results.english: to act according to an order, set of rules, or request
results.example1: He's been ordered to have the dog destroyed because it's dangerous, but he refuses to comply. 那隻狗很危險，因此他接到了把它人道毀滅的命令，但他拒絕服從。
results.example2: There are serious penalties for failure to comply with the regulations. 不遵守規定者將受到嚴懲。

results.name: refrain from
results.english: to avoid doing or stop yourself from doing something
results.example1: We refrained from talking until we knew that it was safe.  我們緘默不語, 直到確定安全了才開始說話。
results.example2: The sign on the wall said Please refrain from smoking. 牆上有個牌子, 上寫「請勿吸煙」。

results.name: mandate
results.english: to give official permission for something to happen
results.example1: The UN rush to mandate war totally ruled out any alternatives.  聯合國匆匆授權開戰，完全排除了其他選擇。

results.name: enforce
results.english: to make people obey a law, or to make a particular situation happen or be accepted
results.chinese: 使服從（法律）；（強制）實行，執行，把…強加於
results.example1: It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits. 對員警來說，嚴格執行限速規定並不總是件易事。
results.example2: The new teacher had failed to enforce any sort of discipline. 這位新教師一點都管不住學生，搞得紀律渙散。

results.name: legislation
results.english: a law or set of laws suggested by a government and made official by a parliament
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] The government has promised to introduce legislation to limit fuel emissions from cars. 政府承諾將透過立法來限制汽車廢氣排放。

results.name: be accustomed to
results.english: familiar with something
results.example1: She quickly became accustomed to his messy ways. 她很快就習慣了他的邋遢作風。
results.example2: I'm not accustomed to being treated like this. 我不習慣別人這樣待我。

results.name: delegate
results.english: to give a particular job, duty, right, etc. to someone else so that they do it for you
results.example1: As a boss you have to delegate (responsibilities to your staff). 你作為老闆必須要分派工作。
results.example2: Authority to make financial decisions has been delegated to a special committee. 財政決策權已經交給一個特別委員會了。

results.name: attentive
results.english: listening carefully
results.example1: an attentive audience  全神貫注的聽眾

results.name: reluctant
results.english: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave.  我玩得很開心，都不願意離開了。
results.example2: Many parents feel reluctant to talk openly with their children.  很多父母都不願意和兒女們敞開心扉交談。

results.name: acquaint...with
results.english: to make someone or yourself familiar with something
results.chinese: 使認識；使了解；使熟悉；使知悉
results.example1: Take time to acquaint yourself with the rules.  花點時間熟悉一下規則。
results.example2: The Broadcasting Museum offers workshops to acquaint children with the world of radio.  廣播博物館還舉辦講習班讓孩子了解無線電世界。

results.name: oversee
results.english: to watch or organize a job or an activity to make certain that it is being done correctly
results.example1: As marketing manager,  her job is to _____ all the company's advertising.  作為行銷經理, 她的工作是負責公司所有的廣告業務。

results.name: lax
results.english: without much care,  attention,  or control
results.example1: The subcommittee contends that the authorities were lax in investigating most of the cases. 小組委員會認為有關部門對多宗案件疏於調查。

results.name: procrastinate
results.english: to keep delaying something that must be done, often because it is unpleasant or boring
results.example1: I know I've got to deal with the problem at some point - I'm just procrastinating. 我知道遲早得解決這個問題——我只是在拖延時間。

results.name: personnel
results.english: the people who are employed in a company, organization, or one of the armed forces
results.chinese: （公司、組織或軍隊的）全體人員，員工，職員
results.example1: The new director is likely to make major changes in personnel. 新主管可能會在人事上做出大變動。
results.example2: military personnel 軍事人員

results.name: directory
results.english: a book that gives a list of names, addresses, or other facts
results.example1: a business directory 企業名錄
results.example2: Look up their number in the telephone directory. 在電話簿裡查查他們的號碼。

results.name: foster
results.english: to take care of a child, usually for a limited time, without being the child's legal parent
results.chinese: 收養，代養，撫育（他人子女，通常指有限的一段時間）
results.example1: Would you consider fostering (a child)? 你會考慮代養一個孩子嗎？

results.name: neutrality
results.english: a neutral position, especially in a war
results.example1: Sweden isn't likely ever to abandon its traditional neutrality.  瑞典永遠不可能放棄其傳統的中立立場。
results.example2: The Queen has maintained political neutrality throughout her reign.  女王在位期間，政治上一直保持中立。

results.name: subsequent
results.english: happening after something else
results.example1: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.  書中講述了他患病及隨後隱退政壇的事。
results.example2: Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure,  because we didn't hear anything.  那些爆炸一定是在我們離開後發生的, 因為我們甚麼也沒聽到。

results.name: the remainder
results.english: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away
results.example1: I ate most of it and gave the remainder to the dog. 我吃了一大半，剩下的餵狗了。
results.example2: It rained the first day but the remainder of the trip was fine. 旅行中第一天下了雨，不過其餘的日子天氣都很好。

results.name: advisable
results.english: If something is advisable, it will avoid problems if you do it.
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] It's advisable to book seats at least a week in advance.  最好至少提前一週預訂座位。
results.example2: A certain amount of caution is advisable at this point.  此刻保持適度謹慎是明智的。

results.name: improvise
results.english: to invent or make something,  such as a speech or a device,  at the time when it is needed without already having planned it
results.example1: I hadn't prepared a speech so I suddenly had to improvise.  我沒有準備演講, 所以突然之間我只好即興講幾句。
results.example2: We improvised a mattress from a pile of blankets.  為了能有地方睡覺, 我們臨時用一堆毯子作床墊。

results.name: alumnus,  alumni
results.english: someone who has left a school, college, or university after finishing their studies there
results.example1: the alumni of St MacNissi's College 聖麥克尼西學院的校友
results.example2: Several famous alumni have agreed to help raise money for the school's restoration fund. 幾位有名望的校友已經同意幫助母校籌集資金修復校舍。

results.name: admission
results.english: permission to enter a place
results.example1: Admission to the exhibition will be by invitation only. 只有持請帖者才可進入展覽會場。
results.example2: There's a notice outside the building that says No admission before twelve noon. 樓外有張告示，寫著「中午12點以前禁止進入」。

results.name: banquet
results.english: a large formal meal for many people, often followed by speeches in honour of someone
results.example1: Medieval banquets are held in the castle once a month.  每個月在城堡裡舉行一次中世紀風格的宴會。

results.name: commit
results.english: to promise or give your loyalty, time, or money to a particular principle, person, or plan of action
results.chinese: 承諾，保證；（使）忠於；（使）致力於；投入（時間或金錢）
results.example1: The government must commit itself to improving healthcare. 政府必須致力改善醫療保健服務。
results.example2: Once we have committed to this course of action there is no going back. 一旦我們承諾採取這個行動，就沒有回頭路。

results.name: informative
results.english: providing a lot of useful information
results.chinese: 有資料量的; 增長見聞的
results.example1: This is an interesting and highly informative book.  這是一本有趣且資訊豐富的書。

results.name: manuscripts
results.english: the original copy of a book or article before it is printed
results.example1: He sent the 400-page manuscript to his publisher. 他將400頁的手稿寄給他的出版商了。

results.name: advocate
results.english: to publicly support or suggest an idea,  development,  or way of doing something
results.example1: [+ -ing (v)] She advocates taking a more long-term view.  她主張把目光放得更長遠一些。
results.example2: He advocates the return of capital punishment.  他主張恢復死刑。

results.name: defy
results.english: to refuse to obey a person,  decision,  law,  situation,  etc.
results.example1: It is rare to see children openly defying their teachers.  很少看見孩子公然跟老師作對。
results.example2: A few workers have defied the majority decision and gone into work despite the strike.  幾個工人不顧大多數人的罷工決定自己去上班了。

results.name: respondent
results.english: a person who answers a request for information
results.example1: In a recent opinion poll, a majority of respondents were against nuclear weapons. 在最近的一次民意調查中，大多數調查物件表示反對發展核子武器。

results.name: has a virtual monopoly on
results.english: a company that has complete control of the product or service it provides because it is the only company that provides it
results.chinese: 形容一間公司擁有壟斷市場狀態

results.name: consistent
results.english: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way
results.chinese: 一貫的；堅持的；始終如一的
results.example1: There has been a consistent improvement in her attitude.  她的態度一直在改進。
results.example2: Her work is sometimes good, but the problem is she's not consistent.  她工作有時不錯，問題是她不能始終如一。

results.name: publicize
results.english: to make information about something generally available
results.example1: Attitudes seem to be changing as a result of recent highly publicized cases of sexual harassment. 由於最近的幾宗性騷擾案件受到連續報道，大眾的看法似乎正在轉變。
results.example2: The work of the charity has been widely publicized throughout the media. 慈善組織的工作獲得媒體的廣泛宣傳。

results.name: draft
results.english: to order people by law to join the armed forces
results.example1: He was drafted (into the army) at 18. 他18歲時應徵參軍（入伍）。

results.name: marginal
results.english: very small in amount or effect
results.example1: The report suggests that there has only been a marginal improvement in women's pay over the past few years.  報告顯示, 過去幾年間女性的工資只有輕微增長。

results.name: contemporary
results.english: existing or happening now
results.example1: contemporary music/literature/art/fashion  當代音樂／文學／藝術／時尚
results.example2: Although the play was written hundreds of years ago, it still has a contemporary (= modern) feel to it.  這個劇本儘管寫於幾百年前，但讀來仍具現代感。

results.name: favourable
results.english: showing that you like or approve of someone or something
results.example1: We have had a favourable response to the plan so far.  到目前為止, 關於此計劃我們得到的回饋是正面的。

results.name: disregard
results.english: to ignore something
results.example1: He told us to disregard everything we'd learned so far and start again. 他告訴我們不要考慮所學過的東西，一切要重新開始。

results.name: incentives
results.english: something that encourages a person to do something
results.example1: Tax incentives have been very effective in encouraging people to save and invest more of their income.  稅收措施在鼓勵人們將收入多儲蓄和多投資方面很有效。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] There is little incentive for people to leave their cars at home when public transport remains so expensive.  公共交通的費用居高不下，無法激勵人們停開私家車。

results.name: mastermind
results.english: to plan a difficult activity,  often a crime,  in detail and make certain that it happens successfully
results.example1: He's believed to have masterminded the attacks.  據信是他策劃了這些襲擊事件。

results.name: stagnant
results.english: not growing or developing
results.example1: a stagnant economy 停滯的經濟

results.name: brisk
results.english: quick,  energetic,  and active
results.chinese: 輕快的, 生氣勃勃的
results.example1: a brisk walk  輕快的步伐
results.example2: He set a brisk pace and we struggled to keep up.  他步伐矯健, 我們在後面拼命跟著。

results.name: soar
results.english: to rise very quickly to a high level
results.example1: All night long fireworks soared into the sky. 整個晚上煙火不斷地竄上高空。
results.example2: Temperatures will soar over the weekend, say the weather forecasters. 天氣預報員說，氣溫會在週末驟升。

results.name: assert
results.english: to say that something is certainly true
results.example1: [+ that] He asserts that she stole money from him.  他一口咬定她偷了他的錢。

results.name: evenly
results.english: in or into equal amounts
results.example1: Divide the mixture evenly between the baking pans. 將混合物分成等份放在烤盤中。
results.example2: Congress is still evenly divided on the issue. 在這個問題上，國會仍舊分成兩個陣營，旗鼓相當。

results.name: prospect
results.english: the possibility that something good might happen in the future
results.chinese: （發生好事情的）可能，可能性，機會
results.example1: Is there any prospect of the weather improving?  天氣有可能好轉嗎？
results.example2: There seems little prospect of an end to the dispute.  爭端似乎不大可能平息。

results.name: implication
results.english: an occasion when you seem to suggest something without saying it directly
results.example1: [+ that] From what she said, the implication was that they were splitting up.  她的話暗示他們將要分手。
results.example2: She accused the party and, by implication, its leader too.  她指責了該政黨，也含蓄地指責了該黨的領袖。

results.name: thrive
results.english: to grow,  develop,  or be successful
results.chinese: 茁壯成長；興旺, 繁榮
results.example1: His business thrived in the years before the war.  戰前那些年, 他的生意很興隆。
results.example2: She seems to thrive on stress.  她似乎很擅長在壓力下工作。

results.name: pharmaceutical
results.english: relating to the production of medicines
results.example1: the pharmaceutical industry  製藥業
results.example2: a pharmaceutical company/product/journal 製藥公司／藥品／藥學期刊

results.name: wane
results.english: to become weaker in strength or influence
results.example1: By the late 70s the band's popularity was beginning to wane.  上世紀70年代末, 這個樂團的人氣開始下滑。

results.name: depression
results.english: the state of feeling very unhappy and without hope for the future
results.example1: I was overwhelmed by feelings of depression. 我萬念俱灰。

results.name: dwindle
results.english: to become smaller in size or amount, or fewer in number
results.example1: The community has dwindled to a tenth of its former size in the last two years. 該社區在過去的兩年裡縮小到了原來的十分之一。
results.example2: Her hopes of success in the race dwindled last night as the weather became worse. 隨著昨晚天氣的惡化，她在比賽中獲勝的希望減小了。

results.name: it could impede the process
results.english: to make it more difficult for something to happen or more difficult for someone to do something
results.example1: Although he's shy,  it certainly hasn't impeded his career in any way.  儘管他很害羞, 但這顯然一點也沒有妨礙他的事業。

results.name: adversity
results.english: a difficult or unlucky situation or event
results.example1: She was always cheerful in adversity. 身處逆境時，她也從不垂頭喪氣。
results.example2: The road to happiness is paved with adversities. 通往幸福的道路上荊棘滿途。

results.name: cohesive
results.english: united and working together effectively
results.example1: a cohesive group  有凝聚力的團體
results.example2: cohesive forces  凝聚力

results.name: installment plan
results.english: a method of paying for something in which the buyer pays part of the cost immediately and then makes small regular payments until the debt is completely paid

results.name: spare
results.english: If something is spare, it is available to use because it is extra.
results.example1: a spare key/tyre 備用鎖匙／輪胎
results.example2: We have a spare room if you want to stay overnight with us. 要是你想在我們這裡過夜的話，我們有一個空房間。

results.name: spare
results.english: to give time, money, or space to someone, especially when it is difficult for you
results.chinese: （尤指在自己困難的情況下）抽出，撥出，擠出
results.example1: [+ two objects] Could you spare me £20? 你能抽出20英鎊給我嗎？
results.example2: I'd love to come, but I can't spare the time. 我很想來，但恐怕沒時間。

results.name: clearance
results.english: an occasion when goods are offered for sale cheaply so that people will be encouraged to buy them and there will be space for new goods
results.example1: We bought our new carpet at a clearance sale.  我們的新地毯是在清倉大減價的時候買的。
results.example2: US I buy Christmas decorations when they go on clearance in January  我在一月份清倉減價的時候購買聖誕裝飾品。

results.name: revolutionary
results.english: involved in or relating to a revolution
results.example1: a revolutionary leader/movement 革命領導人／運動

results.name: envision or envisage
results.english: to imagine or expect something in the future, especially something good
results.example1: Train fare increases of 15 percent are envisaged for the next year. 預計明年火車票價將會上漲15%。
results.example2: [ + that ] It's envisaged that building will start at the end of this year. 預計大樓將在今年年底動工。

results.name: grant
results.english: to give or allow someone something,  usually in an official way
results.chinese: (通常指官方)同意, 准予, 授予
results.example1: [+ two objects] They granted her an entry visa.  他們發給她入境簽證。
results.example2: He was granted asylum.  他的避難請求被接受了。

results.name: grant
results.english: an amount of money given especially by the government to a person or organization for a special purpose
results.chinese: (尤指政府為特殊目的給予個人或組織的)撥款, 補助金
results.example1: a student/research grant  助學金／研究撥款
results.example2: a local authority/government grant  當地行政機構／政府撥款

results.name: domestic
results.english: relating to a person's own country
results.example1: domestic airlines/flights 國內航空公司／航班
results.example2: Domestic opinion had turned against the war. 國內輿論已轉而反對戰爭。

results.name: inquiry
results.english: (the process of asking) a question
results.example1: I've been making inquiries about/into the cost of a round-the-world ticket.  我一直在打聽環遊世界的票價。
results.example2: formal Inquiry into the matter is pointless - no one will tell you anything.  打聽這件事沒有用——沒有人會告訴你。

results.name: corrosion
results.english: the process of corroding, or metal that has been corroded
results.chinese: 腐蝕，侵蝕；腐蝕（或侵蝕）作用的生成物
results.example1: There was a lot of corrosion on the bottom of the car. 汽車底部鏽跡斑斑。
results.example2: figurative We are witnessing the corrosion of moral standards within our society. 我們見證了社會道德的淪喪。

results.name: precautions to avoid infection
results.english: an action that is done to prevent something unpleasant or dangerous happening
results.example1: Many people have been stockpiling food as a precaution against shortages. 為了預防食物短缺, 很多人一直在大量儲備食品。
results.example2: They failed to take the necessary precautions to avoid infection.  他們未能採取必要的預防措施來避免感染。

results.name: it's premeditated
results.english: (especially of a crime or something unpleasant) done after being thought about or carefully planned
results.chinese: （尤指罪行或不快的事情）預先考慮的，預先策劃的，預謀的
results.example1: premeditated murder 蓄意謀殺
results.example2: The assault was premeditated and particularly brutal. 這次襲擊是有預謀的，非常殘忍。

results.name: tailored
results.english: made or changed especially to be suitable for a particular situation or purpose
results.example1: The project clearly requires a tailored computer system.  這個專案計劃顯然需要一個特製的電腦系統。

results.name: economize
results.english: to try to save money by reducing the amount that you are spending
results.chinese: 節約, 節省；緊縮開支
results.example1: You could economize on food by not eating in restaurants all the time. 如果你不總是去餐廳吃飯, 就可以在吃這方面節省很多。
results.example2: A lot of companies are trying to economize by not taking on new staff.  很多公司為了盡可能節省開支, 都不再僱用新員工。

results.name: respective
results.english: relating or belonging to each of the separate people or things you have just mentioned
results.example1: Everyone would go into the hall for assembly and then afterwards we'd go to our respective classes.  所有人都去禮堂參加集會，會後各自回各自的班級。
results.example2: Clinton and Zedillo ordered their respective Cabinets to devise a common counter-drug strategy. 克林頓和塞迪略命令他們各自的內閣制訂兩國共同的反毒品戰略。

results.name: maneuver or manoeuvre
results.english: a movement or set of movements needing skill and care
results.example1: Reversing round a corner is one of the manoeuvres you are required to perform in a driving test. 駕照考試中的一個規定動作是倒車轉彎。

results.name: maneuver
results.english: to turn and direct an object
results.example1: Loaded supermarket trolleys are often difficult to manoeuvre. 滿載的超市購物車往往很難控制方向。
results.example2: This car manoeuvres well at high speed.  這輛汽車高速行駛時操作性能很好。

results.name: infuriate
results.english: to make someone extremely angry
results.example1: His sexist attitude infuriates me. 他歧視女性的態度讓我很生氣。

results.name: commentary
results.english: a set of written remarks on an event, book, or person that explains its subject or expresses an opinion on it
results.example1: There's good arts coverage in the newspaper, but not much political commentary. 報紙上有很多藝術方面的報道，可是政治時事評述卻不多。

results.name: commitment
results.english: a willingness to give your time and energy to something that you believe in, or a promise or firm decision to do something
results.chinese: 忠誠；投入；奉獻；承諾，保證，諾言
results.example1: Players must make a commitment to play for a full season. 隊員必須保證參加整個賽季的比賽
results.example2: her commitment to left-wing politics/the cause of feminism/the company  她對左翼政治／女權主義事業／公司的奉獻

results.name: biography
results.english: the life story of a person written by someone else
results.example1: He wrote a biography of Winston Churchill. 他撰寫了溫斯頓‧丘吉爾的傳記。

results.name: superb
results.english: of excellent quality; very great
results.example1: He is a superb dancer.  他是一個傑出的舞蹈家。
results.example2: Taylor scored a superb goal at the end of the first half.  泰勒在上半場要結束的時候攻入了一個極為精彩的進球。

results.name: carrier
results.english: a person or thing that carries something
results.chinese: 搬運人，運送人；運輸工具

results.name: customary
results.english: traditional
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] In my village, it is customary for a girl to take her mother's name. 在我們村，女孩按習俗隨母姓。

results.name: indulge
results.english: to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable, especially more than is good for you
results.example1: The soccer fans indulged their patriotism, waving flags and singing songs. 足球迷搖著旗唱著歌，縱情抒發他們的愛國熱情。
results.example2: I love champagne but I don't often indulge myself. 我愛喝香檳，但一般都有節制

results.name: the proximity to the town center
results.english: the state of being near in space or time
results.example1: The best thing about the location of the house is its proximity to the town centre.  這棟房子地理位置最好的就是鄰近市中心。

results.name: stipulation
results.english: a rule that must be followed or something that must be done
results.example1: Is there any stipulation concerning the number of people attending the conference?  參加會議的人數方面有什麼明確的要求嗎？
results.example2: [+ that] The only stipulation is that candidates must be over the age of 35.  唯一的規定是候選人必須年滿35歲。

results.name: stipulate
results.english: to say exactly how something must be or must be done
results.example1: She agreed to buy the car, but stipulated racing tyres and a turbo-powered engine. 她同意買這輛車，但指明要裝賽車輪胎和渦輪動力引擎。
results.example2: [ + that ] The law stipulates that new cars must have seat belts for the driver and every passenger. 法律規定新車必須為駕駛人和每位乘客配備坐椅安全帶。

results.name: impeach
results.english: to make a formal statement saying that a public official is guilty of a serious offence in connection with their job, especially in the US
results.chinese: （尤指在美國）控告，彈劾（公職人員）
results.example1: The governor was impeached for wrongful use of state money. 州長因濫用本州公款而遭到彈劾。

results.name: deadlock
results.english: a situation in which agreement in an argument cannot be reached because neither side will change its demands or accept any of the demands of the other side
results.example1: Somebody will have to compromise if we are to break (= end) the deadlock between the two warring factions. 如果我們想打破爭鬥派別之間的僵局，就必須有人作出妥協。
results.example2: Once again the talks have ended in deadlock. 談判再次以僵局告終。

results.name: observant
results.english: good or quick at noticing things
results.chinese: 善於觀察的；觀察力敏銳的；機警的
results.example1: That's a new dress, isn't it? Yes, you are observant! 「那是件新衣服，是不是？」「沒錯，你真是好眼力！」

results.name: disguise
results.english: to give a new appearance to a person or thing, especially in order to hide its true form
results.chinese: 給…化裝，給…喬裝打扮；將…偽裝起來
results.example1: He disguised himself by wearing a false beard.  他粘上假鬍鬚偽裝自己。
results.example2: Minor skin imperfections can usually be disguised with a spot of make-up. 微小的皮膚瑕疵通常可以用化妝品來掩蓋。

results.name: undercut
results.english: to charge less than a competitor
results.example1: Big supermarkets can undercut all rivals, especially small family-owned shops. 大型超市售價可以低於所有競爭對手，尤其是那些商業街上的小店鋪。
results.example2: They claim to undercut their competitors by at least five percent. 他們宣稱售價至少要比競爭對手低5%。

results.name: aggravating
results.english: annoying
results.example1: I find him really aggravating.  我覺得他這個人真煩人。

results.name: imperative
results.english: extremely important or urgent
results.chinese: 極重要的；緊急的；迫切的
results.example1: [+ that] The president said it was imperative that the release of all hostages be secured. 總統說當務之急是確保所有人質都獲釋。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] It's imperative to act now before the problem gets really serious.  必須現在就採取行動, 而不是等到問題變得難以收拾。

results.name: omit
results.english: to fail to include or do something
results.example1: She was omitted from the list of contributors to the report. 這篇報道的撰稿人中漏掉了她的名字。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] formal She omitted to mention that she would be away next week. 她沒提及自己下星期不在這裡的事。

results.name: proficient
results.english: skilled and experienced
results.example1: a proficient swimmer 游泳好手
results.example2: It takes a couple of years of regular driving before you become proficient at it. 你得開上幾年車才能熟練自如。

results.name: dispute
results.english: an argument or disagreement, especially an official one between, for example, workers and employers or two countries with a common border
results.chinese: （尤指勞資雙方或相鄰兩國之間的）爭執，爭端，糾紛
results.example1: a bitter/long-running dispute 激烈／長期的爭執
results.example2: They have been unable to settle/resolve the dispute over working conditions. 他們無法解決工作條件方面的爭端。

results.name: objection
results.english: the act of expressing or feeling opposition to or dislike of something or someone
results.example1: Her objection to/against the plan is based on incorrect facts. 她對這項計劃的反對基於錯誤的數據。
results.example2: A couple of people raised/voiced objections to the proposal. 有幾個人反對這項提議。

results.name: bid
results.english: an offer of a particular amount of money for something that is for sale
results.example1: I made a bid of $150 for the painting.  我出價150美元買這幅畫。
results.example2: She made/put in a bid of £69,000 for the flat, which was accepted. 她為這個單位出價69000英鎊，並以這個價格達成了交易。

results.name: bid
results.english: to offer a particular amount of money for something that is for sale and compete against other people to buy it, especially at a public sale of goods or property
results.chinese: （尤指在拍賣中）出價，喊價競買
results.example1: She knew she couldn't afford it, so she didn't bid.  她知道買不起，所以沒有出價。
results.example2: The communications group has shown an interest in bidding for the company.  該通訊集團有意出價競買這間公司。

results.name: settle
results.english: to reach a decision or an agreement about something, or to end a disagreement
results.chinese: 確定；決定；解決，結束（爭端等）
results.example1: [+ question word] They haven't yet settled when the wedding is going to be. 他們還沒有確訂婚禮在甚麽時候舉行。
results.example2: I'd like to get this matter settled once and for all (= reach a final decision on it). 我想把這件事了結了。

results.name: spot-on
results.english: exactly right
results.example1: How old do I reckon she is? I'd say 38. Spot on. 「我估計她有多大年紀？我看38歲吧。」「一點不差。」

results.name: bulk
results.english: something or someone that is very large
results.example1: She eased her large bulk out of the chair.  她緩緩地將她那龐大的身軀從椅子上挪開。

results.name: endeavor
results.english: an attempt to do something
results.example1: In spite of our best endeavours, it has proven impossible to contact her. 儘管我們盡了最大的努力，但最後還是未能聯繫上她。
results.example2: Crossing the North Pole on foot was an amazing feat of human endeavour. 徒步穿越北極是人類探索領域的一次壯舉。

results.name: subject to something
results.english: to have or experience a particular thing,  especially something unpleasant
results.example1: Cars are subject to a high domestic tax.  買汽車要繳很高的國內稅。
results.example2: In recent years,  she has been subject to attacks of depression.  近年來, 她一直飽受憂鬱症的折磨。

results.name: clientele
results.english: all the customers of a business when they are considered as a group
results.example1: The nightclub has a very fashionable clientele. 這家夜總會有一批很時尚的主顧。

results.name: encompass
results.english: to include different types of things
results.chinese: 包含，包括（尤指很多不同事物）
results.example1: The festival is to encompass everything from music, theatre, and ballet to literature, cinema, and the visual arts.  本屆文化節將涵蓋從音樂、戲劇、芭蕾到文學、電影、視覺藝術等各種藝術形式。

results.name: commodity
results.english: a substance or product that can be traded, bought, or sold
results.example1: The country's most valuable commodities include tin and diamonds. 該國最有價值的商品包括錫和鑽石。
results.example2: the international commodities market 國際商品市場

results.name: consignment
results.english: an amount of goods that is sent somewhere
results.example1: The most recent consignment of cloth was faulty.  最近一次托運的布料有殘疵。

results.name: perishable
results.english: Perishable food decays quickly.
results.chinese: (食物)易腐爛的, 易變質的
results.example1: It's important to store perishable food in a cool place.  一定要把易變壞的食物存放在陰涼的地方。

results.name: courier
results.english: a person or company that takes messages, letters, or parcels from one person or place to another
results.chinese: （遞送重要書信或文件的）信差 ，遞送員
results.example1: I want to have this package delivered by motorcycle courier.  我想找機車遞送員送這個包裹。

results.name: enclosed
results.english: surrounded by walls, objects, or structures
results.example1: He doesn't like enclosed spaces. 他不喜歡封閉的空間。

results.name: formerly
results.english: in the past
results.example1: The European Union was formerly called the European Community. 歐盟舊稱歐洲共同體。

results.name: correspondence
results.english: letters, especially official or business letters
results.chinese: 信件，信函（尤指公函或商業信函）
results.example1: Any further correspondence should be sent to my new address.  以後來信請寄到我的新地址。

results.name: detach
results.english: to separate or remove something from something else that it is connected to
results.chinese: 使分離, 使分開；拆掉
results.example1: You can detach the hood if you prefer the coat without it.  如果不想要大衣上的帽兜, 可以拆掉。
results.example2: Detach the lower part of the form from this letter and return it to the above address.  請將表格的下半部分從信中剪下來, 並寄到上述地址。

results.name: affix
results.english: to fasten or stick one thing to another
results.example1: She affixed a stamp to the envelope. 她把一枚郵票貼在信封上。

results.name: sense of noblesse oblige
results.english: the idea that someone with power and influence should use their social position to help other people
results.chinese: 位高應不負重望；顯貴者行為理應高尚

results.name: oblige
results.english: to force someone to do something, or to make it necessary for someone to do something
results.example1: The law obliges companies to pay decent wages to their employees. 法律強制公司向其僱員支付適當的工資。
results.example2: The law does not obligate sellers to accept the highest offer. 法律沒有強制賣主必須接受最高的出價。

results.name: complimentary
results.english: praising or expressing admiration for someone
results.example1: The reviews of his latest film have been highly complimentary. 評論文章對他的最新影片高度讚賞。
results.example2: Our guests said some very complimentary things about the meal I'd cooked. 我們的客人對我做的飯菜大加讚賞。

results.name: retain
results.english: to keep or continue to have something
results.example1: She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.  她被打敗了, 失去了繼續掌管公司的權力。
results.example2: He managed to retain his dignity throughout the performance.  在整個表演過程中, 他設法保持了自己的尊嚴。

results.name: extensive
results.english: covering a large area; having a great range
results.chinese: 廣闊的, 大面積的；覆蓋範圍廣的
results.example1: a school with extensive grounds  操場很大的學校
results.example2: extensive repairs to the motorway  對高速公路的大規模維修

results.name: occupancy.
results.english: someone's use of a room or building for the purposes of living or working
results.example1: The family's occupancy of the apartment lasted only six months. 這家人只在這套公寓裡住了6個月。
results.example2: The price for a room is $158 per person per night, double/single occupancy (= two people/one person in each room). 房間的價格是每人每晚158美元，雙人或單人房。

results.name: markedly
results.english: in a very obvious or noticeable way
results.example1: Eye-witness accounts of the fighting differ markedly from police reports of what happened.
results.example2: She has markedly changed her eating habits.

results.name: sales projections
results.english: a calculation or guess about the future based on information that you have
results.example1: The company has failed to achieve last year's sales projections by 30 percent.  這家公司未能達到去年的預期銷售目標, 還差30%。

results.name: a substantial difference
results.english: large in size,  value,  or importance
results.chinese: 大的；可觀的；價值巨大的；重大的
results.example1: The findings show a substantial difference between the opinions of men and women.  這些發現顯示男性和女性之間存在重大的意見分歧。
results.example2: She inherited a substantial fortune from her grandmother.  她從祖母那裡繼承了一筆數目可觀的遺產。

results.name: significantly
results.english: in a way that is easy to see or by a large amoun
results.example1: My piano playing has improved significantly since I started with a new teacher. 自從換了一位新老師，我的鋼琴水準有了明顯提升。

results.name: representative
results.english: someone who speaks or does something officially for another person or group of people
results.example1: The firm has representatives in every major city. 這間公司在每個大城市都設有銷售代表。

results.name: incur
results.english: to experience something, usually something unpleasant, as a result of actions you have taken
results.example1: to incur debts/fines/bills  招致債務／遭到罰款／要付帳
results.example2: The play has incurred the wrath/anger of both audiences and critics.  這部劇引起了觀眾和評論家的憤怒。

results.name: inception
results.english: the beginning of an organization or official activity
results.example1: Since its inception in 1968, the company has been at the forefront of computer development.  這家公司自從1968年成立以來一直處於電腦發展的最前列。

results.name: self-reliant
results.english: not needing help or support from other people
results.example1: Single parents have to be self-reliant and inventive. 單親父母必須懂得自力更生，還要富有創造力。

results.name: curtail
results.english: to stop something before it is finished,  or to reduce or limit something
results.example1: to curtail your holiday/spending  縮短假期／縮減開支
results.example2: With all the snow,  our daily walks have been severely curtailed.  雪太多, 我們每天的散步被大大削減。

results.name: committee
results.english: a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or collect information for it
results.chinese: （代表較大的組織決策或搜集資訊的）委員會
results.example1: She sits on/is on the school's development committee. 她是學校發展委員會的成員。
results.example2: The local council has just set up a committee to study recycling. 當地市政會剛剛成立了一個研究資源再利用問題的委員會。

results.name: proceeds
results.english: the amount of money received from a particular event or activity or when something is sold
results.chinese: （從事某種活動或變賣財物的）收入，收益
results.example1: The proceeds of today's festival will go to several local charities. 今天活動的收入將捐給當地的幾家慈善機構。
results.example2: It says on the back of the card all proceeds to charity. 卡片背面寫著「所有收入捐給慈善機構」。

results.name: reimburse
results.english: to pay back money to someone who has spent it for you or lost it because of you
results.example1: The airline reimbursed me for the amount they had overcharged me. 航空公司把多收的錢退還給我了。
results.example2: She was reimbursed by the gas company for the damage to her house. 煤氣公司對她房屋遭受的損失進行了賠償。

results.name: deduct
results.english: to take away an amount or part from a total
results.example1: The player had points deducted (from his score) for arguing with the referee. 那名運動員因與裁判發生爭執而被扣分。

results.name: amend
results.english: to change the words of a text, especially a law or a legal document
results.chinese: 修訂，修正，修改（法律文件等）
results.example1: MPs were urged to amend the law to prevent another oil tanker disaster.  下院議員被敦促修訂該法律，以防止油輪洩漏災難再次發生。
results.example2: In line 20, men should be amended (= changed) to people.  第20行中的 men 應改為 people。

results.name: exempt from
results.english: with special permission not to do or pay something
results.chinese: 被免除（義務或付款）的；被豁免的
results.example1: Goods exempt from this tax include books and children's clothes. 免徵這項稅收的商品包括書籍和童裝。
results.example2: Pregnant women are exempt from dental charges under the current health system. 在現行的醫療制度下，孕婦看牙醫是免費的。

results.name: deficient
results.english: not having enough of
results.example1: A diet deficient in vitamin D may cause the disease rickets.  飲食中缺乏維他命D可導致佝僂病。

results.name: expenditure
results.english: the total amount of money that a government or person spends
results.chinese: （政府或個人的）全部開支，花費
results.example1: It's part of a drive to cut government expenditure. 這是削減政府開支的一個方法
results.example2: The government's annual expenditure on arms has been reduced. 政府已經縮減了年度軍備開支

results.name: excess
results.english: an amount that is more than acceptable, expected, or reasonable
results.example1: An excess of enthusiasm is not always a good thing. 過分熱情不見得總是件好事。
results.example2: They both eat to excess (= too much). 他們兩個都吃得太多了。

results.name: fiscal
results.english: connected with (public) money
results.example1: fiscal policy 財政政策

results.name: incidental
results.english: less important than the thing something is connected with or part of
results.example1: Try not to be distracted by incidental details.  盡量不要為一些次要的枝節問題分心。
results.example2: The points you make are true,  but they're incidental to the main problem.  你的看法都正確, 但它們對主要問題而言只是枝節性的。

results.name: foresee
results.english: to know about something before it happens
results.example1: I don't foresee any difficulties so long as we keep within budget.  只要我們不超出預算，我看不出會有甚麽困難。

results.name: misplace
results.english: to lose something temporarily by forgetting where you have put it
results.chinese: 隨意擱置；亂放（而一時找不到）
results.example1: She misplaced her keys so often that her secretary used to carry spare ones for her. 她經常記不起她的鎖匙放在哪裡，因此她的秘書常為她帶著備用鎖匙。

results.name: emerge
results.english: to appear by coming out of something or out from behind something
results.example1: She emerged from the sea,  blue with cold.  她浮出了海面, 渾身凍得發青。

results.name: persist
results.english: If an unpleasant feeling or situation persists, it continues to exist.
results.example1: If the pain persists, consult a doctor. 如果疼痛持續就去看醫生。
results.example2: The cold weather is set to persist throughout the week. 寒冷天氣很可能將持續整個星期。

results.name: prosecute
results.english: to officially accuse someone of committing a crime in a law court,  or (of a lawyer) to try to prove that a person accused of committing a crime is guilty of that crime
results.example1: Shoplifters will be prosecuted.  商店扒手將遭到起訴。
results.example2: He was prosecuted for fraud. 他因詐騙而被起訴。

results.name: waive the right
results.english: to not demand something you have a right to,  or not cause a rule to be obeyed
results.example1: The bank manager waived the charge (= said we didn't have to pay),  as we were old and valued customers.  那位銀行經理沒有收取我們的費用, 因為我們是尊貴的老顧客。
results.example2: If they waive (= remove) the time limit,  many more applications will come in.  假如取消時間限制, 那麼就會收到多得多的申請。

results.name: sportscaster
results.english: someone who appears on television or radio, giving information and news about sports events
results.chinese: （電視台或電台的）體育節目播音員，體育節目解說員

results.name: improbable
results.english: not likely to happen or be true
results.chinese: 不大可能發生的；未必確實的
results.example1: It's highly improbable that Norris will agree.  諾裡斯很可能不會同意。
results.example2: an improbable-sounding excuse  聽上去不大可信的藉口

results.name: endorse
results.english: to make a public statement of your approval or support for something or someone
results.example1: The Council is expected to endorse the committee's recommendations. 估計地方議會將贊同委員會的提議。
results.example2: formal I fully endorse (= agree with) everything the Chairperson has said. 我完全贊同主席所說的一切。

results.name: erode or erode away
results.english: to rub or be rubbed away gradually
results.example1: Wind and rain have eroded the statues into shapeless lumps of stone. 這些雕像遭受風雨侵蝕，成了一堆堆不成形的亂石。
results.example2: The cliffs are eroding several feet a year. 這些懸崖每年都被侵蝕掉數英尺。

results.name: autonomy
results.english: the right of an organization, country, or region to be independent and govern itself
results.example1: Demonstrators demanded immediate autonomy for their region. 遊行示威者要求立即實現該地區的自治。
results.example2: The universities want to preserve their autonomy from central government. 大學都希望維護其自主辦學權，不受中央政府的控制。

results.name: retraction
results.english: the act of taking back an offer or statement, or admitting that a statement was false
results.chinese: 徹回、取消 某個你以前發表過或寫過的聲名

results.name: extradite
results.english: to make someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal
results.example1: He will be extradited to Arizona from Florida. 他將被從佛羅里達州引渡到亞利桑那州。

results.name: universal suffrage
results.english: the right to vote in an election, especially to vote for representatives in a government
results.chinese: （尤指選舉議會等機構代表的）選舉權，投票權
results.example1: universal suffrage (= the right of all adults to vote) 普選權

results.name: consent
results.english: to agree to do something, or to allow someone to do something
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] Very reluctantly, I've consented to lend her my car. 我很不情願地答應把車借給她。
results.example2: My aunt never married because her father wouldn't consent to her marriage. 我姑媽終生未嫁，因爲她父親不同意她的婚事。

results.name: wield
results.english: to hold a weapon or tool and look as if you are going to use it
results.chinese: 揮舞，握，抓著（武器或工具）
results.example1: She was confronted by a man wielding a knife.  她被一名持刀男子威脅。

results.name: resemble
results.english: to look like or be like someone or something
results.example1: You resemble your mother very closely.  你長得很像你媽媽。
results.example2: After the earthquake,  the city resembled a battlefield.  地震過後, 這座城市看上去就像戰場一般。

results.name: bail
results.english: to leave something such as a project, situation, or relationship
results.chinese: 放某某人鴿子，臨陣退縮
results.example1: Many people would have bailed on Renee but he stood by her.
results.example2: I had a travel partner but he bailed and then I didn’t want to go any more.

results.name: blunt
results.english: saying what you think without trying to be polite or considering other people's feelings
results.chinese: 直率的；生硬的；直截了當的
results.example1: I'll be blunt - that last piece of work you did was terrible. 我就直説了——你創作的最後一件作品糟糕透了。

results.name: have beef with sb
results.chinese: 和某個人之間有疙瘩 (俚語)
results.example1: Hey buddy. Listen, it's been a while since we talked. I know I beat the shit out of you, and I'm sorry about that, but I got no beef with you, really.

results.name: submission
results.english: the act of giving something for a decision to be made by others, or a document formally given in this way
results.example1: No date has yet been set for the submission of applications. 申請的提交日期還未確定。
results.example2: The final deadline for submissions is 21 February. 提交的最後期限是2月21日。

results.name: distress
results.english: a feeling of extreme worry, sadness, or pain
results.example1: She claimed that the way she had been treated at work had caused her extreme emotional and psychological distress. 她說自己在工作中受到的待遇讓她在情感和心理上都感到非常痛苦。
results.example2: Many of the horses were showing signs of distress at the end of the race. 比賽接近尾聲時，許多馬匹都表現出非常痛苦的樣子。

results.name: sustain
results.english: to cause or allow something to continue for a period of time
results.chinese: 保持，維持，使持續，使繼續
results.example1: The economy looks set to sustain its growth into next year.  看來經濟增長會持續到明年
results.example2: He seems to find it difficult to sustain relationships with women. 他似乎覺得和女人維持關係並不容易。

results.name: contagion
results.english: the situation in which a disease is spread by touching someone or something
results.example1: The doctor says there's no chance/danger of contagion.  醫生說不存在傳染的可能／危險。

results.name: intimate
results.english: having,  or being likely to cause,  a very close friendship or personal or sexual relationship
results.chinese: 親密的；有性關係的；宜於密切關係的
results.example1: intimate relationships  親密關係
results.example2: The restaurant has a very intimate atmosphere.  這家餐廳的氣氛很怡人。

results.name: assault
results.english: a violent attack
results.example1: He was charged with sexual assault. 他被指控性侵犯。
results.example2: They launched an assault on the capital yesterday. 昨天他們對首都發起進攻。

results.name: sheer
results.english: used to emphasize how very great,  important,  or powerful a quality or feeling is; nothing except
results.example1: The suggestion is sheer nonsense.  這個建議純粹是胡言亂語。
results.example2: His success was due to sheer willpower/determination.  他的成功全靠自己的意志力／決心。

results.name: bail
results.english: an amount of money that a person who has been accused of a crime pays to a law court so that they can be released until their trial. The payment is a way of making certain that the person will return to court for trial
results.example1: He was released/remanded on bail (of 100, 000).  他在交出（十萬美元的）保釋金後被放了出來。
results.example2: Because of a previous conviction,  the judge refused to grant bail (= allow the accused person to be released). 由於嫌犯有前科, 法官不准將他保釋。

results.name: top sth
results.english: to do, pay, etc. more or better than anyone else
results.example1: They've offered me £1,000. I'm afraid we can't top that. 「他們給我開價1000英鎊。」「恐怕我們開不出比這更高的價。」
results.example2: She topped my suggestion with an even better one of her own. 她自己提出了一個建議，甚至比我的還好。

results.name: hypocrite
results.english: someone who says they have particular moral beliefs but behaves in way that shows these are not sincere
results.example1: He's a hypocrite - he's always lecturing other people on the environment but he drives around in a huge car.  他是個偽君子——他總教導別人要保護環境，但他自己卻到處開著一輛廢氣排量很大的汽車。

results.name: truancy
results.english: the problem or situation of children being absent from school regularly without permission
results.example1: My daughter's school has very good exam results and hardly any truancy.  我女兒所在的學校考試成績很好, 幾乎沒有逃學的。
results.example2: Truanting was a serious problem in a fifth of the schools surveyed.  在1／5被調查的學校中, 逃學是一個嚴重問題。

results.name: grudge
results.english: a strong feeling of anger and dislike for a person who you feel has treated you badly,  especially one that lasts for a long time
results.chinese: 怨恨, 嫌隙, 積怨
results.example1: I don't bear any grudge against you.  我對你沒有絲毫怨恨。
results.example2: Amanda still has/holds a grudge against me for refusing to lend her that money.  艾曼達到現在仍對我不借錢給她一事耿耿於懷。

results.name: mend
results.english: to repair something that is broken or damaged
results.example1: Could you mend this hole in my shirt?  你能把我襯衫上的這個洞補一下嗎？
results.example2: UK I've left my watch at the jeweller's to be mended. 我把手錶留在鐘錶店那裡修理了。

results.name: reach out
results.english: to offer help and support to someone
results.chinese: 向某人伸出援手，給某人支持
results.example1: She set up her charity to reach out to the thousands of homeless on the streets. 她創建了慈善團體，向數以千計流落街頭的人們提供幫助。

results.name: ribbon cutting ceremony
results.english: an occasion when a ribbon (= a long narrow strip of coloured material) is cut in order to open a new hospital, school, etc. for the first time, especially as part of an official ceremony

results.name: tip sb off
results.english: to warn someone secretly about something that will happen,  so that they can take action or prevent it from happening
results.chinese: 向(某人)告密；給(某人)通風報信
results.example1: [+ that] Somebody must have tipped the burglars off that the house would be empty.  一定是有人給盜賊通風報信, 告訴他們房子裡到時候會沒有人。
results.example2: The robber was caught when someone tipped off the police.  有人向警方報信後, 搶劫者即被抓獲。

results.name: pomade
results.english: a substance containing oil or wax, used to make hair shine or to give it a particular style

results.name: expel a member
results.english: to force someone to leave a school, organization, or country
results.example1: The new government has expelled all foreign diplomats.  新政府驅逐了所有外國外交官。
results.example2: My brother was expelled from school for bad behaviour.  我弟弟因為行為不當被學校開除了。

results.name: blow over
results.english: When an argument blows over,  it becomes gradually less important until it ends and is forgotten.
results.example1: I thought that after a few days the argument would blow over.  我覺得過幾天這場爭論就會逐漸平息。

results.name: brag about
results.english: to speak too proudly about what you have done or what you own
results.example1: She's always bragging about how much money she earns. 她老是吹噓自己賺錢如何如何多。
results.example2: [+ that] They bragged that their team had never been beaten. 他們誇耀説他們隊伍從未輸過。

results.name: irrelevant to
results.english: not related to what is being discussed or considered and therefore not important
results.example1: These documents are largely irrelevant to the present investigation. 這些文件與目前的調查幾乎毫不相干。
results.example2: Making a large profit is irrelevant to us - the important thing is to make the book available to the largest possible audience. 賺取巨額利潤對我們來說並不重要，重要的是要讓儘可能多的讀者讀到這本書。

results.name: inflammatory
results.english: intended or likely to cause anger or hate
results.example1: The men were using inflammatory language/making inflammatory remarks about the other team's supporters. 這些人惡語攻擊另一支球隊的支持者。

results.name: intoxicated
results.english: drunk
results.example1: She was charged with driving while intoxicated. 她被指控酒後駕車。

results.name: habitual
results.english: usual or repeated
results.example1: a habitual thief  慣竊
results.example2: habitual drug use 吸毒成癮

results.name: concoct
results.english: to invent an excuse,  explanation,  or story in order to deceive someone
results.chinese: 編造, 捏造, 虛構(藉口、解釋或故事)
results.example1: He concocted a story about working late at the office.  他編造謊言說他在辦公室工作到很晚。

results.name: felony
results.english: (an example of) serious crime that can be punished by one or more years in prison
results.example1: a _____ charge 重罪指控

results.name: tendency
results.english: If someone has a tendency to do or like something, they will probably do it or like it.
results.example1: His _____ to exaggerate is well known.他喜歡誇張的傾向是出了名的。

results.name: diversionary
results.english: taking your attention away from something else

results.name: forthcoming
results.english: happening soon
results.example1: We have just received the information about the forthcoming conference.  我們剛剛收到即將舉行的大會的資料。

results.name: beat the shit out of sb
results.chinese: 把某人痛打一頓 (打到快死的那種)

results.name: it's a sellout
results.english: a situation in which someone does not do what they have promised to do or what they should do
results.example1: Most of the workers see the union agreement as a sellout. 大多數工人覺得工會協定是一種背叛。

results.name: blasphemy
results.english: something that you say or do that shows you do not respect God or a religion
results.chinese: （對上帝或宗教的）褻瀆；褻瀆的言行；侮慢的言行
results.example1: to be accused of blasphemy  被譴責褻瀆上帝
results.example2: figurative humorous Madonna fans think that any criticism of her is blasphemy.  瑪丹娜的歌迷們認為對她的任何批評都是對她的不敬。

results.name: verdict
results.english: an opinion or decision made after judging the facts that are given,  especially one made at the end of a trial
results.chinese: (根據事實作出的)意見, 決定；(尤指)判決, 裁決
results.example1: The jury reached/returned a unanimous verdict of (not) guilty.  陪審團一致判定有罪／無罪。
results.example2: Voters gave their verdict on the government's economic record last night by voting overwhelmingly for the opposition.  昨晚選民們以壓倒性的多數票支援反對黨, 由此可以看出他們對本屆政府在經濟上的作為的評判。

results.name: jury
results.english: a group of people who have been chosen to listen to all the facts in a trial in a law court and to decide if a person is guilty or not guilty,  or if a claim has been proved
results.example1: members of the jury  陪審團成員
results.example2: The jury has/have been unable to return a verdict (= reach a decision).  陪審團未能作出裁決。

results.name: on edge
results.english: nervous and not relaxed
results.chinese: 如坐針氈的；惴惴不安的；煩躁的
results.example1: Is something wrong? You seem a bit on edge this morning.  出甚麼事了？你今天上午好像有些心神不寧。

results.name: rehabilitation
results.english: the process of returning to a healthy or good way of life, or the process of helping someone to do this afterthey have been in prison, been very ill, etc.
results.chinese: 恢復（正常生活）；康復；（囚犯）獲得改造
results.example1: Many amputees in the early stages of their rehabilitation feel despair. 在康復初期，許多截肢病人感到絕望。
results.example2: the rehabilitation of violent offenders 對暴力罪犯的改造

results.name: he left me stranded
results.english: unable to leave somewhere because of a problem such as not having any transport or money
results.chinese: 被困住的 (因為沒有錢, 或沒有交通工具)
results.example1: He left me _____ in town with no car and no money for a bus.他把我丟在城裡, 既沒車也沒錢坐公車。

results.name: detention
results.english: the act of officially detaining someone
results.example1: Concern has been expressed about the death in detention of a number of political prisoners.  人們對一些政治犯在關押期間死去表示關注。

results.name: time frame
results.english: a period of days, weeks, months, etc. within which an activity is intended to happen
results.chinese: （安排進行某活動的）時間框架，時間範圍
results.example1: Have you set a time frame for completing the job? 你給這項工作定下完成時限了嗎？
results.example2: The new law introduces these changes in/within a fairly long/short time frame. 新頒佈的法律計劃在相當長／短的時間內進行這些改革。

results.name: plea
results.english: an urgent and emotional request
results.example1: He made a _____ for mercy. 他懇求得到幫助

results.name: file
results.english: to officially record something, especially in a law court
results.example1: The police filed charges against the two suspects. 警方對兩名嫌疑犯提出了訴訟。

results.name: petition
results.english: a document signed by a large number of people demanding or asking for some action from the government or another authority
results.example1: I signed a petition against the proposed closure of the local hospital today. 今天我在反對關閉當地醫院的請願書上簽了名。

results.name: immortal
results.english: living or lasting for ever
results.example1: immortal God 永生的上帝
results.example2: The priest said he was endangering his immortal soul. 神父說他正在危及自己不朽的靈魂。

results.name: be eligible for
results.english: having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions
results.example1: Are you _____ ___ early retirement/maternity leave?你符合提前退休／休産假的條件嗎？
results.example2: You might be eligible for a grant. 你或許有資格得到獎學金。

results.name: uptight
results.english: worried or nervous and not able to relax
results.example1: Don't get uptight about the exam - just do your best.  對待考試不要太緊張——盡力而爲吧。

results.name: hostile
results.english: unfriendly and not liking something
results.example1: a hostile crowd 不友善的人群
results.example2: The president had a hostile reception in Ohio this morning. 總統今天早上在俄亥俄州受到了不友善的接待。

results.name: scarce
results.english: not easy to find or get
results.example1: Food and clean water were becoming _____.食物和乾淨的水變得越來越稀缺。

results.name: miscreant
results.english: someone who behaves badly or does not obey rules
results.example1: We need to discourage miscreants.  我們需要懲戒無賴之徒。

results.name: drawback
results.english: a disadvantage or the negative part of a situation
results.chinese: 缺點, 弱點；不利因素
results.example1: One of the drawbacks of living with someone is having to share a bathroom.  和別人合住的缺點之一就是不得不合用洗手間。

results.name: underfunded
results.english: If an organization is underfunded, it does not receive a large enough income.
results.chinese: （機構）缺乏資金的，資金不足的
results.example1: She claims schools are underfunded. 她宣稱學校獲得的資金不足。

results.name: be devoid of
results.english: to lack or be without something that is necessary or usual
results.example1: Their apartment is _____ ___ all comforts. 他們的公寓沒有任何能提供舒適享受的設施。

results.name: obligate
results.english: to force someone to do something, or to make it necessary for someone to do something
results.example1: The law _____s companies to pay decent wages to their employees. 法律強制公司向其僱員支付適當的工資。

results.name: internalize
results.english: If you internalize your emotions or feelings, you do not allow them to show although you think about them.
results.example1: Many women tend to internalize their anxiety and distress. 女人常常將所有的焦慮和苦惱都深藏心底。

results.name: unity
results.english: the state of being joined together or in agreement
results.example1: European political and economic unity 歐洲政治和經濟的統一
results.example2: a call for national unity 號召全民團結

results.name: ascend
results.english: to move up or climb something
results.example1: They slowly ascended the steep path up the mountain.  他們沿著陡峭的山路，緩緩地向上攀登。
results.example2: There's a long flight of steps ascending (= leading up) to the cathedral doors.  要往上走很長一段樓梯，才能到達大教堂的門前。

results.name: ouster
results.english: the process of removing someone from an important position or job
results.example1: The committee's chairperson is facing a possible _____. 委員會的主席面臨可能被革職的命運。

results.name: nosy
results.english: too interested in what other people are doing and wanting to discover too much about them
results.chinese: 愛管閒事, 愛追問的
results.example1: She was complaining about her _____ parents. 她在抱怨她父母愛管閒事。

results.name: of his own accord
results.english: If you do something of your own accord, you do it without being asked to do it.
results.example1: She came of her own accord. No one asked her to come.  她自願來的，沒有人叫她來。

results.name: beget
results.english: to cause
results.chinese: 引起、招致 某件事的發生
results.example1: Poverty _____s hunger,  and hunger _____s crime. 貧窮導致饑餓, 饑餓則導致犯罪。

results.name: venomous
results.english: poisonous
results.chinese: 分泌毒液的；有毒腺的；有毒的
results.example1: a venomous snake 毒蛇

results.name: vending machine
results.english: a machine from which you can buy small things such as cigarettes, drinks, and sweets by putting coins into it
results.example1: The vending machine in the office dispenses really tasteless coffee. 辦公樓裡的自動販賣機售出的咖啡真是一點兒味道都沒有。

results.name: have the edge over
results.english: an advantage over other people
results.example1: In terms of experience, she definitely had the edge over the other people that we interviewed. 就工作經驗而言，她顯然要比我們面試過的其他人都勝出一籌。

results.name: premier
results.english: best or most important
results.example1: He's one of the nation's premier scientists.  他是該國最重要的科學家之一。

results.name: convene
results.english: to bring together a group of people for a meeting, or to meet for a meeting
results.example1: The prime minister _____ed (a meeting of) his cabinet to discuss the matter. 首相召集部長召開會議討論這個問題。

results.name: refute
results.english: to say or prove that a person, statement, opinion, etc. is wrong or false
results.chinese: 反駁, 駁斥 某個指控, 但還沒有證據
results.example1: to _____ a person/theory/argument/claim 駁斥一個人／理論／論點／說法

results.name: a phantom killer
results.english: like a ghost
results.example1: A phantom coach is said to pass through the grounds of this house when there's a full moon. 據說月圓時一輛幽靈馬車就會駛過這棟房子的庭院。
results.example2: humorous The phantom wine-drinker has been around (= an unknown person has been drinking the wine)! 附近一定有嗜酒幽靈出沒！

results.name: preside
results.english: to be in charge of a formal meeting, ceremony, or trial
results.chinese: 主持某個會議, 或是擔任主席
results.example1: Who would be the best person to _____ at/over the public enquiry? 誰來主持大眾調查最合適呢？
results.example2: Judge Langdale is to preside over the official enquiry into the case. 蘭代爾法官將主持這個案子的正式調查。

results.name: perch on
results.english: to sit on or near the edge of something
results.chinese: 坐在…（的邊緣）上；棲息於；停留於
results.example1: We perched on bar stools and had a beer. 我們坐在酒吧高凳上，喝了一杯啤酒。
results.example2: A blackbird was perching on the gate. 一隻烏鶇停落在大門上。

results.name: enroll
results.english: to put yourself or someone else onto the official list of members of a course, college, or group
results.example1: Is it too late to enrol at the college?  現在去那所大學註冊是不是來不及了？
results.example2: I enrolled for/in/on the modern art course. 我註冊修讀現代藝術課程。

results.name: assent to
results.english: official agreement to or approval of an idea, plan, or request
results.example1: Once the directors have given their assent to the proposal we can begin. 一旦董事們同意這項提議，我們就可以開始了。
results.example2: She nodded her assent to the proposal. 她點頭表示同意該建議。

results.name: regard
results.english: to consider or have an opinion about something or someone
results.example1: Environmentalists regard GM technology with suspicion.  環境論者對基因改造技術持懷疑態度。
results.example2: Her parents always regarded her as the smartest of their children.  她父母一貫把她看作是所有子女中最聰明的。

results.name: tentative
results.english: (of a plan or idea) not certain or agreed, or (of a suggestion or action) said or done in a careful but uncertain way because you do not know if you are right
results.chinese: （計劃、想法、建議、行動等）試驗（性）的，試探（性）的，暫時的
results.example1: I have _____ plans to take a trip to Seattle in July. 我暫定七月去西雅圖旅行。

results.name: paternity
results.english: the fact of being a father
results.example1: Increasingly, the unmarried father of a child in Europe registers his paternity at the baby's birth. 歐洲有越來越多的未婚爸爸在嬰兒出生時登記自己的父親身分。

results.name: we'll commence doing ...
results.english: to begin something
results.example1: We will _____ building work in August of next year. 我們將於明年八月開始破土動工。

results.name: arise
results.english: to happen
results.example1: Should the opportunity arise, I'd love to go to China. 要是有機會的話，我很想去中國。
results.example2: Could you work on Saturday, should the need arise (= if it were to be necessary)? 萬一有需要，你可以在星期六工作嗎？

results.name: exploit
results.english: to use someone or something unfairly for your own advantage
results.example1: Laws exist to stop companies exploiting their employees. 法律規定禁止公司剝削其員工。

results.name: appoint
results.english: to choose someone officially for a job or responsibility
results.example1: We've appointed three new teachers this year. 我們今年已經任用了三名新教師。
results.example2: He's just been appointed (as) director of the publishing division. 他剛剛被任命為出版部主任。

results.name: radical (1)
results.english: relating to the most important parts of something or someone; complete or extreme
results.example1: We need to make some radical changes to our operating procedures.  我們需要對操作流程進行一些根本性的變革。
results.example2: I'm just having my hair trimmed - nothing radical.  我正把頭髮剪短一下——沒什麼大改變。

results.name: competent
results.english: able to do something well
results.chinese: 有能力的；能幹的；稱職的
results.example1: a competent secretary/rider/cook  能幹的秘書／騎手／廚師
results.example2: I wouldn't say he was brilliant but he is competent at his job. 我雖然不會說他是才華橫溢，可他還是能勝任工作的。

results.name: designate
results.english: to choose someone officially to do a particular job
results.example1: Churches are _____ed on the map by crosses. 地圖上教堂以十字形記號標出。
results.example2: He was _____ed to lead the expedition. 他被指派率領遠征隊。

results.name: dismiss
results.english: to decide that something or someone is not important and not worth considering
