results.chinese: 對…不予理會，摒棄，（從頭腦中）去除
results.example1: I think he'd dismissed me as an idiot within five minutes of meeting me. 我認爲他和我見面五分鐘後就把我歸入了傻瓜之列。
results.example2: Let's not just dismiss the idea before we've even thought about it. 我們還是別不假思索就把這種想法排除在外。

results.name: praise
results.english: things that you say that express your admiration and approval of someone or something
results.example1: They deserve praise for all their hard work. 他們如此辛苦地工作，理應受到表揚。
results.example2: His economic policies have won widespread praise for reducing government debt. 他的經濟政策因減輕了政府的債務而受到廣泛讚揚。

results.name: praise
results.english: to express admiration or approval of the achievements or characteristics of a person or thing
results.example1: He should be praised for his honesty. 他應該因為誠實而獲得表揚。
results.example2: My parents always praised me when I did well at school. 我在學校裡表現好時父母總是誇獎我。

results.name: deliberation
results.english: considering or discussing something
results.chinese: 考慮；討論, 比較正式比較長的討論
results.example1: After much _____,  she decided to accept their offer.  經過反覆考慮, 她決定接受他們的報價。

results.name: congestion charge
results.english: an amount of money that you have to pay each day to drive into a city centre, charged in order to reduce traffic
results.chinese: 擁堵費（開車進入市中心需要支付的費用，徵收該項費用的目的是減少車流量。）

results.name: alleviate
results.english: to make something bad such as pain or problems less severe
results.example1: The drugs did nothing to _____ her pain/suffering. 這些藥物對減輕她的病痛／痛苦沒有絲毫作用。

results.name: expedite
results.english: to make something happen more quickly
results.example1: Something needs to be done to _____ the process. 需要採取措施以加快進度。

results.name: divert
results.english: to cause something or someone to change direction
results.example1: Traffic will be diverted through the side streets while the main road is resurfaced.  這條主幹道重鋪路面時，車輛行人將被分流到側路通行。
results.example2: Our flight had to be diverted to Newark because of the storm.  由於暴風雨，我們的班機被迫改在紐華克機場降落。

results.name: malfunction
results.english: a failure to work or operate correctly
results.example1: Shortly before the crash the pilot had reported a malfunction of the aircraft's navigation system. 就在飛機墜毀前不久，飛行員曾報告說導航系統失靈。

results.name: equip
results.english: to provide a person or a place with objects that are necessary for a particular purpose
results.example1: It's going to cost $4 million to equip the hospital. 給這所醫院配齊醫療設備將耗資400萬美元。
results.example2: All the police officers were equipped with shields to defend themselves against the rioters. 所有警察都配備了盾牌以便在與暴亂分子的對抗中防身。

results.name: automotive
results.english: relating to road vehicles
results.example1: the automotive industry  汽車工業
results.example2: automotive manufacturing/engineers  汽車製造／工程師

results.name: fare
results.english: the money that you pay for a journey in a vehicle such as a bus or train

results.name: prominent
results.english: Something that is in a prominent position can easily be seen.
results.example1: New books are displayed in a _____ position on tables at the front of the store. 新書陳列在商店前方桌上的一個顯眼位置。

results.name: collision
results.english: an accident that happens when two vehicles hit each other with force
results.example1: There has been a _____ on the southbound stretch of the motorway. 在高速公路南向路段上發生了一宗撞車事故。

results.name: obstruct
results.english: to block a road, passage, entrance, etc. so that nothing can go along it, or to prevent something from happening correctly by putting difficulties in its way
results.example1: After the earthquake many roads were _____ed by collapsed buildings. 地震過後, 許多道路都被倒塌的建築物堵住了。

results.name: delinquent
results.english: late (in paying money owed)
results.chinese: 遲付欠款的，未按時還款的，拖欠的
results.example1: She has been delinquent in paying her taxes.  她一直沒有按時納稅。

results.name: withdrawal
results.english: the act or process of taking something away so that it is no longer available, or of someone stopping being involved in an activity
results.example1: Doctors demanded the withdrawal of the drug (from the market) after several cases of dangerous side-effects were reported. 報道出現幾宗嚴重副作用的病例之後，醫生們要求（從市場上）收回這種藥物。
results.example2: Her sudden withdrawal from the championship caused a lot of press speculation about her health. 她突然退出錦標賽，引發媒體關於她健康狀況的各種猜測。

results.name: transaction
results.english: an occasion when someone buys or sells something, or when money is exchanged or the activity of buying or selling something
results.example1: Each transaction at the foreign exchange counter seems to take forever. 外幣兌換櫃枱的每筆交易似乎都要花很長時間。
results.example2: We need to monitor the transaction of smaller deals. 我們需要監控規模較小的交易。

results.name: loan
results.english: an amount of money that is borrowed, often from a bank, and has to be paid back, usually together with an extra amount of money that you have to pay as a charge for borrowing
results.example1: She's trying to get a $50,000 loan to start her own business. 為了開辦自己的公司，她正在爭取一筆五萬美元的貸款。
results.example2: We could apply for/take out a loan to buy a car. 我們可以申請貸款去買汽車。

results.name: mortgage
results.english: an agreement that allows you to borrow money from a bank or similar organization, especially in order to buy a house, or the amount of money itself
results.example1: They took out a £40o,000 mortgage (= they borrowed £40o,000) to buy the house. 他們借了四萬英鎊的按揭貸款來買房子。
results.example2: a monthly mortgage payment 每月償付的按揭貸款

results.name: lucrative
results.english: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money
results.chinese: （尤指生意、職位或活動）賺錢的，盈利的
results.example1: a _____ business/deal 有利可圖的生意/機會
results.example2: The merger proved to be very _____ for both companies. 事實證明, 這次兼併使兩間公司都獲利豐厚。

results.name: inherent
results.english: existing as a natural or basic part of something
results.example1: There are dangers/risks ______ in almost every sport. 幾乎每種運動本身都帶有危險／風險。

results.name: innate
results.english: An innate quality or ability is one that you were born with, not one you have learned.
results.example1: Cyril's most impressive quality was his _____ goodness. 西裡爾給人印象最深的品質是他天生的善良。

results.name: lease
results.english: a legal agreement in which you pay money in order to use a building, piece of land, vehicle, etc. for a period
results.example1: The _____ runs out/expires in two years' time. 租借契約將在兩年後到期。

results.name: extricate from
results.english: to remove something or set something free with difficulty
results.example1: It took hours to extricate the car from the sand.  用了幾個小時才把陷入沙地中的車拉出來。
results.example2: I tried to extricate myself from the situation.  我試圖從這種局面中擺脫出來。

results.name: it's evident that...
results.english: easily seen or understood
results.example1: Harry's courage during his illness was _____ to everyone. 生病期間哈利表現出的勇氣大家有目共睹。

results.name: insight
results.english: (the ability to have) a clear, deep, and sometimes sudden understanding of a complicated problem or situation
results.chinese: 洞察力, 深刻的見解
results.example1: It was an interesting book,  full of fascinating _____s into human relationships. 這是一本有趣的書, 充滿了對人際關係獨到的見解。

results.name: speculation
results.english: the activity of guessing possible answers to a question without having enough information to be certain
results.chinese: 猜測 (對於什麼事情為何發生或是未來會發生的)
results.example1: Rumours that they are about to marry have been dismissed as pure _____. 他們打算結婚的傳言已證實只不過是猜測。

results.name: outlook
results.english: the likely future situation
results.example1: The outlook for the economy is bleak. 經濟前景暗淡。
results.example2: The outlook for today is cloudy and dry at first with showers later. 今天天氣先是多雲無雨，晚些時候有陣雨。

results.name: depreciation
results.english: the process of losing value

results.name: diseases are prevalent
results.english: existing very commonly or happening often
results.chinese: 流行的, 盛行的, 普遍的
results.example1: These diseases are more _____ among young children.這些疾病在幼兒中更普遍。
results.example2: Trees are dying in areas where acid rain is most _____.在酸雨非常嚴重的地區, 樹木正面臨枯死。

results.name: furnished
results.english: containing furniture or containing furniture of a particular type
results.example1: She's looking for a furnished flat/apartment.  她正在找配備傢俱的公寓。
results.example2: Their house is expensively furnished.  他們把房子佈置得很豪華。

results.name: drape
results.english: drape sth across, on, over, etc. sth - to put something such as cloth or a piece of clothing loosely over something
results.example1: He draped his jacket over the back of the chair and sat down to eat. 他把夾克搭在椅子靠背上，然後坐下來吃飯。
results.example2: She draped the scarf loosely around her shoulders. 她把圍巾鬆鬆地披在肩膀上。

results.name: renovate
results.english: to repair and improve something, especially a building
results.chinese: 修復，翻新，整修（尤指建築物）
results.example1: He renovates old houses and sells them at a profit. 他靠翻修老房子再出售賺錢。

results.name: open-casket
results.english: used to describe a funeral at which the coffin is open and people can see the dead person's body
results.example1: an open-casket funeral/service 開棺葬禮／祈禱儀式

results.name: wind chime
results.english: an arrangement of shells or small decorative shapes of metal or wood that hang from pieces of wire or string and make a gentle noise when moved by the wind

results.name: missis,  missus
results.english: wife
results.example1: Me and the missus (= my wife) are going to our daughter's for Christmas. 我和妻子要去女兒家過聖誕節。
results.example2: Have you met Jack's new missus? 你見過傑克的新老婆嗎？

results.name: intake
results.english: an opening through which air, liquid, or gas is taken in
results.example1: The Tornado jet fighter-bomber has two air intakes, one at the base of each wing.  旋風噴射戰鬥轟炸機有兩個進氣口，每個機翼的底部各有一個。

results.name: rehab
results.english: the process of helping someone to stop taking drugs or alcohol
results.chinese: （吸毒或酗酒者的）康復治療，康復訓練
results.example1: She's just finished four months of rehab. 她剛剛做完四個月的康復治療。
results.example2: After his arrest in 2011, he checked himself into rehab to get over his heroin addiction. 自2011年被捕後，他就主動進行康復治療來戒掉海洛英毒癮。

results.name: lapse
results.english: to end legally or officially by not being continued or made effective for a longer period
results.example1: The association needs to win back former members who have allowed their subscriptions to _____. 該協會需要重新把那些已經期滿退出的會員吸引回來。

results.name: in hindsight
results.english: the ability to understand an event or situation only after it has happened
results.example1: With (the benefit/wisdom of) hindsight, I should have taken the job.  現在想想，我真應該接受那份工作。
results.example2: In hindsight, it would have been better to wait. 事後看來，等一等會更好。

results.name: in jeopardy
results.english: in danger of being damaged or destroyed
results.example1: The lives of thousands of birds are in jeopardy as a result of the oil spill. 石油洩漏使成千上萬隻鳥兒的生命受到威脅。

results.name: yank
results.english: to pull something forcefully with a quick movement
results.example1: He tripped over the cord and yanked the plug out. 他絆到了電線，一下子把插頭拽了出來。
results.example2: She yanked open the cupboard door and everything fell out. 她猛地打開櫥櫃，所有東西都掉了出來。

results.name: femicide
results.english: the crime of killing a woman or women; an occasion when this happens

results.name: homicide
results.english: (an act of) murder
results.example1: He was convicted of homicide.  他被判犯下謀殺罪。
results.example2: The number of homicides in the city has risen sharply.  這個城市的殺人案件急劇增加。

results.name: perpetrate
results.english: to commit a crime or a violent or harmful act
results.example1: In this country,  half of all violent crime is _____ed by people who have been drinkingalcohol. 在這個國家, 一半的暴行是酗酒者犯下的。
results.example2: Federal soldiers have been accused of _____ing atrocities against innocent people. 聯邦士兵被控對無辜民眾做出殘暴行為。

results.name: far-right, far-left
results.english: used to refer to political groups whose opinions are very extreme
results.example1: supporters of the far left 極左派的支持者

results.name: misogynist
results.english: a man who hates women or believes that men are much better than women

results.name: contractor
results.english: a person or company that arranges to supply materials or workers for building or for moving goods
results.chinese: 承辦人；承辦商；承包方；訂約人

results.name: dense
results.english: having parts that are close together so that it is difficult to go or see through
results.example1: dense fog  濃霧
results.example2: a dense forest 密林

results.name: compulsory
results.english: If something is compulsory, you must do it because of a rule or law.
results.chinese: 必須做的；強制性的 (因為法律或規定而有義務要做的)
results.example1: The law made wearing seat belts in cars _____. 坐車繫安全帶是法律強制規定的。

results.name: adjacent to
results.english: very near, next to, or touching
results.example1: They work in adjacent buildings.  他們在相鄰的兩座樓裡工作。
results.example2: They lived in a house adjacent to the railway.  他們家住在鐵路旁邊。

results.name: conserve
results.english: to keep and protect something from damage, change, or waste
results.chinese: 保護；保藏；保存；保留；節約
results.example1: To conserve electricity, we are cutting down on our heating. 為了省電，我們在減少中央供熱。
results.example2: I'm not being lazy - I'm just conserving my energy/strength for later. 我不是在偷懶——我只是在為以後保存精力／體力。

results.name: dispose of
results.english: to get rid of someone or something or deal with something so that the matter is finished
results.example1: How did they dispose of the body? 他們是如何處理屍體的？
results.example2: It took only five minutes for the world champion to dispose of (= defeat) his opponent. 世界冠軍只用五分鐘就擊敗了對手。

results.name: preserve
results.english: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed
results.example1: We want to preserve the character of the town while improving the facilities. 我們想在改善市鎮設施的同時保存其特色。
results.example2: The agreement preserved our right to limit trade in endangered species. 這項協定保留了我們限制瀕危物種貿易的權利。

results.name: excessive
results.english: too much
results.example1: Excessive exercise can sometimes cause health problems. 過度的運動有時也會導致健康問題。
results.example2: Any more pudding would simply be excessive. 不能再吃布丁了，再吃就太多了。

results.name: depict
results.english: to represent or show something in a picture or story
results.example1: Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century. 她的畫反映了上個世紀普通人的生活。
results.example2: In the book, he depicts his father as a tyrant. 在那本書裡，他把自己的父親描寫成了一個暴君。

results.name: demolish
results.english: to completely destroy a building, especially in order to use the land for something else
results.example1: A number of houses were _____ed so that the supermarket could be built. 為了修建超級市場, 很多房屋被拆除了。

results.name: linger
results.english: to take a long time to leave or disappear
results.example1: The smell from the fire still _____ed days later. 大火過後好幾天還能聞到燒焦的味道。
results.example2: It's impossible to forget such horrific events. they _____ in the memory forever.  這樣恐怖的事件讓人難以忘記——會永遠留在人們的記憶中。

results.name: sketchy information
results.english: containing few details
results.chinese: 簡略的, 粗略的 (報告、調查)
results.example1: So far we only have _____ information about what caused the explosion. 迄今爲止, 我們僅僅粗略掌握了關於爆炸的大概起因。

results.name: untidy
results.english: not tidy
results.chinese: 不整潔的, 邋遢的, 淩亂的
results.example1: an _____ room淩亂的房間
results.example2: She's really _____ at home.她在家真的很邋遢。

results.name: endoscopy
results.english: a medical examination of a hollow organ of the body

results.name: gastrointestinal
results.english: in or relating to both the stomach and the intestine (= the long tube that food passes through after the stomach)
results.chinese: 腸胃（裡）的；與腸胃相關的
results.example1: the gastrointestinal tract 腸胃道
results.example2: gastrointestinal bleeding 腸胃出血

results.name: stunning
results.english: extremely beautiful or attractive
results.example1: a stunning dress 漂亮的連衣裙
results.example2: a stunning view over the bay of Saint Tropez 俯瞰聖特羅佩灣的迷人景色

results.name: kit sb out
results.english: to supply someone or something with the clothes or equipment that are needed for a particular purpose
results.chinese: （為某一目的）給…配備服裝（或裝備）
results.example1: They went shopping to get kitted out for the trip. 他們去購買旅行所需的東西。

results.name: inaccessible
results.english: very difficult or impossible to travel to
results.example1: one of the most inaccessible places in the world 世界上最難到達的地方之一
results.example2: Some of the houses on the hillside are inaccessible to cars. 山坡上的一些房屋開車上不去。

results.name: contaminate
results.english: to make something less pure or make it poisonous
results.example1: Much of the coast has been contaminated by nuclear waste. 大部分海岸已受到核廢料污染。
results.example2: The food which had been contaminated was destroyed. 受污染的食物已被銷毀了。

results.name: sideline
results.english: to stop someone taking an active and important part in something
results.chinese: 排擠, 讓他無法參加他平常在參與的活動
results.example1: He was _____ed after criticizing the policy. 他對政策進行了批評以後便遭到了排擠。

results.name: parental
results.english: relating to parents or to being a parent
results.example1: parental advice/influence  父母的忠告／影響
results.example2: The government repeatedly stressed its support for parental choice in the selection of a child's school.  政府一再強調其支持父母在為孩子選校上的選擇。

results.name: tackle
results.english: to try to deal with something or someone
results.example1: There are many ways of tackling this problem. 處理這個問題有許多辦法。
results.example2: I tackled him about his careless work. 就他工作馬虎一事，我與他進行了交涉。

results.name: regrettable
results.english: making you feel sad and sorry about something
results.chinese: 使人悔恨的；令人遺憾的；不幸的；可悲的
results.example1: a most/deeply regrettable mistake 令人深感懊悔的錯誤

results.name: discharge
results.english: to send out a substance, especially waste liquid or gas
results.chinese: 排放，排出（尤指廢液或廢氣）
results.example1: Large amounts of dangerous waste are discharged daily by the factory. 這個工廠每天排放大量危險的廢物。
results.example2: The oil that discharged into the sea seriously harmed a lot of birds and animals. 排放到海裡的油對許多鳥和動物產生了嚴重的危害。

results.name: precedent
results.english: an action, situation, or decision that has already happened and can be used as a reason why a similar action or decision should be performed or made
results.example1: There are several precedents for promoting people who don't have formal qualifications. 提拔沒有正式學歷的人是有幾個先例的。
results.example2: Some politicians fear that agreeing to the concession would set a dangerous precedent. 一些政客擔心同意讓步會開創危險的先例。

results.name: brokerage
results.english: the activity of buying and selling foreign money, shares in companies, etc. for other people, or the money that is charged for doing this
results.example1: The company's main activity is insurance brokerage. 這家公司的主要業務是從事保險經紀。

results.name: maternity
results.english: the state of being a mother

results.name: booklet
results.english: a very thin book with a small number of pages and a paper cover, giving information about something

results.name: precondition
results.english: something that must happen or be true before it is possible for something else to happen
results.example1: A halt to the fighting is a precondition for negotiations. 停火是談判的前提。

results.name: capricious
results.english: changing mood or behaviour suddenly and unexpectedly
results.example1: He was a cruel and _____ tyrant. 他是個殘忍而又反覆無常的暴君。

results.name: ethnic
results.english: relating to a particular race of people
results.example1: A question on ethnic origin was included in the census.  人口普查包括一個有關種族來源的問題。
results.example2: The factory's workforce reflects the ethnic mix from which it draws its labour.  這個工廠的員工組成反映了勞動力來源的種族雜居狀況。

results.name: hectare
results.english: a unit of measurement of an area of land (10,000 m2)

results.name: ecological
results.english: relating to ecology or the environment
results.chinese: 生態的；生態學的；環保的
results.example1: The destruction of the rain forests is an ecological disaster. 雨林遭破壞是一種生態災難。

results.name: engulf
results.english: to surround and cover something or someone completely
results.example1: The flames rapidly engulfed the house. 大火很快吞沒了那座房子。
results.example2: Northern areas of the country were engulfed by/in a snowstorm last night. 昨晚一場暴風雪席捲了這個國家的北部地區。

results.name: toxic
results.english: poisonous
results.example1: toxic waste/chemicals/effluent  有毒的廢料／化學品／廢水

results.name: haze
results.english: something such as heat or smoke in the air that makes it less clear, so that it is difficult to see well
results.example1: The road through the desert shimmered in the haze. 穿越沙漠的道路透過霧氣散發出微光。
results.example2: I saw her through a haze of cigarette smoke. 我透過一片香煙的煙霧看見了她。

results.name: ensuing
results.english: happening after something and because of it
results.example1: An argument broke out and in the _____ fight,  a gun went off.先是發生了爭吵, 隨後動了手, 接著就開了槍。
results.example2: He lost his job and in the _____ months became more and more depressed.他失業了, 在接下來的幾個月中他越來越消沈。

results.name: smog
results.english: a mixture of smoke, gases, and chemicals, especially in cities, that makes the atmosphere difficult to breathe and harmful for health
results.example1: Smog is a major problem in Athens. 霧霾是雅典的一個主要問題。
results.example2: As we flew into the airport, we could see a murky yellow smog hovering over the city. 我們飛進機場時，可以看到一層黃色的霧霾籠罩在城市上空。

results.name: slash
results.english: to cut with a sharp blade using a quick, strong movement
results.example1: The museum was broken into last night and several paintings were slashed. 昨晚有人闖進了博物館，有幾幅畫被劃破了。
results.example2: She tried to commit suicide by slashing her wrists. 她試圖割腕自殺。

results.name: crack down on
results.english: to start dealing with bad or illegal behaviour in a more severe way
results.example1: The library is _____ing ___ ___ people who lose their books. 圖書館將嚴厲處罰丟書的人。

results.name: in a bid to
results.english: an attempt to achieve or get something
results.example1: Her bid for re-election was unsuccessful. 她爭取連任的努力沒有成功。
results.example2: They have reduced the cost of borrowing in a bid to get the economy moving again. 他們已經降低了借貸成本，試圖重新刺激經濟。

results.name: particulate
results.english: an extremely small piece of dirt, especially one produced by road vehicles, that causes pollution
results.chinese: （尤指汽車引擎排出的引起嚴重污染的）微粒，顆粒

results.name: lodge
results.english: to (cause to) become stuck in a place or position
results.example1: A fish bone had _____ed in her throat. 一根魚刺鯁在她的喉嚨裡

results.name: cardiovascular disease
results.english: relating to the heart and blood vessels (= tubes that carry blood around the body)
results.example1: cardiovascular disease 心血管疾病

results.name: respiratory
results.english: relating to breathing
results.example1: Smoking can cause respiratory diseases. 吸煙會導致呼吸系統疾病。

results.name: marquee
results.english: a large tent used for eating and drinking in at events held mainly outside that involve a lot of people
results.example1: We're planning to hold the wedding reception in a marquee in the garden. 我們打算在花園的大帳篷裡舉行婚宴。

results.name: plantation
results.english: a large farm, especially in a hot part of the world, on which a particular type of crop is grown

results.name: congregation
results.english: a group of people who have come together in a religious building for worship and prayer
results.chinese: （在宗教場所參加膜拜、祈禱的）會衆；信眾
results.example1: The priest asked the congregation to kneel.  牧師請信衆跪下。

results.name: decipher
results.english: to discover the meaning of something written badly or in a difficult or hidden way
results.example1: Can you decipher the writing on this envelope? 你能辨認出信封上的字嗎？

results.name: endangered species
results.english: animals or plants that may soon not exist because there are very few now alive

results.name: squarely
results.english: directly and firmly
results.chinese: 徑直地；直截了當地；毫不含糊地
results.example1: She refused to come down squarely on either side of the argument. 她拒絕直接加入爭論的任何一方。
results.example2: She punched him square on the jaw. 她一拳不偏不倚正中他的下頜。

results.name: mat
results.english: a small piece of strong material that covers and protects part of a floor
results.example1: Wipe your feet on the mat before you come inside. 你進來前先在地墊上擦擦腳。

results.name: reckless
results.english: doing something dangerous and not worrying about the risks and the possible results
results.chinese: 魯莽的；輕率的；不顧後果的
results.example1: He was found guilty of reckless driving. 他被判魯莽駕駛罪名成立。

results.name: comprehensive
results.english: complete and including everything that is necessary
results.chinese: 全面的；綜合的；包羅萬象的；詳盡的
results.example1: We offer you a comprehensive training in all aspects of the business. 我們向你提供這個行業各方面的綜合培訓。
results.example2: Is this list comprehensive or are there some names missing? 這份名單是完整的還是遺漏了一些名字？

results.name: cleanliness
results.english: the state of being clean, or the act of keeping things clean

results.name: dietary
results.english: relating to your diet
results.example1: Dietary habits can be very difficult to change. 飲食習慣很難改變。
results.example2: Do you have any special dietary requirements? 你有甚麼特殊的飲食要求嗎？

results.name: versatile
results.english: able to change easily from one activity to another or able to be used for many different purposes
results.chinese: 多種用途的；萬用的；多才多藝的
results.example1: He's a very versatile young actor who's as happy in highbrow dramas as he is in TV comedies. 他是一個非常多才多藝的年輕演員，無論是演高雅電影還是電視喜劇都一樣得心應手。
results.example2: A leather jacket is a timeless and versatile garment that can be worn in all seasons. 皮夾克是一種永不過時、適合多種場合的衣服，可以在任何季節穿。

results.name: fleet
results.english: a group of ships, or all of the ships in a country's navy
results.chinese: 船隊；（一國的）全部艦隊，海軍
results.example1: a fleet of 20 sailing ships  一支由20艘帆船組成的船隊
results.example2: a fishing fleet  捕魚船隊

results.name: disclaimer
results.english: a formal statement saying that you are not legally responsible for something, such as the information given in a book or on the internet, or that you have no direct involvement in it

results.name: mortality
results.english: the way that people do not live for ever
results.example1: Her death made him more aware of his own mortality. 她的去世讓他更加意識到自己終有一死。

results.name: opulent
results.english: expensive and luxurious
results.example1: an opulent lifestyle 奢侈的生活方式
results.example2: an opulent hotel 豪華的飯店

results.name: ignition
results.english: the electrical system in an engine that causes the fuel to burn or explode in order to start the engine
results.example1: Switch/Turn the ignition on. 打開點火開關。
results.example2: an ignition key 點火開關

results.name: strive
results.english: to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties
results.chinese: (尤指長期或不畏艱難地) 努力, 奮鬥, 力爭
results.example1: Mr. Roe has kindled expectations that he must now _____ to live up to.  羅先生激發了人們的期望, 現在他必須努力不辜負這種期望。
results.example2: In her writing she _____ed for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.  她在寫作中力圖在創新和傳統散文形式之間取得平衡。

results.name: endorsement
results.english: the act of saying that you approve of or support something or someone
results.example1: The campaign hasn't received any political endorsements. 此活動未得到任何政治支援。
results.example2: He hoped to secure quick endorsement of the plan from the president. 他希望很快能從總統那裡獲得對這項計畫的許可。

results.name: premium
results.english: an amount of money paid to get insurance
results.example1: Car insurance _____s have increased this year. 今年汽車保險費漲了。
results.example2: The _____s for healthcare plans are high. 健保計劃的保險費很高。

results.name: deprivation
results.english: a situation in which you do not have things or conditions that are usually considered necessary for a pleasant life
results.example1: They used sleep deprivation as a form of torture.  他們把不讓人睡覺作為一種折磨人的手段。
results.example2: There is awful deprivation in the shanty towns.  貧民區的生活條件十分糟糕。

results.name: induce
results.english: to persuade someone to do something
results.example1: They induced her to take the job by promising editorial freedom. 他們向她保證有編輯自由，以勸服她接受這項工作。
results.example2: Nothing could induce me (= I definitely cannot be persuaded) to climb a mountain/ride a bike. 沒有甚麼能誘使我去爬山／騎腳踏車的。

results.name: susceptible to
results.english: easily influenced or harmed by something
results.chinese: 易受影響的，易受傷害的
results.example1: She isn't very susceptible to flattery.  她不太聽信別人的奉承。
results.example2: These plants are particularly susceptible to frost.  這些植物很容易受霜凍影響。

results.name: outcry
results.english: a strong expression of anger and disapproval about something, made by a group of people or by the public
results.example1: The release from prison of two of the terrorists has provoked a public _____.  釋放兩名恐怖分子激起了公眾的強烈抗議。

results.name: outlaw
results.english: to make something illegal or unacceptable
results.example1: The new law will outlaw smoking in public places. 新法律將禁止在公共場所吸煙。

results.name: discriminate
results.english: to treat a person or particular group of people differently, especially in a worse way from the way in which you treat other people, because of their skin colour, sex, sexuality, etc.
results.example1: She felt she had been discriminated against because of her age. 她認為自己受到了年齡歧視。
results.example2: In order to increase the number of female representatives, the selection committee decided to discriminate in favour of women for three years. 為了增加女性代表的人數，選拔委員會決定在三年內特別禮遇婦女。

results.name: harsh
results.english: unpleasant, unkind, cruel, or more severe than is necessary
results.chinese: 令人不快的；嚴酷的；（無端地）嚴厲的
results.example1: harsh criticism 嚴厲的批評
results.example2: He said some harsh words (= spoke unkindly) about his brother. 他說了他兄弟一些難聽的話。

results.name: aptitude
results.english: a natural ability or skill
results.example1: I had no _____ for accountancy and began to hate it.

results.name: zealous
results.english: enthusiastic and eager
results.chinese: 熱衷的, 狂熱的, 尤其是政治宗教類
results.example1: a _____ supporter of the government's policies 政府政策的積極支持者

results.name: workforce
results.english: the group of people who work in a company, industry, country, etc.
results.example1: The majority of factories in the region have a workforce of 50 to 100 (people). 該地大多數工廠都擁有50至100名工人。
results.example2: Much of the workforce in the banking sector is/are affected by the new legislation. 銀行業的大部分員工都收到新法律影響。

results.name: adept
results.english: having a natural ability to do something that needs skill
results.example1: She's very adept at dealing with the media.  她應付媒體遊刃有餘。
results.example2: Tamsin Palmer gave a technically adept performance on the piano.  塔姆辛‧帕爾默演奏的鋼琴曲技法純熟。

results.name: curriculum vitae,  CV
results.english: a resume

results.name: a diploma
results.english: a document given by a college or university to show that you have passed a particular exam or finished your studies
results.example1: a diploma in business studies 商學文憑
results.example2: US a high school diploma 高中畢業證書

results.name: novice
results.english: a person who is not experienced in a job or situation
results.example1: I've never driven a car before - I'm a complete novice. 我以前從未開過車——完全是個新手。
results.example2: This plant can be difficult for novice gardeners to grow. 讓園藝新手來培育這種植物是相當有難度的。

results.name: vacancy
results.english: a space or place that is available to be used
results.example1: We wanted to book a hotel room in July but there were no vacancies. 我們想預訂七月份的飯店房間，但是已經沒有空房了。
results.example2: The dentist can't see you today but she has a vacancy tomorrow morning. 牙醫今天不能給你看病，不過她明天上午有空。

results.name: credentials
results.english: the abilities and experience that make someone suitable for a particular job or activity,  or proof of someone's abilities and experience
results.chinese: 資歷, 資格；資格證書, 資質證明
results.example1: The policeman asked to see the driver’s _____.

results.name: screening
results.english: a test or examination to discover if there is anything wrong with someone
results.example1: regular screening(s) for cervical cancer 定期子宮頸癌篩檢

results.name: pertain to
results.english: to be connected with a particular subject,  event,  or situation
results.example1: We are only interested in the parts of the proposals that pertain to local issues. 我們只對議案中涉及當地的部分感興趣。

results.name: commensurate
results.english: in a correct and suitable amount compared to something else
results.example1: a salary that is commensurate with skills and experience  與技能和經驗相稱的薪水

results.name: preeminent
results.english: more important or powerful than all others:

results.name: preliminary
results.english: coming before a more important action or event, especially introducing or preparing for it
results.example1: Preliminary results show that the vaccine is effective, but this has to be confirmed by further medical trials.  初查結果顯示疫苗是有效的，但這有待於進一步醫學實驗的證實。
results.example2: We've decided to change the design based on our preliminary findings. 我們決定依據初步調查的結果對設計方案進行更改。

results.name: prerequisite
results.english: something that must exist or happen before something else can exist or happen
results.chinese: 先決條件，前提，必備條件
results.example1: Passing a written test is a prerequisite for taking the advanced course. 通過筆試是學習進階課程的前提。
results.example2: Public support is a prerequisite for/to the success of this project. 大眾支持是這一計劃取得成功的必備條件。

results.name: probationer
results.english: a person such as a police officer or teacher who has recently passed his or her final exams and who is doing the first year of work

results.name: stern
results.english: severe,  or showing disapproval
results.example1: a stern look/warning/voice  嚴厲的目光／警告／語氣
results.example2: She is her own sternest critic.  她對自己非常苛刻。

results.name: curriculum
results.english: the subjects studied in a school, college, etc. and what each subject includes
results.example1: the school curriculum 學校課程

results.name: by all means
results.english: used to give permission
results.example1: May I borrow this book? By all means.  「我可以借這本書嗎？」「當然可以。」

results.name: if I'm not mistaken
results.chinese: 如果我的理解沒錯的話

results.name: depiction
results.english: the way that something is represented or shown
results.example1: The painter's depictions of the horror of war won her a worldwide reputation. 這位畫家對戰事恐怖的描繪使她蜚聲國際
results.example2: I disapprove of the depiction of violence on television. 我反對電視節目中的暴力描寫。

results.name: his strategy was exemplary
results.english: very good and suitable to be copied by other people
results.chinese: 優異的；值得仿傚的；(可作)楷模的
results.example1: His tact was exemplary,  especially considering the circumstances. 他的策略堪稱典範, 尤其是考慮到當時的情形。

results.name: in accordance with
results.english: following or obeying a rule,  law,  wish,  etc.
results.chinese: 依照規則(法律, 意願等)
results.example1: In accordance with her wishes,  she was buried in France.  按照她的遺願, 人們將她安葬在法國。

results.name: indecisive
results.english: not good at making decisions
results.chinese: 優柔寡斷的，猶豫不決的
results.example1: He is widely thought to be an indecisive leader. 大家普遍認為他是個優柔寡斷的領導人。

results.name: religious observances
results.english: the act of obeying a law or following a religious custom
results.chinese: （對法律或宗教習俗的）遵守，奉行
results.example1: religious observances such as fasting 宗教習俗例如禁食

results.name: pointed
results.english: A pointed remark, question, or manner is intended as a criticism of the person it is directed to.
results.chinese: （評論、問題、方式等）尖銳的，犀利的，直截了當的，批評的
results.example1: My aunt made a few pointed remarks about my taste in clothes. 姑姑一針見血地批評了我對服裝的品味。

results.name: surpass
results.english: to do or be better than
results.example1: His time for the 100 metres surpassed the previous world record by one hundredth of a second.  他以0.01秒的優勢打破了100米短跑的前世界紀錄。
results.example2: The book's success has surpassed everyone's expectations.  這本書獲得出乎所有人意料的成功。

results.name: suppress
results.english: to end something by force
results.example1: _____ an impulse (壓住衝動)
results.example2: Pro-independence demonstrations were ruthlessly _____. (被鎮壓)

results.name: with respect to
results.english: in connection with something
results.example1: The two groups are very similar ___ _____ ___ age.

results.name: from this day onwards
results.english: beginning at a particular time and continuing after it
results.example1: I'm usually at home from five o'clock onwards. 我通常從五時起都在家。

results.name: stand over
results.english: to stand close to someone and watch what they are doing
results.chinese: 就近從旁觀察(某人)做事
results.example1: Don't stand over me all the time - it makes me nervous.  別一直站在旁邊盯著我——搞得我神經緊張。

results.name: catch sb red-handed
results.english: to find someone in the act of doing something illegal
results.chinese: 當場抓住（某人）做非法勾當

results.name: compel them to do ...
results.english: to force someone to do something
results.example1: [+ to infinitive] As a schoolboy he was compelled to wear shorts even in winter.  在小學階段，即使在冬天他也被迫穿著短褲。
results.example2: formal The new circumstances compelled a change in policy.  新情況迫使在政策上作出改變。

results.name: prestigious
results.english: very much respected and admired, usually because of being important
results.chinese: 有威望的，有聲望的，受尊敬的
results.example1: a prestigious literary award 頗具聲望的文學獎
results.example2: a prestigious university 享有盛譽的大學

results.name: on account of
results.english: because of something
results.example1: He doesn't drink alcohol on account of his poor health.  由於健康原因，他不喝酒。

results.name: scrutiny
results.english: the careful and detailed examination of something in order to get information about it
results.example1: under the _____ of the police 在警方的監視之下

results.name: stipulate
results.english: to say exactly how something must be or must be done
results.example1: She agreed to buy the car, but stipulated racing tyres and a turbo-powered engine. 她同意買這輛車，但指明要裝賽車輪胎和渦輪動力引擎。
results.example2: ][+ that] The law stipulates that new cars must have seat belts for the driver and every passenger. 法律規定新車必須為駕駛人和每位乘客配備坐椅安全帶。

results.name: introspection
results.english: examination of and attention to your own ideas,  thoughts,  and feelings
results.example1: His defeat in the world championship led to a long period of gloomy introspection.  世界錦標賽上落敗後, 他長期鬱鬱寡歡, 處於自我反省之中。

results.name: as per
results.english: according to the instructions
results.example1: I had two spoonfuls after lunch, as per instructions. 我依照說明午餐後吃了兩匙。

results.name: radical
results.english: relating to the most important parts of something or someone; complete or extreme
results.example1: We need to make some radical changes to our operating procedures. 我們需要對操作流程進行一些根本性的變革。
results.example2: I'm just having my hair trimmed - nothing radical. 我正把頭髮剪短一下——沒什麼大改變。

results.name: meltdown
results.english: a complete failure, especially in financial matters
results.example1: financial/economic/market meltdown 金融災難／經濟崩潰／市場崩潰
results.example2: The last few months have seen the progressive meltdown of the country's political system. 過去幾個月間，該國的政治體系一步步走向瓦解。

results.name: abruptly
results.english: in a sudden, unexpected, and sometimes unpleasant way
results.example1: He stood up abruptly and went outside.
results.example2: The talks ended abruptly when one of the delegations walked out in protest.

results.name: mammoth
results.english: extremely large
results.example1: Cleaning up the city-wide mess is going to be a mammoth task.  清掃全市範圍內的垃圾將是一項艱巨的任務。
results.example2: It's a mammoth undertaking - are you sure you have the resources to cope?  這是一項艱巨的任務——你肯定有能力完成嗎？

results.name: exhaustive
results.english: complete and including everything
results.example1: an exhaustive study/report  全面的研究／詳盡的報告

results.name: temperament
results.english: the part of your character that affects your moods and the way you behave
results.example1: He has a romantic _____. 他富有浪漫氣質。

results.name: reside
results.english: to live, have your home, or stay in a place
results.example1: The family now resides in southern France. 這家人現居住在法國南部。

results.name: distillery
results.english: a factory where strong alcoholic drinks are produced by the process of distilling

results.name: grip
results.english: to hold very tightly
results.example1: The baby gripped my finger with her tiny hand. 嬰兒的小手緊緊握住我的手指。
results.example2: Old tyres won't grip (= stay on the surface of the road) in the rain very well. 在雨天，舊輪胎在路面上防滑性能不是太好。

results.name: petition
results.english: a document signed by a large number of people demanding or asking for some action from the government or another authority
results.example1: I signed a petition against the proposed closure of the local hospital today. 今天我在反對關閉當地醫院的請願書上簽了名。

results.name: inadvertently
results.example1: All authors need to be wary of _____ copying of other people's ideas.  所有作者都需注意不要在無意中抄襲了他人的觀點。
results.example2: He inadvertently deleted the file.  他不小心把檔案刪除了。

results.name: judicial
results.english: involving a law court
results.example1: the judicial system 司法制度
results.example2: a judicial enquiry/review 司法質詢／審查

results.name: keenly
results.english: extremely or very strongly
results.example1: He felt his loneliness most _____ on Sunday. 星期天他倍感寂寞。
results.example2: They are keenly aware that this will be their last chance to succeed.

results.name: lawsuit
results.english: a problem taken to a law court by an ordinary person or an organization rather than the police in order to obtain a legal decision
results.example1: Two of the directors filed a lawsuit against their former employer.  其中的兩位董事已經對其前僱主提出訴訟。
results.example2: mainly UK They brought a lawsuit against the company.  他們對這家公司提起訴訟。

results.name: off-limits
results.english: If an area of land is off-limits, you are not allowed to enter it.

results.name: ordinance
results.english: a law or rule made by a government or authority
results.chinese: 法令, 法規；條令, 條例
results.example1: City Ordinance 126 forbids the parking of cars in this area.  《市政條例》第126條禁止在該地區停放車輛。

results.name: punctual
results.english: arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
results.example1: a punctual start to the meeting 準時開會
results.example2: He's fairly punctual (= he usually arrives on time). 他通常非常準時。

results.name: reprimand
results.english: to express to someone your strong official disapproval of them
results.example1: She was reprimanded by her teacher for biting another girl.  她因為咬了另一個女孩而受到了老師的訓斥。

results.name: stiff
results.english: firm or hard
results.example1: stiff cardboard  硬紙板
results.example2: This hair spray has made my hair stiff. 這種髮膠使我的頭髮變硬。

results.name: substantiate
results.english: to show something to be true,  or to support a claim with facts
results.example1: We have evidence to substantiate the allegations against him.  我們有證據支持對他的指控。
results.example2: Reports that children had been hurt have not been substantiated.  有關兒童受到傷害的報導並未得到證實。

results.name: trespass
results.english: to go onto someone's land or enter their building without permission
results.chinese: 擅自進入，侵入（他人土地或建築物）
results.example1: I hope this is a public footpath and we're not trespassing on someone's land. 但願這是條公共人行道，我們沒有擅自闖入別人的地界。

results.name: at sb's behest
results.english: because someone has asked or ordered you to do something
results.chinese: 按照…的要求；在…的命令下
results.example1: The budget proposal was adopted at the mayor's _____. 在市長的要求下, 這項預算建議獲得採納。

results.name: meadow
results.english: a field with grass and often wild flowers in it
results.example1: There was a path through the meadow to the village.  有一條小徑穿過草地通向村莊。

results.name: subdue
results.english: to reduce the force of something, or to prevent something from existing or developing
results.example1: The fire burned for eight hours before the fire crews could subdue it. 大火燒了八個小時後，消防隊才控制住火勢。
results.example2: He criticized the school for trying to subdue individual expression. 他指責學校試圖壓制個性的自由表現。

results.name: stun
results.english: to make a person or animal unconscious or unable to think normally, especially by hitting their head hard
results.chinese: 使失去知覺，使昏迷；（尤指重擊頭部）把…打昏
results.example1: Stunned by the impact, he lay on the ground wondering what had happened.  遭重擊後，他躺在地上想弄清楚發生了甚麼事。
results.example2: This injection stuns the rhinoceros, so we can examine it.  這支注射針劑可以把犀牛弄暈，然後我們就可以對牠進行檢查。

results.name: probe
results.example1: They are _____ing into the cause of the crime. 他們正在探究犯罪的原因。

results.name: at sb's discretion
results.english: the right or ability to decide something
results.example1: Students can be expelled at the discretion of the principal (= if the principal decides it). 校長有權開除學生。
results.example2: I leave the decision to your discretion (= for you to decide). 我讓你來決定這件事。

results.name: be bound to
results.english: certain or extremely likely to happen
results.chinese: 肯定的；極有可能的；必然的；註定了的
results.example1: she's _____ to know 她肯定知道

results.name: circumscribe
results.english: to limit something
results.example1: Their movements have been severely circumscribed since the laws came into effect. 自從這些法律生效以來，他們的活動受到了嚴格約束。
results.example2: There followed a series of tightly circumscribed visits to military installations. 隨之而來的是對參觀軍事設施的一系列嚴格限制。

results.name: enact
results.english: to put something into action, especially to make something law
results.example1: Several bills were _____ed at the end of this session of Parliament. 幾項法案在這屆國會的會議結束時被制定

results.name: impeccable
results.english: perfect, with no problems or bad parts
results.example1: impeccable taste/manners/credentials 無可挑剔的品味／舉止／資歷
results.example2: His English is impeccable. 他的英語無懈可擊。

results.name: in fringe
results.english: the outer or less important part of an area, group, or activity
results.chinese: （地區或群體的）邊緣，周邊；（活動的）次要部分
results.example1: the southern fringe of the city 城市的南部邊緣
results.example2: He attended several of the fringe meetings at the conference. 在大會期間他參加了幾場週邊會議。

results.name: legitimate
results.english: reasonable and acceptable
results.chinese: 合理的，可接受的，得到認可的
results.example1: He claimed that the restaurant bill was a legitimate business expense.  他聲稱飯店帳單是一筆合理的業務開支。

results.name: cartridge
results.english: a small part with a particular purpose that can be easily replaced with another similar part, used in a larger piece of equipment
results.example1: an ink/printer cartridge 墨水囊／印表機墨水匣（或色帶盒）

results.name: run errands
results.english: a short journey either to take a message or to take or collect something
results.example1: I'll meet you at six, I've got some errands to do/run first. 我會在六點和你見面，我得先去辦些事情。

results.name: seal
results.english: to close an entrance or container so that nothing can enter or leave it
results.example1: to cover a surface with a special liquid to protect it （用特殊液體）覆蓋…的表面
results.example2: This floor has just been sealed (with varnish), so don't walk on it! 地板剛剛上過清漆，別在上面走！

results.name: clerical
results.english: relating to work done in an office
results.chinese: 辦公室工作的；辦事員工作的；文書工作的
results.example1: a clerical job (= a job performing general office duties). 文書工作
results.example2: a clerical error (= a mistake made in the office) （辦公時的）筆誤

results.name: conclusive
results.english: proving that something is true, or ending any doubt
results.chinese: 無可置疑的；確實的；決定性的；結論性的
results.example1: They had conclusive evidence/proof of her guilt. 他們掌握了她犯罪的確鑿證據。
results.example2: a conclusive argument 令人信服的論據

results.name: editorial
results.english: an article in a newspaper that expresses the editor's opinion on a subject of particular interest at the present time
results.example1: All the papers deal with the same subject in their editorials. 所有的報紙都針對同一問題發表了社論。

results.name: put sth forward
results.english: to change a clock or watch to make it show a later time, especially an hour later
results.example1: Most European countries put the clocks forward in the spring.  大多數歐洲國家會在春季將鐘錶撥快一小時。

results.name: officiate
results.english: to be in charge of or to lead a ceremony or other public event
results.chinese: 主持(儀式或其他公眾活動)
results.example1: the priest who ______ed at their wedding. 主持他們婚禮的牧師

results.name: strew
results.english: to spread things in an untidy way over a surface, or to be spread in an untidy way over a surface
results.example1: They marked the end of the war by strewing flowers over the graves of 18,000 soldiers. 他們在1.8萬名士兵的墳墓上撒滿鮮花，以此紀念戰爭的結束。
results.example2: The park was strewn with litter after the concert. 音樂會後公園裡遍地都是垃圾。

results.name: strewn with
results.english: to spread things in an untidy way over a surface, or to be spread in an untidy way over a surface
results.example1: They marked the end of the war by strewing flowers over the graves of 18,000 soldiers. 他們在1.8萬名士兵的墳墓上撒滿鮮花，以此紀念戰爭的結束。
results.example2: The park was strewn with litter after the concert. 音樂會後公園裡遍地都是垃圾。

results.name: a shopaholic
results.english: a person who enjoys shopping very much and does it a lot
results.example1: A self-confessed shopaholic, Diane loved looking for new clothes with her two daughters. 戴安娜承認自己是購物狂，她熱衷於和兩個女兒一起選購新衣。

results.name: (sth) take their toll on
results.english: If something takes its/a toll, it causes suffering, deaths, or damage.
results.example1: The problems of the past few months have taken their toll on her health and there are shadows under her eyes. 過去幾個月的問題影響了她的健康，她眼睛出現黑眼圈。
results.example2: The deepening recession has also taken its toll in the south of the country, where unemployment is rife. 日益加劇的經濟衰退也嚴重影響到該國南部地區，那裡的失業率居高不下。

results.name: slump
results.english: (of prices, values, or sales) to fall suddenly
results.example1: The value of property has _____ed. 房産價值突然下跌。

results.name: go bust
results.english: If a company goes bust, it is forced to close because it is financially unsuccessful.
results.example1: More than 20 companies in the district went bust during the last three months.  過去的三個月裡這一地區有超過20家公司破產。

results.name: intricate
results.english: having a lot of small parts or details that are arranged in a complicated way and are therefore sometimes difficult to understand, solve, or produce
results.chinese: 錯綜複雜的；複雜精細的；難理解的；難解決的
results.example1: The watch mechanism is extremely intricate and very difficult to repair. 手錶的機械結構非常複雜精密，很難修理。
results.example2: Police officers uncovered an intricate web of deceit. 警官揭開了一整套錯綜複雜的騙局。

results.name: prosperous
results.english: successful, usually by earning a lot of money
results.example1: In a prosperous country like this, no one should go hungry. 在這樣一個繁榮的國家裡，不應該有人挨餓。

results.name: affluent
results.english: having a lot of money or owning a lot of things
results.example1: affluent nations/neighbourhoods 富有國家／富人區

results.name: ominous
results.english: suggesting that something unpleasant is likely to happen
results.chinese: 惡兆的，不祥的，不吉利的
results.example1: There was an ominous silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.  當我詢問我會否獲得續約時，回答我的是不祥的沉默。
results.example2: The engine had been making an ominous sound all the way from my parents' house.  從我父母家出發後，一路上引擎一直發出一種不正常的聲音。

results.name: valet
results.english: to clean, especially the inside of, something
results.example1: There's a service which will valet your car for you while it is parked. 有一項代客洗車服務是趁車停在那裡時進行的。

results.name: intercept
results.english: to stop and catch something or someone before that thing or person is able to reach a particular place
results.example1: _____ a missile 攔截飛彈

results.name: splurge
results.english: to spend a lot of money on buying goods,  especially expensive goods
results.chinese: 亂花(錢)；揮霍(尤指購買奢侈品)
results.example1: to _____ money on sth. 在某事物上大把花錢

results.name: desecrate.
results.english: to damage or show no respect towards something holy or very much respected
results.example1: The mosque/shrine was desecrated by vandals. 清真寺／神殿遭到破壞分子的褻瀆。
results.example2: It's a crime to desecrate the country's flag. 褻瀆國旗是一種罪行。

results.name: mollify
results.english: to make someone less angry or upset
results.example1: I tried to mollify her by giving her flowers. 我試圖送花來撫慰她。

results.name: wither
results.english: (to cause) to become weak and dry and decay
results.example1: Grass had withered in the fields. 田裡的草都枯萎了。

results.name: ritual
results.english: a set of fixed actions and sometimes words performed regularly, especially as part of a ceremony
results.chinese: 例行公事，老規矩；（尤指）儀式
results.example1: Coffee and the newspaper are part of my morning ritual. 喝咖啡和讀報紙是我早晨必做的事情之一。
results.example2: The birds were performing a complex mating ritual. 這些鳥在進行程式複雜的交配。

results.name: be affiliated with
results.english: to cause a group to become part of or form a close relationship with another, usually larger, group, or organization
results.chinese: 使併入，使隸屬（較大的團體或組織）；使緊密聯繫
results.example1: a college affiliated to the University of Mumbai 孟買大學附屬學院
results.example2: The school is affiliated with a national association of driving schools. 這所學校隸屬於一個全國駕駛學校協會。

results.name: an industrial conglomerate
results.english: a company that owns several smaller businesses whose products or services are usually very different
results.example1: a financial/industrial conglomerate  金融／工業企業集團

results.name: impending doom
results.english: used to refer to an event, usually something unpleasant or unwanted, that is going to happen soon
results.chinese: （通常指不愉快或不受歡迎的事件）即將發生的，逼近的
results.example1: impending disaster/doom  即將來臨的災難／劫數
results.example2: The player announced his impending retirement from international football. 這位球員宣佈他即將從國家隊退役。

results.name: a proponent
results.english: a person who speaks publicly in support of a particular idea or plan of action
results.example1: He is one of the leading proponents of capital punishment.他是死刑的主要支持者之一。

results.name: proprietor
results.english: a person who owns a particular type of business,  especially a hotel,  a shop,  or a company that makes newspapers
results.example1: a hotel/newspaper proprietor  旅館／報業老闆

results.name: telecommuter
results.english: a person who works for an organization from their home and communicates with the main office and customers, etc. by phone or email
results.chinese: 利用電腦終端等）遠距離工作者
results.example1: The company spends about $5,000 per person to equip telecommuters with a state-of-the-art laptop and printer.

results.name: literacy
results.english: the ability to read and write
results.example1: Far more resources are needed to improve adult literacy. 提高成年人的讀寫能力所需要的資源還遠遠不夠。
results.example2: The country has a literacy rate of almost 98%. 這個國家接近98%的人有讀寫能力。

results.name: stationery
results.english: the things needed for writing, such as paper, pens, pencils, and envelopes

results.name: draw on
results.english: to use information or your knowledge of something to help you do something
results.example1: His novels draw heavily on his childhood. 他的小說大多取材於自己的童年經歷。
results.example2: She had a wealth of experience to draw on. 她有豐富的經驗可資借鑒。

results.name: discern
results.english: to see, recognize, or understand something that is not clear
results.example1: I could just discern a figure in the darkness.  在黑暗中我只能看出一個人影。
results.example2: It is difficult to discern any pattern in these figures. 在這些數字中很難找出規律。

results.name: expectant
results.english: thinking that something pleasant or exciting is going to happen
results.chinese: （對愉快或令人激動的事情）期待的，渴望的，盼望的
results.example1: the children's expectant faces 小朋友充滿渴望的表情

results.name: propel
results.english: to push or move something somewhere,  often with a lot of force
results.example1: a rocket _____ed through space在推力作用下穿越外太空的火箭

results.name: recline
results.english: to lean or lie back with the upper part of your body in a nearly horizontal position
results.example1: She was reclining elegantly on the sofa. 她優雅地斜倚在沙發上。
results.example2: He reclined his head against/on my shoulder. 他把頭靠在我的肩上。

results.name: trivial
results.english: having little value or importance
results.chinese: 微不足道的，瑣碎的；沒有價值的
results.example1: I don't know why he gets so upset about something so trivial. 我不明白他因何為芝麻大的事也如此煩惱。
results.example2: Sexual harassment in the workplace is not a trivial matter. 工作場所的性騷擾可不是件小事。

results.name: ambiance
results.english: the character of a place or the quality it seems to have
results.example1: Despite being a busy city,  Dublin has the _____ of a country town.儘管都柏林是一個繁忙的城市, 但頗有鄉村城鎮的情調。

results.name: aspiration
results.english: something that you hope to achieve
results.chinese: 志向，抱負；渴望達到的目標
results.example1: I've never had any political aspirations.  我從來就沒甚麼政治抱負。
results.example2: It's a story about the lives and aspirations of poor Irish immigrants.  這個故事講述了窮苦的愛爾蘭移民的生活與抱負。

results.name: creditable
results.english: deserving praise, trust, or respect
results.chinese: 值得稱讚的；可信的；可敬的
results.example1: Our team came in a creditable third in the competition. 我們球隊在比賽中得了第三名，很不錯。
results.example2: The other, less creditable, reason for their decision was personal gain. 他們作出這一決定的另一原因是個人得益，當然這點不太值得稱道。

results.name: an eminent person
results.english: famous, respected, or important
results.example1: an _____ historian 聲名顯赫的歷史學家

results.name: he entrusts his bag to her
results.english: to give someone a thing or a duty for which they are responsible
results.example1: He didn't look like the sort of man you should entrust your luggage to.  他看起來就不可靠，你不應該把行李託付給他。
results.example2: Two senior officials have been entrusted with organizing the auction. 兩名高層官員受委託組織這次拍賣活動。

results.name: conceal
results.english: to prevent something from being seen or known about
results.example1: The listening device was concealed in a pen. 竊聽裝置藏在筆裡。
results.example2: I tried to conceal my surprise when she told me her age. 她告訴我她的年齡時，我盡力掩飾自己的驚訝。

results.name: look up to him
results.english: to admire and respect someone
results.example1: He'd always looked up to his uncle. 他一直很敬重叔叔。

results.name: proofread
results.english: to find and correct mistakes in text before it is printed or put online

results.name: recondition
results.english: to repair a machine or piece of equipment and return it to a good condition
results.example1: The shop sells reconditioned vacuum cleaners.  這間商店出售翻新的吸塵器。

results.name: stool
results.english: a seat without any support for the back or arms
results.example1: a bar/kitchen/piano stool 吧檯／廚房／鋼琴凳
results.example2: a three-legged stool 三腳凳

results.name: burdensome
results.english: causing difficulties or work
results.example1: a burdensome task 繁重的任務

results.name: commend
results.english: to formally praise someone or something
results.example1: The judge _____ed her for her bravery. 法官稱讚了她的勇敢。

results.name: intensive
results.english: involving a lot of effort or activity in a short period of time
results.chinese: 密集的，集中的；加強的；深入的
results.example1: two weeks of intensive training  兩周的密集訓練
results.example2: an intensive course in English 英語密集課程

results.name: an astute person
results.english: able to understand a situation quickly and see how to take advantage of it
results.example1: an astute investor/businesswoman 精明的投資者／女商人
results.example2: his astute handling of the situation 他對局勢的巧妙處理

results.name: smock
results.english: a piece of clothing like a long shirt, worn loosely over other clothing to protect it when working, or a piece of women's clothing that is similar to this
results.example1: an artist's smock 藝術家的工作服

results.name: disrupt
results.english: to prevent something, especially a system, process, or event, from continuing as usual or as expected
results.example1: Heavy snow disrupted travel into the city this morning.  今晨的大雪擾亂了入城交通系統的正常運作。
results.example2: The meeting was disrupted by a group of protesters who shouted and threw fruit at the speaker.  一群抗議者一邊呼喊一邊向發言者投擲水果，讓會議無法正常進行下去。

results.name: restraint
results.english: calm and controlled behaviour
results.example1: He showed admirable restraint,  and refused to be provoked. 他表現出極大的克制, 面對挑釁泰然處之。

results.name: aggravate
results.english: to make a bad situation worse
results.example1: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion. 在市中心限制停車的試驗方案使交通擠塞的問題更加嚴重。

results.name: in commemoration of
results.english: something that is done to remember officially and give respect to a great person or event
results.example1: A set of stamps has been commissioned in commemoration of Independence Day. 為紀念獨立日特別製作了一套郵票。
results.example2: Thousands of veterans will take part in a commemoration of the battle. 數千名老兵將參加戰爭紀念活動。

results.name: segregate ... from ...
results.english: to keep one group of people apart from another and treat them differently, especially because of race or sex
results.chinese: （尤指基於種族或性別原因）隔離並差別對待
results.example1: a segregated school/society 實行種族隔離的學校／社會
results.example2: Blacks were segregated from whites in every area of life. 在生活中的各方各面，黑人和白人被隔離開。

results.name: vandalize
results.english: to intentionally damage property belonging to other people
results.example1: When I got back, my car had been vandalized. 等我回來的時候，我的車已被恣意搞破壞的人給砸壞了。
results.example2: Bored teenagers went around vandalizing phoneboxes. 閑得發悶的青少年到處去破環電話亭。

results.name: superintendent
results.english: a person who is in charge of work done in a particular department, office, etc., or who is responsible for keeping a building or place in good condition
results.chinese: 主管，負責人；（大樓的）看管人
results.example1: In the US, a school superintendent is in charge of the schools in a particular area. 在美國，教育局長主管一個地區的學校。
results.example2: We asked the superintendent (also US informal super) to fix the broken window in our apartment. 我們請管理員把我們公寓破碎的玻璃窗修一下。

results.name: probation
results.english: a period of time when a criminal must behave well and not commit any more crimes in order to avoid being sent to prison
results.example1: He was fined and given two years' probation.  他被處以罰金和兩年緩刑。
results.example2: The judge put him on probation for two years.  法官判他緩刑兩年。

results.name: gang up on sb
results.english: to unite as a group against someone
results.example1: Johnnie says the girls in his class are ganging up on him and teasing him.

results.name: lash out
results.english: to suddenly attack someone or something physically or criticize him, her, or it in an angry way
results.example1: I was only teasing him and suddenly he lashed out (at me) and hit me in the face. 我只是在和他鬧著玩，他卻突然動起手來，一拳打在我的臉上。
results.example2: Why's Tina in such a bad mood? She really lashed out at me when I was late for work. 蒂娜爲甚麽情緒這麽糟糕？我上班遲到了她就對我大發雷霆。

results.name: horoscope
results.english: a description of what is going to happen to you, based on the position of the stars and planets at the time of your birth
results.example1: I read my horoscope most days. 我大多數日子都會看一下自己的星座運勢。
results.example2: My horoscope said I was going to be lucky in love this month. 我的星相說這個月我會走桃花運。

results.name: testimony
results.english: (an example of) spoken or written statements that something is true, especiallythose given in a law court
results.example1: Some doubts have been expressed about his testimony. 有人對他的證詞提出了一些質疑。

results.name: sacred
results.english: considered to be holy and deserving respect, especially because of a connection with a god
results.chinese: （尤指因與神有關而）神聖的，值得崇敬的
results.example1: sacred relics/temples 聖物／殿
results.example2: This area is sacred to the Apaches. 對阿帕契人而言，這一個地區是神聖的。

results.name: confiscate
results.english: to take a possession away from someone when you have the right to do so, usually as a punishment and often for a limited period, after which it is returned to the owner
results.chinese: （通常指作爲懲罰）沒收，把…充公
results.example1: Miss Edwards confiscated my phone! 愛德華小姐沒收了我的電話！
results.example2: His passport was confiscated by the police to prevent him from leaving the country. 警方沒收了他的護照，以防他出境。

results.name: concussion
results.english: temporary damage to the brain caused by a fall or hit on the head or by violent shaking
results.example1: UK He's been dizzy and confused since the accident. Do you think he has concussion?  發生事故以來，他一直有點頭暈和思維混亂。你覺得那是不是腦震盪？
results.example2: US He's been dizzy and confused since the accident. Do you think he has a concussion?  發生事故以來，他一直有點頭暈和思維混亂。你覺得那是不是腦震盪？

results.name: subpoena
results.english: to order someone to go to a law court to answer questions
results.example1: A friend of the victim was subpoenaed as a witness by lawyers representing the accused. 被告方律師傳喚受害人的一個朋友出庭作證。
results.example2: [+ to infinitive] They were subpoenaed to testify before the judge. 他們被傳喚到庭作證。

results.name: rinky-dink
results.english: having little importance or influence, or old-fashioned or of poor quality
results.chinese: 無足輕重的；無價值的；過時的；劣質的
results.example1: Their family business is a rinky-dink operation. 他們的家族企業是小本經營。

results.name: she obsesses about her weight
results.english: If something or someone obsesses you, or if you obsess about something or someone, you think about it, him, or her all the time.
results.chinese: （使）著迷；（使）困擾；（使）牽掛；（使）縈迴於心
results.example1: The whole relationship obsessed me for years. 這一關係多年來一直困擾著我。
results.example2: She used to obsess about her weight. 她過去總是過分在意自己的體重。

results.name: evolve into
results.english: to develop gradually, or to cause something or someone to develop gradually
results.chinese: （使）逐步發展；（使）逐步演變；（使）逐漸形成；（使）進化
results.example1: Did humans evolve from apes? 人類是由猿進化而來的嗎？
results.example2: The company has evolved over the years into a multi-million dollar organization. 這間公司在幾年內逐步發展成為一間擁有幾百萬美元資產的大企業。

results.name: STD
results.english: abbreviation for sexually transmitted disease
results.chinese: 性傳播疾病（sexually transmitted disease的縮寫）

results.name: provoke
results.english: to cause a reaction, especially a negative one
results.example1: The prospect of increased prices has already _____ed an outcry.物價上漲的預測已經引發了強烈抗議。

results.name: looking over my shoulder
results.english: to feel anxious and nervous about something to happen
results.chinese: 提心吊膽，覺得憂慮是否有些事情即將發生
results.example1: I guess I am just getting tired of looking over my shoulder. 我猜我只是厭煩了提心吊膽的日子。
results.example2: I get to leave constantly looking over my shoulder for monsters dressed up as the popular kid, constantly on edge and assuming the worst in every boy.

results.name: testify
results.english: to speak seriously about something, especially in a law court, or to give or provide proof
results.example1: [+ that] He testified that he had seen the man leaving the building around the time of the murder. 他作證說，自己看到那人在謀殺發生前後離開了大樓。

results.name: disciplinary
results.english: relating to discipline
results.example1: disciplinary measures/action (= punishment)   懲罰措施／行動

results.name: discredit the testimony
results.english: to cause people to stop respecting someone or believing in an idea or person
results.chinese: 使名譽受損；使受到懷疑
results.example1: Evidence of links with drug dealers has discredited the mayor. 市長與販毒分子有瓜葛的證據使他名譽掃地。
results.example2: discredited theories 受到懷疑的理論

results.name: be wary of
results.english: not completely trusting or certain about something or someone
results.example1: I'm a little wary of/about giving people my address when I don't know them very well. 如果不是太熟的話，我不會輕易告訴別人我的地址。

results.name: auditorium
results.english: the part of a theatre, or similar building, where the people who are watching and listening sit
results.example1: No smoking in the auditorium. 觀眾席中禁止吸煙。

results.name: choir
results.english: a group of people who sing together
results.chinese: 合唱團；（尤指教堂的）唱詩班
results.example1: He sings in the church choir. 他在教堂唱詩班唱歌。
results.example2: choir practice 合唱團的練習

results.name: oar
results.english: a long pole with a wide, flat part at one end, used for rowing a boat
results.example1: a pair of oars 一副槳
results.example2: She dipped her oars into the water and pulled. 她把槳放到水中劃起來。

results.name: premiere
results.english: the first public performance of a play or any other type of entertainment
results.example1: The world premiere of the opera will be at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. 這部歌劇的世界首演將在紐約的大都會歌劇院舉行。

results.name: rake
results.english: to use a rake to make earth level or to collect leaves
results.chinese: （用耙子）耙，耙平；（把葉子）耙在一起
results.example1: In the autumn I rake (up) the dead leaves. 秋天，我用耙子將落葉耙集成堆。
results.example2: Rake (over) the soil before planting the seeds. 在播種之前要把土壤耙平整。

results.name: stroll
results.english: to walk in a slow, relaxed manner, especially for pleasure
results.example1: We could stroll along the beach after dinner. 晚飯後我們可以去海灘散散步。

results.name: as it is
results.english: already
results.example1: I'm not buying the children anything else today - I've spent far too much money as it is. 今天我不會再給孩子們買任何別的東西了——我花的錢已經太多了。

results.name: concrete
results.english: clear and certain, or real and existing in a form that can be seen or felt
results.chinese: 確定的，確實的；具體的，有形的，實在的
results.example1: They think she killed her husband, but they have no concrete evidence. 他們認爲她殺死了自己的丈夫，但是沒有確鑿的證據。
results.example2: We have a general idea of what we want, but nothing concrete at the moment. 我們對需要甚麽有個大致的想法，可是具體的東西目前還沒有想好。

results.name: stall
results.english: a large table or a small shop with an open front from which goods are sold in a public place
results.example1: In the village market, the stalls are piled high with local vegetables. 村子市集的攤位上高高堆著當地産的蔬菜。

results.name: metropolitan
results.english: relating to a large city
results.example1: the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York 紐約大都會藝術博物館
results.example2: He was drawn to the metropolitan glamour and excitement of Paris. 他為巴黎的大都會魅力與激情所吸引。

results.name: as opposed to
results.english: rather than
results.example1: I'd prefer to go in May, as opposed to September. 我更願意五月份去，而不是九月份。

results.name: bold
results.english: not frightened of danger
results.example1: She was a bold and fearless climber. 她是一位勇敢無畏的登山者。
results.example2: The newspaper made the bold move/took the bold step of publishing the names of the men involved. 該報採取大膽行動，將有關人員的名字都公佈了出來。

results.name: compilation
results.english: the act of compiling something
results.example1: A team of four was involved in the compilation of the book. 一個四人小組參與了這本書的編寫工作。

results.name: mediate
results.english: to talk to two separate people or groups involved in a disagreement to try to help them to agree or find a solution to their problems
results.example1: Negotiators were called in to mediate between the two sides.  請來了談判人員為雙方調解
results.example2: The two envoys have succeeded in mediating an end to the war. 兩位使節透過談判斡旋促成了戰爭的結束。

results.name: modest
results.english: not usually talking about or making obvious your own abilities and achievements
results.example1: He's very modest about his achievements. 他對自己的成就很謙虛。

results.name: persistent
results.english: lasting for a long time or difficult to get rid of
results.chinese: 持續的；存留的；頑強存在的
results.example1: a persistent smell/skin rash 持續不散的氣味／頑固的皮膚疹
results.example2: Symptoms of the illness include a high temperature and a persistent dry cough. 此疾病症狀包括高燒和持久乾咳。

results.name: at a stretch
results.english: continuously or without any interruptions
results.example1: There's no way I could work for ten hours at a stretch. 要我連續工作十小時是不可能的。

results.name: consolidate your debt
results.english: to become, or cause something to become, stronger, and more certain
results.example1: The success of their major product _____ed the firm's position in the market. 公司主打産品取得的成功鞏固了該公司在市場上的地位。
results.example2: She hoped that marriage would _____ their relationship. 她希望婚姻能鞏固他們的關係。

results.name: contend
results.english: to compete in order to win something
results.example1: There are three world-class tennis players _____ing for this title. 有三位世界頂級網球選手爭奪這項冠軍。
results.example2: He's _____ing against someone with twice his experience. 他在和經驗比他豐富一倍的人競爭。

results.name: constitute
results.english: to be or be considered as something
results.example1: This latest defeat constitutes a major setback for the Democrats. 最近的這次失敗是對民主黨的一次重挫。

results.name: intervention
results.english: a situation in which someone becomes involved in a particular issue, problem etc in order to influence what happens
results.example1: Women’s groups are concerned about the high levels of medical intervention during childbirth.
results.example2: We do not need further government intervention.

results.name: irretrievable
results.english: impossible to correct or return to a previously existing situation or condition
results.chinese: 無法糾正的，不能恢復的，無法挽救的
results.example1: I agree things look difficult, but the situation is far from irretrievable.  我承認情況看起來不妙，但還遠遠沒到無法挽救的地步。
results.example2: The couple separated on the grounds of irretrievable breakdown (of their marriage). 這對夫妻因（婚姻）關係破裂無法挽回而分居。

results.name: jeopardize
results.english: to put something such as a plan or system in danger of being harmed or damaged
results.chinese: 使處於危險境地；危及，損害
results.example1: She knew that by failing her finals she could jeopardize her whole future. 她知道考試不及格會影響自己整個未來的前途。

results.name: legible
results.english: Legible writing or print can be read easily.
results.chinese: （筆跡或字體）清晰的，易讀的，清楚的
results.example1: Her handwriting is barely legible. 她寫的字幾乎無法辨認。

results.name: setback
results.english: something that happens that delays or prevents a process from developing
results.example1: Sally had been recovering well from her operation, but yesterday she experienced/suffered a setback. 莎莉手術後一直恢復良好，但昨天她的病情再度復發。
results.example2: There has been a slight/temporary setback in our plans. 我們的計劃遭到了一點／暫時的挫敗。

results.name: underlying
results.english: real but not immediately obvious
results.example1: And what might be the underlying significance of these supposedly random acts? 這些看似偶然的行爲，其暗含的意義可能是甚麽呢？

results.name: a strain on
results.english: a force or influence that stretches, pulls, or puts pressure on something, sometimes causing damage
results.example1: The hurricane put such a strain on the bridge that it collapsed. 在颶風強大的威力之下，橋塌了。
results.example2: As you get older, excess weight puts a lot of strain on the heart. 隨著年齡的增長，體重過重會給心臟造成很大負擔。

results.name: rave reviews
results.english: admiring and giving a lot of praise
results.chinese: 狂熱褒評的，大加讚揚的，捧上天的
results.example1: The show has received rave reviews/notices in all the papers. 這場演出受到所有報紙的高度評價／吸引了所有報紙的注意並得到熱情洋溢的報道。

results.name: contrive.
results.english: to arrange a situation or event, or arrange for something to happen, using clever planning
results.chinese: 巧妙安排；謀劃, 策劃
results.example1: Couldn't you _____ a meeting between them? I think they'd really like each other. 你不能為他們安排一次會面嗎？我覺得他們真的互有好感。
results.example2: Somehow she _____ed to get tickets for the concert. 她不知透過甚麽方式得到了音樂會的門票。

results.name: fortify
results.english: to make something stronger, especially in order to protect it
results.example1: They hurriedly fortified the village with barricades of carts.  他們匆忙用馬車搭起路障，加強村子的防禦。
results.example2: The argument had fortified her resolve to prove she was right.  這番爭論增強了她證明自己正確的決心。

results.name: mingle
results.english: to mix or combine, or be mixed or combined
results.example1: The excitement of starting a new job is always mingled with a certain apprehension. 剛開始一份新工作時，興奮中總是摻雜著一點擔憂。
results.example2: The two flavours mingle well. 兩種味道混合在一起十分搭配。

results.name: stark
results.english: empty, simple, or obvious, especially without decoration or anything that is not necessary
results.chinese: 赤裸的；簡單的；明顯的；（尤指）毫無修飾的，粗陋的；嚴重的；極端的
results.example1: It was a stark room with a bed and chair as the only furniture. 這個房間很簡陋，僅有的傢俱就是一張床和一把椅子。
results.example2: In the suburbs the spacious houses stand in stark (= extreme) contrast to the slums of the city's poor. 郊區寬敞的大房子和城裡的貧民窟形成了鮮明的對比。

results.name: steadiness
results.english: the quality of not changing suddenly
results.example1: She finds the steadiness of life with an older man appealing.
results.example2: The timing of the change came at a period of relative steadiness in interest rates.

results.name: alluring
results.english: attractive or exciting
results.chinese: 誘人的，迷人的；吸引人的
results.example1: I didn't find the prospect of a house with no electricity very alluring. 我無法想像，一幢連電都沒有接通的房子會有甚麼吸引力。
results.example2: She was wearing a most alluring dress at Sam's dinner party. 她出席薩姆的晚宴時身穿一件非常迷人的禮服。

results.name: assimilate into American
results.english: to become part of a group, country, society, etc., or to make someone or something become part of a group, country, society, etc.
results.example1: The European Union should remain flexible enough to _____ more countries quickly.  歐盟應該保持足夠的靈活性, 以加快步伐吸收更多的國家為其成員。
results.example2: You shouldn't expect immigrants to _____ into an alien culture immediately.  你不應該指望移民能夠馬上融入一種外國文化中。

results.name: at all costs
results.english: no matter what dangers or difficulties are involved
results.example1: We realized we had to fight the lawsuit at any cost.

results.name: culminate in
results.english: If an event or series of events culminates in something, it ends with it, having developed until it reaches this point.
results.example1: My arguments with the boss got worse and worse, and finally culminated in my resignation. 我和老闆的爭吵日益惡化，直到最終我決定換工作。
results.example2: Their many years of research have finally culminated in a cure for the disease. 經過多年研究，他們終於開發出一種能治癒該病的藥物。

results.name: defiance
results.english: behaviour in which you refuse to obey someone or something
results.example1: The demonstration is a pointless act/gesture of defiance against the government.  透過示威來對抗政府是一種毫無意義的行為／姿態。
results.example2: In defiance of the ceasefire, rebel troops are again firing on the capital. 叛軍違反停火協定再次向首都開火。

results.name: dissipate
results.english: to (cause to) gradually disappear or waste
results.chinese: (使) 逐漸消失；(使) 逐漸浪費掉
results.example1: The heat gradually _____s into the atmosphere.  熱量逐漸消失在大氣中。
results.example2: His anger _____ed as the situation became clear.  隨著局勢的明朗, 他漸漸消了氣。

results.name: overwhelming
results.english: difficult to fight against
results.chinese: 難以抵擋的；無法抗拒的
results.example1: She felt an overwhelming urge/desire/need to tell someone about what had happened. 她感到有一種抑制不住的衝動／慾望／需要想告訴別人所發生的事情。

results.name: cast
results.english: to choose actors to play particular parts in a play, film, or show
results.chinese: 分配…扮演（某角色），為…選派演員
results.example1: He was often cast as the villain. 他經常演反面角色。
results.example2: In her latest movie she was cast against type (= played a different character than the one she usually played or might be expected to play). 在最近拍的電影中，她改變了戲路。

results.name: recession
results.english: a period when the economy of a country is not successful and conditions for business are bad
results.example1: The country is sliding into the depths of (a) _____.  這個國家一步步滑入經濟衰退的谷底。

results.name: session
results.english: a period of time or meeting arranged for a particular activity
results.chinese: （從事某項活動的）一段時間（或集會）；一場；一節
results.example1: The 21-year-old runner twisted his ankle in a training session last Friday. 這位21歲的跑者上週五在訓練時扭傷了腳踝。
results.example2: As the European heads of state gathered, the press were allowed in for a photo session. 歐洲國家首腦聚集起來時，新聞記者獲准進入拍照。

results.name: commerce
results.english: the activities involved in buying and selling things
results.example1: the world of commerce and industry  工商界

results.name: prolong
results.english: to make something last a longer time
results.example1: We were having such a good time that we decided to prolong our stay by another week. 我們過得非常愉快，決定再多待一個星期。
results.example2: She chewed each delicious mouthful as slowly as she could, prolonging the pleasure. 她細嚼慢嚥，盡情地享受每一口美食。

results.name: downturn
results.english: a reduction in the amount or success of something, such as a country's economic activity
results.example1: the continuing economic _____  經濟的持續衰退
results.example2: There is evidence of a _____ in the housing market.  房産市場出現了衰退的跡象。

results.name: entail
results.english: to make something necessary, or to involve something
results.example1: Such a large investment inevitably _____s some risk.  這樣的钜額投資必然會有一定的風險。

results.name: flourish
results.english: to grow or develop successfully
results.chinese: 茁壯成長；繁榮；蓬勃發展
