results.example1: My tomatoes are _____ing this summer. it must be the warm weather.  今年夏天我的番茄長勢很好——這一定是天氣暖和的原因。
results.example2: Watercolour painting began to _____ in Britain around 1750.  1750年左右, 水彩畫開始在英國興盛起來。

results.name: foremost
results.english: most important or best; leading
results.chinese: 最重要的；最佳的；領先的
results.example1: This is one of the country's _____ arts centres.  這是全國最重要的藝術中心之一。
results.example2: She's one of the _____ experts on child psychology.  她是兒童心理學領域最頂尖的專家之一。

results.name: forerunner
results.english: something or someone that acts as an early and less advanced model for what will appear in the future, or a warning or sign of what is to follow
results.example1: Germany's Green party was said to be the forerunner of environmental parties throughout Europe. 德國綠黨據說是全歐洲環保政黨的先驅。
results.example2: The drop in share prices in March was a forerunner of the financial crash that followed in June. 三月份股價的下跌是隨後六月份金融崩潰的一個預兆。

results.name: put sb/sth forward
results.english: to state an idea or opinion, or to suggest a plan or person, for other people to consider
results.chinese: 提出（想法或計劃）；推薦（某人）
results.example1: The proposals that you have put forward deserve serious consideration. 你提出的建議值得認真考慮。
results.example2: Many suggestions have been put forward, but a decision is unlikely until after next year's general election. 已經提出了許多建議，但要等到明年的大選過後才可能作出決定。

results.name: skyrocket
results.english: to rise extremely quickly or make extremely quick progress towards success
results.example1: Housing prices have skyrocketed in recent months. 近幾個月房價飛漲。

results.name: surge
results.english: a sudden and great increase
results.example1: An unexpected surge in electrical power caused the computer to crash. 突然出現的電壓遽增導致電腦當機。
results.example2: There has been a surge in house prices recently. 最近房價飛漲。

results.name: synergy
results.english: the combined power of a group of things when they are working together that is greater than the total power achieved by each working separately
results.example1: Team work at its best results in a synergy that can be very productive. 團隊精誠合作可以大大提高效率。

results.name: synthesis
results.english: the mixing of different ideas, influences, or things to make a whole that is different, or new
results.example1: He describes his latest record as a _____ of African and Latin rhythms.  他說他最新的唱片「融合了非洲和拉丁音樂」的旋律。

results.name: vicious
results.english: Vicious people or actions show an intention or wish to hurt someone or something very badly.
results.example1: a vicious thug 兇殘的暴徒
results.example2: The police said that this was one of the most vicious attacks they'd ever seen. 警方說這是他們所見過的最為殘暴的襲擊之一。

results.name: stationary
results.english: not moving, or not changing
results.example1: a stationary car/train 停著的汽車／火車
results.example2: The traffic got slower and slower until it was stationary. 車流移動得越來越慢，最後完全不動了。

results.name: the storm abated
results.english: to become less strong
results.example1: The storm/wind/rain has started to _____.  暴風雨/風/雨開始減弱了。
results.example2: The fighting in the area shows no sign of _____ing.  這個地區的戰事沒有任何緩和的跡象。

results.name: conspicuous
results.english: very noticeable or attracting attention, often in a way that is not wanted
results.example1: In China, her blonde hair was conspicuous. 在中國，她的金髮十分顯眼。
results.example2: He tried not to look conspicuous and moved slowly along the back of the room. 他儘量不使自己顯眼，沿著房間後部慢慢移動。

results.name: leisurely
results.english: used to describe an action that is done in a relaxed way, without hurrying
results.example1: We enjoyed a leisurely picnic lunch on the lawn. 中午我們在草地上悠閒地享用了一頓野餐。

results.name: a hint of menace
results.english: a dangerous quality that makes you think someone is going to do something bad
results.example1: He had a slight air of menace which made me uneasy.  他略帶威脅的神情使我感到不安。
results.example2: He spoke with a hint of menace. 他的語氣中透出一絲威脅。

results.name: perceptible
results.english: that can be seen, heard, or noticed
results.example1: There was a barely perceptible movement in his right arm. 他的右臂微微動了一下。
results.example2: The past year has seen a perceptible improvement in working standards. 去年，工作條件有了明顯改善。

results.name: dispatch
results.english: to send something, especially goods or a message, somewhere for a particular purpose
results.example1: Two loads of cloth were dispatched to the factory on 12 December. 12月12日兩車布料被發到工廠。

results.name: solitary
results.english: A solitary person or thing is the only person or thing in a place.
results.example1: On the hill, a solitary figure was busy chopping down trees. 山上，有個人正忙著砍樹。
results.example2: In the distance was a solitary building. 遠處是一棟孤零零的建築。

results.name: ailing economy
results.english: experiencing difficulty and problems
results.chinese: 境況不佳的, 處境困難的；不景氣的
results.example1: the country's _____ economy  該國不景氣的經濟
results.example2: Ted asked me if I could help him fix his _____ car.  特德的車壞了, 他問我是否可以幫他修理一下。

results.name: multilateral
results.english: involving more than two groups or countries
results.chinese: 多國（或多方）參加的，多國（或多方）間的
results.example1: Seven countries are taking part in the multilateral talks. 將有七個國家參加這次多邊會談。

results.name: privatization
results.english: the act of selling an industry, company or service that was owned and controlled by the government, so it becomes privately owned and controlled

results.name: rebound
results.english: to bounce back after hitting a hard surface
results.example1: If an action rebounds on you, it does not have the effect you hoped for but has an unpleasant effect on you instead. 産生事與願違的結果；適得其反
results.example2: His continual demands for sympathy rebounded on him because his friends finally stopped listening. 他沒完沒了地希望從別人那裡得到同情，結果卻適得其反，因為最終他的朋友們都不願再聽他訴苦。

results.name: runner-up
results.english: a person who comes second in a race or competition

results.name: sluggish
results.english: moving or operating more slowly than usual and with less energy or power
results.example1: A heavy lunch makes me sluggish in the afternoon. 豐盛的午餐使我一下午都懶得動彈。
results.example2: Something is wrong with the car - the engine feels sluggish. 這輛車出了問題——引擎運轉不太順暢。

results.name: volatile
results.english: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly or suddenly become violent or angry
results.chinese: 不穩定的；易變的；易怒的, 喜怒無常的
results.example1: Food and fuel prices are very _____ in a war situation.  戰爭時期食品和燃料的價格極易波動。
results.example2: The situation was made more _____ by the fact that people had been drinking a lot of alcohol.  人們一直在大喝烈酒, 這讓情況變得更加不穩定。

results.name: strap
results.english: a narrow piece of leather or other strong material used for fastening something or giving support
results.example1: Could you help me fasten this strap around my suitcase? 你能幫我用這條帶子把手提箱繫緊嗎？

results.name: not that I'm aware of
results.english: used when answering a question to mean that, judging from the information you have, the answer is no
results.chinese: 據我所知並非如此，據我所知沒有
results.example1: Is she especially unhappy at school? Not that I know of. 「她在學校特別不高興嗎？」「據我所知沒有。」

results.name: overcoat
results.english: a long thick coat worn in cold weather

results.name: stylish
results.english: of a high quality in appearance, design, or behaviour
results.example1: The film's direction is subtle and stylish. 這部電影導演手法精巧細緻、格調高雅。

results.name: apparel
results.english: clothes of a particular type when they are being sold in a shop
results.example1: sports _____ 運動服裝

results.name: glassware
results.english: drinking glasses or other objects made of glass
results.chinese: 玻璃杯；玻璃器皿；玻璃製品
results.example1: a display/collection of ornamental glassware 玻璃飾品展／一批玻璃飾物藏品

results.name: rural
results.english: in, of, or like the countryside
results.chinese: 鄉村的，農村的；似鄉村的
results.example1: The area is still very rural and undeveloped. 這個地區仍是一片鄉村景象，沒有被開發。

results.name: readership
results.english: the group of people who regularly read a particular newspaper, magazine, etc.
results.example1: The magazine has a readership of over 250,000. 這本雜誌的讀者超過了25萬人。
results.example2: It's a newspaper with a large right-wing readership. 這份報紙擁有大批右翼讀者。

results.name: purport to
results.english: to pretend to be or to do something, especially in a way that is not easy to believe
results.example1: They purport to represent the wishes of the majority of parents at the school.  他們聲稱自己代表了該校大多數學生家長的期望。
results.example2: The study purports to show an increase in the incidence of the disease. 該研究據稱顯示出這種疾病的發病率在上升。

results.name: relay
results.english: to repeat something you have heard, or to broadcast a signal, message, or programme on television or radio
results.example1: I was told the news first and then I relayed it to the others. 我是第一個被告知這消息的人，接著我又轉告了其他人。
results.example2: TV pictures of the war were relayed around the world by satellite. 有關戰爭的電視新聞圖片透過衛星在全世界進行了轉播。

results.name: orphan
results.english: a child whose parents are dead
results.example1: The civil war is making orphans of many children. 內戰正使許多孩子成為孤兒。

results.name: by no means
results.english: not at all
results.example1: It is by no means certain that we'll finish the project by June. 我們能否在六月份前完成這項工程還很難確定。
results.example2: This isn't the last we'll hear of it by any means. 這絕對不會是我們最後一次聽到此事。

results.name: textile
results.english: a cloth made by hand or machine
results.example1: the textile industry 紡織業

results.name: thrifty
results.english: showing a careful use of money, especially by avoiding waste
results.example1: They have plenty of money now,  but they still tend to be _____.  他們現在很有錢, 但仍很節儉。

results.name: awning
results.english: a cloth or plastic cover fastened to a building or structure and supported by a frame that is used to protect someone or something from the sun or rain
results.chinese: (門窗等前面的) 雨篷, 遮篷
results.example1: The gaily striped _____s of the market stalls made an attractive scene.  市場貨攤上那些色彩鮮艷的條紋布遮陰篷構成了一個迷人的風景。

results.name: utensil
results.english: a tool with a particular use, especially in a kitchen or house
results.chinese: （尤指廚房或家用的）器具，用具
results.example1: In the drawer was a selection of kitchen utensils - spoons, spatulas, knives, and whisks. 抽屜裡有一套廚房用具——勺、鏟子、刀和攪蛋器。

results.name: garment
results.english: a piece of clothing

results.name: wind or wind up
results.english: If you wind (up) a clock or watch, you cause it to work by turning a key, handle, or other device.

results.name: converse
results.english: opposite
results.example1: a converse effect/opinion/argument 相反的效果／觀點／論點

results.name: dilute
results.english: to make a liquid weaker by mixing in something else
results.example1: Dilute the juice (with water) before you drink it. 果汁先（用水）稀釋一下再喝。

results.name: generic
results.english: shared by, typical of, or relating to a whole group of similar things, rather than to any particular thing
results.example1: The new range of engines all had a generic problem with their fan blades. 這一新系列的引擎有一個通病，就是風機葉片有問題。

results.name: embellish
results.english: to make something more beautiful or interesting by adding something to it
results.chinese: 裝飾，修飾；給…錦上添花，渲染
results.example1: The ceiling was _____ed with flowers and leaves.  天花板上裝飾著花和葉。
results.example2: He couldn't resist _____ing the story of his accident a little.  在描述他出的那次意外時, 他忍不住添油加醋地渲染了一番

results.name: embroider
results.english: to decorate cloth or clothing with patterns or pictures consisting of stitches that are sewn directly onto the material
results.example1: I am _____ing this picture for my mother. 我正在爲媽媽繡這幅畫。

results.name: exhilarating moments
results.english: making you feel very excited and happy
results.chinese: 令人極度興奮的；使人興高采烈的
results.example1: an _____ walk in the mountains 令人興奮的山中漫步

results.name: exorbitant
results.english: Exorbitant prices, demands, etc. are much too large.
results.chinese: (價格、要求) 過分的, 過高的, 離譜的
results.example1: The bill for dinner was _____. 晚餐的價錢太高了。

results.name: exquisite
results.english: very beautiful and delicate
results.example1: an _____ piece of china 一件精緻的瓷器
results.example2: Look at this _____ painting.看看這幅精美的油畫。

results.name: extravagance
results.english: something expensive that you buy even though you do not need it
results.example1: Perfume is my greatest extravagance. 香水是我最大的奢侈品。

results.name: lavish
results.english: large in quantity and expensive or impressive
results.example1: The evening was a _____ affair with glorious food and an endless supply of champagne.  晚會很豪華, 食物精美可口, 香檳源源不斷。
results.example2: The _____ production makes this musical truly memorable.  這部音樂劇的豪華製作陣容給人留下了深刻印象。

results.name: intermittent
results.english: not happening regularly or continuously; stopping and starting repeatedly or with periods in between
results.example1: intermittent rain 陣雨
results.example2: an intermittent noise 時斷時續的噪音

results.name: delighted
results.english: very pleased
results.chinese: 令人高興的，使人愉快的，給人快樂的
results.example1: a delighted audience 興高采烈的觀眾
results.example2: [+ that] I'm absolutely delighted that you can come. 你能來，我特別高興。

results.name: durable
results.english: able to last a long time without becoming damaged
results.example1: The machines have to be made of durable materials. 這種機器必須使用耐用的材料來製造。
results.example2: The resolution calls for a durable peace settlement. 該決議呼籲得出一個持久的和平解決方案。

results.name: remnant
results.english: a small piece or amount of something that is left from a larger original piece or amount
results.example1: the _____s of last night's meal 昨晚的剩飯
results.example2: _____s of the city's former glory 這座城市輝煌歷史的遺跡

results.name: suspend
results.english: to stop something from being active, either temporarily or permanently
results.example1: The ferry service has been suspended for the day because of bad weather. 因為天氣惡劣，渡船已經停開。
results.example2: The country's president has suspended the constitution and assumed total power. 總統廢除憲法，獨攬大權。

results.name: unfavourable
results.english: not giving you an advantage or a good chance of success
results.chinese: 不利的；反對的；相反的；有害的；令人不快的
results.example1: Current conditions are very _____ for new businesses. 目前的條件對新興企業非常不利。
results.example2: We have to be prepared for an _____ outcome. 我們要為結果不利做好準備。

results.name: a hectic schedule
results.english: full of activity, or very busy and fast
results.example1: a _____ schedule  滿滿的行程表
results.example2: The area has become a haven for people tired of the _____ pace of city life.  這一地區成了那些厭倦城市繁忙生活的人們的安樂窩。

results.name: intent
results.english: giving all your attention to something
results.chinese: 專心致志的, 專注的
results.example1: an _____ stare 目不轉睛的注視
results.example2: She had an _____ look on her face.她的面部表情非常專注。

results.name: ornamental
results.english: beautiful rather than useful
results.chinese: 裝飾性的，裝飾用的；裝飾的
results.example1: a bowl of ornamental china fruit 一盤裝飾性瓷製果
results.example2: The handles on each side of the box are purely ornamental (= they are for decoration only). 盒子兩邊的把手純粹是裝飾性的。

results.name: specimen
results.english: something shown or examined as an example; a typical example
results.example1: He has a collection of rare insect specimens. 他收集了很多稀有昆蟲的標本。
results.example2: Museums will pay large amounts of money for good dinosaur fossil specimens. 博物館願意出大價錢購買完好的恐龍化石標本。

results.name: apparatus
results.english: a set of equipment or tools or a machine that is used for a particular purpose
results.example1: The divers checked their breathing _____. 潛水員檢查了一下呼吸器。

results.name: concession
results.english: something that is allowed or given up, often in order to end a disagreement, or the act of allowing or giving this
results.chinese: （常指為結束爭端而作出的）認可，讓步，妥協
results.example1: Both sides involved in the conflict made some concessions in yesterday's talks. 在昨天的談判中，衝突雙方都作出了讓步。
results.example2: He stated firmly that no concessions will be made to the terrorists. 他強硬地宣稱不會對恐怖分子作出任何讓步。

results.name: concurrent
results.english: happening or existing at the same time
results.chinese: 並發的, 同時發生的；並存的
results.example1: The judge imposed _____ sentences totalling 14 years for the attacks on the girls.  法官對其侵害少女的多宗罪行數罪並罰, 判處其14年有期徒刑。

results.name: distill
results.english: to make a liquid stronger or purer by heating it until it changes to a gas and then cooling it so that it changes back into a liquid
results.example1: Some strong alcoholic drinks such as whisky are made by _____ing.  威士卡等烈酒是用蒸餾法製成的。

results.name: dysfunction
results.english: a problem or fault in a part of the body or a machine
results.example1: There appears to be a dysfunction in the patient's respiratory system. 病患的呼吸系統似乎出現功能失調。

results.name: implant
results.english: to put an organ, group of cells, or device into the body in a medical operation
results.example1: The owner's name and address is stored on a microchip and implanted in the dog's body. 主人的姓名和地址都儲存在晶片中，然後植入犬隻體內。

results.name: patronize
results.english: to be a regular customer of a shop or restaurant,  etc.
results.chinese: 經常光顧, 經常惠顧(商店、餐館等)
results.example1: The restaurant was _____ed by many artists and writers during the 1920s.  在1920年代有許多藝術家和作家經常光顧這家餐館。

results.name: staple
results.english: a main product or part of something
results.chinese: 主要產品；某物的主要部分
results.example1: Shortages mean that even staples (= basic foods) like bread are difficult to find. 物資短缺意味著連麵包之類的主食都難覓蹤影。
results.example2: Romantic fiction and reference books are a staple of many public libraries. 言情小說和工具書是很多公共圖書館的主要藏書。

results.name: steer
results.english: to control the direction of a vehicle
results.chinese: 駕駛（交通工具）；掌方向盤
results.example1: She carefully steered the car around the potholes. 她小心開車繞過那些坑洞。
results.example2: This car is very easy to steer. 這輛車很容易開。

results.name: sturdy
results.english: physically strong and solid or thick, and therefore unlikely to break or be hurt
results.example1: sturdy walking boots 結實的徒步靴
results.example2: a sturdy table 結實的桌子

results.name: gear A to B
results.english: to design or organize something so that it is suitable for a particular purpose, situation, or group of people
results.example1: Most public places are simply not _____ed ___ the needs of people with disabilities.  大多數公共場所根本不能適應殘疾人士的需要。
results.example2: The workshops are _____ towards helping people to become more employable.  研習班旨在幫助學員提高就業能力。

results.name: bewildering
results.english: confusing and difficult to understand
results.chinese: 令人困惑的；令人不知所措的
results.example1: He gave me directions to his house,  but I found them utterly _____.  他告訴我到他家的路, 但我發現他指的路讓人完全摸不著頭緒。

results.name: cutting-edge
results.english: very modern and with all the newest features
results.example1: _____-_____ design/technology 前衛的設計／尖端的技術

results.name: obsolete
results.english: not in use any more, having been replaced by something newer and better or more fashionable
results.chinese: 廢棄的；過時的；淘汰的；老化的
results.example1: Gas lamps became _____ when electric lighting was invented.  電燈發明以後煤氣燈就被淘汰了。

results.name: streamline
results.english: to improve the effectiveness of an organization such as a business or government, often by making the way activities are performed simpler
results.chinese: (常透過簡化辦事程式) 使 (機構) 效率更高；簡化
results.example1: The cost-cutting measures include _____ing administrative procedures in the company.  縮減開支的措施包括簡化公司的行政管理程式。
results.example2: Leading organizations use software to _____ their workflow.  頂尖的機構使用軟體簡化工作流程。

results.name: craft
results.english: skill and experience, especially in relation to making objects; a job or activity that needs skill and experience, or something produced using skill and experience
results.chinese: （尤指製作東西的）工藝，手藝；技術
results.example1: the craft of furniture making/sewing/glassblowing 傢俱製作／縫紉／玻璃吹製工藝
results.example2: political/literary craft 政治手腕／文學手法

results.name: firewood
results.english: wood used as fuel for a fire
results.example1: We can use those old shelves as firewood. 我們可以用這些舊擱板當木柴。

results.name: assembly
results.english: a group of people, especially one that meets regularly for a particular purpose, such as government, or, more generally, the process of coming together, or the state of being together
results.chinese: （尤指為特定目的而經常）聚集在一起的人，（所有）與會者；集合，聚集
results.example1: the United Nations General Assembly 聯合國大會
results.example2: She has been tipped as a future member of the Welsh Assembly. 大家預測她將會成為威爾士議會議員。

results.name: pack sth away
results.english: to put something into a bag or container, or to put something in the place where it is usually kept
results.example1: Come on, children, it's time to pack away your toys. 好了，孩子們，該把你們的玩具收拾起來了。

results.name: squeak
results.english: to make a short, very high cry or sound
results.chinese: 發出短促的尖叫；吱吱叫；嘎吱作響
results.example1: The mice in the cupboard squeaked. 老鼠在碗櫥裡吱吱地叫。
results.example2: The door squeaked as it swung back and forth on its rusty hinges. 門的鉸鏈生銹了，轉動起來嘎吱嘎吱作響。

results.name: glean
results.english: to collect information in small amounts and often with difficulty
results.example1: From what I was able to glean, the news isn't good. 從我辛苦收集到的資訊來看，情況不妙。
results.example2: They're leaving on Tuesday - I managed to glean that much (from them). 他們將在星期二離開——我辛辛苦苦（從他們那裡）打探到的就只有這些。

results.name: wearable
results.english: Clothes that are wearable are easy to wear because they are comfortable, acceptable in most social situations, and look attractive in combination with other clothes.
results.chinese: （服飾）舒適的，實用的，適宜穿戴的
results.example1: Unlike a lot of women's fashion magazines, it features clothes that are both affordable and wearable. 與許多女性時尚雜誌不一樣，它介紹的衣服既不太貴又適宜穿。

results.name: workbench
results.english: a strong table for working on, especially one on which objects such as pieces of wood or metal can be firmly held so that tools can be used on them
results.chinese: （尤指可固定木頭、金屬等的）工作檯

results.name: combustible
results.english: able to burn easily
results.example1: Wood and coal are both combustible substances. 木頭和煤炭都是易燃物質。

results.name: representation
results.english: a person or organization that speaks, acts, or is present officially for someone else
results.chinese: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人
results.example1: Can he afford legal representation? 他請得起律師嗎？

results.name: pretzel
results.english: a hard salty biscuit that has been baked especially in stick or knot shapes

results.name: Hitch-hiker
results.chinese: 在路邊舉起大姆指，招手要搭便車的人

results.name: contest
results.english: a competition to do better than other people, usually in which prizes are given
results.example1: a dance/sports contest  舞蹈／體育比賽
results.example2: She's won a lot of beauty contests. 她多次在選美大賽中獲勝。

results.name: snort
results.english: to make an explosive sound by forcing air quickly up or down the nose
results.chinese: 噴鼻息，從鼻中噴氣作聲(像豬叫)
results.example1: He did an impression of a horse snorting. 他模仿了馬噴鼻息的聲音。
results.example2: Camille snorts when she laughs. 卡米爾大笑的時候鼻腔裡會發出怪聲。

results.name: I could live without it
results.chinese: 一個比較有禮貌的方式去表達你不喜歡。例如人家問你他在旁邊抽煙可以吧，你就說這句

results.name: endearing
results.english: making someone like you
results.chinese: 使人喜愛的；引人愛慕的
results.example1: She laughs at herself a lot, which is always endearing. 她經常自嘲，大家都很欣賞她這一點。

results.name: crude
results.english: simple and not skilfully done or made
results.chinese: 粗糙的；簡陋的；粗製的；未加修飾的
results.example1: a crude device/weapon  簡陋的裝置／粗製的武器

results.name: grease
results.english: animal or vegetable fat that is soft after melting, or more generally, any thick oil-like substance
results.example1: The dinner plates were thick with grease. 餐盤上厚厚一層油。
results.example2: You'll have to put some grease on those ball bearings. 你要往滾珠軸承上塗些油。

results.name: outlast
results.english: to live or exist, or to stay energetic and determined, longer than another person or thing
results.chinese: 比…活得長；比…持續時間長
results.example1: The empress outlasted all her children. 女皇比她的子女們都活得長。
results.example2: The Orioles outlasted the Yankees, finally winning 10 to 9. 黃鸝隊堅持到底，最終以10比9戰勝了揚基隊。

results.name: settle on sth
results.english: to agree on a decision
results.example1: Have you settled on a name for the baby? 你們決定給寶寶取甚麽名字了嗎？

results.name: synthetic
results.english: Synthetic products are made from artificial substances, often copying a natural product.
results.example1: synthetic fibres 人造纖維

results.name: wear and tear
results.english: the damage that happens to an object in ordinary use during a period
results.example1: Seat covers on buses take a lot of wear and tear. 火車上的座套磨損比較嚴重。

results.name: come apart
results.english: to separate into several pieces
results.example1: I picked up the book and it came apart in my hands. 我撿起書，書就散開了。
results.example2: My boots are coming apart at the seams. 我的靴子開口了。

results.name: halt
results.english: to (cause to) stop moving or doing something or happening
results.example1: Halt! called the guard. You can't go any further without a permit. 「站住！」警衛喊道，「沒有通行證不能入內。」
results.example2: Production has halted at all of the company's factories because of the pay dispute. 由於工資糾紛，這家公司所有工廠都停産了。

results.name: weld
results.english: to join two pieces of metal together permanently by melting the parts that touch
results.example1: Iron spikes have been _____ed (on) to the railings around the embassy.  大使館周圍的護欄上都焊上了鐵刺尖頭。

results.name: arable
results.english: Arable farming land is used for, or is suitable for, growing crops.
results.chinese: 適於耕種的，可耕的；耕作的
results.example1: arable farming/farmers/farms/land 耕作農業／從事耕作農業的人／適宜墾植的農場／可耕地

results.name: broadly
results.english: in a general way, without considering specific examples or all the details
results.example1: Broadly speaking, don't you think women make better drivers than men? 總的來説，你不覺得女性開車比男性開得好嗎？
results.example2: Many of the findings in this study are broadly similar to those of Johnes (1990). 這項研究的許多發現與喬納斯（1990）的結果大體相似。

results.name: excavation
results.english: the act of removing earth that is covering very old objects buried in the ground in order to discover things about the past
results.example1: Three skulls and one full skeleton were discovered during the excavation of an Egyptian tomb.
results.example2: She has taken part in several excavations of Roman settlements across Europe.

results.name: fabricate
results.english: to invent or produce something false in order to deceive someone
results.example1: He was late, so he fabricated an excuse to avoid trouble. 他遲到了，就編了個理由以免惹上麻煩。
results.example2: He claims that the police fabricated evidence against him. 他聲稱警方偽造了對他不利的證據。

results.name: liquidity
results.english: the fact of being available in the form of money, rather than investments or property, or of being able to be changed into money easily
results.example1: The group has excellent liquidity.
results.example2: This liquidity problem is very serious for small and medium-sized business.

results.name: nimble
results.english: quick and exact either in movement or thoughts
results.chinese: （行動）靈活的，敏捷的；（頭腦）機敏的，敏銳的
results.example1: nimble fingers/feet 靈巧的手指／雙腳
results.example2: His nimble mind calculated the answer before I could key the numbers into my computer. 我還沒來得及把數字輸入電腦，他那敏捷的頭腦已經算出答案。

results.name: obfuscate
results.english: to make something less clear and harder to understand, especially intentionally
results.chinese: （尤指故意）使模糊，使糊塗，使困惑
results.example1: She was criticized for using arguments that obfuscated the main issue. 她被批評故意使用混淆主要問題的論點。

results.name: pertinent
results.english: relating directly to the subject being considered
results.chinese: 有關的, 直接相關的
results.example1: a _____ question/remark 切中要害的問題/評論
results.example2: Chapter One is _____ to the post-war period.第一章講述的是戰後時期。

results.name: perturbed
results.english: worried
results.chinese: 擔心的；煩惱的；心緒不寧的
results.example1: He didn't seem unduly/overly _____ed by the news.  他似乎並未因這則消息而過分擔憂。

results.name: pragmatic
results.english: solving problems in a sensible way that suits the conditions that really exist now, rather than obeying fixed theories, ideas, or rules
results.example1: In business,  the _____ approach to problems is often more successful than an idealistic one.  在商界裡, 用實際的方法來解決問題往往比空想更有成效。

results.name: prevail
results.english: to be common among a group of people or area at a particular time
results.example1: This attitude still _____s among the middle classes.  這種觀點在中產階級裡仍然很普遍。

results.name: recede
results.english: to move further away into the distance, or to become less clear or less bright
results.example1: As the boat picked up speed,  the coastline _____ed into the distance until finally it became invisible.  船越開越快, 海岸線漸漸遠去, 直至最後從視線中消失。
results.example2: The painful memories gradually _____ed in her mind.  痛苦的記憶逐漸在她腦海中變得淡漠了。

results.name: unfailing
results.english: If a positive quality of someone's character is unfailing, it shows itself at all times.
results.chinese: （個人的優良品質）經久不衰的，一貫的
results.example1: unfailing enthusiasm 一貫的熱情

results.name: unmet
results.english: not satisfied, or achieved
results.example1: These children have many unmet needs. 這些孩子有許多未滿足的要求。
results.example2: The demand for affordable housing is largely unmet. 提供負擔得起的住房這一要求在很大程度上沒有滿足。

results.name: rinse
results.english: to use water to clean the soap or dirt from something
results.example1: First apply shampoo to hair and then rinse thoroughly. 先把洗髮劑塗抹在頭髮上，然後沖洗乾淨。
results.example2: There was no soap, so I just rinsed my hands with water. 沒有肥皂了，所以我只是用水沖了沖手。

results.name: loaf
results.english: bread that is shaped and baked in a single piece and can be sliced for eating
results.example1: two loaves of white bread 兩條白麵包

results.name: go out on a limb
results.english: having an opinion that is different from most people's and is unpopular
results.chinese: （意見）未得到衆人贊同的，孤立的
results.example1: She's going out on a limb in criticizing her own party leadership. 她對自己所在黨的領導提出的批評並沒有得到大多數人的贊同。

results.name: New Year's resolution
results.english: a promise that you make to yourself to start doing something good or stop doing something bad on the first day of the year
results.example1: Have you made any New Year's resolutions? Yes, I'm going to eat more healthily and give up smoking. 「你給自己定下甚麼新年決心了嗎？」「是的，我要令自己飲食更加健康，並且戒煙。

results.name: truckload
results.english: the amount of something that can be carried by a truck
results.chinese: 一貨車貨物；一貨車運量
results.example1: Truckloads of rice have been brought in to the areas affected by drought. 一車車的大米運到了受乾旱影響的地區。
results.example2: Donations of food and medicine have been arriving by the truckload all week. 整整一週以來，捐贈的食品和藥物源源不斷地由貨車運達。

results.name: plummet
results.english: to fall very quickly and suddenly
results.example1: House prices have plummeted in recent months. 房價近幾個月來暴跌。
results.example2: Several large rocks were sent plummeting down the mountain. 好幾塊巨石被從山上推下。

results.name: sprout
results.english: to produce leaves, hair, or other new developing parts, or (of leaves, hair, and other developing parts) to begin to grow
results.chinese: 發(芽), 抽(芽)；長出(毛髮等)；(葉、毛髮等) 生長
results.example1: It takes about three days for the seeds to _____.  這些種子大概要三天時間才會發芽。
results.example2: Your hair is sticking up. it looks like you're _____ing horns!  你的頭髮豎起來了——看起來跟長了角一樣！

results.name: better yet
results.english: used to introduce an idea that is even better than the one previously mentioned.
results.example1: You've been working too much. You should take one or two days off, or better yet, go on vacation to some nice place.

results.name: botch
results.english: to spoil something by doing it badly
results.example1: We _____ed (up) our first attempt at wallpapering the bathroom.  我們第一次試著給浴室貼壁紙, 結果一團糟。

results.name: have a boob job
results.english: to have an operation to change the shape of the breasts, usually to make them larger
results.chinese: 做乳房手術；（通常指）做隆胸手術
results.example1: So do you think she's had a boob job? 那麽你覺得她做過隆乳手術嗎？

results.name: dairy
results.english: used to refer to cows that are used for producing milk, rather than meat, or to foods that are made from milk, such as cream, butter, and cheese
results.chinese: 奶牛的；奶製品的，乳品的
results.example1: dairy cattle 奶牛
results.example2: dairy farmers 乳品場工人

results.name: I meant to ask you
results.english: it is often used where the speaker had intended (some time in the past) asking a question, then forgot about it, and has now just remembered. Because of this usage, it is sometimes used as a way of introducing a question unrelated to the recent topic of conversation, by suggesting that it is something the speaker has only just remembered.

results.name: I've been meaning to ask you
results.english: Sometimes you have a question that you want to ask someone, but you don't ask it for a long time. That may be because you're nervous, or because you keep forgetting to ask it. The phrase I've been meaning to ask you... introduces a question such as this.
results.chinese: 對了，我一直想問你個問題
results.example1: “I've been meaning to ask you: do you know what's up with Matt?”

results.name: instill
results.english: to put a feeling, idea, or principle gradually into someone's mind, so that it has a strong influence on the way that person thinks or behaves
results.example1: It is part of a teacher's job to _____ confidence in/into his or her students.  教師的部分職責是逐漸培養學生的信心。

results.name: loosely
results.english: not exactly
results.example1: The film is loosely based on the novel by Kundera. 這齣電影是根據昆德拉的小說的大致內容改編而成的。
results.example2: This phrase can be loosely translated as Go away! 這個片語可以大概翻譯爲「走開」。

results.name: leather-wearing
results.example1: you're such a nice guy meanss I'm gonna be dating leather-wearing alcoholics and complaining about them to you

results.name: to cushion the blow
results.english: to make a bad situation less serious
results.chinese: 緩解打擊；緩和不良狀況
results.example1: He's lost his job, but the redundancy money will cushion the blow. 他丟了工作，不過遣散費會減輕對他的打擊。

results.name: wrinkly
results.english: covered in wrinkles

results.name: pimple
results.english: a small raised spot on the skin that is temporary
results.chinese: 面皰, 小膿包, 粉刺

results.name: benign
results.english: A benigntumour is not likely to cause death.
results.example1: a benign tumour 良性腫瘤

results.name: lop off
results.english: to cut something off in one quick movement
results.example1: I'll need to lop off the lower branches of the tree. 我要砍掉這棵樹上低矮的枝杈。

results.name: run-of-the-mill
results.english: ordinary and not special or exciting in any way
results.chinese: 普普通通的；平淡無奇的；乏味的
results.example1: He gave a fairly run-of-the-mill speech. 他的演講很乏味。

results.name: at short notice
results.english: only a short time before something happens
results.chinese: 在短時間內；一經通知立即
results.example1: I can't cancel my plans at such short notice. 我無法在這麼短的時間內取消我的安排。

results.name: be stumped
results.english: to be unable to answer a question or solve a problem because it is too difficult
results.example1: I'm completely stumped - how did she manage to escape?  我百思不得其解——她是如何逃脫的？
results.example2: Scientists are stumped by this mystery virus.  這種神秘的病毒把科學家難倒了。

results.name: darn
results.english: used instead of damn to express anger
results.chinese: （用於替代 damn）可惡，可恨，討厭
results.example1: Darn it! There goes my bus! 討厭！我要坐的公車剛剛開走！

results.name: tender
results.english: gentle, loving, or kind
results.chinese: 溫柔的；溫情的；關懷的；慈愛的
results.example1: a tender look/smile 溫柔的眼神／微笑
results.example2: What you need is some tender loving care. 你需要的是體貼入微的關懷。

results.name: be tensed up
results.english: very nervous and worried and unable to relax because of something that is going to happen
results.example1: You seem all tensed up. Are you still waiting for that call? 你好像很緊張。你還在等那個電話嗎？

results.name: Over my dead body
results.english: If you say something will happen over your dead body, you mean that you will do everything you can to prevent it.
results.chinese: 只要我還有一口氣就不能那樣做；除非我死了
results.example1: Joe says he's going to buy a motorbike. Over my dead body! 「祖說他想買輛機車。 」「只要我還有一口氣就不准他買！」

results.name: cuddle
results.english: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a loving way, or (of two people) to hold each other close to show love or for comfort
results.example1: She cuddled the baby and eventually it stopped crying. 她摟著小孩，漸漸地孩子不哭了。
results.example2: They sat in the back row of the cinema kissing and cuddling. 他們坐在電影院後排，接吻摟抱。

results.name: caress
results.english: to touch or kiss someone in a gentle and loving way
results.example1: Gently he caressed her cheek. 他輕撫她的臉頰。

results.name: tremble
results.english: to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional
results.chinese: （通常因寒冷、害怕或情緒激動）顫抖，發抖
results.example1: When he came out of the water, he was trembling with cold. 他從水裡出來時，冷得直打哆嗦。
results.example2: Her bottom lip trembled, and tears welled up in her eyes. 她的下嘴唇顫抖，淚水也湧上眼眶。

results.name: root for
results.english: to support

results.name: cumulative
results.english: increasing by one addition after another
results.example1: The cumulative effect of using so many chemicals on the land could be disastrous  使用大量化學物質經年累月會對土地造成災難性的後果。

results.name: patio
results.english: an area outside a house with a solid floor but no roof, used in good weather for relaxing, eating, etc.
results.example1: In the summer we have breakfast out on the patio. 夏天我們在外面露臺上吃早餐。

results.name: make a pass at sb
results.example1: Paulo _____ed ___ _____ ___ me. Paul對我調情

results.name: unleash
results.english: to suddenly release a violent force that cannot be controlled
results.example1: At worst, nuclear war could be unleashed. 最壞的情況是，可能會爆發核戰爭。
results.example2: Rachel's arrival on the scene had unleashed passions in him that he could scarcely control. 瑞秋的到來激起了他難以抑制的熱情。

results.name: distraught
results.english: extremely worried,  nervous,  or upset
results.chinese: 極其不安的, 非常焦慮的
results.example1: The missing child's distraught parents made an emotional appeal for information on TV.  失蹤兒童的父母極爲焦慮, 在電視上懇請大家提供相關消息。

results.name: usher sth in
results.english: to be at the start of a new period, especially when important changes or new things happen, or to cause important changes to start happening
results.chinese: 開創（尤指重大的變化或新事物）；開始；開啓
results.example1: These changes could usher in a period of dramatic economic growth. 這些改變有可能開啟一個經濟急劇成長的時期。
results.example2: His inventions helped usher in the era of skyscrapers. 他的發明推動開啟了一個摩天大樓的時代。

results.name: swear off sth
results.english: to make a decision to stop doing, using, or being involved with something harmful, such as drugs or alcohol, or something that is not good or helpful
results.chinese: 發誓不做，保證放棄，下決心戒除
results.example1: After years of addiction, he swore off drugs completely. 上癮幾年後，他發誓徹底戒毒。

results.name: squat
results.english: short and wide, usually in a way that is not attractive
results.chinese: 低矮的；矮墩墩的，矮胖的
results.example1: a row of ugly, squat houses 一排低矮難看的房子
results.example2: a heavily built, squat man 矮胖的男人

results.name: exterior
results.english: on or from the outside
results.example1: In some of the villages the exterior walls of the houses are painted pink. 在一些村子裡，房屋外牆被漆成粉紅色。
results.example2: Exterior to the main house there is a small building that could be used as an office or studio. 房屋的主要單位外有一個小屋，可以用作辦公室或工作間。

results.name: he is gracious
results.english: behaving in a pleasant, polite, calm way
results.chinese: 慈祥的, 和藹的；有禮貌的
results.example1: He was _____ enough to thank me. 他很有禮貌地向我道謝。
results.example2: The losing team was _____ in defeat. 失利的球隊豁達地面對失敗。

results.name: breakage
results.english: something that has been broken
results.example1: Any _____s must be paid for. 任何損壞必須賠償。

results.name: cut back
results.english: to spend less, do less, or use less of something
results.example1: The government has announced plans to cut back on defence spending by 10 percent next year. 政府宣佈了明年國防開支縮減10%的計劃。
results.example2: If exercise is causing you pain, you should cut back. 如果運動讓你覺得疼，就應該減量。

results.name: candid
results.english: honest and telling the truth, especially about something difficult or painful
results.chinese: （尤指對棘手或令人痛苦之事）率直的，坦誠的，直言不諱的
results.example1: The two presidents have had candid talks about the current crisis. 兩位總統就當前的危機進行了坦率的交談。
results.example2: To be candid with you, I think you're making a dreadful mistake. 跟你說實話，我覺得你在犯一個可怕的錯誤。

results.name: that being said
results.chinese: 即使如此，即便這樣，類似However，Nevertheless，But這些轉折連接詞
results.example1: The Internet has made our lives more convenient. _____ _____ _____, it has also caused many problems in modern days. 網路讓我們的生活方便許多。儘管如此，它也帶來了許多的問題。

results.name: stray
results.english: Stray things have moved apart from similar things and are not in their expected or intended place.
results.example1: There are still a few _____ spots of paint on the window pane. 窗戶玻璃上還有零星的幾個油漆點。
results.example2: Several journalists have been killed or injured by _____ bullets while reporting on the civil war. 有幾位記者在報導內戰時因被流彈打中而喪命或負傷。

results.name: depot
results.english: a building where supplies or vehicles, especially buses, are kept
results.example1: an arms/weapons _____ 武器庫
results.example2: a fuel/storage _____ 油/倉庫

results.name: a stain
results.english: a dirty mark on something that is difficult to remove
results.example1: a blood/grass stain  血污／草漬
results.example2: You can remove a red wine stain from a carpet by sprinkling salt over it.  地毯上紅酒的汙漬可以撒鹽來清除。

results.name: wear sth out
results.english: to use something so much that it is damaged and cannot be used any more, or to become damaged in this way
results.example1: Moving parts in engines wear out much more quickly than stationary parts. 引擎的運動部件比固定部件磨損得要快得多。

results.name: casualty
results.english: a person injured or killed in a serious accident or war
results.chinese: （嚴重事故或戰爭中的）傷亡人員
results.example1: The train was derailed but there were no casualties, police said. 警方稱，火車出軌了，但沒有人員傷亡。
results.example2: The rebels suffered heavy casualties. 叛亂分子傷亡慘重。

results.name: aggression
results.english: spoken or physical behaviour that is threatening or involves harm to someone or something
results.example1: Some types of dog are bred for aggression. 某些品種的狗是養來起攻擊作用的。
results.example2: an act of aggression 攻擊行為

results.name: censure
results.english: strong criticism or disapproval
results.chinese: 指責, 斥責, 譴責
results.example1: His dishonest behaviour came under severe censure.  他的不誠實行為受到了嚴厲指責。

results.name: compelling
results.english: If a reason, argument, etc. is compelling, it makes you believe it or accept it because it is so strong.
results.chinese: （理由、論證等）令人信服的，很有說服力的
results.example1: compelling evidence  強而有力的證據
results.example2: It's a fairly compelling argument for going.  去的理由很有說服力。

results.name: factual
results.english: using or consisting of facts
results.example1: She gave a clear, factual account of the attack to the police. 她如實地清晰陳述了遇襲經過。

results.name: fleeting
results.english: short or quick
results.example1: a fleeting glimpse  迅速的一瞥
results.example2: This is just a fleeting visit.  這只是一次短暫的訪問。

results.name: sparse
results.english: small in numbers or amount,  often spread over a large area
results.chinese: 稀少的；稀疏的, 零落的
results.example1: _____ vegetation/woodland 稀疏的植被／林地
results.example2: a _____ beard 稀稀疏疏的鬍子

results.name: unwavering
results.english: never changing or becoming weaker
results.chinese: 從不動搖的；從不變弱的
results.example1: Her belief in the project has been unwavering.  她對這一專案的信心從未動搖。

results.name: vibrant
results.english: energetic, exciting, and full of enthusiasm
results.chinese: 活躍的；精力充沛的；熱情洋溢的
results.example1: a vibrant personality  活潑的個性
results.example2: The hope is that this area will develop into a vibrant commercial centre.  希望這個地區會發展成為一個活躍的商業中心。

results.name: blemish
results.english: a fault in a person's character
results.example1: Is any politician's record without blemish on this issue?  在這個問題上，有哪個政客沒有汙點記錄？

results.name: rebate
results.english: an amount of money that is returned to you, especially by the government, for example when you have paid too much tax
results.chinese: (尤指政府返還的) 部分退款
results.example1: a tax _____ 退還部分稅款

results.name: sth slip sb's mind/memory
results.english: to be forgotten
results.example1: I forgot I'd arranged to meet Richard last night - it completely slipped my mind. 我忘記安排了昨晚要與理查會面——我完全給忘了。

results.name: soak sth up
results.english: If a dry material or substance soaks up a liquid, it absorbs the liquid through its surface.
results.example1: I tried to soak up most of the spilled milk with a dishcloth. 我試著用布把灑出來的牛奶大致吸乾淨。

results.name: span
results.english: to exist or continue for a particular length of time
results.example1: Tennis has a history spanning several centuries. 網球的歷史長達幾個世紀。
results.example2: Her acting career spanned almost six decades. 她的演藝生涯持續了近60載。

results.name: a ferry
results.english: a boat or ship for taking passengers and often vehicles across an area of water, especially as a regular service
results.example1: We're going to the Channel Islands by/on the _____. 我們將坐渡船去海峽群島。
results.example2: We took the _____ to Calais. 我們乘渡船去了加來。

results.name: layover
results.english: a short stay in a place that you make while you are on a longer journey to somewhere else
results.example1: We had a four-hour layover in Chicago. 飛行途中，我們在芝加哥逗留了四個小時。

results.name: memorable
results.english: likely to be remembered or worth remembering
results.example1: a memorable tune  難忘的曲調
results.example2: I haven't seen them since that memorable evening when the boat capsized. 自從發生翻船意外的那個令人難忘的晚上以後，我再沒有見過他們。

results.name: capsize
results.english: to (cause a boat or ship to) turn upside down by accident while on water
results.example1: A huge wave capsized the yacht. 巨浪把遊艇打翻了。
results.example2: When the boat capsized we were trapped underneath it. 船翻了，我們被困在船下。

results.name: round trip
results.english: If you make a round trip, you go on a journey and return to where you started from.

results.name: voyage
results.english: a long journey, especially by ship
results.example1: He was a young sailor on his first sea voyage. 他第一次出海航行時還是個年輕的水手。
results.example2: figurative The first year of a loving relationship is a voyage (= period) of discovery. 談戀愛的第一年是彼此了解的階段。

results.name: barge
results.english: to hurry somewhere or through a place in a rude and forceful way
results.example1: They barged through the crowds. 他們在人群中橫衝直撞。
results.example2: When the doors opened she barged her way to the front of the queue. 門一開她就衝到了隊伍前面。

results.name: turbulence
results.english: strong sudden movements within air or water
results.example1: We might be experiencing some turbulence on this flight due to an approaching electrical storm. 由於前面有雷暴向我們襲來，我們的飛機可能會遇到不穩定氣流。

results.name: concourse
results.english: a large space or room in a public building such as a station or airport that people meet in or pass through
results.chinese: （火車站、機場等的）中央大廳，大堂
results.example1: There's a ticket machine in the main concourse. 在主大堂有一部售票機。

results.name: lodging
results.english: a temporary place to stay
results.chinese: 寄宿的地方；借宿的地方
results.example1: The price includes board and lodging (= meals and a room to sleep in). 該價格包括食宿費。

results.name: presumably
results.english: used to say what you think is the likely situation
results.example1: They can presumably afford to buy a bigger apartment. 他們大概買得起一間大一點的公寓。
results.example2: Presumably he just forgot to send the letter. 他可能是忘了寄信。

results.name: charter
results.english: to rent a vehicle, especially an aircraft, for a special use and not as part of a regular service
results.chinese: 包租（交通工具，尤指飛機）
results.example1: They've chartered a plane to take delegates to the conference. 他們包了一架飛機送代表參加會議。

results.name: confer
results.english: to exchange ideas on a particular subject, often in order to reach a decision on what action to take
results.chinese: （常指爲達成行動決議而）商討，商議，協商
results.example1: I need some time to confer with my lawyer. 我想花點時間跟我的律師商量一下。

results.name: embark
results.english: to go onto a ship
results.example1: We embarked at Liverpool for New York. 我們從利物浦登船，前往紐約。

results.name: dispense
results.english: to give out things, especially products, services, or amounts of money
results.example1: There is a vending machine on the platform that dispenses snacks. 月臺上有一個出售零食的自動售貨機。

results.name: impound
results.english: If the police impound something that belongs to you, they take it away because you have broken the law.
results.example1: The police impounded cars and other personal property belonging to the drug dealers. 警方沒收了毒販的汽車及其他個人財物。
results.example2: The vehicle was impounded by customs. 車輛被海關扣押了。

results.name: remittance
results.english: an amount of money that you send to someone
results.example1: She sends a small remittance home to her parents each month.  她每月寄回家一小筆錢給她父母。

results.name: aesthetic
results.english: relating to the enjoyment or study of beauty
results.example1: The new building has little aesthetic value/appeal.  新樓幾乎沒有甚麼美學價值。

results.name: reflex
results.english: a physical reaction to something that you cannot control
results.chinese: 反射動作；反射作用；本能反應
results.example1: I'm sorry I punched him, it was a reflex action/response.  我很抱歉打了他，那不過是一種反射動作／本能反應而已。

results.name: catch on
results.english: to understand, especially after a long time
results.example1: He doesn't take hints very easily, but he'll catch on (to what you're saying) eventually.  他不太會察言觀色，不過最終還是會明白（你所說的話）的。

results.name: drift off
results.english: to gradually start to sleep
results.example1: I couldn't help drifting off in the middle of that lecture - it was so boring!  我在聽講座的過程中不知不覺地睡著了——這個講座太乏味了！

results.name: purge
results.english: to get rid of people from an organization because you do not agree with them
results.example1: Party leaders have undertaken to purge the party of extremists.  政黨領袖已採取行動清除黨內的極端分子。
results.example2: Hard-liners are expected to be purged from the administration.  主張強硬路線的人預測將從政府中清除出去。

results.name: a fishing vessel
results.english: a large boat or a ship
results.example1: a cargo/fishing/naval/patrol/sailing/supply vessel  貨船／漁船／海軍艦艇／巡邏艇／帆船／補給船

results.name: deposit + $$
results.english: to pay someone an amount of money when you make an agreement with that person to pay for or buy something, that either will be returned to you later, if the agreed arrangement is kept, or that forms part of the total payment
results.chinese: 支付（押金、訂金或預繳費用）
results.example1: When we moved in, we had to deposit $1,000 with the landlord in case we broke any of his things.  我們搬進去時必須向房東交1000美元的押金，以防我們損壞其房內物件。
results.example2: You deposit 20 percent now and pay the rest when the car is delivered.  你可以先付20%的訂金，餘款在交車時支付。

results.name: royalty
results.english: a payment made to writers, people who have invented things, owners of property, etc. every time their books, devices, land, etc. are bought or used by others
results.chinese: （專利）使用費；（著作的）版稅；（土地等的）開採使用費，租用費

results.name: obscure
results.english: to prevent something from being seen or heard
results.example1: Two new skyscrapers had sprung up, obscuring the view from her window.  兩座新摩天大樓拔地而起，擋住了她窗外的風景。
results.example2: The sun was obscured by clouds. 太陽被雲層遮住了。

results.name: ethical
results.english: relating to beliefs about what is morally right and wrong
results.example1: ethical and legal issues  道德和法律問題
results.example2: the ethical dilemmas surrounding genetic research  圍繞基因研究的倫理困境

results.name: instrumental
results.english: If someone or something is instrumental in a process, plan, or system, that person or thing is one of the most important influences in causing it to happen.
results.example1: She was instrumental in bringing about the prison reform act.  監獄改革條例得以出臺多虧她大力促成。

results.name: lengthen
results.english: to make something longer, or to become longer
results.example1: I'll have to lengthen this skirt. 我必須把這條裙子放長一些。
results.example2: lengthening waiting lists  越來越長的等候者名單

results.name: replica
results.english: an exact copy of an object
results.example1: The ship is an exact replica of the original Golden Hind.  這艘船是按照「金色石斑魚」號原樣仿造的。

results.name: arbitration
results.english: the process of solving an argument between people by helping them to agree to an acceptable solution
results.example1: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to go to arbitration (= to have the disagreement solved by an arbitrator).  爭議雙方都同意提請仲裁。

results.name: foil a plan
results.english: to prevent someone or something from being successful
results.example1: The prisoners' attempt to escape was foiled at the last minute when police received a tip-off.  由於警方收到密報，囚犯的越獄企圖在最後一刻被挫敗。

results.name: impartial
results.english: not supporting any of the sides involved in an argument
results.example1: impartial advice  客觀公正的建議
results.example2: A trial must be fair and impartial. 審判必須客觀公正。

results.name: preferential
results.english: used to say that something you are given that is better than what other people receive
results.example1: Inmates claimed that some prisoners had received preferential treatment.  犯人聲稱有些囚犯受到了優待。
results.example2: Single mothers have been given preferential access to council housing.  單親媽媽被授予了優先享用公有住宅的權利。

results.name: recollection
results.english: a memory of something
results.example1: I have many pleasant recollections of the time we spent together.  我們一起度過的時光給我留下了許多美好的回憶。

results.name: relinquish
results.english: to give up something such as a responsibility or claim
results.example1: He has relinquished his claim to the throne.  他放棄了繼承王位的要求。
results.example2: She relinquished control of the family investments to her son.  她把家庭投資的掌控權移交給了兒子。

results.name: remembrance
results.english: the act of remembering and showing respect for someone who has died or a past event
results.example1: A church service was held in remembrance of the victims. 在教堂舉行了一次紀念受害者們的禮拜儀式。

results.name: solicit
results.english: to ask someone for money, information, or help
results.example1: to solicit donations for a charity 呼籲人們捐款給慈善機構
results.example2: It is illegal for public officials to solicit gifts or money in exchange for favours. 公務員利用職務之便索求他人財物是非法的。

results.name: down payment
results.english: an amount of money that you pay at the time that you buy something but is only a part of the total cost of that thing. You usually pay the rest of the cost over a period of time
results.example1: I made/put a down payment on a new smart TV.  我已經交了新智慧電視的首期付款。

results.name: moderator
results.english: someone who tries to help other people come to an agreement
results.example1: An independent moderator should be appointed to oversee the negotiations. 應任命一個獨立的調解人來監督談判。

results.name: he blustered
results.english: to speak in a loud, angry, or offended way, usually with little effect
results.chinese: 咆哮，氣勢洶洶地説（卻通常作用不大）
results.example1: [+ speech] You had no right to do it, no right at all, he blustered. 「你沒有權力那様做，根本沒有權力」，他氣勢洶洶地吼道。

results.name: rocky
results.english: made of rock and therefore usually rough and difficult to travel along
results.chinese: 岩石構成的，多岩石的；崎嶇難行的
results.example1: She scrambled along the rocky path.  她沿著一條崎嶇的小道攀爬。

results.name: ingest
results.english: to eat or drink something
results.example1: The chemicals can be poisonous if ingested.  這些化學製品如果攝入體內可能會引起中毒。

results.name: cumbersome
results.english: awkward because of being large, heavy, or not effective
results.example1: cumbersome equipment  笨重的設備
results.example2: cumbersome bureaucracy  繁瑣的官僚體制

results.name: inmate
results.english: a person who is kept in a prison or a hospital for people who are mentally ill
results.chinese: （監獄中的）囚犯；（精神病院中的）病人

results.name: carv
results.english: to make something by cutting into especially wood or stone, or to cut into the surface of stone, wood, etc.
results.example1: This totem pole is carved from/out of a single tree trunk.  這根圖騰柱是由一整根樹幹雕刻而成的
results.example2: He carved her name on a tree.  他將她的名字刻在樹上。

results.name: eclipse
results.english: an occasion when the sun disappears from view, either completely or partly, while the moon is moving between it and the earth, or when the moon becomes darker while the shadow of the earth moves over it
results.example1: a solar/lunar eclipse  日／月蝕
results.example2: On Wednesday there will be a total/partial eclipse of the sun.  週三將有一次日全／偏蝕。

results.name: salute
results.english: a sign of respect made to someone by raising the right hand to the side of the head
results.example1: The soldier gave a salute and the officer returned it. 士兵向軍官敬禮，軍官回禮。

results.name: silhouette
results.english: a dark shape seen against a light surface
results.example1: The silhouette of the bare tree on the hill was clear against the winter sky.  在冬日天空的映襯下，山上光禿禿的樹影清晰可見。

results.name: celestial
results.english: of or from the sky or outside this world
results.example1: The moon is a celestial body.  月亮是天體中的一員。

results.name: mete sth out
results.english: to give or order a punishment or make someone receive cruel or unfair treatment
results.chinese: 施加（懲罰）；使受苦；使受到不公平對待
results.example1: In the past, schoolteachers regularly meted out physical punishment to their pupils.  在過去，教師常常體罰學生。

results.name: a chunk of
results.english: a part of something, especially a large part
results.chinese: 一部分；（尤指）大部分，一大塊
results.example1: a chunk of text  一大段文字
results.example2: a substantial chunk of our profits  我們利潤的很大一部分

results.name: deter
results.english: to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it
results.example1: These measures are designed to deter an enemy attack.  這些措施旨在阻止敵人的進攻。
results.example2: High prices are deterring many young people from buying houses.  高昂的價格讓很多年輕人對於買房屋望而卻步。

results.name: conscription
results.english: a piece of text, a formal suggestion, or a drawing in its original state, often containing the main ideas and intentions but not the developed form
results.example1: This is only a rough draft - the finished article will have pictures too. 這只是一個粗略的草稿——定稿後的文章中還會有一些圖片。
results.example2: She asked me to check the (first) draft of her proposal. 她請我檢查一下她的（第一稿）提案草稿。

results.name: cultivate
results.english: to prepare land and grow crops on it, or to grow a particular crop
results.example1: Most of the land there is too poor to cultivate. 那裡大部分土地太貧瘠，無法耕種。
results.example2: The villagers cultivate mostly maize and beans.  村民們主要種植玉米和豆類。

results.name: patch
results.english: a small area that is different in some way from the area that surrounds it
results.example1: Our dog has a black patch on his back.  我們的狗背上有塊黑斑。
results.example2: The hotel walls were covered in damp patches.  飯店的牆壁上滿是濕漬。

results.name: acupressure
results.english: a treatment for pain or illness in which certain parts of the body are pressed with the hands
results.chinese: 指壓（一種治療疼痛或其他疾病的方法，以手指按壓身體特定部位）

results.name: exfoliate
results.english: to remove dead skin cells from the surface of the skin, in order to improve its appearance

results.name: clink
results.english: a short ringing sound like pieces of glass or metal knocking lightly together
results.example1: I could hear the clink of coins in his pocket. 我聽到他口袋裡的硬幣叮噹作響。

results.name: waft
results.english: to (cause to) move gently through the air
results.example1: A gentle breeze wafted the scent of roses in through the open window. 一陣微風將玫瑰的香味從敞開的窗子裡送了進來。
results.example2: The sound of a flute wafted down the stairs. 長笛的聲音飄到了樓下。

results.name: frame
results.english: to express something choosing your words carefully
results.example1: The interview would have been more productive if the questions had been framed more precisely. 如果當時問題提得更確切些，採訪就會更有成效。

results.name: audacious
results.english: showing a willingness to take risks or offend people
results.chinese: 大膽的；敢於冒險的；魯莽的；放肆的
results.example1: He described the plan as ambitious and audacious. 他認為這是一項偉大而大膽的計劃。
results.example2: an audacious remark/suggestion 大膽的評論／建議

results.name: raid
results.english: (of the police) to enter a place suddenly in order to find someone or something
results.example1: Police officers from the organized crime division have raided businesses in central London. 有組織罪案調查科的員警已經突擊搜查了位於倫敦中心的一些公司。

results.name: fugitive
results.english: a person who is running away or hiding from the police or a dangerous situation
results.example1: Thousands of fugitives are fleeing from the war-torn area. 數以千計的難民逃離被戰爭蹂躪的地方。
results.example2: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid were fugitives from justice (= they ran away to avoid being tried in court). 布奇‧凱西迪和日舞小子都是逃犯。

results.name: wrongdoing
results.english: a bad or an illegal action
results.example1: She has strenuously denied any criminal wrongdoing. 她堅決否認有任何違法行為。

results.name: allegation
results.english: a statement, made without giving proof, that someone has done something wrong or illegal
results.example1: Several of her patients have made allegations of professional misconduct about/against her. 她治療的幾位病人指責她失職。
results.example2: [+ that] Allegations that Mr Dwight was receiving money from known criminals have caused a scandal. 有指控稱德懷特先生收取已知犯罪分子錢財，這已成為一樁醜聞。

results.name: understate
results.english: to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important, serious, bad, etc. than it really is
results.chinese: 對…輕描淡寫；不如實陳述；避重就輕地說
results.example1: She believes the research understates the amount of discrimination women suffer. 她認爲該研究對婦女所遭受的歧視輕描淡寫。

results.name: funnel
results.english: to send something directly and intentionally
results.example1: No one knows who has been funnelling weapons to the terrorists. 沒人知道是誰一直在向恐怖分子輸送武器。

results.name: oust
results.english: to force someone to leave a position of power, job, place, or competition
results.chinese: 將…趕下臺，罷免，廢黜；趕走；淘汰
results.example1: The president was ousted (from power) in a military coup in January 1987. 總統在1987年1月的一次軍事政變中被趕下臺。
results.example2: Police are trying to oust drug dealers from the city . 警方正試圖將毒品販子們從市中心攆走。

results.name: slip
results.english: to go somewhere or put something somewhere quickly, often so that you are not noticed
results.chinese: 溜走；迅速地做；悄悄地做
results.example1: Just slip out of the room while nobody's looking. 趁沒人注意時溜出房間。
results.example2: She slipped between the cool cotton sheets and was soon asleep. 她鑽進涼爽的棉被裡，很快就睡著了。

results.name: violate
results.english: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
results.chinese: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
results.example1: They were charged with violating federal law. 他們被控違犯了聯邦法律。
results.example2: It seems that the troops deliberately violated the ceasefire agreement. 那些軍隊似乎是故意違反停火協議。

results.name: not that
results.english: used to say you are not suggesting something
results.example1: She wouldn't tell me how much it cost - not that I was really interested. 她不願告訴我這花了多少錢——我並不真的想知道。

results.name: prosecutor
results.english: a legal official who accuses someone of committing a crime, especially in a law court

results.name: a hostage
results.english: someone who is taken as a prisoner by an enemy in order to force the other people involved to do what the enemy wants
results.example1: She was taken/held hostage by the gunmen. 她被持槍歹徒劫持作為人質。
results.example2: The terrorists have seized 20 hostages and are threatening to kill one a day unless their demands are met. 恐怖分子劫持了20名人質，並威脅除非他們的要求得到滿足，否則將每天殺掉一名人質。

results.name: rig
results.english: to arrange dishonestly for the result of something, for example an election, to be changed
results.chinese: （採取不正當的手段）操縱；對…做手腳
results.example1: Previous elections in the country have been rigged by the ruling party. 這個國家以前的選舉都受到了執政黨的操縱。

results.name: presume
results.english: to believe something to be true because it is very likely, although you are not certain
results.example1: [+ (that)] I presume (that) they're not coming, since they haven't replied to the invitation. 鑒於他們沒有回覆邀請，我認為他們不會來了。
results.example2: In British law, you are presumed innocent until you are proved guilty. 按照英國法律，你在證明有罪之前，一律假定是無辜的。

results.name: hassle
results.english: (a situation causing) difficulty or trouble
results.example1: I can't face the hassle of moving again. 我受不了再搬一次家的麻煩。
results.example2: My boss has been giving me a lot of hassle this week.  這星期老闆給我找了很多麻煩事。

results.name: umpire
results.english: a person who is present at a sports competition in order to make certain that the rules of that particular game are obeyed and to judge if particular actions are acceptable
results.example1: a cricket/tennis umpire 板球／網球裁判

results.name: utterly
results.english: completely or extremely
results.example1: What an utterly stupid thing to do!
results.example2: She was utterly devastated when her husband died.

results.name: gloomy
results.english: unhappy and without hope
results.example1: a gloomy person/expression 一個愁容滿面的人／一個沮喪的表情
results.example2: The cemetery is a gloomy place. 墓地是個讓人感到壓抑的地方。

results.name: the Arctic
results.english: the very cold area around the North Pole
results.example1: Polar bears live in the Arctic. 北極熊生活在北極地區。

results.name: peculiar
results.english: unusual and strange, sometimes in an unpleasant way
results.example1: She has the most peculiar ideas. 她的想法非常古怪。
results.example2: It's peculiar that they didn't tell us they were going away.  真奇怪，他們並沒有告訴我們他們要外出。

results.name: immunity
results.english: a situation in which you are protected against disease or from legal action
results.example1: The vaccination gives you immunity against the disease for up to six months. 注射這種疫苗會使你對這種疾病有長達六個月的免疫力。
results.example2: He was granted immunity from prosecution because he confessed the names of the other spies. 他因供出了其他間諜的名字而免受起訴。

results.name: indictment
results.english: a formal statement of accusing someone
results.example1: The charges on the indictment include murder and attempted murder. 起訴書上的指控包括謀殺罪及企圖謀殺罪。

results.name: be in breach of sth
results.english: to be breaking a particular law or rule
results.example1: The theatre was in breach of the safety laws for having no fire doors. 由於沒有消防門，這家劇院違反了安全法規。
results.example2: He was sued for breach of contract. 他因為違約而被起訴。

results.name: hermit
results.english: a person who lives alone and apart from the rest of society, especially for religious reasons

results.name: deterrent
results.english: something that deters people from doing something
results.chinese: 威懾力量；遏制因素；制止物
results.example1: a nuclear deterrent 核威懾力
results.example2: Tougher prison sentences may act/serve as a deterrent to other would-be offenders. 從嚴判決可以起到震懾其他潛在犯罪者的作用。

results.name: deceive
results.english: to persuade someone that something false is the truth, or to keep the truth hidden from someone for your own advantage
results.example1: The company deceived customers by selling old computers as new ones. 該公司用舊電腦冒充新機器欺騙顧客。
results.example2: The sound of the door closing deceived me into thinking they had gone out. 關門聲讓我以為他們己經出門了。

results.name: scent
results.english: a pleasant natural smell
results.example1: the scent of roses 玫瑰的香味

results.name: flute
results.english: a tube-shaped musical instrument with a hole that you blow across at one end while holding the tube out horizontally to one side

results.name: speculate
results.english: to guess possible answers to a question when you do not have enough information to be certain
results.example1: I don't know why she did it - I'm just speculating. 我不知道她爲甚麽那麽做——我只是猜測。
results.example2: A spokesperson declined to speculate on the cause of the train crash. 一位發言人拒絕就火車相撞事件的原因作出推測。

results.name: worship
results.english: to have or show a strong feeling of respect and admiration for God or a god
results.chinese: 敬奉，崇拜，信仰（上帝或神）
results.example1: On the island the people worshipped different gods. 在這個島上，人們信仰不同的神。

results.name: Shia or Shiite
results.english: a member of the second largest religious movement in Islam, based on the belief that Ali, a member of Mohammed's family, and the teachers who came after him were the true religious leaders
results.chinese: 什葉派教徒（伊斯蘭教的第二大派別）

results.name: a cleric
results.english: a religious leader
results.chinese: 教士，牧師；神職人員；僧侶
results.example1: a Buddhist/Catholic/Muslim cleric 佛教僧侶／天主教／穆斯林神職人員

results.name: bloc
results.english: a group of countries or people that have similar political interests
results.chinese: 集團，陣營（指具有類似政治利益的國家或人的群體）
results.example1: The European Union is a powerful trading/trade bloc. 歐盟是一個強大的貿易集團。
results.example2: the former Eastern/Communist bloc countries 前東歐集團／共產主義陣營國家

results.name: mourn
results.english: to feel or express great sadness, especially because of someone's death
results.chinese: （尤指因某人的亡故而）哀悼，悲傷
results.example1: Queen Victoria mourned Prince Albert/Prince Albert's death for 40 years. 維多利亞女王為亞伯特親王的去世服喪40年。
results.example2: She was still mourning for her brother. 她還在悼念她的哥哥。

results.name: militia
results.english: a military force whose members are trained soldiers but who often have other jobs
results.chinese: 民兵組織；預備役部隊；國民衛隊
results.example1: A UN force was sent in to stop fighting between three rival militias. 一支聯合國部隊被派去制止三個敵對的民兵組織之間的爭鬥。
results.example2: The government called out the militia to help cope with the rioting. 政府召集國民衛隊來幫助應付騷亂。

results.name: dismantle
results.english: to take a machine apart or to come apart into separate pieces
results.example1: She dismantled the washing machine to see what the problem was, but couldn't put it back together again. 她拆開洗衣機想看看出了甚麽問題，但是卻裝不起來了。
results.example2: The good thing about the bike is that it dismantles if you want to put it in the back of the car. 這種腳踏車的好處是可以拆開放在汽車的後部。

results.name: a patron
results.english: a person or group that supports an activity or organization, especially by giving money
results.example1: The Princess Royal is a well-known patron of several charities. 眾所周知，長公主是好幾家慈善機構的贊助人。

results.name: shrewdness
results.english: clear understanding and good judgment of a situation, usually resulting in an advantage
results.example1: With great shrewdness, Jane decided not to repeat the news she had heard that morning. 珍非常精明，她決定不提她那天早晨聽到的新聞。
results.example2: She was a woman of great courage and political shrewdness.

results.name: grapple
results.english: to fight, especially in order to win something
results.chinese: （尤指為了得到某物而）扭打，搏鬥
results.example1: The children grappled for the ball. 孩子們為了爭球打成一團。

results.name: warrant
results.english: an official document, signed by a judge or other person in authority, that gives the police permission to search someone's home, arrest a person, or take some other action
results.chinese: （由法官或官員簽署的）搜查令，逮捕狀，令狀
results.example1: a search warrant 搜查令
results.example2: Judge La Riva had issued an arrest warrant/a warrant for his arrest. 拉裡瓦法官已經簽署了一份逮捕狀／逮捕他的令狀。

results.name: eradicate
results.english: to get rid of something completely or destroy something bad
results.example1: The government claims to be doing all it can to eradicate corruption. 政府聲稱正盡其所能根治腐敗。
results.example2: The disease that once claimed millions of lives has now been eradicated. 這種曾奪去數百萬人生命的疾病現在已被根除了。

results.name: plead guilty
results.english: to make a statement of what you believe to be true, especially in support of something or someone or when someone has been accused in a law court
results.chinese: （尤指在法庭上）為…辯護；申辯；認（罪）
results.example1: The defendant pleaded not guilty/innocent to robbery with violence. 被告不承認暴力搶劫。
results.example2: They paid a high-powered attorney to plead their case (= argue for them in court). 他們聘請了一位很有能力的律師為自己辯護。

results.name: standoff
results.english: a situation in which agreement in an argument does not seem possible

results.name: reiterate
results.english: to say something again, once or several times
results.example1: The government has reiterated its refusal to compromise with terrorists. 政府重申拒絕向恐怖分子妥協。
results.example2: [+ that] She reiterated that she had never seen him before. 她一再重申自己以前從未見過他。

results.name: he has been maimed
results.english: to injure a person so severely that a part of their body will no longer work as it should
results.example1: Many children have been maimed for life by these bombs. 許多孩子被這些炸彈炸至重傷，終身殘疾。

results.name: deviate
results.english: to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving
results.example1: The recent pattern of weather deviates from the norm for this time of year. 近來的天氣狀況與往年同期相比有些異常。

results.name: an iota of evidence
results.english: an extremely small amount
results.example1: I haven't seen one iota of evidence to support his claim. 我沒有看到任何可以支持他的說法的證據。

results.name: condemn
results.english: to criticize something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons
results.chinese: （通常指出於道義而）譴責，指責
results.example1: The terrorist action has been condemned as an act of barbarism and cowardice. 人們譴責這一恐怖行徑是野蠻和懦弱的行爲。
results.example2: The film was condemned for its sexism. 這齣電影被指責帶有性別歧視。

results.name: immoral
results.english: morally wrong, or outside society's standards of acceptable, honest, and moral behaviour
results.example1: immoral behaviour 不道德的行為
results.example2: It's an immoral tax, because the poor will pay relatively more. 這是不道德的稅收，因為窮人相對要付出更多。

results.name: masquerade as sb/sth
results.english: to pretend or appear to be someone or something
results.example1: Hooligans masquerading as protesters have once again caused disturbances. 假扮成抗議人士的流氓惡棍再次鬧事。

results.name: peremptory instructions
results.english: expecting to be obeyed immediately and without asking questions
results.chinese: 不容置辯的；專橫的，霸道的
results.example1: He started issuing peremptory instructions. 他開始下達一些強制性的命令。
results.example2: She was highly critical of the insensitive and peremptory way in which the cases had been handled. 她嚴厲批評了對這些案件毫不體察、武斷死板的處理方式。

results.name: monument
results.english: a structure or building that is built to honour a special person or event
results.example1: In the square in front of the hotel stands a monument to all the people killed in the war. 在那家飯店前的廣場上矗立著紀念所有戰爭死難者的紀念碑。

results.name: adversary
results.english: an enemy
results.example1: He saw her as his main adversary within the company. 在他眼中，她是他在公司中的頭號對手。

results.name: retaliatory
results.english: A retaliatory action is one that is harmful to someone who has done something to harm you.
results.example1: retaliatory measures 報復性措施
results.example2: He urged people not to resort to retaliatory violence. 他力勸人們不要以暴制暴。

results.name: hubbub
results.english: a loud noise, especially caused by a lot of people all talking at the same time
results.chinese: （很多人同時說話時產生的）喧嚷，喧鬧
results.example1: I could hardly hear myself speak above all the hubbub in the bar. 在喧嚷的酒吧裡，我幾乎聽不見自己的聲音。

results.name: inner-city riots
results.english: a noisy, violent, and uncontrolled public meeting
results.example1: Inner-city riots erupted when a local man was shot by police. 在市中心，由於一名當地男子被員警開槍打死而突然引發了暴亂。

results.name: rival
results.english: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area
results.example1: He beat his closest/nearest rival by 20 marks. 他以領先20分的成績打敗了和他水平最接近的對手。
results.example2: The companies produce rival versions of the toy. 這些公司生産的玩具跟我們的産品爭奪市場。

results.name: audible
results.english: able to be heard
results.example1: The lecturer spoke so quietly that he was scarcely audible at the back of the hall. 這位講師的聲音太小，坐在禮堂後面的人幾乎聽不見。
results.example2: She gave an audible sigh of relief. 大家聽到她如釋重負地舒了一口氣。

results.name: erupt
results.english: When a volcano erupts, it explodes and flames and rocks come out of it.
results.example1: Since the volcano last erupted, many houses have been built in a dangerous position on its slopes. 自從火山上次噴發後，很多房屋建在了火山山坡上的危險地帶。

results.name: hooligan
results.english: a violent person who fights or causes damage in public places
results.example1: Hooligans had sprayed paint all over the car. 流氓們將整個汽車車身都噴上了油漆。

results.name: rebel
results.english: a person who is opposed to the political system in their country and tries to change it using force
results.chinese: （試圖武裝推翻國家政治制度的）反抗者，造反者
results.example1: The rebels took over the capital and set up a new government. 叛亂分子佔領了首都並成立了新政府。
results.example2: rebel troops/fighters 反叛軍隊／戰士

results.name: irritate
results.english: to make someone angry or annoyed
results.example1: After a while her behaviour really began to irritate me. 過了一會兒兒，她的行為真讓我惱火了。

results.name: ballistic missile
results.english: a missile (= flying weapon) that has power in order to direct it on its flight, but that continues and falls towards its target without power

results.name: farm sb out
results.english: to arrange for another person to take care of someone, especially your child
results.chinese: 託人照顧（尤指自己的孩子）
results.example1: Almost since birth, their baby has been farmed out to nannies and nurseries. 他們的孩子幾乎是一出生就交託給保姆和托兒所照顧。

results.name: proportional or proportionate
results.english: If two amounts are proportional, they change at the same rate so that the relationship between them does not change.
results.example1: Weight is proportional to size. 重量與大小是成比例的。
results.example2: How far you go is directly proportional to how fast you go (= as one thing increases, the other increases at exactly the same rate).

results.name: vigilant
results.english: always being careful to notice things, especially possible danger
results.example1: Following the bomb scare at the airport, the staff have been warned to be extra vigilant. 機場的炸彈恐嚇事件之後，全體員工都被告誡要格外警惕。
results.example2: Nobody could break into the building when the vigilant guard was on duty. 那位警覺的警衛值班時，沒有人能闖入這棟大樓。

results.name: caution
results.english: a spoken warning given by a police officer or official to someone who has broken the law
results.example1: As it was her first offence, she was only given a caution. 由於是初犯，所以只給了她一個口頭警告。

results.name: discard
results.english: to throw something away or get rid of it because you no longer want or need it
results.example1: Discarded food containers and bottles littered the streets. 街上到處都是被丟棄的食品包裝和瓶子。

results.name: scorch
results.english: to (cause to) change colour with dry heat, or to burn slightly
results.example1: The iron was too hot and he scorched the shirt. 熨斗太燙了，他把襯衫燙焦了。
results.example2: The surrounding buildings were scorched by the heat of the explosion. 周圍建築被爆炸產生的高溫熏得變色了。

results.name: allegedly
results.english: used when something illegal or wrong is said to have been done, but has not been proved
results.example1: That's where he allegedly killed his wife.
results.example2: She was arrested for allegedly stealing a car.

results.name: tit for tat
results.english: actions done intentionally to punish other people because they have done something unpleasant to you
results.example1: I noticed she didn't send me a card - I think it was tit for tat because I forgot her birthday last year. 我發現她沒有給我寄賀卡——我覺得她這是報復，因為去年我忘了她的生日。

results.name: spiral
results.english: to move in a spiral
results.chinese: 呈螺旋式上升（或下降）；盤旋上升（或下降）
results.example1: With one wing damaged, the model airplane spiralled downwards. 模型飛機的一個機翼壞了，盤旋下墜。

results.name: crude
results.english: oil from rocks underground in a natural state that has not yet been treated

results.name: proxy
results.english: authority given to a person to act for someone else, such as by voting for them in an election, or the person who this authority is given to
results.chinese: （由個人委託的）代理人，代表；代理權；代表權
results.example1: a proxy vote 代投的一票
results.example2: My brother's voting for me by proxy in the club elections. 在俱樂部選舉中，我弟弟代表我投票。

results.name: military reprisals
results.english: (an example of) activity against another person, especially as a punishment by military forces or a political group
results.chinese: （尤指軍事或政治的）報復，報復行動
results.example1: economic/military reprisals 經濟／軍事報復
results.example2: They promised that individuals could live freely without fear of reprisal from the military. 他們承諾說，人們可以自由生活，不必擔心軍方的報復。

results.name: podium
