results.english: a raised area on which a person stands to speak to a large number of people, to conduct music, or to receive a prize in a sports competition
results.chinese: 演講台；樂隊指揮台；領獎台
results.example1: Tears ran down her face as she stood on the winner's podium. 她站在領獎臺上時淚水順著她的臉龐流了下來。

results.name: station
results.english: to cause especially soldiers to be in a particular place to do a job
results.example1: I hear your son's in the army - where's he stationed? 我聽說你兒子在當兵——他駐紮在哪裡？
results.example2: The regiment was stationed in Singapore for several years. 這個團在新加坡駐紮了幾年。

results.name: bunker
results.english: a shelter, usually underground, that has strong walls to protect the people inside it from bullets or bombs

results.name: aide
results.english: a person whose job is to help someone important, such as a member of a government or a military officer of high rank
results.chinese: （政府或軍隊高官等的）助理，助手
results.example1: a senior government aide 政府高級助理
results.example2: an aide to the prime minister 首相助理

results.name: cement their relationship
results.english: to make something such as an agreement or friendship stronger
results.example1: The university's exchange scheme has cemented its links with many other academic institutions. 這所大學的交流計劃加強了與許多其他學術機構的聯繫。

results.name: rudderless
results.english: (of an organization) without anyone in control and therefore unable to take decisions
results.chinese: （組織）群龍無首的，無人領導的，無人管理的

results.name: a flagrant misuse of funds
results.english: (of a bad action, situation, person, etc.) shocking because of being so obvious
results.chinese: 駭人聽聞的；公然的；罪惡昭彰的
results.example1: a flagrant misuse of funds/privilege 明目張膽的濫用資金／特權
results.example2: a flagrant disregard for the law 公然蔑視法律

results.name: get through
results.english: to succeed in talking to someone on the phone
results.chinese: 用電話聯繫上；打通電話
results.example1: I tried to call her but couldn't get through. 我試圖給她打電話，但打不通。
results.example2: I got through to the wrong department. 我把電話錯打到另外一個部門去了。

results.name: outreach
results.english: an effort to bring services or information to people where they live or spend time
results.chinese: 擴大（醫療或其他）服務範圍，外展服務
results.example1: The centre was awarded a grant for outreach to the homeless. 這個中心被授予一筆資金用於為無家可歸者提供外展服務。

results.name: sedan
results.english: a car with seats for four or five people, two or four doors, and a separate area in the back for bags, boxes, and suitcases
results.chinese: （可以搭載四、五個人，有兩個或四個門，後部有專門放置行李空間的）轎車

results.name: high-stakes
results.english: involving the possible loss of a large amount of money
results.example1: a high-stakes poker game

results.name: regiment
results.english: a large group of soldiers, or (more generally) any large number of things or people
results.chinese: （軍隊的）團；大批，大群（事物或人）
results.example1: Regiments are usually commanded by a colonel and are sometimes made up of soldiers from a particular city or part of the country. 團通常由上校指揮，有時其士兵都來自某個城市或國家的某個特定地區。

results.name: scrub
results.english: (an area of land covered with) short trees and bushes, growing on dry ground of low quality

results.name: sanctuary
results.english: protection or a safe place, especially for someone or something being chased or hunted
results.chinese: 庇護，保護；避難所，庇護所
results.example1: Illegal immigrants found/sought/took sanctuary in a local church. 非法移民把當地的一座教堂當作避難所。
results.example2: The chapel became a sanctuary for the refugees. 這座小教堂成爲難民的庇護所。

results.name: mob
results.english: a large, angry crowd, especially one that could easily become violent
results.example1: The angry mob outside the jail was/were ready to riot. 監獄外憤怒的暴民準備鬧事。
results.example2: a lynch mob 行私刑的暴民

results.name: fairway
results.english: in golf, the area of short grass between the tee (= place where you first hit the ball) and the green (= place where the ball should enter a hole)
results.example1: He completely missed the fairway from his tee shot, and his ball ended up in the bushes. 他開球完全偏離球道，球最後落進了灌木叢。

results.name: euthanize
results.english: to kill an animal because it is very old or sick or because there is no one to take care of it
results.example1: Overcrowded shelters would not be able to euthanize unwanted animals. 擁擠不堪的動物救助站無法對被遺棄動物實施安樂死。

results.name: pristine
results.english: new or almost new, and in very good condition
results.example1: pristine new offices 嶄新的辦公室
results.example2: Washing machine for sale - only two months old and in pristine condition. 出售洗衣機——只用了兩個月，完好如新。

results.name: unmatched
results.english: having no equal; better than any other of the same type
results.chinese: 無可匹敵的，無雙的，無與倫比的
results.example1: For years they have enjoyed a standard of living unmatched by any other country in Europe. 多年來，他們所享受的生活水準是歐洲其他任何國家都無法比擬的。

results.name: septic
results.english: infected by bacteria that produce pus
results.chinese: 敗血症的，膿毒性細菌感染的，膿毒性的
results.example1: I had my ears pierced and one of them went septic. 我穿了耳洞，有一隻耳朵感染了。

results.name: joey
results.english: a young kangaroo

results.name: traumatize
results.english: to shock and upset someone severely and for a long time
results.example1: She was completely traumatized by the death of her mother. 母親的死令她痛苦萬分。

results.name: sombre
results.english: serious, sad, and without humour or entertainment
results.example1: a sombre atmosphere/voice/face 嚴肅的氣氛／聲音／臉
results.example2: The funeral was a sombre occasion. 葬禮是嚴肅的場合。

results.name: raze the city
results.english: to completely destroy a city, building, etc.
results.chinese: 把（城市、建築物等）夷爲平地；徹底摧毀
results.example1: The town was razed to the ground in the bombing raid - not a building was left standing. 整個城鎮在空襲中被夷爲平地——沒有一座建築物倖存。

results.name: pus
results.english: thick, yellowish liquid that forms in and comes from an infected cut or injury in the body
results.example1: a pus-filled wound 化膿的傷口

results.name: pierce
results.english: to go into or through something, making a hole in it using a sharp point
results.example1: The needle pierces the fabric four times a second. 針穿過布料的速度是每秒鐘四次。
results.example2: I couldn't wear these earrings because my ears aren't pierced. 我沒法戴這些耳環，因為我沒有穿耳洞。

results.name: gaily
results.english: happily or brightly
results.chinese: 歡樂地，喜氣洋洋地；閃亮地，明亮地
results.example1: I could hear her gaily singing in her bedroom. 我可以聽到她在睡房興高采烈地唱著歌。
results.example2: The tree lights twinkled gaily across the lake. 湖對岸，樹上燈光閃爍，透出歡樂的氣氛。

results.name: raid
results.english: a short sudden attack, usually by a small group of people
results.chinese: （通常由一小隊人發起的）突襲，襲擊
results.example1: The commandos made/staged/carried out a daring raid (on the enemy). 突擊隊大膽（向敵人）發起了突襲。
results.example2: planes on a bombing raid 執行空襲轟炸任務的飛機

results.name: slope
results.english: a surface that lies at an angle to the horizontal so that some points on it are higher than others
results.example1: The roof is at a slope (= at an angle to a horizontal surface) of 30°. 屋頂有30°的坡度。

results.name: colonel
results.english: an officer of high rank in the army or air force
results.example1: Colonel is the military rank between lieutenant-colonel and brigadier. 上校是介於中校和準將之間的軍銜。
results.example2: Colonel Furlong 弗朗上校

results.name: loom
results.english: If an unwanted or unpleasant event looms, it seems likely to happen soon and causes worry.
results.chinese: （不希望或不愉快的事情）陰森地逼近
results.example1: Here, too, the threat of unemployment has been looming on the horizon. 另外，還有失業的威脅在逼近。
results.example2: The threat of closure looms over the workforce. 工廠可能關閉，令工人們焦慮不安。

results.name: undermine
results.english: to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually
results.chinese: (常指逐漸地) 削弱 (信心、權威等)，損害
results.example1: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position/him. 總統指責有兩位內閣部長在暗中算計他。
results.example2: Criticism just undermines their confidence. 批評只是削弱了他們的信心。

results.name: sovereign
results.english: a king or queen

results.name: hold off
results.english: to not do something immediately
results.example1: [+ -ing (v)] Let's hold off making a decision until next week. 我們延到下周再作決定吧。
results.example2: US They've decided to hold off on buying a car until they're both working. 他們決定等兩人都開始工作之後再買車。

results.name: cite
results.english: to speak or write words taken from a particular writer or written work
results.example1: She cites both T.S. Eliot and Virginia Woolf in her article. 她在文章中引用了T.S.艾略特和維吉尼亞‧伍爾芙的作品。

results.name: monarch
results.english: a king or queen
results.chinese: 君主；國王，皇帝；女王，女皇
results.example1: a hereditary monarch 世襲的國王
results.example2: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch (= only has very limited powers). 英國的國家元首是君主立憲的國王或女王。

results.name: blindside
results.english: to surprise someone, usually with harmful results
results.example1: The recession blindsided a lot of lawyers who had previously taken for granted their comfortable income. 經濟衰退出其不意地打擊了那些先前想當然地認為自己應獲得豐厚收入的律師們。

results.name: empirical
results.english: based on what is experienced or seen rather than on theory
results.chinese: 以經驗（或實驗）爲依據的；經驗主義的；來自經驗（或觀察）的
results.example1: This theory needs to be backed up with solid empirical data/evidence. 這個理論需要翔實的實驗資料／實際經驗來支援。
results.example2: Empirical studies show that some forms of alternative medicine are extremely effective. 臨床研究顯示某些替代療法極其有效。

results.name: yellowish
results.english: slightly yellow
results.example1: The leaves vary from yellowish-green to dark green. 葉子從黃綠色到深綠色各不相同。

results.name: seizure
results.english: the action of taking something by force or with legal authority
results.chinese: 佔領，奪取，攫取；查封，沒收，充公
results.example1: seizure of power/property/control 對權力／財産／控制權的攫取
results.example2: Seizures of illicit drugs have increased by 30 percent this year. 今年，查獲的違禁藥品增加了30%。

results.name: lofty
results.english: high
results.example1: a lofty eiling/mountain/wall  高頂／山／牆

results.name: shaky
results.english: not firm or strong
results.chinese: 不穩定的；不堅固的；不結實的
results.example1: The building's foundations are rather shaky, and it could collapse at any time. 這棟建築的地基很不穩固，隨時可能會倒塌。
results.example2: Their marriage looks pretty shaky to me. 在我看來，他們的婚姻關係岌岌可危。

results.name: dial sth down
results.english: to make something less forceful or extreme
results.example1: A stage actor may need to dial down the energy for the intimacy of the movie camera.
results.example2: We must find a way to dial back the violence in our cities.

results.name: tabloid
results.english: (of or relating to) a type of popular newspaper with small pages that has many pictures and short, simple reports
results.example1: the tabloid press 通俗小報界
results.example2: a tabloid newspaper 通俗小報

results.name: take a provocative look at the problem
results.english: causing thought about interesting subjects
results.example1: The programme will take a detailed and provocative look at the problem of homelessness. 這個節目將以啟發性的視角詳細審視無家可歸這個問題。

results.name: destined for
results.english: intended (for a particular purpose)
results.example1: The money was destined for the relief of poverty, but was diverted by corrupt officials. 這些資金是用於救濟窮人的，卻被腐敗的官員挪用了。
results.example2: These cars are destined for the European market. 這些汽車是為歐洲市場生產的。

results.name: pothole
results.english: a hole in a road surface that results from gradual damage caused by traffic and/or weather
results.chinese: （路面因行車或天氣而形成的）凹坑，坑洞
results.example1: The car's suspension is so good that when you hit a pothole you hardly notice it. 這部車的懸架避震性很好，碰到路面的坑洞幾乎察覺不到。

results.name: rife
results.english: If something unpleasant is rife, it is very common or happens a lot.
results.chinese: （指不良事物）盛行的；流行的；普遍的
results.example1: Dysentery and malaria are rife in the refugee camps. 痢疾和瘧疾在難民營肆虐。

results.name: gunmen
results.english: a man, usually a criminal, who is armed with a gun
results.chinese: 持槍者；（通常指）持槍犯罪分子，持槍歹徒
results.example1: The three men were held hostage for two days by masked gunmen. 這三名男子被一夥蒙面持槍歹徒劫持為人質達兩天之久。

results.name: seize
results.english: to take something quickly and keep or hold it
results.example1: I seized his arm and made him turn to look at me. 我抓住他的手臂，使他轉身看著我。
results.example2: He seized the chance/opportunity of a free flight with both hands (= with eagerness or enthusiasm). 他急切地緊抓住搭乘免費航班的機會。

results.name: hit out
results.english: to criticize something or someone strongly
results.example1: The Medical Association yesterday hit out at government cuts in healthcare services. 昨天，醫療協會猛烈抨擊了政府削減醫療保健開支的措施。

results.name: He had a fit at work
results.english: a sudden attack of illness when someone cannot control their movements and becomes unconscious
results.example1: an epileptic fit 癲癇病發作
results.example2: He had a fit at work and collapsed. 他工作時突然昏厥倒地。

results.name: epileptic
results.english: suffering from or caused by epilepsy
results.chinese: 患癲癇的；由癲癇引起的
results.example1: an epileptic fit 癲癇病發作
results.example2: Her aunt is epileptic. 她姑姑患有癲癇。

results.name: asthma
results.english: a medical condition that makes breathing difficult by causing the air passages to become narrow or blocked
results.example1: an asthma sufferer 哮喘病患者
results.example2: an asthma attack 哮喘病發作

results.name: physio
results.english: informal for physiotherapist
results.chinese: 物理治療師（physiotherapist的非正式說法）

results.name: blaze
results.english: to burn brightly and strongly
results.example1: The sun was blazing down that afternoon. 那天下午烈日炎炎。

results.name: infiltrate
results.english: to secretly become part of a group in order to get information or to influence the way that group thinks or behaves
results.example1: A journalist managed to infiltrate the powerful drug cartel. 一位記者設法滲入了勢力強大的販毒集團內部。

results.name: chimney
results.english: a hollow structure that allows the smoke from a fire inside a building to escape to the air outside
results.example1: Factory chimneys belched dense white smoke into the sky. 工廠的煙囪向空中噴出濃濃的白煙。

results.name: sweep
results.english: the act of sweeping something to clean it
results.example1: I've given the kitchen floor a sweep (= I have swept it). 我已經掃了廚房的地板。

results.name: zero in on sth
results.english: to direct all your attention towards a particular thing
results.example1: We must decide on our target market, then zero in on it. 我們必須確定目標市場，然後將其鎖定。

results.name: vacant
results.english: not filled or occupied; available to be used
results.example1: The hospital has no vacant beds. 這家醫院沒有空床位。

results.name: lockbox
results.chinese: 一種密碼鎖+鑰匙鎖二合一的東西

results.name: autopsy
results.english: the cutting open and examination of a dead body in order to discover the cause of death
results.example1: They carried out/peformed an autopsy. 他們進行了檢屍。
results.example2: The body arrived for autopsy at the Dallas hospital. 屍體被運到達拉斯醫院進行解剖。

results.name: flue
results.english: a pipe that leads from a fire or heater to the outside of a building, taking smoke, gases, or hot air away

results.name: sheeting
results.english: thin material, especially cloth, plastic, or metal, used to cover something
results.chinese: 薄材料（尤指布、塑膠或金屬）

results.name: cardboard
results.english: material like very thick, stiff paper, usually pale brown in colour, used especially for making boxes
results.chinese: （尤指製作盒子的）硬紙板，卡紙板
results.example1: a cardboard box 硬紙板盒

results.name: toxicology
results.english: the scientific study of the characteristics and effects of poisons

results.name: malnutrition
results.english: physical weakness and bad health caused by having too little food, or too little of the types of food necessary for good health
results.example1: Many of the refugees are suffering from severe malnutrition. 許多難民嚴重營養不良。

results.name: to spark another debate
results.english: to cause the start of something, especially an argument or fighting
results.chinese: 引起，導致，觸發（尤指爭論或打鬥）
results.example1: This proposal will almost certainly spark another countrywide debate about immigration. 這項提議很可能會再一次引起全國性的關於移民的爭論。
results.example2: The visit of the G20 leaders sparked off (= caused the start of) mass demonstrations. G20國家領導人的到訪引發了大規模示威遊行。

results.name: allowance
results.english: money that you are given regularly, especially to pay for a particular thing
results.chinese: （尤指為特定事項支付的）定期補貼，津貼
results.example1: The perks of the job include a company pension and a generous travel allowance. 這份工作的特殊待遇包括公司退休金計劃和豐厚的差旅補助。
results.example2: I couldn't have managed at college if I hadn't had an allowance from my parents. 要不是父母定期給我生活費，我沒法讀完大學。

results.name: frugal
results.english: careful when using money or food, or (of a meal) cheap or small in amount
results.chinese: 節儉的；樸素的；（食物）簡單的，廉價的
results.example1: a frugal lifestyle 節儉的生活方式
results.example2: a frugal meal of bread and soup 只有麵包和湯的便宜飯食

results.name: plight
results.english: an unpleasant condition, especially a serious, sad, or difficult one
results.example1: the plight of the poor/homeless 窮人／無家可歸者的困難處境
results.example2: Few of us can be unmoved by the plight of the refugees. 我們幾乎無一不為難民的困難處境而心有所感。

results.name: outrage
results.english: a feeling of anger and shock
results.example1: These murders have provoked outrage across the country. 這些謀殺事件激起了全國公眾的憤慨。
results.example2: Many politicians and members of the public expressed outrage at the verdict. 許多政治家和公眾人物表達了對這判決的憤慨。

results.name: rectify
results.english: to correct something or make something right
results.example1: I am determined to take whatever action is necessary to rectify the situation. 我決心採取一切必要的措施來整頓局面。
results.example2: Every effort is made to rectify any errors/mistakes before the book is printed. 在書付印前會盡力去審校修改書中的錯誤。

results.name: simmer
results.english: If a disagreement or negative emotion simmers, it grows slowly stronger over a period of time and could become more serious at any moment.
results.example1: The strike has been simmering for weeks. 罷工已經醞釀了好幾個禮拜。
results.example2: She's been simmering with resentment ever since the meeting. 會議之後她便心生怨恨，一直耿耿於懷。

results.name: strain
results.english: to become stretched or to experience pressure, or to make something do or experience this
results.chinese: （使）緊張，（使）承受壓力；拉緊，繃緊；損傷
results.example1: I've put on such a lot of weight recently - this dress is straining at the seams. 我最近胖了很多——這條裙子穿上後緊繃繃的。
results.example2: I strained a muscle in my back playing squash. 我打壁球拉傷了背肌。

results.name: a whole slew of other crimes
results.english: a large amount or number
results.example1: Savino has been charged with three murders as well as a whole slew of other crimes. 薩維諾被控犯有三項謀殺罪外加一大堆其他的罪行。

results.name: forge
results.english: to make or produce something, especially with some difficulty
results.example1: The accident forged a close bond between the two families. 事故使兩個家庭緊密地聯繫在了一起。
results.example2: She forged a new career for herself as a singer. 她成了一名歌唱家，為自己開創了一番新事業。

results.name: herald
results.english: to be a sign that something important, and often good, is starting to happen, or to make something publicly known, especially by celebrating or praising it
results.chinese: 預示…的開始；（尤指透過慶祝或讚揚）宣佈（常指好事）
results.example1: The president's speech heralds a new era in foreign policy. 總統的演說預示著一個外交政策新時代的開始。
results.example2: This drug has been heralded as a major breakthrough in the fight against breast cancer. 這種藥據稱是在對抗乳癌方面的一個重大突破。

results.name: tariff
results.english: a charge or list of charges either for services or on goods entering a country

results.name: elusive
results.english: difficult to describe, find, achieve, or remember
results.chinese: 難以描述（或找到、達到、記起）的；困難的
results.example1: The answers to these questions remain as elusive as ever. 這些問題的答案仍然是不得而知。
results.example2: elusive memories 模糊的記憶

results.name: harvest
results.english: to pick and collect crops, or to collect plants, animals, or fish to eat
results.example1: In the US, winter wheat is harvested in the early summer. 在美國，冬小麥一般在初夏收割。

results.name: troublesome
results.english: causing a lot of problems for someone
results.chinese: 令人煩惱的；討厭的；麻煩的，棘手的
results.example1: Her hip has been troublesome for quite a while, and she'll probably need surgery on it. 她的髖部有很長一段時間都不舒服，可能需要動手術。
results.example2: The negotiations have proven more troublesome than any of us expected. 談判比我們所有人事先想像的都要棘手。

results.name: rift
results.english: a large crack in the ground or in rock
results.example1: The stream had cut a deep rift in the rock. 溪流在岩石上沖刷出一條很深的溝。

results.name: edge
results.english: to move slowly with gradual movements or in gradual stages, or to make someone or something move in this way
results.example1: A long line of traffic edged its way forward. 一條長長的車龍緩緩向前移動。
results.example2: Inflation has edged up to five percent over the last two years. 在過去兩年中，通貨膨脹慢慢攀升至5%

results.name: rivalry
results.english: a situation in which people, businesses, etc. compete with each other for the same thing
results.example1: There's such rivalry among/between my three sons. 我的三個兒子相互較勁，鬧得不可開交。
results.example2: There's fierce rivalry for the job/to get the job. 很多人想要得到這份工作，競爭非常激烈。

results.name: tangle with sb
results.english: to become involved with someone, usually by arguing or fighting with them
results.chinese: 與（某人）有瓜葛；（通常指）與（某人）爭吵（或打架）
results.example1: He was a self-opinionated, overbearing tyrant, and he was the last man she should want to tangle with. 他這個人固執己見、盛氣淩人，她絕不要與他有甚麼瓜葛。

results.name: weigh
results.english: to carefully consider, especially by comparing facts or possibilities, in order to make a decision
results.example1: Only when we have weighed all the factors involved can we decide when would be the best time to start. 我們只有權衡了所有相關因素後，才能決定何時開始最好。
results.example2: Economic benefits must be carefully weighed against the possible dangers of handling radioactive waste. 考慮經濟收益時，必須衡量處理放射性核廢料可能出現的危險。

results.name: subsidy
results.english: money given as part of the cost of something, to help or encourage it to happen
results.example1: The company received a substantial government subsidy. 公司得到大筆政府津貼。
results.example2: The government is planning to abolish subsidies to farmers. 政府正計劃取消對農場主人的補貼。

results.name: immensely
results.english: extremely
results.example1: He was immensely popular in his day. 在他那個時代，他非常受歡迎。
results.example2: She's an immensely talented young athlete. 她是個才華洋溢的年輕運動員。

results.name: bilateral
results.english: involving two groups or countries
results.example1: France and Germany have signed a bilateral agreement to help prevent drug smuggling. 法國和德國已經簽署了一項雙邊協定，以防止毒品走私。

results.name: get (sth) off the ground
results.english: If a plan or activity gets off the ground or you get it off the ground, it starts or succeeds.
results.example1: A lot more money will be required to get this project off the ground. 要啟動這個工程，還需要大量的資金。

results.name: derail
results.english: to prevent a plan or process from succeeding
results.example1: Renewed fighting threatens to derail the peace talks. 重燃的戰火對和談構成了威脅。

results.name: resurface
results.english: to rise to the surface of the water again
results.chinese: 再次浮出；再次露出水面
results.example1: When the divers did not resurface after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them. 一個小時後潛水員們都沒有浮出水面，於是三名船員潛水下去搜尋他們。

results.name: take precedence
results.english: the condition of being dealt with before other things or of being considered more important than other things
results.chinese: （時間、順序、重要程度等的）居前，領先
results.example1: Precedence must be given to the injured in the evacuation plans. 在疏散計劃中應優先考慮傷者。
results.example2: Business people often think that fluency and communication take precedence over grammar when speaking. 商界人士常認為說話的流利程度和表達能力比文法重要。

results.name: substance
results.english: the most important part of what someone has said or written
results.chinese: （某人）所說（或所寫）的最重要的部分，要點
results.example1: Later that year, the substance of their secret conversation appeared in a newspaper article. 那年稍後，他們這次秘密談話的要點出現在報紙上的一篇文章中。

results.name: broker
results.english: to arrange something such as a deal, agreement, etc. between two or more groups or countries
results.chinese: 作為經紀人（或中間人）安排（交易、協議等）
results.example1: The diplomats have failed in their attempts to broker a ceasefire. 外交官們促成停火的嘗試已告失敗。

results.name: Brexit
results.english: an exit (= act of leaving) by the United Kingdom from the European Union (short for British exit)
results.example1: There have been various attempts to calculate how much Brexit will cost.

results.name: erect
results.english: to build a building, wall, or other structure
results.example1: The war memorial was erected in 1950. 這座戰爭紀念碑建於1950年。
results.example2: The soldiers had erected barricades to protect themselves. 士兵們築起了街壘用以自衛。

results.name: expedience
results.english: the situation in which something is helpful or useful in a particular situation, but sometimes not morally acceptable
results.chinese: 權宜之計；應急辦法；逼不得已而做的事
results.example1: As a matter of expedience, we will not be taking on any new staff this year. 逼不得已，我們公司今年不會請新員工。
results.example2: I think this government operates on the basis of expediency, not of principle. 我認為這任政府做事毫無原則，只顧眼前的事。

results.name: tout
results.english: to advertise, talk about, or praise something or someone repeatedly, especially as a way of encouraging people to like, accept, or buy something
results.chinese: （尤指為了提高銷售額、知名度或推動發展）給…做廣告，宣傳，讚揚，吹捧
results.example1: The minister has been touting these ideas for some time. 教育部長一段時間以來一直在宣傳這些理念。
results.example2: He is being widely touted as the next leader of the party. 到處都在宣傳他是党的下一任領袖。

results.name: stagnate
results.english: to stay the same and not grow or develop
results.example1: The electronics industry is showing signs of stagnating after 15 years of growth. 電子産業在經過15年的飛速發展之後出現了停滯不前的跡象。

results.name: contract
results.english: to catch or become ill with a disease
results.example1: He contracted malaria while he was travelling. 他旅行時染上了瘧疾。

results.name: steep
results.english: (of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle
results.example1: It's a steep climb to the top of the mountain, but the view is worth it. 爬上山頂的路非常陡，不過風景非常好，值得一爬。
results.example2: The castle is set on a steep hill/hillside. 城堡坐落在陡峭的山／山坡上。

results.name: resort to sth
results.english: to do something that you do not want to do because you cannot find any other way of achieving something
results.chinese: （別無辦法的情況下）訴諸，依靠，採用
results.example1: I had to resort to violence/threats to get my money. 為了拿到我的錢，我被迫訴諸暴力／採取威脅的手段。
results.example2: [+ -ing (v)] When she didn't answer the phone, I resorted to calling up to her from the street. 她不接我的電話，我沒有辦法，只好站在街上對她大喊。

results.name: restrain his anger
results.english: to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something
results.example1: When he started fighting, it took four police officers to restrain him. 他出手打人，四個員警才把他制服。
results.example2: You should try to restrain your ambitions and be more realistic. 你應該儘量控制自己的野心，更現實一些。

results.name: dysentery
results.english: a disease of the bowels that causes the contents to be passed out of the body much more often and in a more liquid form than usual. It is caused by an infection that is spread by dirty water or food.

results.name: malaria
results.english: a disease that you can get from the bite of a particular type of mosquito (= a small flying insect). Malaria causes periods of fever and makes you shiver and feel very cold. It is common in many hotter parts of the world.

results.name: journalist
results.english: a person who writes news stories or articles for a newspaper or magazine or broadcasts them on radio or television
results.chinese: 新聞記者；報紙撰稿人；廣播員
results.example1: a freelance political journalist 政論文章自由撰稿人

results.name: cartel
results.english: a group of similar independent companies who join together to control prices and limit competition
results.chinese: （多家公司為控制價格和限制競爭聯合組成的）卡特爾，同業聯盟
results.example1: an oil cartel 石油卡特爾

results.name: perk
results.english: an advantage or something extra, such as money or goods, that you are given because of your job
results.chinese: （因工作而享有的）補貼，津貼，額外待遇
results.example1: A company car and a mobile phone are some of the perks that come with the job. 這份工作的一些額外待遇包括配備公司車和行動電話。

results.name: pension
results.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or a private company to a person who does not work any more because they are too old or have become ill
results.example1: US a government pension 政府養老金
results.example2: He won't be able to draw (= receive) his pension until he's 65. 他要等到65歲以後才能領取養老金。

results.name: commando
results.english: a small group of soldiers that are specially trained to make attacks on enemy areas that are very dangerous or difficult to attack
results.example1: Trevor volunteered for Special Service and joined 1 Commando.

results.name: seam
results.english: a line where two things join, especially a line of sewing joining two pieces of cloth or leather
results.chinese: （尤指縫合兩塊布或皮革的）線縫，接縫
results.example1: The bags we sell have very strong seams, so they will last for years. 我們賣的袋子縫線處非常牢固，所以經久耐用。
results.example2: figurative Their marriage is coming/falling apart at the seams (= likely to fail). 他們的婚姻已瀕臨破裂。

results.name: strike
results.english: to refuse to continue working because of an argument with an employer about working conditions, pay levels, or job losses
results.example1: Democratization has brought workers the right to strike and join a trade union. 民主化賦予工人罷工和加入工會的權利。
results.example2: We're striking for better pay and improved safety standards. 我們舉行罷工，要求加薪並提高安全標準。

results.name: resentment
results.english: a feeling of anger because you have been forced to accept something that you do not like
results.example1: He harbours a deep resentment against his parents for his miserable childhood.
results.example2: This decision has caused resentment among some teachers.

results.name: capital punishment
results.english: punishment by death, as ordered by a legal system

results.name: to fuel resentment
results.english: Something that fuels a feeling or a type of behaviour increases it or makes it stronger.
results.example1: The rapid promotion of the director's son has itself fuelled resentment within the company. 董事的兒子升職太快了，這件事激起了公司內的不滿情緒。
results.example2: The president's speech fuelled speculation that she is about to resign. 總統的講話引起了人們認為她準備辭職的猜測。

results.name: epidemic
results.english: the appearance of a particular disease in a large number of people at the same time
results.example1: a flu epidemic 流感的傳播

results.name: pneumonia
results.english: a serious illness in which one or both lungs become red and swollen and filled with liquid
results.example1: People who are bedridden can easily get pneumonia. 長期臥床的人易患肺炎。

results.name: acute
results.english: If a bad situation is acute, it causes severe problems or damage.
results.example1: She felt acute embarrassment/anxiety/concern at his behaviour. 她對他的行為感到極其尷尬／憂慮／擔憂。
results.example2: The problem of poverty is particularly acute in rural areas. 貧窮問題在農村地區尤為嚴重。

results.name: pandemic
results.english: (of a disease) existing in almost all of an area or in almost all of a group of people, animals, or plants
results.chinese: （疾病）大規模流行的，廣泛蔓延的
results.example1: In some parts of the world malaria is still pandemic. 在世界上一些地區瘧疾仍在廣泛流行。

results.name: rip through sth
results.english: to move very powerfully through a place or building, destroying it quickly
results.example1: The explosion ripped through the hotel. 爆炸將飯店炸穿了。
results.example2: A hurricane ripped through the Caribbean. 一股颶風席捲了加勒比海。

results.name: outbreak
results.english: a time when something suddenly begins, especially a disease or something else dangerous or unpleasant
results.chinese: （尤指疾病、危險或不快之事的）發作，暴發，突然發生
results.example1: an outbreak of cholera/food poisoning/rioting/war 霍亂／食物中毒／騷亂／戰爭的暴發
results.example2: Last weekend saw further thundery outbreaks. 上週末仍然雷聲不斷。

results.name: viral
results.english: used to describe something that quickly becomes very popular or well known by being published on the internet or sent from person to person by email, phone, etc.
results.chinese: （通過網路在個體之間迅速）病毒式的（傳播）
results.example1: Here's a list of the top ten viral videos this week. 以下是本週十大病毒式傳播的影像。
results.example2: Within days the film clip went viral. 幾天內這段電影視頻便病毒式地傳開了。

results.name: strain
results.english: an animal or plant from a particular group whose characteristics are different in some way from others of the same group
results.example1: Scientists have discovered a new strain of the virus which is much more dangerous. 科學家已經發現了一種危險得多的新病毒。

results.name: pathogen
results.english: any small organism, such as a virus or a bacterium that can cause disease
results.example1: a dangerous pathogen 一種危險的病原體

results.name: imperial
results.english: belonging or relating to an empire or the person or country that rules it
results.example1: the Imperial palace 皇宮
results.example2: imperial grandeur 帝國的輝煌

results.name: bright ideas
results.english: intelligent and quick to learn
results.example1: They were bright children, always asking questions. 這些孩子很聰明，總愛問問題。
results.example2: She was enthusiastic and full of bright ideas and suggestions. 她很有熱情，滿腦子好主意和建議。

results.name: how do you fare
results.english: to succeed or be treated in the stated way
results.example1: How did you fare in your exams? 你考得怎麼樣？
results.example2: Low-paid workers will fare badly/well under this government. 在這屆政府執政期間，低收入工人的境況會很糟／很好。

results.name: a mound of earth
results.english: a large pile of earth, stones, etc. like a small hill
results.example1: a burial mound (= a place where people were buried in ancient times) 墓塚

results.name: fanfare.
results.english: a loud, short piece of music played on brass instruments, often to announce something important
results.chinese: （通常指宣佈重要人物到場的）號角齊鳴

results.name: self-opinionated
results.english: having and expressing very strong feelings and beliefs, and believing that your own ideas are the only correct ones
results.chinese: 剛愎自用的；固執己見的

results.name: he is overbearing
results.english: too confident and too determined to tell other people what to do, in a way that is unpleasant
results.chinese: 專橫的；傲慢的；盛氣淩人的
results.example1: Milligan had a pompous, overbearing father. 米利根有個自負、專橫的父親。

results.name: proprietary
results.english: relating to owning something, or relating to or like an owner
results.example1: I just assumed he owned the place - he had a proprietary air about him. 我理所當然以為這個地方是他的——他有一副主人的架勢。

results.name: ephemeral
results.english: lasting for only a short time
results.chinese: 短暫的，極短的；轉瞬即逝的
results.example1: Fame in the world of rock and pop is largely ephemeral. 在搖滾和流行音樂界，名聲大多轉瞬即逝。

results.name: a tyrant
results.english: a ruler who has unlimited power over other people, and uses it unfairly and cruelly
results.chinese: 暴君；暴虐的人；專橫的人
results.example1: Tamir, one of several sons of the exiled ruler, vowed he would liberate his country from the tyrant. 泰咪爾是被放逐的幾個君主兒子中的一個，他發誓要把國家從暴君手中解放出來。
results.example2: figurative humorous Overnight my boss seems to have turned into a tyrant. 我的老闆似乎一夜之間變成了一個暴君。

results.name: harbour
results.english: to think about or feel something, usually over a long period
results.example1: He's been harbouring a grudge against her ever since his promotion was refused. 自從升職要求被拒絕後，他就一直對她懷恨在心。
results.example2: There are those who harbour suspicions about his motives. 有人對他的動機心存懷疑

results.name: scour
results.english: to search a place or thing very carefully in order to try to find something
results.example1: The police are scouring the area for the missing child. 警方在這個地區四處搜查，尋找失蹤的孩子。
results.example2: I scoured the shops for a blue and white shirt, but I couldn't find one anywhere. 我跑遍商店想買一件藍白相間的襯衫，但卻怎麽也買不到。

results.name: asteroid
results.english: one of many large rocks that circle the sun

results.name: slammed the door
results.english: to (cause to) move against a hard surface with force and usually a loud noise
results.example1: The wind made the door/window slam (shut). 風吹過來門／窗戶砰地關上了。
results.example2: I had to stop suddenly, and the car behind me slammed into the back of me. 我不得不猛地停下，結果後面的車砰地撞上了我的車尾巴。

results.name: crater
results.english: the round hole at the top of a volcano, or a hole in the ground similar to this
results.example1: the huge crater of Vesuvius 巨大的維蘇威火山口
results.example2: a bomb crater 炸彈坑

results.name: predate
results.english: to have existed or happened before another thing
results.example1: These cave paintings predate any others which are known. 這些洞穴繪畫早於其他任何已知的同類繪畫。

results.name: thaw the ice
results.english: to (cause to) change from a solid, frozen state to a liquid or soft one, because of an increase in temperature
results.example1: Allow the meat to thaw completely before cooking it. 烹製這些肉之前要先徹底解凍。
results.example2: The sun came out and thawed the ice. 太陽出來了，冰雪開始融化。

results.name: tectonic
results.english: relating to the structure of the surface of the earth and the way it is formed, changed, and moved by forces inside it
results.example1: the motion of the earth's tectonic plates (= sections of the planet's surface) 地球板塊的運動

results.name: deposit
results.english: to leave something somewhere
results.example1: The flood waters fell, depositing mud over the whole area. 洪水退去後，留下的淤泥覆蓋了整個地區。
results.example2: I deposited my luggage in a locker at the station. 我把行李存放在車站的儲物櫃裡了。

results.name: continent
results.english: one of the seven large land masses on the earth's surface, surrounded, or mainly surrounded, by sea and usually consisting of various countries
results.example1: the North American continent 北美大陸
results.example2: the continents of Asia and Africa 亞非兩洲

results.name: glacial
results.english: made or left by a glacier
results.chinese: 由冰河形成的；冰川造成的
results.example1: glacial deposits 冰川沉積

results.name: planetary
results.english: relating to planets
results.example1: planetary science/motion 行星學／運動

results.name: pompous
results.english: too serious and full of importance
results.chinese: 妄自尊大的，自以為是的
results.example1: He's a pompous old prig who's totally incapable of taking a joke. 他是個傲慢自負的老頭，根本開不起玩笑。
results.example2: He can sometimes sound a little pompous when he talks about acting. 他談起表演來有時會顯得有點自負。

results.name: pupil
results.english: a person, especially a child at school, who is being taught
results.example1: a primary-school pupil 小學生
results.example2: There is a very relaxed atmosphere between staff and pupils at the school. 這所學校師生之間的氣氛很輕鬆。

results.name: he gasped
results.english: to take a short, quick breath through the mouth, especially because of surprise, pain, or shock
results.chinese: （尤指由於驚奇、痛苦或震驚而）喘息，喘氣，倒抽氣
results.example1: When she saw the money hidden in the box she gasped in surprise. 她看到藏在盒子裡的錢時，驚得倒吸了一口氣。
results.example2: [+ speech] Help me! he gasped. 「幫幫我！」他他喘息道。

results.name: grimace
results.english: to make an expression of pain, strong dislike, etc. in which the face twists in an ugly way
results.chinese: （因疼痛或厭惡而）做鬼臉，做怪相
results.example1: He tried to stand and grimaced with pain. 他試圖站起來，結果疼得齜牙咧嘴。

results.name: pat
results.english: to touch someone or something gently and usually repeatedly with the hand flat
results.example1: He patted my head/patted me on the head affectionately. 他慈愛地拍了拍我的頭。
results.example2: I bent down to pat the little puppy. 我彎腰拍了拍那隻小狗。

results.name: livelihood
results.english: (the way someone earns) the money people need to pay for food, a place to live, clothing, etc.
results.example1: Many ship workers could lose their livelihoods because of falling orders for new ships. 由於新船訂單減少，許多船廠工人可能要丟掉飯碗。
results.example2: That farm is his livelihood. 那個農場是他的生活來源。

results.name: loathe
results.english: to hate someone or something
results.example1: Do you like fish? No, I loathe it. 「你喜歡魚嗎？」「不，我討厭魚。」
results.example2: [+ -ing (v)] I loathe doing housework. 我討厭做家務。

results.name: handily
results.english: easily
results.example1: The New York Yankees handily defeated the Boston Red Sox. 紐約洋基隊輕鬆擊敗了波士頓紅襪隊。

results.name: ramp sth up
results.english: If a business ramps up its activity, it increases it.
results.example1: The company announced plans to ramp up production to 10,000 units per month. 這間公司宣佈了每月生産一萬件的增産計劃。
results.example2: To stay competitive, they'll have to ramp up product development as well as cut prices. 為保持競爭力，他們除了降價以外，還將不得不加大産品開發的力度。

results.name: plague
results.english: bubonic plague , or any serious disease that kills many people
results.example1: Millions died of (the) plague. 數百萬人死於瘟疫。

results.name: cholera
results.english: a serious infection of the bowels caused by drinking infected water or eating infected food, causing diarrhoea, vomiting, and often death

results.name: laud
results.english: to praise
results.example1: The German leadership lauded the Russian initiative. 德國領導人讚揚了俄羅斯的倡議。

results.name: genome
results.english: the complete set of genetic material of a human, animal, plant, or other living thing

results.name: bubonic plague
results.english: a very infectious disease spread by rats, causing swelling, fever, and usually death. In the 14th century it killed half the people living in Europe.
results.chinese: 腺鼠疫；腹股溝淋巴結鼠疫

results.name: a prig
results.english: a person who obeys the rules of correct behaviour and considers himself or herself to be morally better than other people
results.chinese: 一本正經的人；自命清高的人

results.name: bowel
results.english: the long tube that carries solid waste from the stomach out of the body
results.example1: He has trouble with his bowels. 他的腸胃有問題。
results.example2: bowel cancer/cancer of the bowel 腸癌

results.name: diarrhoea (US diarrhea)
results.english: an illness in which the body's solid waste is more liquid than usual and comes out of the body more often
results.example1: diarrhoea and sickness 腹瀉噁心
results.example2: an attack of diarrhoea 腹瀉發作

results.name: sb's demise
results.english: the death of a person

results.name: lockdown
results.english: a situation in which people are not allowed to enter or leave a building or area freely because of an emergency
results.chinese: （建築或地區）因緊急情況而被封鎖了
results.example1: The Secret Service is imposing a virtual lockdown on the city. 特勤局實質上把整個城市都封鎖了。
results.example2: The school has been placed on lockdown this morning while authorities investigate a bomb threat. 這座學校今天早晨被置於封鎖之下，便於當局調查炸彈威脅。

results.name: the death toll
results.english: suffering, deaths, or damage
results.example1: Independent sources say that the death toll from the earthquake runs into thousands. 獨立消息人士稱地震中的傷亡人數達到數千人。

results.name: indefinite
results.english: not exact, not clear, or without clear limits
results.chinese: 不確定的；不清楚的；無限期的
results.example1: The project has been postponed for an indefinite period. 這專案被無限延期了。
results.example2: an indefinite number of people 不確定的人數

results.name: contain
results.english: to keep something harmful within limits and not allow it to spread
results.chinese: 控制，遏制，制止（有害物蔓延）
results.example1: Farms in the area have been closed off in an attempt to contain the disease. 為阻止疾病擴散，該地區的農場都被關閉了。
results.example2: More police were sent to help contain the violence. 更多警力被派去協助控制暴力行為。

results.name: epicentre
results.english: the point on the earth's surface directly above an earthquake or atomic explosion
results.chinese: （地震）震央；（原子彈爆炸的）中心，爆炸點

results.name: autonomous
results.english: independent and having the power to make your own decisions
results.example1: an autonomous organization, country, or region is independent and has the freedom to govern itself 自治的，有自治權的
results.example2: an autonomous region/province/republic/council 自治地區／省／共和國／委員會

results.name: ward
results.english: one of the parts or large rooms into which a hospital is divided, usually with beds for patients
results.example1: a geriatric/maternity/psychiatric ward 老年人／產科／精神病病房

results.name: corridor
results.english: a long passage in a building or train, especially with rooms on either side
results.chinese: （尤指兩邊是房間的）走廊，通道，過道
results.example1: Her office is at the end of the corridor. 她的辦公室在走廊盡頭。

results.name: tend
results.english: to care for something or someone
results.example1: He carefully tended his sunflower plants. 他精心照料他的向日葵。
results.example2: The nurse gently tended the patient's cuts and bruises. 護士細心護理病人的傷口和瘀腫。

results.name: blister
results.english: a painful swelling on the skin that contains liquid, caused usually by continuous rubbing, especially on your foot, or by burning
results.chinese: （皮膚通常因摩擦或燙傷而起的）水皰
results.example1: New shoes always give me blisters. 新鞋總會把我的腳磨出皰。

results.name: state-backed
results.english: used to describe an activity or organization that is approved, owned, or controlled by a government
results.example1: Under radical new funding plans this state-backed company would receive an extra £2bn of taxpayers' money.
results.example2: He proposes a state-backed plan to help new teachers pay back student loans.

results.name: mounting
results.english: gradually increasing
results.example1: mounting anxiety/excitement 不斷增長的焦慮／興奮
results.example2: mounting debts 日益累積的債務

results.name: precautionary
results.english: intended to prevent something unpleasant or dangerous from happening
results.example1: The company has withdrawn the drug as a precautionary measure.
results.example2: Hospital staff are stressing the tests are purely precautionary and say the chances of anyone catching the disease are a million to one.

results.name: accrue
results.english: to increase in number or amount over a period of time
results.example1: Interest will accrue on the account at a rate of seven percent. 帳戶上的存款將會以7%的利率生息。
results.example2: Little benefit will accrue to the city (= it will receive little benefit) from the new transport links. 新的道路修建計劃幾乎不會給該城市帶來甚麼利益。

results.name: airborne particles
results.english: in the air, or carried by air or wind or by an aircraft
results.chinese: 在空中的；空氣傳播的；空運的；飛行中的
results.example1: The airborne radioactive particles have covered a huge area of Russia. 透過空氣傳播的放射性粒子覆蓋了俄羅斯廣大地區。
results.example2: Airborne troops were dropped by parachute behind enemy lines. 空降部隊傘降到敵後陣地上。

results.name: measles
results.english: an infectious disease that produces small, red spots all over the body
results.example1: The number of deaths from measles fell by 30 per cent. 死於麻疹的人數下降了30%。
results.example2: One of the children got the measles. 孩子中有一個患上了麻疹。

results.name: clinical
results.english: used to refer to medical work or teaching that relates to the examination and treatment of ill people
results.example1: clinical tests/training 臨床試驗／實習
results.example2: Clinical trials of the new drug may take five years. 這種新藥的臨床試驗可能需要五年時間。

results.name: containment
results.english: the act of controlling or limiting something or someone harmful
results.example1: Containment of crowd violence was the police's main concern. 阻止群體暴力事件的發生是警方最關注的事。

results.name: epidemiology
results.english: the scientific study of diseases and how they are found, spread, and controlled in groups of people

results.name: decimate
results.english: to kill a large number of something, or to reduce something severely
results.chinese: 毀滅，大量殺戮；大幅削減
results.example1: Populations of endangered animals have been decimated. 瀕臨動物的數量已經大幅減少。

results.name: annihilate
results.english: to destroy something completely so that nothing is left
results.example1: a city annihilated by an atomic bomb 被原子彈夷為平地的城市

results.name: stifling
results.english: extremely hot and unpleasant
results.chinese: 悶熱的，熱得令人窒息的
results.example1: I can't bear this stifling humidity. 我受不了這種悶熱潮濕。
results.example2: Several hundred people were crammed into the stifling room. 幾百人擠在這個令人窒息的房間裡。

results.name: brush sb/sth aside
results.english: to refuse to consider something seriously because you feel that it is not important
results.example1: She brushed their objections aside, saying Leave it to me. 她對他們的反對置之不理，説道：「交給我吧。」

results.name: admittedly
results.english: used when you are agreeing that something is true, especially unwillingly
results.chinese: （尤用於不情願地承認某事時）不得不承認
results.example1: Admittedly, I could have tried harder but I still don't think all this criticism is fair. 不可否認，我本來可以再努力些。儘管如此，我認為這些批評也並非完全公道。

results.name: mind-boggling
results.english: extremely surprising and difficult to understand or imagine
results.chinese: 令人難以想像的；十分驚人的
results.example1: She was paid the mind-boggling sum of ten million dollars for that film. 那部電影她的片酬竟達千萬英鎊的天文數字。

results.name: calibre
results.english: the quality of someone or something, especially someone's ability
results.chinese: (能力方面的) 品質；水準；才能，能力
results.example1: If teaching paid more it might attract people of (a) higher calibre. 如果提高教師的工資，也許會吸引更高水準的人才。
results.example2: The competition entries were of such (a) high calibre that judging them was very difficult. 參賽作品水準都很高，很難對它們作出評判。

results.name: tune in
results.english: to watch or listen to a particular television or radio programme or station
results.example1: Be sure to tune in to next week's show. 一定要收看下週的節目。
results.example2: Will the millions of viewers who regularly tune in stay loyal, now that their favorite host is gone? 現在他們喜歡的主持人走了，那幾百萬忠實的觀眾還會繼續收聽嗎？

results.name: soil
results.english: the material on the surface of the ground in which plants grow
results.example1: light/heavy/fertile soil 輕質／黏重／肥沃土
results.example2: sandy or chalky soils 沙質或白堊質土壤

results.name: top-flight
results.english: highest in standard or quality
results.chinese: 頂級的；最優秀的；品質最好的
results.example1: He's one of our top-flight engineers. 他是我們最優秀的工程師之一。

results.name: glaring errors
results.english: used to say that something bad is very obvious
results.chinese: （負面事物）十分顯眼的，易見的，明顯的
results.example1: glaring errors 明顯的錯誤
results.example2: a glaring injustice 明顯不公正

results.name: be no mean feat
results.english: to be a great achievement
results.example1: Getting the job finished in under a week was no mean feat. 一周內就把這項任務完成了，真了不起。

results.name: tussle
results.english: to have difficult disagreements or strong arguments
results.example1: During his twelve years in Congress he has tussled with the chemical, drug and power companies on behalf of the ordinary person. 在國會任職的12年裡，他代表普通人與化工、醫藥、電力公司進行了激烈的鬥爭。
results.example2: The residents are still tussling over the ever-scarcer street parking. 居民仍為爭取日益緊缺的街頭停車位而爭吵。

results.name: droves
results.english: a large group, especially of people, moving towards a place
results.chinese: （前往某地的）群體（尤指移動的人群）
results.example1: Every summer droves of sightseers crowd the city. 每年夏天大批觀光客令該市擁擠不堪。
results.example2: Fans came in droves to see her concerts. 歌迷們蜂擁而至來參加她的音樂會。

results.name: jersey
results.english: a shirt that is worn by a member of a sports team
results.chinese: （體育運動隊隊員穿的）運動衫

results.name: chant
results.english: to repeat or sing a word or phrase continuously
results.chinese: 重複地說（或唱）；反覆吟唱；反覆唸誦
results.example1: The crowd were chanting the team's name. 人群正反覆呼喚著自己足球隊的名字。
results.example2: Demonstrators chanted anti-government slogans in the square. 示威者在廣場上呼喊反政府口號。

results.name: dash
results.english: the act of running somewhere very quickly
results.example1: I made a dash for the bathroom. 我衝向廁所。
results.example2: There was a mad dash for the exit. 人們拼命衝向出口。

results.name: glitz
results.english: the quality of being exciting and attractive, but often in a way that has no real worth:
results.example1: The party's electoral message may be obscured by the glitz and glamour of its presentation.
results.example2: The extraordinary thing about Cannes is that despite the surface glitz, most people get up early and work.

results.name: showbiz
results.english: informal for show business

results.name: achy
results.english: Someone who feels achy has continuous pains in their body that are unpleasant but not very strong.
results.example1: I've been feeling tired and achy (= full of pains) all morning. 我整個上午都覺得全身疼痛乏力。

results.name: chronic diseases
results.english: (especially of a disease or something bad) continuing for a long time
results.chinese: （尤指疾病或不好的事物）慢性的，長期的
results.example1: chronic diseases/conditions 慢性病
results.example2: chronic arthritis/pain 慢性關節炎／長期的疼痛

results.name: agita
results.english: great worry or nervousness
results.example1: The prospect of taking more risks gave them all agita.

results.name: mercury
results.english: a chemical element that is a heavy, silver-coloured metal, liquid at normal temperatures
results.example1: Mercury is used in batteries, pesticides, and thermometers. 水銀用於電池、殺蟲劑與溫度計中。

results.name: put sb/sth forth
results.english: to state an idea or opinion, or to suggest a plan or person, for other people to consider
results.chinese: 提出（想法或計劃）；推薦（某人）
results.example1: The proposals that you have put forth deserve serious consideration. 你提出的建議值得認真考慮。
results.example2: Many suggestions have been put forth, but a decision is unlikely until after next year's general election. 已經提出了許多建議，但要等到明年的大選過後才可能作出決定。

results.name: a shortage of ammunition
results.english: objects that can be shot from a weapon, such as bullets or bombs
results.example1: a good supply of ammunition 充足的彈藥供應
results.example2: a shortage of ammunition 彈藥短缺

results.name: activist
results.english: a person who believes strongly in political or social change and takes part in activities such as public protests to try to make this happen
results.chinese: 激進主義分子，行動主義分子；積極分子
results.example1: He's been a trade union/party activist for many years. 多年來他一直是工會／黨的積極分子。
results.example2: an animal rights activist 保護動物權益積極分子

results.name: tear sth down
results.english: to intentionally destroy a building or other structure because it is not being used or it is not wanted any more
results.example1: They're going to tear down the old hospital and build a new one. 他們要拆掉舊醫院，再建個新的。

results.name: tent
results.english: a shelter made of canvas or a similar material and supported by poles and ropes, that you can fold up and carry with you

results.name: decent
results.english: socially acceptable or good
results.chinese: 正派的；體面的，正經的；像樣的，相當不錯的
results.example1: Everyone should be entitled to a decent wage/standard of living. 人人都應該有權獲得像樣的工資／過著體面的生活。
results.example2: It was very decent (= kind) of you to help. 你能幫忙，真是個大好人啊

results.name: the economic is bleak
results.english: If a situation is bleak, there is little or no hope for the future.
results.example1: The economic outlook is bleak. 經濟前景暗淡。

results.name: makeshift
results.english: temporary and of low quality, but used because of a sudden need
results.example1: Thousands of refugees are living in makeshift camps. 數千個難民居住在臨時帳篷裡。

results.name: pummel
results.english: to hit someone or something repeatedly, especially with your fists (= closed hands)
results.example1: The boxer had pummelled his opponent into submission by the end of the fourth round. 第四回合比賽快要結束時那位拳擊手連續擊打對手使其認輸。

results.name: enclave
results.english: a part of a country that is surrounded by another country, or a group of people who are different from the people living in the surrounding area
results.chinese: 飛地（被包圍在另外一個國家境內，和本國其他領土不接壤）；（在其他人群中聚居的）族群，群體：
results.example1: Campione d'Italia is an Italian enclave in Switzerland. 坎皮奧內是位於瑞士境內的一塊義大利飛地。

results.name: displace
results.english: to force something or someone out of its usual or original position
results.chinese: 迫使…離開常居地（或原位）
results.example1: The building of a new dam will displace thousands of people who live in this area. 建造新水壩將迫使居住在這一地區的數千人遷往別處。

results.name: circulate
results.english: to go around or through something, or to make something go around or through something
results.chinese: （使）循環；（使）流通；（使）傳遞；（使）散佈
results.example1: Hot water circulates through the heating system. 熱水在供暖系統中循環。
results.example2: I've circulated a good luck card for everyone to sign. 我拿了一張好運卡傳著讓每個人都簽名。

results.name: phenom
results.english: someone or something extremely successful, especially someone young in sports who achieves a lot very quickly
results.chinese: 傑出的人（或事物）；奇跡；（尤指）體育奇才
results.example1: In less than a year, the 21-year-old phenom has become the best player in baseball. 在不到一年的時間內，這名21歲的體育奇才已經成為棒球界中數一數二的優秀選手。

results.name: apropos
results.english: suitable in a particular situation or at a particular time
results.example1: clothes that are apropos to the occasion 適合那個場合穿的衣服

results.name: asylum
results.english: protection or safety, especially that given by a government to people who have been forced to leave their own countries for their safety or because of war
results.example1: to seek/apply for political asylum 尋求／申請政治庇護

results.name: overt behavior
results.english: done or shown publicly or in an obvious way and not secret
results.chinese: 公開的，明顯的，毫不隱瞞的
results.example1: overt racism 公然的種族歧視
results.example2: He shows no overt signs of his unhappiness. 他沒有明顯表現出不高興。

results.name: signage
results.english: all the signs that advertise a product, etc.
results.example1: As part of its rebranding effort, the company will replace signage on 2,000 of its stores. 作為改名活動的一部分，這家公司將更換旗下兩千多家商店的廣告標誌。

results.name: culprit
results.english: a fact or situation that is the reason for something bad happening
results.example1: Children in this country are getting much too fat, and sugar and sweets are the main culprits. 該國兒童過於肥胖，糖和甜食是罪魁禍首。

results.name: villain
results.english: a bad person who harms other people or breaks the law
results.example1: Some people believe that Richard III was not the villain he is generally thought to have been. 有些人認為理查三世不是通常人們認為的惡棍。
results.example2: He's either a hero or a villain, depending on your point of view. 他要麼是英雄，要麼是惡棍，這取決於你如何看了。

results.name: crammed
results.english: very full of people or things
results.example1: a crammed train/room 擁擠的火車／房間
results.example2: The docks were crammed with/crammed full of people trying to board the boats. 碼頭上擠滿了想要上船的人

results.name: whim
results.english: a sudden wish or idea, especially one that cannot be reasonably explained
results.example1: We booked the trip on a whim. 我們一衝動就預訂了假日遊。
results.example2: You can add what you want to this mixture - brandy, whisky, or nothing at all - as the whim takes you. 你可以在這種混合飲料裡加入任何你喜歡的東西——白蘭地、威士卡或甚麼也不加——全看你自己。

results.name: racism
results.english: the belief that people's qualities are influenced by their race and that the members of other races are not as good as the members of your own, or the resulting unfair treatment of members of other races
results.chinese: 種族主義；種族歧視，種族迫
results.example1: The authorities are taking steps to combat/fight/tackle racism in schools. 當局將採取措施反對／打擊／應對各學校中的種族歧視。
results.example2: The report made it plain that institutional racism (= racism in all parts of an organization) is deep-rooted in this country. 報告明確指出，該國各組織機構中都存在著根深蒂固的種族偏見。

results.name: hunker down
results.english: to make yourself comfortable in a place or situation, or to prepare to stay in a place or position for a long time, usually in order to achieve something or for protection
results.chinese: 蹲守；準備長期逗留在某處
results.example1: The press have hunkered down for the night outside the palace, waiting for news of the royal birth. 媒體在王宮外守候了一夜，等候王室添丁的消息。

results.name: caucus
results.english: in the US, a meeting held to decide which candidate a political group will support in an election
results.chinese: （美國政黨集團挑選候選人的）決策會議

results.name: address an issue
results.english: to give attention to or deal with a matter or problem
results.example1: The issue of funding has yet to be addressed. 資金問題尚未得到解決。

results.name: punch above your weight
results.english: If a country or business punches above its weight, it becomes involved in, or succeeds in, an activity that needs more power, money, etc. than it seems to have.
results.chinese: 能和高於自己重量級別的對手較量
results.example1: Singapore punches above its weight in the world economy. 新加坡在世界經濟中的地位堪比一些經濟強國。

results.name: fatality
results.english: a death caused by an accident or by violence, or someone who has died in either of these ways
results.chinese: （事故或暴力事件中的）死亡，死者
results.example1: There are thousands of traffic fatalities (= deaths in traffic accidents) every year. 每年死於交通意外的人數以千計。
results.example2: The first fatalities of the war were civilians. 戰爭中首當其衝喪命的是平民百姓。

results.name: artillery
results.english: very large guns that are moved on wheels or metal tracks, or the part of the army that uses these
results.example1: Naval gunfire and ground-based artillery are generally less accurate than many aircraft-borne weapons. 一般而言，許多空投武器都要比軍艦炮火和地面炮火精確度高。

results.name: moor
results.english: to tie a boat so that it stays in the same place
results.example1: We moored further up the river. 我們停泊在河流更上游的地方。
results.example2: We moored the boat to a large tree root. 我們將船繫泊在一棵大樹下。

results.name: in remission
results.english: a period of time when an illness is less severe or is not affecting someone
results.example1: Her cancer has been in remission for several years. 她的癌症幾年來有所緩解。

results.name: verge
results.english: the edge or border of something
results.example1: They set up camp on the verge of the desert. 他們在沙漠邊緣紮下了營地。

results.name: implore
results.english: to ask someone to do or not do something in a very sincere, emotional, and determined way
results.chinese: 懇求（某人）（不）做…，哀求（某人）（不）做…
results.example1: She implored her parents not to send her away to school. 她哀求父母不要送她上學。

results.name: in acquittal
results.english: the decision of a court that someone is not guilty
results.example1: The first trial ended in a hung jury, the second in acquittal. 第一次審判因為陪審團意見不一致而未能作出裁定，第二次審判以宣判無罪告終。
results.example2: Of the three cases that went to trial, two ended in acquittals. 付諸庭審的三個案件中，有兩個最終作出無罪判決。

results.name: imbue sth/sb with sth
results.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling, quality, or idea
results.example1: His poetry is imbued with deep, religious feeling. 他的詩歌充滿了深厚的宗教情感。

results.name: vie for the title
results.english: to compete with other people to achieve or get something
results.example1: Six candidates are currently vying for the Democratic presidential nomination. 六名候選人目前正在爭奪民主黨的總統候選人提名資格。
results.example2: The two older children tend to vie with the younger one for their mother's attention. 兩個大一點的孩子正在和小的爭寵，都想博得媽媽的注意。

results.name: a shopping precinct
results.english: a part of a city or a town in which vehicles are not allowed, used for a special purpose, such as shopping
results.chinese: （市鎮中有特定用途的）區域；（尤指）徒步商業區
results.example1: a shopping precinct 商業區
results.example2: a pedestrian precinct 徒步區

results.name: bask in the sun
results.english: to lie or sit enjoying the warmth especially of the sun
results.example1: We could see seals on the rocks, basking in the sun. 我們可以看到海豹在岩石上曬太陽。

results.name: promising
results.english: Something that is promising shows signs that it is going to be successful or enjoyable.
results.chinese: 有希望的；有出息的；有前途的
results.example1: They won the award for the most promising new band of the year. 他們贏得了該年度最有前途新進樂團獎。
results.example2: How's your new venture going? It's looking quite promising. 「你的新事業進展得如何？」「看起來相當不錯。」

results.name: preclude from
results.english: to prevent something or make it impossible, or prevent someone from doing something
results.example1: His contract precludes him from discussing his work with anyone outside the company. 合約中禁止他與公司外的人談論工作。
results.example2: The fact that your application was not successful this time does not preclude the possibility of you applying again next time. 這次應徵失敗並不妨礙你下次再來應徵。

results.name: conscript
results.english: to force someone by law to serve in one of the armed forces
results.example1: He was conscripted into the army at the age of 18. 他18歲被徵召入伍。

results.name: a disgruntled employee
results.english: unhappy, annoyed, and disappointed about something
results.example1: A disgruntled former employee is being blamed for the explosion. 一名心懷不滿的前員工被認為是此次爆炸的罪魁禍首。
results.example2: The players were disgruntled with the umpire. 運動員們對裁判不滿。

results.name: monstrosity
results.english: something that is very ugly and usually large
results.example1: The new office building is a real monstrosity. 新的辦公大樓真是個龐大的怪物。

results.name: recoil
results.english: the sudden backward movement that a gun makes when it is fired

results.name: detonator
results.english: a small amount of explosive in a bomb that explodes first and causes a larger explosion, or an electrical device that is used from a distance to make a bomb explode

results.name: set off/out
results.english: to start a journey
results.example1: What time will we have to set off for Grandma's house tomorrow? 我們明天要甚麽時候出發去奶奶家？
results.example2: Jenny set off down the road on her new bike. 珍妮騎著新腳踏車沿著馬路出發了。

results.name: detonate
results.english: to (cause something to) explode
results.example1: The device detonated unexpectedly. 裝置發生了意外爆炸。
results.example2: A remote control device was used to detonate the bomb. 有人用遙控裝置引爆了那枚炸彈。

results.name: cordon sth off
results.english: If people in authority, such as the police, cordon off a building or area, they put something around it in order to stop people from entering it.
results.chinese: 設置警戒線將…圍起，封鎖
results.example1: They've cordoned off the whole area because of a suspected bomb. 因懷疑有炸彈，他們封鎖了整個地區。

results.name: rightful
results.english: A rightful position or claim is one that is morally or legally correct
results.example1: Don't forget that I am the rightful owner of this house. 不要忘記我是這所房子的合法主人。

results.name: sensational
results.english: very good, exciting, or unusual
results.example1: a sensational sports car/dress 極好的跑車／連衣裙
results.example2: She looks sensational (= extremely attractive) in her new dress. 她穿上新裙子漂亮極了。

results.name: a cautionary note
results.english: giving a warning

results.name: prompt
results.english: to make something happen
results.example1: The bishop's speech has prompted an angry response from both political parties. 主教的發言激起了兩大政黨的憤怒回應。
results.example2: Recent worries over the president's health have prompted speculation over his political future. 最近對總統健康狀況的擔憂引發了對其政治前途的猜測。

results.name: set sth back
results.english: to reduce something to a weaker or less advanced state
results.example1: This defeat has set back their chances of winning the competition. 這次失敗降低了他們贏得這次競賽的機會。

results.name: concentration
results.english: a large number or amount of something in the same place
results.example1: There is a heavy concentration of troops in the area. 該地區有重兵駐紮。

results.name: thrilled
results.english: extremely happy about something
results.example1: [+ that] I was thrilled that so many people turned up to the party. 這麼多人參加派對，我太高興了。

results.name: about-face
results.english: a change of direction
results.example1: a complete change of opinion or behaviour （意見或行為的）徹底轉變
results.example2: This is the government's second about-turn on the issue. 這是政府在這個問題上立場第二次180度大轉變。

results.name: staggered
results.english: very shocked or surprised
results.example1: I was staggered at the prices. 看到價錢我嚇了一跳。

results.name: a farce.
results.english: a situation that is very badly organized or unfair
results.chinese: 滑稽的情景，荒唐的舉動，鬧劇
results.example1: No one had prepared anything so the meeting was a bit of a farce. 誰也沒有作任何準備，因此會議有點像一齣鬧劇。

results.name: malicious software
results.english: intended to harm or upset other people
results.chinese: 惡意的，惡毒的，意在傷人的
results.example1: a malicious look in his eyes 他惡狠狠的眼神
results.example2: He complained that he'd been receiving malicious phone calls. 他抱怨說他接二連三地接到惡意騷擾電話。

results.name: intimacy
results.english: a situation in which you have a close friendship or sexual relationship with someone
results.example1: Intimacy between teachers and students is not recommended. 不提倡師生之間關係過於密切。

results.name: upwards
results.english: towards a higher position, level, or value
results.example1: She turned her face upwards to the sun. 她抬頭面向正午的太陽。
results.example2: The cost of completion has been revised upwards again due to inflation. 由於通貨膨脹，完工的費用再次調高。

results.name: fallacious
results.english: not correct
results.example1: His argument is based on fallacious reasoning. 他的論點是建立在錯誤的推理基礎上的。

results.name: a dissident
results.english: a person who publicly disagrees with and criticizes their government
results.example1: political dissidents 持不同政見者

results.name: extremist
results.english: someone who has beliefs that most people think are unreasonable and unacceptable
results.example1: a group of extremists (= people with extreme opinions) 一群極端分子

results.name: at length
results.english: for a long time
results.example1: George went on at great length about his various illnesses. 喬治滔滔不絕地講起他身患的各種疾病。

results.name: razor wire
results.english: wire with pieces of sharp metal fixed across it, often positioned on top of walls, such as those surrounding a prison, to stop people climbing over the walls
results.chinese: （設於高牆上防止翻越的）尖利鐵絲網，刺鋼絲

results.name: patchwork
results.english: cloth made by sewing together a lot of smaller pieces of cloth with different patterns and colours, or the activity of doing this
results.example1: a patchwork quilt/jacket 百衲被／拼布補綴的夾克衫
results.example2: The old lady sat in the corner doing patchwork. 那個老太太坐在角落裡做些縫補活。

results.name: exile
results.english: to send someone away from their own country, village, etc., especially for political reasons
results.chinese: （尤指出於政治原因的）流放，放逐，流亡
results.example1: The monarch was exiled because of the coup. 由於發生了政變，國王被迫流亡。

results.name: justify
results.english: to give or to be a good reason for
results.chinese: 為…辯護；證明…正當（或有理、正確）；是…的正當理由
results.example1: [+ -ing (v)] I can't really justify taking another day off work. 我真的找不出理由再多休一天假了。
results.example2: Are you sure that these measures are justified? 你確定這些措施合理嗎？

results.name: stricken
results.english: suffering severely from the effects of something unpleasant
results.chinese: 受嚴重侵害的，遭受重創的
results.example1: All the oil from the stricken tanker has now leaked into the sea. 失事油輪上的油現已全部外洩到海中。
results.example2: My country has been stricken by war for the past five years. 我的祖國在過去五年內飽受戰亂蹂躪。

results.name: vast
results.english: extremely big
results.example1: A vast audience watched the broadcast. 大量的觀眾觀看了轉播。
results.example2: The amount of detail the book contains is vast. 該書所包含的細節內容非常豐富。

results.name: nasal
results.english: related to the nose
results.example1: nasal passages 鼻道
results.example2: nasal congestion 鼻塞

results.name: swab
results.english: a small piece of soft material used for cleaning a cut or for taking a small amount of substance from a body, or the substance itself that can then be tested
results.chinese: 拭子，消毒棉；用藥籤取下的化驗標本
results.example1: The nurse cleaned the cut on my leg with a swab. 護士用一根棉花棒清理我腿上的傷口。
results.example2: I'm just going to take a swab of your ear, said the doctor. 醫生說：「我要用棉花棒從你耳朵裡取樣檢查。」

results.name: rugby
results.english: a sport where two teams try to score points by carrying an oval ball across a particular line or kicking it over and between an H-shaped set of posts
results.example1: Tom plays rugby every Saturday. 湯姆每週六都玩橄欖球。
results.example2: He's built like a rugby player (= he is very big and strong). 他有橄欖球球員一樣的體型。

results.name: Brisbane
results.english: a large city in eastern Australia, that is the capital of the state of Queensland
results.chinese: 布里斯班，澳洲東部的一個大城市

results.name: alight
results.english: burning
results.example1: I had to use a bit of petrol to get the fire alight. 我不得不倒了一點汽油才生著了火。
results.example2: The rioters overturned several cars and set them alight. 暴徒掀翻了幾輛汽車並將其付之一炬。

results.name: squad
results.english: a small group of people trained to work together as a unit
results.example1: An army bomb squad arrived and defused the bomb. 一個陸軍防爆小組趕到，拆除了炸彈。
results.example2: the seizure of a large amount of heroin by the drug squad 緝毒小組對大量海洛因的繳獲

results.name: douse (also dowse)
results.english: to make something or someone wet by throwing a lot of liquid over it, him, or her
results.example1: We watched as demonstrators doused a car in/with petrol and set it alight. 我們注視著示威者往汽車上倒汽油並放火點燃。

results.name: self-inflicted
results.english: If an injury or a problem is self-inflicted, you have caused it yourself.
results.example1: self-inflicted pain/damage 自己釀成的痛苦／傷害

results.name: scene
results.english: a place where an unpleasant event has happened
results.chinese: （不愉快事件發生的）現場，地點
results.example1: The police arrived to find a scene of horrifying destruction. 員警趕到時看到那個地方已經毀得不成形了。
results.example2: Evidence was found at the scene of the crime. 在案發現場發現了證據。

results.name: shattering
results.english: making you feel extremely tired
results.example1: It was a shattering schedule - seven meetings in two days. 這是個累死人的行程表——兩天之內竟然有七次會。

results.name: govern
results.english: to have a controlling influence on something
results.example1: Prices of goods are governed by the cost of the raw materials, as well as by the cost of production and distribution. 商品的價格不但取決於生產和行銷成本，而且取決於原材料的價格。

results.name: make the cut
results.english: To meet or come up to a required standard (from golf where a player must do equal or better than a certain score to continue)
results.example1: (original meaning) The young player did not make the cut and was unable to join the team that year.
results.example2: Some say if Pluto were discovered today instead of 75 years ago, it woundn't make the cut.

results.name: contender
results.english: someone who competes with other people to try to win something
results.example1: Now aged 42, he is no longer considered a serious contender for the title. 他今年42歲，人們已不再認爲他是奪冠的熱門人物了。

results.name: ruthless
results.english: not thinking or worrying about any pain caused to others; cruel
results.example1: a ruthless dictator 殘忍的獨裁者
results.example2: Some people believe that to succeed in this world you have to be ruthless. 有些人認為，在這個世界上要想成功必須冷酷無情。

results.name: stereotype
results.english: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong
results.chinese: （尤指錯誤的）刻板印象，老套俗見，成見
results.example1: racial/sexual stereotypes 陳舊的種族偏見／性別成見
results.example2: He doesn't conform to/fit/fill the national stereotype of a Frenchman. 他不符合一般人心目中法國人的形象。

results.name: connotation
results.english: a feeling or idea that is suggested by a particular word although it need not be a part of the word's meaning, or something suggested by an object or situation
results.chinese: 內涵意義；隱含意義；聯想意義
results.example1: The word lady has connotations of refinement and excessive femininity that some women find offensive. lady 一詞有優雅和過分嬌柔的涵義，因此某些女性覺得該詞具有冒犯意。

results.name: jumble
results.english: to mix things together untidily
results.example1: Her clothes were all jumbled up/together in the suitcase. 她的衣服都胡亂扔在手提箱裡。

results.name: advisory
results.english: an official announcement that contains advice, information, or a warning
results.example1: weather/travel advisories 天氣報告／旅遊公告
results.example2: Television companies sometimes broadcast advisories before violent movies. 電視臺在播放有暴力內容的電影前，有時會先作警示。

results.name: soothe
results.english: to make someone feel calm or less worried
results.example1: to soothe a crying baby 讓哭鬧的嬰兒安靜下來

results.name: they are pedantic
results.english: giving too much attention to formal rules or small details
results.chinese: 迂腐的，學究式的，書呆子氣的
results.example1: They were being unnecessarily pedantic by insisting that Berry himself, and not his wife, should have made the announcement. 他們太拘泥於形式，堅持要求由貝利本人而不是他妻子來宣佈，這實在沒有必要。

results.name: contempt
results.english: a strong feeling of disliking and having no respect for someone or something
results.example1: At school she had complete contempt for all her teachers. 在學校讀書時她對所有老師都不屑一顧。
results.example2: You should treat those remarks with the contempt that they deserve. 你理應對那些話不屑一顧。

results.name: civility
results.english: politeness or a polite remark
results.example1: She greeted them with civility, but not much warmth. 她客氣地跟他們打招呼，可是不大熱情。
results.example2: After a few civilities, they got down to business. 寒暄幾句後他們就談起了正事。

results.name: emission
results.english: the act of sending out gas, heat, light, etc.
results.chinese: （氣體、熱量、光線等的）排放，散發，射出
results.example1: Environmental groups want a substantial reduction in the emission of greenhouse gases. 環保組織要求切實減少溫室氣體的排放量。

results.name: stand for sth
results.english: to support or represent a particular idea or set of ideas
results.example1: This party stands for low taxes and individual freedom. 這個政黨支持低稅率，主張個人自由。

results.name: jargon
results.english: special words and phrases that are used by particular groups of people, especially in their work
results.example1: military/legal/computer jargon 軍事／法律／電腦術語

results.name: the brink of sth
results.english: the point where a new or different situation is about to begin
results.example1: Extreme stress had driven him to the brink of a nervous breakdown. 極大的壓力使他處於精神崩潰的邊緣。
results.example2: Scientists are on the brink of (= extremely close to) a major new discovery. 科學家們就快有新的重大發現了。

results.name: fragment
results.english: a small piece or a part, especially when broken from something whole
results.chinese: 小片，小塊；（尤指）碎片，碎塊
results.example1: The road was covered with fragments of glass from the shattered window. 馬路上到處是車窗的碎玻璃片。
results.example2: Literary scholars are piecing together her last unpublished novel from fragments of a recently discovered manuscript. 文學研究者們正在把最近發現的她最後一部未發表小說的手稿殘片一點點拼湊起來。

results.name: recognition
results.english: If you are given recognition, people show admiration and respect for your achievements.
results.example1: Ella complained that the company never gave her any recognition for her work. 艾拉抱怨說公司從未認可過她的工作。
results.example2: He was presented with a gold watch in recognition of (= to show respect for) his years as club secretary. 俱樂部贈予他一隻金錶，以感謝他多年作為俱樂部幹事所付出的心血。

results.name: flashy
results.english: looking too bright, big, and expensive in a way that is intended to get attention and admiration
results.chinese: （因豔麗、巨大和昂貴而）顯眼的，俗豔的
results.example1: a flashy car 外觀俗麗的汽車
results.example2: flashy gold jewellery 俗氣的黃金首飾

results.name: superiority
results.english: the fact that one person or thing is better, stronger, etc. than another
results.example1: The Australian team soon demonstrated their superiority over the opposition. 澳大利亞隊很快在對手面前顯示出優勢。

results.name: empathize
results.english: to be able to understand how someone else feels
results.chinese: 表示同情；有同感，産生共鳴
results.example1: It's very easy to empathize with the characters in her books. 讀者很容易和她書中的人物産生共鳴。

results.name: lowly
results.english: low in position and importance, or not respected
results.example1: He took a lowly job in an insurance firm. 他在保險公司得到了一個低級職位。
results.example2: His first job in the hotel was as a lowly bellboy. 他在飯店的第一份工作是當小門童。

results.name: predictor
results.english: something such as an event or fact that enables you to say what will happen in the future
results.chinese: （可讓人預報未來的事件或事實）預報性事物
results.example1: One of the best predictors of a student's achievement is the socioeconomic status of the parents. 學生未來成就的最好的預報因素之一是父母的社會經濟地位。

results.name: leave entitlement
results.english: something that you have a right to do or have, or the right to do or have something
results.chinese: 有權做的事；有權擁有的東西；權利，資格
results.example1: pension/holiday entitlements 獲得退休金／帶薪休假的權利
results.example2: Managers have generous leave entitlement. 經理們可享受很寬裕的假期。

results.name: narcissism
results.english: too much interest in and admiration for your own physical appearance and/or your own abilities
results.chinese: （對容貌和能力的）自我陶醉，孤芳自賞，自戀

results.name: theorize
results.english: to develop a set of ideas about something
results.chinese: 建立理論；從理論上說明
results.example1: It's easy to theorize about what might have happened. 對於原本可能發生的事情作理論上的推測是很容易的。

results.name: a conscientious student
results.english: putting a lot of effort into your work
