results.chinese: 認真的；盡心盡責的；一絲不苟的
results.example1: a conscientious student 認真的學生

results.name: snippet
results.english: a small and often interesting piece of news, information, or conversation
results.chinese: 一條，一則（新聞、消息或談話）
results.example1: I heard an interesting snippet on the radio this morning. 今天早上我從廣播裡聽到了一則有趣的新聞。
results.example2: I love listening to snippets of conversation in restaurants. 我喜歡在餐廳裡聽一些談話的片斷。

results.name: gale force winds
results.english: (of winds) very strong
results.example1: Meteorologists predicted gale-force winds. 氣象學家預測將有大風。

results.name: encase
results.english: to cover or surround something or someone completely
results.example1: The nuclear waste is encased in concrete before being sent for storage in disused mines. 核廢料在送往廢棄的礦井存放之前，先用混凝土密封起來。

results.name: coating
results.english: a layer of a particular substance that covers a surface
results.example1: a thick coating of chocolate 一層厚厚的巧克力
results.example2: The goggles have a laser-protection coating. 護目鏡上涂有厚厚的鐳射防護層。

results.name: icicle
results.english: a long pointed stick of ice that is formed when drops of water freeze
results.example1: Icicles hung from the roof. 屋簷上掛著冰柱。

results.name: impersonate
results.english: to intentionally copy another person's characteristics, such as their behaviour, speech, appearance, or expressions, especially to make people laugh
results.example1: She's the woman who impersonates all the celebrities on TV. 她是在電視上扮演各種名人的那個人。

results.name: in moderation
results.english: the quality of doing something within reasonable limits
results.example1: You can eat whatever you want as long as it's in moderation. 你想吃甚麼都可以，只要適量就好。
results.example2: All parties will have to show great moderation during these very difficult negotiations. 在艱難的談判期間，所有的黨派將不得不表現出極大的克制。

results.name: longitudinal analysis
results.english: Longitudinal research is done on people or groups over a long period of time.
results.example1: longitudinal analysis/studies 縱向分析／研究

results.name: coronary
results.english: relating to the arteries (= thick tubes) that supply blood to the muscles of the heart
results.example1: Regular exercise reduces the risk of coronary heart disease. 經常鍛煉身體能減少患冠心病的危險。

results.name: pinpoint
results.english: to find out or say the exact position in space or time of something
results.chinese: 準確指出，確定（位置或時間）
results.example1: It is not possible to pinpoint precisely the time of death. 準確地確定死亡時間是不可能的。

results.name: synonymous
results.english: having the same meaning
results.example1: The words annoyed and irritated are more or less synonymous. annoyed 和 irritated 兩個詞幾乎是同義的。

results.name: whereas
results.english: compared with the fact that; but
results.example1: He must be about 60, whereas his wife looks about 30. 他肯定有60歲上下了，可他妻子看起來只有30歲左右。
results.example2: You eat a huge plate of food for lunch, whereas I have just a sandwich. 你午飯吃了一大盤東西，可我只吃了個三明治。

results.name: counterpart
results.english: a person or thing that has the same purpose as another one in a different place or organization
results.chinese: （與不同地方或組織的人或物）作用相同者，相對應者
results.example1: The prime minister is to meet his European counterparts to discuss the war against drugs. 首相將會見歐洲各國首腦就打擊毒品犯罪進行商討。

results.name: in place
results.english: If something is in place, it is in its usual or correct position.
results.chinese: 處於通常（或正確）的位置
results.example1: The chairs are all in place. 椅子都擺在合適的地方。
results.example2: He screwed the shelf in place. 他把架子釘在合適的位置。

results.name: I tumbled down
results.english: to fall quickly and without control
results.example1: I lost my footing and tumbled down the stairs. 我一失足從樓梯上滾了下來。
results.example2: At any moment the whole building could tumble down. 整幢建築隨時有可能倒塌。

results.name: implode
results.english: to fall towards the inside with force
results.example1: The vacuum inside the tube caused it to implode when the external air pressure was increased. 隨著外部氣壓的增加，管內真空使管中發生內爆。

results.name: prudent
results.english: careful and avoiding risks
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] It's always prudent to read a contract carefully before signing it. 簽合約前先好好看一下，這樣做永遠都是明智的。

results.name: a lenient judge
results.english: not as severe or strong in punishment or judgment as would be expected
results.chinese: （處罰或判決）寬容的，寬大的，從輕的
results.example1: They believe that judges are too lenient with terrorist suspects. 他們認為法官對恐怖嫌疑分子過於寬容。
results.example2: In view of the quantity of drugs involved, 16 years was the most lenient sentence (= punishment) the judge could impose. 就涉及的毒品數量而言，16年徒刑已是法官所能作出的最輕判決了。

results.name: stance
results.english: a way of thinking about something, especially expressed in a publicly stated opinion
results.example1: The doctor's stance on the issue of abortion is well known. 這位醫生在墮胎問題上的立場眾人皆知。

results.name: household
results.english: a group of people, often a family, who live together
results.example1: By the 1960s, most households had a TV. 到了20世紀60年代，絕大多數家庭都擁有電視。
results.example2: household expenses 家庭開支

results.name: Dow Jones, the Dow
results.english: an index (= a system for comparing values) of the prices of shares in the 30 most important companies on the New York Stock Exchange

results.name: turbulent
results.english: involving a lot of sudden changes, arguments, or violence
results.chinese: 騷亂的，騷動的；動盪的，混亂的
results.example1: a turbulent marriage 吵吵鬧鬧的婚姻
results.example2: This has been a turbulent week for the administration. 對政府來講，這是動盪多事的一週。

results.name: sell-off
results.english: a sale of an unwanted business at a low price to encourage someone to buy it

results.name: intrastate
results.english: within one state, especially in the US
results.example1: The airline offers the only existing intrastate commercial air service in the state.
results.example2: intrastate commerce/markets/revenue

results.name: in the midst of sth
results.english: in the middle of an event, situation, or activity
results.example1: I'm sorry but I'm too busy - I'm in the midst of writing a report. 恐怕我太忙了——我正在寫一份報告。
results.example2: The country is in the midst of an economic crisis. 這個國家正在經歷一場經濟危機。

results.name: in lieu (of)
results.english: instead (of)
results.example1: He worked on Sunday and took Monday off in lieu. 他周日工作，這樣週一可以休息。
results.example2: They gave some books in lieu of payment for the work I did. 對我做的這些工作，他們給了我一些書作為報酬而不是付錢。

results.name: circadian clock
results.english: used to describe the processes in animals and plants that happen naturally during a 24-hour period
results.chinese: （動植物的）晝夜的，約一日的，約24小時的（節律，週期）
results.example1: Our circadian clock makes it difficult to sleep during the day. 晝夜生理時鐘讓我們很難在白天睡覺。

results.name: contentious
results.english: causing or likely to cause disagreement
results.chinese: 有爭議的；引起爭論的；可能引發爭議的
results.example1: a contentious decision/policy/issue/subject 有爭議的決定／政策／問題／話題
results.example2: She has some very contentious views on education. 她對教育持有一些頗具爭議的看法。

results.name: annual compensation
results.english: the combination of money and other benefits (= rewards) that an employee receives for doing their job
results.chinese: 報酬（僱員獲得的金錢和其他福利的總和）
results.example1: Annual compensation for our executives includes salary and bonus under our incentive plan. 我們的高級管理人員獲得的年度報酬包括工資以及按獎勵計劃發放的獎金。

results.name: chronicler
results.english: a person who writes descriptions of historical events as they happen
results.example1: He was a photographer and chronicler of life in the poorest neighbourhoods at the end of the 19th century.
results.example2: Medieval chroniclers worked from monasteries and royal courts, setting down what seemed to be the most important events of the day.

results.name: brownstone
results.english: a house with its front built of a reddish-brown stone, especially common in New York City
results.chinese: （尤指多見於紐約的）外牆為褐沙石的房屋

results.name: she peered through the window
results.english: to look carefully or with difficulty
results.example1: When no one answered the door, she peered through the window to see if anyone was there. 沒有人開門，她就費力地透過窗戶往裡望去，看是否有人在。
results.example2: The driver was peering into the distance trying to read the road sign. 司機費力地看著遠方，想要看清路標。

results.name: crouch
results.english: to bend your knees and lower yourself so that you are close to the ground and leaning forward slightly
results.example1: She saw him coming and crouched (down) behind a bush. 看見他來了，她便蜷伏在一簇灌木叢後面。

results.name: voyeur
results.english: a person who gets sexual pleasure from secretly watching other people in sexual situations, or (more generally) a person who watches other people's private lives
results.example1: I felt like a voyeur visiting the war zone and seeing badly injured people being dragged from their bomb-shattered homes. 我在戰區看到身受重傷的人們被從炸毀的家園中拖出來時，感覺自己就像個偷窺者。

results.name: a secluded house
results.english: quiet, private, and not near people, roads, or buildings
results.example1: a secluded beach 僻靜的海灘
results.example2: a secluded house in the forest 森林裡一所僻靜的房子

results.name: foolproof
results.english: (of a plan or machine) so simple and easy to understand that it is unable to go wrong or be used wrongly
results.chinese: （計劃或機器）連傻子都懂的，操作簡便的，萬無一失的
results.example1: I don't believe there's any such thing as a foolproof system for making money. 我認為不存在任何萬無一失的賺錢方法。
results.example2: This new DVD player is supposed to be foolproof. 台新的光碟播放機應該是傻瓜型的。

results.name: placard
results.english: a large piece of card, paper, etc. with a message written or printed on it, often carried in public places by people who are complaining about something
results.example1: Demonstrators marched past holding/waving placards that said Send food, not missiles! 示威者舉著／揮動著標語牌遊行，上面寫著「要食物，不要飛彈」。

results.name: anchor
results.english: to make something or someone stay in one position by fastening him, her, or it firmly
results.chinese: 把…繫住（或紮牢）；使穩固，使固定
results.example1: We anchored ourselves to the rocks with a rope. 我們用繩子把自己固定在岩石上。

results.name: hormone
results.english: any of various chemicals made by living cells that influence the development, growth, sex, etc. of an animal and are carried around the body in the blood
results.example1: male and female hormones 雄性和雌性激素
results.example2: growth hormones 生長激素

results.name: inhibit
results.english: to slow down a process or the growth of something
results.example1: This drug inhibits the growth of tumours. 這種藥可以抑制腫瘤的生長。

results.name: berserk
results.english: very angry or out of control
results.example1: My mother will go berserk (= be extremely angry) when she finds out I've ruined her favourite dress. 如果我媽發現我弄壞了她最喜歡的裙子，她一定會氣瘋的。

results.name: bang-up
results.english: very good or excellent
results.chinese: 極好的；一流的；極出色的
results.example1: She did a bang-up job. 她做得漂亮極了。

results.name: televise
results.english: to show or broadcast on television
results.chinese: 用電視播放，在電視上播出
results.example1: The match will be televised live (= shown as it is being played) on BBC Scotland. 這場比賽將由英國廣播公司蘇格蘭電視台進行實況轉播。

results.name: insofar as
results.english: to the degree that

results.name: high-pitched
results.english: A high-pitched noise is high and sometimes also loud or unpleasant.
results.example1: the high-pitched scream of the fire alarm 火災報警器的尖厲響聲

results.name: louver
results.english: a door or window with flat sloping pieces of wood, metal, or glass across it to allow light and air to come in while keeping rain out

results.name: associate...with
results.english: to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else
results.chinese: 將…（與…）聯繫起來，把…聯繫在一起
results.example1: Most people associate this brand with good quality. 大多數人把這個品牌和優良品質聯繫在一起。

results.name: supreme
results.english: having the highest rank, level, or importance
results.chinese: （等級、水準或重要性）最高（的），至高無上（的）
results.example1: the Supreme Court 最高法院
results.example2: The country's present constitution gives supreme authority to the presidency. 現行憲法賦予總統至高無上的權力。

results.name: repatriate
results.english: to send or bring someone, or sometimes money or other property, back to the country that he, she, or it came from
results.chinese: 將…遣返回國；寄（錢）回國，將（資金等）調回本國
results.example1: The government repatriated him because he had no visa. 他沒有簽證，所以被政府遣送回國。

results.name: presumptive
results.english: believed to be something, or likely to be true, based on the information that you have
results.chinese: 可據以推定的；推測為真的
results.example1: presumptive signs of pregnancy 懷孕的預征

results.name: tension
results.english: a feeling of fear or anger between two groups of people who do not trust each other
results.chinese: （互不信任的人群之間的）緊張關係；緊張局勢
results.example1: ethnic/racial tension 民族／種族間的緊張關係
results.example2: There are growing tensions between the two countries. 兩國間的關係日益緊張。

results.name: flare up
results.english: When something bad such as violence, pain, or anger flares (up), it suddenly starts or gets much worse.
results.chinese: （暴力、疼痛或憤怒）爆發，突發，加劇
results.example1: Violence flared up again last night. 昨晚再次爆發暴力事件。
results.example2: Tempers flared after a three-hour delay at the Airport yesterday. 昨天機場三小時的航班延誤引得群情激憤。

results.name: fusillade
results.english: a large number of bullets fired at the same time or one after another very quickly
results.example1: a fusillade of automatic fire 自動武器的火力齊射
results.example2: (formal figurative) A fusillade (= sudden large amount) of questions greeted the president at this afternoon's press conference. 在今天下午的新聞發布會上，總統遭到了連珠炮一般的提問。

results.name: shade
results.english: to prevent direct light from shining on something
results.example1: I shaded my eyes from the glare of the sun. 我遮住眼睛，避開刺眼的陽光。
results.example2: The broad avenues are shaded by splendid trees. 寬闊的大道蔭庇在大樹下。

results.name: morally reprehensible
results.english: If someone's behaviour is reprehensible, it is extremely bad or unacceptable.
results.chinese: 應受斥責的；應受指責的；不道德的
results.example1: reprehensible conduct/actions 應受指責的行為／行動

results.name: companion
results.english: a person you spend a lot of time with often because you are friends or because you are travelling together
results.example1: The dog has been her constant companion these past ten years. 在過去的這十年裡，這隻狗一直與她形影不離。
results.example2: a travelling companion 旅伴

results.name: jaded
results.english: not having interest or losing interest because you have experienced something too many times
results.example1: Flying is exciting the first time you do it, but you soon become jaded. 第一次坐飛機你會很興奮，但很快你就會厭倦了。
results.example2: Perhaps some caviar can tempt your jaded palate. 也許來些魚子醬能讓沒有食慾的你胃口大開。

results.name: a strong urge
results.english: a strong wish, especially one that is difficult or impossible to control
results.chinese: （尤指難以或無法控制的）慾望，衝動
results.example1: The two of them seem unable to control their sexual urges. 他們兩個似乎慾火焚身。
results.example2: [ + to infinitive ] The urge to steal is very strong in some of these young men. 這些年輕人中有很多人都有很強的偷竊慾望。

results.name: hold out
results.english: If a supply of something such as food or money holds out, there is enough of it to last for a particular period of time.

results.name: compound
results.english: an area surrounded by fences or walls that contains a group of buildings
results.example1: The gates opened and the troops marched into their compound. 大門開了，部隊進入他們的大院。
results.example2: The embassy compound has been closed to the public because of a bomb threat. 因受到炸彈威脅，使館區停止對公眾開放。

results.name: the government is crumbling
results.english: to become weaker in strength or influence
results.chinese: （力量和影響力）減弱，崩潰，瓦解，敗落
results.example1: Support for the government is crumbling. 對政府的支持日漸減少。

results.name: temptation
results.english: the wish to do or have something that you know you should not do or have
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] As a young actress, she resisted the temptation to move to Hollywood. 作為一名年輕女演員，她抵擋住了前往好萊塢的誘惑。

results.name: ingrained
results.english: (of beliefs) so firmly held that they are not likely to change
results.example1: Such ingrained prejudices cannot be corrected easily. 如此根深蒂固的偏見是不容易糾正的。
results.example2: The belief that you should own your house is deeply ingrained in our society. 在我們的社會中，應該擁有自己的住房這一觀念根深蒂固。

results.name: permeate
results.english: to spread through something and be present in every part of it
results.example1: Dissatisfaction with the government seems to have permeated every section of society. 社會的每一個角落似乎都瀰漫著對政府的不滿。
results.example2: A foul smell of stale beer permeated the whole building. 整棟樓都散發著變質啤酒的臭味。

results.name: punctuation
results.english: (the use of) special symbols that you add to writing to separate phrases and sentences to show that something is a question, etc.
results.chinese: 標點符號；標點符號用法
results.example1: His letter was completely without punctuation. 他的信裡一個標點符號也沒有。

results.name: pedant
results.english: a person who is too interested in formal rules and small details that are not important

results.name: primitive
results.english: relating to human society at a very early stage of development, with people living in a simple way without machines or a writing system
results.example1: primitive man 原始人
results.example2: The spiny anteater is a mammal, although a very primitive one. 針鼴屬於哺乳動物，儘管是非常原始的一種。

results.name: cognitive
results.english: connected with thinking or conscious mental processes
results.chinese: 感知的；認知的；認識力的
results.example1: Some of her cognitive functions have been impaired. 她的部分認知能力受到了損害。
results.example2: cognitive behaviour/development 認知行為／認知發展

results.name: plausible
results.english: seeming likely to be true, or able to be believed
results.example1: a plausible explanation/excuse 貌似有理的解釋／藉口

results.name: puberty
results.english: the stage in people's lives when they develop from a child into an adult because of changes in their body that make them able to have children
results.example1: At puberty, pubic hair develops and girls begin to menstruate. 青春期時，陰毛開始生長，女孩開始月經來潮。

results.name: beckon
results.english: to move your hand or head in a way that tells someone to come nearer
results.example1: Hey you! she called, beckoning me over with her finger. 「嘿，我在叫你呢！」她喊道，並用手指示意我過去。
results.example2: He beckoned to me, as if he wanted to speak to me. 他給我打手勢，好像是要跟我說甚麼。

results.name: pubic
results.english: of or near the sexual organs on the outside of a person's body
results.example1: pubic hair 陰毛
results.example2: the pubic area 陰部

results.name: fixation
results.english: the state of being unable to stop thinking about something or someone, or an unnaturally strong interest in something or someone
results.example1: Liz has a fixation with food. 莉茲有戀食癖。
results.example2: a mother fixation 戀母情結

results.name: notoriety
results.english: the state of being famous for something bad
results.example1: He achieved/gained notoriety for being difficult to work with as an actor. 他獲得了最難合作的演員的惡名。

results.name: a misgiving about
results.english: a feeling of doubt or worry about a future event
results.example1: Many teachers expressed serious misgivings about the new tests. 許多教師表示對新的考試非常擔憂。
results.example2: My only misgiving is that we might not have enough time to do the job well. 我唯一擔心的是我們可能沒有足夠的時間把這項工作做好。

results.name: a sociopath
results.english: a person who is completely unable or unwilling to behave in a way that is acceptable to society
results.example1: I'm telling you he's a complete/total sociopath. 我告訴你，他是個徹底的反社會分子。

results.name: pleasingly
results.english: 喜歡地，滿意地；
results.chinese: in a way that gives a sense of enjoyment or satisfaction
results.example1: pleasingly smooth/soft
results.example2: Put the food on the platter and arrange it pleasingly.

results.name: a plump woman
results.english: having a pleasantly soft, rounded body or shape
results.example1: a nice plump chicken 肥嫩多肉的小雞
results.example2: a child with plump rosy cheeks 兩頰胖乎乎、紅通通的小孩

results.name: be of French extraction
results.english: to be from a family that originally came from another country

results.name: holler
results.english: to shout loudly
results.example1: He was hollering something about seeing a snake. 他叫喊著說看到了一條蛇。

results.name: distaste
results.english: a dislike of something that you find unpleasant or unacceptable
results.example1: His distaste for publicity of any sort is well known. 眾所周知，他不喜歡任何形式的宣傳。
results.example2: She looked at the advertisement with distaste before walking quickly on. 她厭惡地看了看那個廣告，然後快步走開了。

results.name: cynical
results.english: believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere
results.chinese: 憤世嫉俗的；懷疑人之真誠的；認為人皆自私的
results.example1: She has a pretty cynical view of men. 她對男人的態度太過偏激。
results.example2: I've always been deeply cynical about politicians. 我對政客們總是嗤之以鼻。

results.name: implicate
results.english: to show that someone is involved in a crime or partly responsible for something bad that has happened
results.example1: Have they any evidence to implicate him in the robbery? 他們有證據證明他涉嫌搶劫案嗎？

results.name: hi is an accessory
results.english: someone who helps another person to commit a crime but does not take part in it
results.example1: an accessory to murder 謀殺案的同謀

results.name: sth was stashed
results.english: to store or hide something, especially a large amount
results.chinese: 存放，藏匿（尤指大量物品）
results.example1: The stolen pictures were stashed (away) in a warehouse. 失竊的畫被藏匿在一個倉庫裡。

results.name: sack
results.english: a large bag made of strong cloth, paper, or plastic, used to store large amounts of something
results.chinese: 大布袋；麻袋；大紙袋；大塑膠袋
results.example1: The corn was stored in large sacks. 玉米裝在大麻袋裡。
results.example2: a sack of potatoes/coal/flour 一袋馬鈴薯／煤／麵粉

results.name: groin
results.english: the place where your legs meet the front of your body
results.example1: He pulled a muscle in his groin. 他腹股溝一處肌肉拉傷。
results.example2: a groin strain 大腿根拉傷

results.name: statute of limitation
results.english: a law that has been formally approved and written down
results.example1: statute of limitation 法律追溯期

results.name: they were indicted
results.english: If a law court or a grand jury indicts someone, it accuses them officially of a crime.
results.example1: He was indicted on drug charges at Snaresbrook Crown Court. 在斯奈爾斯布魯克刑事法庭他被起訴犯有與毒品有關的罪行。
results.example2: US Five people were indicted for making and selling counterfeit currency. 五人因製售假鈔被起訴。

results.name: divulge
results.english: to make something secret known
results.example1: Journalists do not divulge their sources. 記者們不會透露消息來源。
results.example2: [ + question word ] The CEO refused to divulge how much she earned. 執行長拒絕透露她的收入。

results.name: memorabilia
results.english: objects that are collected because they are connected with a person or event that is thought to be very interesting
results.example1: an auction of pop memorabilia 通俗藝術紀念品的拍賣
results.example2: Beatles memorabilia 披頭四樂隊紀念品

results.name: a braggart
results.english: someone who proudly talks a lot about himself or herself and his or her achievements or possessions

results.name: skepticism
results.english: doubt that something is true or useful
results.example1: The company's environmental claims have been greeted/regarded/treated with skepticism by conservationists.
results.example2: Some of the workers expressed skepticism at first and said they wanted to take a close look at the contract.

results.name: strangle
results.english: to kill someone by pressing their throat so that they cannot breathe
results.example1: She had been strangled with her own scarf and her body dumped in the woods. 她被人用她自己的圍巾勒死，棄屍於樹林裡。

results.name: fall/slip through the cracks
results.english: to not be noticed or dealt with by a system
results.chinese: 不被注意，遭遺漏，被遺忘
results.example1: Too many young people slip through the cracks in the healthcare system. 無數的年輕人被醫療保健系統忽略。

results.name: recount the story of...
results.english: to describe how something happened, or to tell a story
results.example1: He recounted his adventures since he had left home. 他講述了離家以後的很多奇遇。
results.example2: [ + question word ] He was fond of recounting how he had played professional football when he was 19. 他對自己19歲時在職業隊踢球的經歷津津樂道。

results.name: level
results.english: to make a surface flat
results.example1: Level the wet cement before it sets. 在水泥凝固前把它抹平。

results.name: demolition
results.english: the act of destroying something such as a building
results.example1: the demolition of dangerous buildings 拆除危險建築

results.name: redemption
results.english: (especially in Christianity) an occasion when someone is saved from evil, suffering, etc.
results.chinese: （尤指基督教的）拯救，贖罪，救贖

results.name: scribble
results.english: a careless piece of writing or drawing
results.example1: What are all these scribbles doing on the wallpaper? 牆紙上這些亂塗的東西是什麼？
results.example2: I hope you can read my scribble! 我希望你能看懂我的潦草字跡！

results.name: a deed
results.english: a legal document that is an official record of an agreement or official proof that someone owns land or a building
results.chinese: （土地或建築的）契約，所有權證書

results.name: discrepancy
results.english: a difference between two things that should be the same
results.example1: There is some discrepancy between the two accounts. 這兩份帳單之間有一些出入。
results.example2: The committee is reportedly unhappy about the discrepancy in numbers. 據說委員會對數字不一致很不滿。

results.name: in-house
results.english: Something that is done in-house is done within an organization or business by its employees rather than by other people.
results.chinese: 在組織內部的；在機構內部的
results.example1: an in-house training scheme 內部訓練計劃
results.example2: All our advertising material is designed in-house. 我們所有的廣告材料都是由內部設計的。

results.name: lingo
results.english: a type of language that contains a lot of unusual or technical expressions
results.example1: internet lingo 網際網路術語

results.name: vet
results.english: to examine something or someone carefully to make certain that they are acceptable or suitable
results.example1: During the war, the government vetted all news reports before they were published. 戰爭期間，所有新聞報道在發表之前要接受政府的審查。
results.example2: The bank carefully vets everyone who applies for an account. 銀行對每個申請開通帳戶的人都進行仔細的審核。

results.name: the figures bode ill for the company's future
results.english: to be a sign of something that will happen in the future, usually something very good or bad
results.example1: These recently published figures bode ill/do not bode well for the company's future. 最近公佈的數字預示著公司的前景不妙。
results.example2: The hurricane bodes disaster for those areas in its path. 颶風預示著將給所經過的地區帶來災難。

results.name: sore
results.english: painful and uncomfortable because of injury, infection, or too much use
results.example1: All the dust has made my eyes sore. 灰塵使我的眼睛酸痛。
results.example2: My feet were sore with all the walking. 走了這麽多的路，我的腳很痛。

results.name: suburb
results.english: an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live
results.example1: Box Hill is a suburb of Melbourne. 博士山屬於墨爾本的近郊住宅區。
results.example2: We drove from middle-class suburbs to a very poor inner-city area. 我們從中產階級的近郊住宅區驅車前往市中心的貧民區。

results.name: crucify
results.english: to severely punish or damage someone or something
results.chinese: 嚴懲；折磨 (原意是把sb釘在十字架上)
results.example1: He's going to crucify me when he finds out what I've done! 等他發現了我的所作所爲會狠狠懲罰我的！

results.name: obituary
results.english: a report, especially in a newspaper, that gives the news of someone's death and details about their life

results.name: adamant
results.english: impossible to persuade, or unwilling to change an opinion or decision
results.chinese: 固執的；堅決的，堅定不移的
results.example1: [ + that ] I've told her she should stay at home and rest but she's adamant that she's coming. 我告訴過她應該在家裡休息，可她堅持要來。

results.name: ponder
results.english: to think carefully about something, especially for a noticeable length of time
results.example1: She sat back for a minute to ponder her next move in the game. 她在椅背上靠了一會兒，思考下一步棋該怎麼走。

results.name: sideways
results.english: in a direction to the left or right, not forwards or backwards
results.example1: The fence is leaning sideways. 柵欄向一邊傾斜。
results.example2: If you would move sideways to the left, I can get everyone in the picture. 如果你能向左移一點，我就可以把所有人都拍進照片裡。

results.name: vilify
results.english: to say or write unpleasant things about someone or something, in order to cause other people to have a bad opinion of them
results.example1: He was vilified by the press as a monster. 他被新聞界醜化成一個變態的怪物。

results.name: obscene
results.english: offensive, rude, or shocking, usually because of being too obviously related to sex or showing sex
results.chinese: 猥褻的；淫穢的；下流的；粗俗的
results.example1: In the raid, police found several boxes of obscene DVDs. 警方在這次突擊搜查中發現了幾箱淫穢光碟。
results.example2: He was jailed for making obscene phone calls (= ones in which unwanted sexual suggestions were made to the listener). 他因撥打色情騷擾電話而入獄。

results.name: drag
results.english: something that is not convenient and is boring or unpleasant
results.example1: Filling in forms is such a drag! 填寫這些表格真麻煩！
results.example2: I've got to go to the dentist again - what a drag! 我還得去看牙醫——真麻煩！

results.name: hatchet
results.english: a small axe (= tool with a blade that cuts when you hit things with it)

results.name: court
results.english: to try to get something, especially attention or support from other people
results.chinese: 求取，設法取得（尤指注意或支持）
results.example1: She courts publicity by inviting journalists to extravagant parties. 她邀請新聞記者參加奢華派對來謀求曝光率。

results.name: be critical of
results.english: saying that someone or something is bad or wrong
results.chinese: 批評的；批判的；挑剔的；謹嚴的
results.example1: a critical report 批判性的報道
results.example2: The report is highly critical of safety standards at the factory. 這篇報道尖銳地批評了那家工廠的安全標準。

results.name: sanitize
results.english: to change something in order to make it less strongly expressed, less harmful, or less offensive
results.chinese: 淨化；消除…中過激（或有害、令人不快的）內容
results.example1: The military wants to allow only a sanitized report/version of the incident to become public. 有關該事件，軍方希望只公開經過文飾的報。

results.name: blab to
results.english: to talk carelessly or too much, often telling others something you should keep secret
results.example1: Someone blabbed to the press. 有人向新聞界洩露了情況。

results.name: delve into
results.english: to search, especially as if by digging, in order to find a thing or information
results.example1: She delved into her pocket to find some change.
results.example2: 她伸手到口袋裡找零錢。

results.name: trip (sb) up
results.english: to fall because you hit your foot on something, or to make someone fall by putting your foot in front of the other person's foot
results.example1: I'm terribly sorry. I didn't mean to trip you up. 實在對不起，我不是有意要絆倒你的。
results.example2: She tripped up on the rug. 她在小地毯上絆了一下。

results.name: demonize
results.english: to try to make someone or a group of people seem as if they are evil
results.example1: The Nazis used racist propaganda in an attempt to demonize the Jews. 納粹試圖利用種族主義宣傳將猶太人妖魔化。

results.name: invoke
results.english: to use a law in order to achieve something, or to mention something in order to explain something or to support your opinion or action
results.example1: Police can invoke the law to regulate access to these places. 警方可以借助有關法律來約束人們進入這些地方。

results.name: grievance
results.english: a complaint or a strong feeling that you have been treated unfairly
results.chinese: 不平，委屈；不滿，抱怨，牢騷
results.example1: A special committee has been appointed to handle prisoners' grievances. 已經指派一個特別委員會去處理犯人的不滿情緒。
results.example2: Bill still harbours/nurses a grievance against his employers for not promoting him. 因為沒有得到提升，比爾對他的僱主仍然心懷不滿。

results.name: propaganda
results.english: information, ideas, opinions, or images, often only giving one part of an argument, that are broadcast, published, or in some other way spread with the intention of influencing people's opinions
results.example1: political/wartime propaganda 政治／戰時宣傳
results.example2: At school we were fed communist/right-wing propaganda. 在學校時我們被灌輸了共產主義／右翼思想。

results.name: irate customers
results.english: very angry
results.example1: We have received some irate phone calls from customers. 我們接到了一些顧客打來怒氣沖沖的電話。

results.name: a tirade
results.english: a long, angry speech expressing strong disapproval
results.example1: She launched into an angry/furious tirade about how she had been unfairly treated. 她就自己遭受的不公正對待，進行了長時間的憤怒控訴。
results.example2: In a furious tirade of abuse, the opposition spokesperson demanded the minister's resignation. 在措詞激烈的長篇指責中，反對黨發言人要求這位部長辭職。

results.name: a reconciliation between the two sides
results.english: a situation in which two people or groups of people become friendly again after they have argued
results.example1: It took hours of negotiations to bring about a reconciliation between the two sides. 雙方談了好幾個小時才達成和解。

results.name: cap
results.english: to cover the top of something
results.example1: The mountain was capped with snow. 山頂覆蓋著白雪。
results.example2: have your teeth capped (= protected with an artificial covering) 替你裝上牙套

results.name: a tenuous connection
results.english: A tenuous connection, idea, or situation is weak and possibly does not exist.
results.chinese: （關係、想法、形勢等）不確定的，不明朗的
results.example1: The police have only found a tenuous connection between the two robberies. 我們只能認定這兩樁搶劫案之間可能有某些聯繫。

results.name: shrug sth off
results.english: to treat something as if it is not important or not a problem
results.chinese: 對…滿不在乎；對…不予理睬
results.example1: The stock market shrugged off the economic gloom and rose by 1.5 percent. 股市沒有受到經濟不景氣的影響，上漲了1.5%。
results.example2: You're a father and you can't simply shrug off your responsibility for your children. 你是一位父親，不能推卸對孩子們的責任。

results.name: be attuned to the needs of children
results.english: able to understand or recognize something
results.example1: A good nurse has to be attuned to the needs of his or her patients. 一名優秀的護士應該對其病人的需求心領神會。
results.example2: A mother's ears are attuned to even the slightest variation in her baby's breathing. 母親對寶寶的呼吸聲中哪怕是最細微的變化，都能敏銳地察覺出來。

results.name: infectious
results.english: able to pass a disease from one person, animal, or plant to another
results.chinese: （人或動植物）傳染的，具傳染性的
results.example1: an infectious patient 傳染病病人
results.example2: After the 21-day isolation period, Ebola survivors are no longer infectious. 經過21天的隔離期以後，伊波拉病毒倖存者不再具有傳染性。

results.name: concede
results.english: to admit, often unwillingly, that something is true
results.example1: [ + (that) ] The government has conceded (that) the new tax policy has been a disaster. 政府承認新的稅收政策是徹底失敗的。
results.example2: [ + speech ] Well okay, perhaps I was a little hard on her, he conceded. 「好吧，也許我對她是有點苛刻，」他承認道。

results.name: be cautious about sth
results.english: Someone who is cautious avoids risks.
results.chinese: 謹慎的，細心的，小心翼翼的
results.example1: He's a cautious driver. 他開車很小心。

results.name: nonetheless
results.english: despite what has just been said or done
results.example1: There are serious problems in our country. Nonetheless, we feel this is a good time to return. 我們國家存在嚴重問題。但儘管如此，我們仍然覺得這是歸國的好時機。

results.name: quell
results.english: to stop something, especially by using force
results.chinese: （尤其指透過武力）制止，平息；鎮壓
results.example1: Police in riot gear were called in to quell the disturbances/unrest. 身穿防暴裝的員警奉命前來平息騷亂。
results.example2: This latest setback will have done nothing to quell the growing doubts about the future of the club. 最近一次的挫折對消除人們對俱樂部前景與日俱增的疑慮沒有一點好處。

results.name: fixated
results.english: unable to stop thinking about something
results.example1: a nation fixated on the past 固戀過去的國家
results.example2: He became fixated with his best friend's wife. 他對摯友的妻子異常思戀。

results.name: she's fretting about ...
results.english: to be nervous or worried
results.example1: Don't fret - I'm sure he's OK. 別發愁——他肯定沒事。
results.example2: She spent the day fretting about/over what she'd said to Nicky. 她為對尼基說的話而擔心了一整天。

results.name: call a truce
results.english: a short interruption in a war or argument, or an agreement to stop fighting or arguing for a period of time
results.chinese: 講和（協議）；休戰，停戰（協定）
results.example1: After years of rivalry the two companies have agreed (US agreed to) a truce. 經過多年的競爭，兩家公司同意握手言和。
results.example2: We've got to spend the weekend together, so we might as well call (= have) a truce. 我們必須在一起過週末，所以最好還是講和。

results.name: folly
results.english: the fact of being stupid, or a stupid action, idea, etc.
results.chinese: 愚蠢；愚蠢的行為（或念頭等）
results.example1: She said that the idea was folly. 她說這是個愚蠢的主意。
results.example2: [ + to infinitive ] It would be folly for the country to become involved in the war. 那個國家要是參戰的話實屬愚蠢之舉。

results.name: a let-up
results.english: a pause or reduction in something, usually something bad
results.example1: The airline authorities are not expecting a let-up in delays (= are not expecting delays to stop) for the rest of the summer. 航空公司方面預計今年夏季航班延誤的情況依然會出現。

results.name: intensify
results.english: to become greater, more serious, or more extreme, or to make something do this
results.example1: Fighting around the capital has intensified in the last few hours. 首都周圍的戰鬥在過去的幾小時裡變得更加激烈。

results.name: profound impact
results.english: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
results.chinese: 強烈的(影響)；極度的(悲痛)
results.example1: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profound effect on him. 他六歲時母親的過世對他的影響很大。
results.example2: Those two lines of poetry express perfectly the profound sadness of loss. 那兩行詩貼切表達了失去親人的深切悲痛。

results.name: discontent
results.english: a feeling of wanting better treatment or an improved situation
results.example1: Discontent among junior ranks was rapidly spreading. 下級軍官的不滿情緒正在迅速蔓延。
results.example2: There was widespread discontent at/about/over/with the plan. 人們對該計劃普遍感到不滿。

results.name: caste
results.english: a system of dividing Hindu society into classes, or any of these classes
results.example1: the caste system 種姓制度

results.name: some slurs
results.english: a remark that criticizes someone and is likely to have a harmful effect on their reputation
results.example1: Her letter contained several outrageous slurs against/on her former colleagues. 她信裡有好幾處內容在肆意詆毀以前同事。
results.example2: His comments cast a slur on the integrity of his employees. 他的評論是對其員工正直品格的詆毀。

results.name: descend
results.english: to go or come down
results.example1: The path descended steeply into the valley. 這條路很陡，一直通到山谷。
results.example2: Jane descended the stairs. 簡走下了樓梯。

results.name: an inner-city slum
results.english: a very poor and crowded area, especially of a city
results.chinese: （尤指城市中的）貧民窟，棚戶區
results.example1: an inner-city slum 市中心的貧民窟
results.example2: She was brought up in the slums of Lima. 她在利馬的貧民區長大。

results.name: scavenger
results.english: a bird or animal that feeds on dead animals that it has not killed itself

results.name: disproportionate
results.english: too large or too small in comparison to something else, or not deserving its importance or influence
results.chinese: 不成比例的；不相稱的；太大（或太小）的
results.example1: There are a disproportionate number of girls in the class. 這個班裡女孩的人數特別多。
results.example2: The country's great influence in the world is disproportionate to its relatively small size. 該國在世界上的巨大影響力與其相對較小的面積有些不成比例。

results.name: the highest accolade
results.english: praise and approval
results.example1: He's been granted the ultimate accolade - his face on a postage stamp. 他獲得了最高榮譽——他的肖像被印在了郵票上。
results.example2: Her approval was the highest accolade he could receive. 她的嘉許就是他所能得到的最高讚賞。

results.name: scattered
results.english: covering a wide area
results.chinese: 分散的；散佈的；疏疏落落的
results.example1: Toys and books were scattered about/around the room. 房間裡到處都是玩具和書籍。
results.example2: My family is scattered all over the world. 我的家人遍佈世界各地。

results.name: noteworthy
results.english: deserving attention because of being important or interesting
results.example1: a noteworthy example/event 值得注意的實例／事件
results.example2: It is noteworthy that one third of students do not pay any tuition fees. 值得注意的是，1/3的學生不繳納任何學費。

results.name: shun
results.english: to avoid something
results.example1: She has shunned publicity since she retired from acting. 告別舞臺生涯後，她便遠離了大眾的注意。

results.name: doctorate
results.english: the highest degree from a university
results.example1: She has a doctorate in physics from Yale. 她獲得了耶魯大學的物理學博士學位元。

results.name: virology
results.english: the scientific study of viruses and the diseases that they cause

results.name: heist
results.english: a crime in which valuable things are taken illegally and often violently from a place or person
results.example1: a $2 million jewellery heist 涉案價值200萬美元的珠寶搶劫案

results.name: maddening crowds
results.english: making you angry
results.example1: She has a maddening habit of interrupting me when I'm talking to her. 和她說話時她老是打斷我，這個毛病讓我十分惱火。

results.name: crucifix
results.english: a model or picture representing Jesus Christ on a cross
results.chinese: 有耶穌像的十字架；耶穌受難像
results.example1: She always wears a small gold crucifix round her neck. 她脖子上總是掛著一個小小的耶穌受難的金十字架。

results.name: not too shabby
results.english: looking old and in bad condition because of being used for a long time or not being cared for
results.example1: He wore a shabby old overcoat. 他穿著一件破舊的大衣。
results.example2: Her home is a rented one-bedroom apartment in a shabby part of town. 她的住所是一套租來的雅房公寓，位於城裡很差的地段。

results.name: infertile
results.english: An infertile person, animal, or plant cannot have babies, produce young, or produce new plants.
results.chinese: 不能生育的；不結果實的
results.example1: It has been estimated that one in eight couples is infertile. 據估計，每八對夫婦中就有一對不能生育。

results.name: exhale
results.english: to send air out of your lungs
results.chinese: 呼出，吐出（肺中的空氣），呼氣
results.example1: Take a deep breath in then exhale into the mouthpiece. 深呼吸，然後將氣吹入樂器吹口中。

results.name: left in limbo
results.english: an uncertain situation that you cannot control and in which there is no progress or improvement
results.example1: Until we have official permission to go ahead with the plans we're in limbo. 在該計劃得到正式批准之前，我們一直處於停滯狀態。

results.name: a bank vault
results.english: a room, especially in a bank, with thick walls and a strong door, used to store money or valuable things in safe conditions
results.example1: a bank vault 銀行金庫
results.example2: She entered the vault with an armed guard. 她同一名武裝保安一起進入了金庫。

results.name: corner
results.english: to force a person or an animal into a place or situation from which they cannot easily escape
results.chinese: 將（人或動物）逼入困境；使陷入絕境，使走投無路
results.example1: Once the police had cornered her in the basement, she gave herself up. 一旦警察把她困在地下室裡，她便束手就擒了。

results.name: distinct
results.english: clearly noticeable; that certainly exists
results.example1: There's a distinct smell of cigarettes in here. 這裡確實有一股煙味兒。

results.name: chatter
results.english: conversation about things that are not important
results.example1: I can't concentrate with Ann's constant chatter. 安一直嘮嘮叨叨，我沒法集中精神。

results.name: whimper
results.english: (especially of an animal) to make a series of small, weak sounds, expressing pain or unhappiness
results.chinese: （尤指動物因疼痛或不高興而）嗚咽，抽泣
results.example1: A half-starved dog lay in the corner, whimpering pathetically. 一隻餓得半死的狗趴在角落裡，可憐地嗚咽著。
results.example2: I said she couldn't have an ice cream and she started to whimper. 我說不給她買霜淇淋吃，她就開始抽聲哭泣。

results.name: wail
results.english: to make a long, high cry, usually because of pain or sadness
results.example1: The women gathered around the coffin and began to wail, as was the custom in the region. 女人們都圍到了棺材旁，開始號啕大哭，當地的風俗就是這樣。
results.example2: [ + speech ] My finger hurts, wailed the child. 「我的手指頭很痛，」那個孩子大哭道。

results.name: muffled
results.english: A muffled sound is quiet or not clear.
results.example1: I could hear muffled voices next door but couldn't make out any words. 我聽到隔壁有人壓低聲音說話，可聽不清說甚麼。
results.example2: The muffled roar of traffic could be heard in the distance. 遠處隱約傳來車輛行駛發出的轟轟聲。

results.name: noble
results.english: belonging to a high social rank in a society, especially by birth
results.example1: a noble family 貴族家庭

results.name: bravado
results.english: a show of courage, especially when unnecessary and dangerous, to make people admire you
results.example1: It was an act of bravado that made him ask his boss to resign. 就是蠻幹逞能的心理促使他要求老闆辭職的。

results.name: defuse
results.english: to make a difficult or dangerous situation calmer by reducing or removing its cause
results.example1: The two groups will meet next week to try to defuse the crisis/situation/tension. 雙方將於下週會面以求緩和危機／局面／緊張局勢。

results.name: topless
results.english: used to describe someone, usually a woman, wearing nothing on the upper part of the body, or something connected with this way of dressing
results.example1: topless dancers/bars/sunbathing 裸露上身的舞女／女招待裸露上身的酒吧／袒胸日光浴
results.example2: Many women now go topless on the beach. 如今許多女人都在海灘上袒露上身。

results.name: rosary
results.english: a string of beads (= little decorative balls) used especially by Roman Catholics and Buddhists to count prayers, or the prayers themselves
results.chinese: （尤指天主教徒和佛教徒用的）念珠；（天主教）玫瑰經；佛經
results.example1: She was saying the rosary. 她正在念經。

results.name: propane
results.english: a gas used as fuel, especially for cooking and heating

results.name: saturated
results.english: completely wet
results.example1: It's pouring down outside - I'm absolutely saturated! 外面下著傾盆大雨——我全身都濕透了！

results.name: he bustled around the house
results.english: to do things in a hurried and busy way
results.example1: Thora bustled around the house, getting everything ready. 托拉在公寓裡忙著把所有東西都準備好。

results.name: petrified
results.english: extremely frightened
results.example1: I stood petrified as the most enormous dog I've ever seen came bounding up to me. 當我平生所見的最大的一隻狗向我撲來的時候，我嚇得呆在那裡一動不動。
results.example2: She's petrified of being on her own in the house at night. 她晚上一個人在家被嚇壞了。

results.name: tourniquet
results.english: a strip of cloth that is tied tightly around an injured arm or leg to stop it bleeding
results.example1: If it continues to bleed, you may have to apply a tourniquet to the limb. 如果流血不止，你可能得在手臂上用止血帶。

results.name: leaflet
results.english: a piece of paper that gives you information or advertises something
results.example1: Demonstrators handed out leaflets to passers-by. 示威者向路人派發傳單。
results.example2: A leaflet about the new bus services came through the door today. 今天從門縫塞進來一張介紹公車新增服務的廣告。

results.name: verbose
results.english: using more words than necessary, and therefore long and boring

results.name: ledge
results.english: a narrow shelf that sticks out from a vertical surface
results.chinese: 壁架，橫檔 (國外窗戶外側下方那個窄窄平台)

results.name: out sick
results.english: if you are out sick, you do not go to work because you are sick
results.example1: About 14% of the New York Police Department were out sick on Sunday.

results.name: a hereditary disease
results.english: (of characteristics or diseases) passed from the genes of a parent to a child, or (of titles and positions in society) passed from parent to a child as a right
results.chinese: （特點或疾病）遺傳的；（稱號或爵位）世襲的
results.example1: a hereditary disease 遺傳性疾病
results.example2: Depression is often hereditary. 憂鬱症常常是遺傳的。

results.name: communist
results.english: relating to communism
results.example1: the Communist Party 共產黨
results.example2: Demonstrators denounce the event as Communist propaganda.

results.name: rumblings
results.english: a sign of anger or disagreement
results.example1: There are rumblings of annoyance throughout the workforce. 員工們普遍流露出怨憤情緒。

results.name: dire
results.english: very serious or extreme
results.example1: These people are in dire need of help. 這些人急需援助。
results.example2: He gave a dire warning that an earthquake was imminent. 他鄭重警告說馬上就要地震了。

results.name: be stretched thin
results.english: to not have enough money, people, supplies, etc. to operate, do a job, or provide what is needed
results.chinese: 忙得暈頭轉向；神經繃得太緊
results.example1: Troops polled say armed forces stretched too thin overseas. 部隊民調顯示，駐派海外的軍隊太操了
results.example2: I realized I've been stretching myself too thin, so I quit my job as an administration assistant. 我發現我忙得暈頭轉向，所以我辭掉了行政助理的工作。

results.name: confluence
results.english: the place where two rivers flow together and become one larger river

results.name: influenza
results.english: formal for flu

results.name: first responder
results.english: someone who is one of the first people to arrive to deal with an emergency, especially a paramedic, police officer, or firefighter
results.example1: First responders like paramedics and firefighters could be entering areas of very dangerous radiation.
results.example2: 999 tapes can reveal a great deal about what happens when police and first responders get called.

results.name: complication
results.english: an extra medical problem that makes it more difficult to treat an existing illness
results.example1: If there are no complications, the doctor says that she'll be able to come home within two weeks. 如果沒有併發症的話，醫生說她兩週內就可以出院了。

results.name: ventilator
results.english: a machine that helps people breathe correctly by allowing air to flow in and out of their lungs
results.example1: He was brought into intensive care shortly after the accident and immediately put on a ventilator. 車禍發生後不久，他就被送進了加護病房，並且馬上戴上了人工呼吸器。

results.name: pacifist
results.english: someone who believes in pacifism
results.chinese: 反戰主義者，和平主義者；綏靖主義者
results.example1: The pacifist movement is gaining increasing support among young people. 和平主義運動正獲得越來越多年輕人的支持。

results.name: scalpel
results.english: a very sharp knife that is used for cutting through skin and flesh during an operation

results.name: vanity
results.english: the fact that you are too interested in your appearance or achievements
results.example1: He wants the job purely for reasons of vanity and ambition. 他想得到那份工作純粹是為了滿足虛榮和野心。

results.name: shrapnel
results.english: small pieces of metal that fly through the air when a bomb or similar weapon explodes and are intended to injure people
results.example1: Twelve people were hit by shrapnel in the attack. 襲擊中共有12人被流彈擊中。
results.example2: a shrapnel wound 彈片傷

results.name: scoundrel
results.english: a person, especially a man, who treats other people very badly and has no moral principles
results.example1: He was, she said, a heartless scoundrel who had stripped her of everything she owned. 她說，他是個狠心的無賴，奪走了屬於她的一切。

results.name: destitute
results.english: without money, food, a home, or possessions
results.chinese: 一無所有的，赤貧的，一貧如洗的
results.example1: The floods left thousands of people destitute. 洪水使數千人一貧如洗。

results.name: metallic
results.english: A metallic sound, appearance, or taste is like metal.
results.chinese: （聲音、外形或味道）有金屬特性的，像金屬的，金屬似的
results.example1: a dull, metallic sound 低沉的金屬聲
results.example2: Beer from a can often has a metallic taste. 罐裝啤酒常有一股金屬味道。

results.name: the nadir of her career
results.english: the worst moment, or the moment of least hope and least achievement
results.chinese: 最糟糕的時刻；最消沉的時刻；最失意的時候；最低點
results.example1: The defeat was the nadir of her career. 那次挫敗是她職業生涯的谷底。

results.name: continual
results.english: happening repeatedly, usually in an annoying or not convenient way
results.chinese: （通常指令人討厭或引起不便地）頻頻的，頻繁的，再三的
results.example1: I've had continual problems with this car ever since I bought it. 自從我買回這車，它就常常出毛病。
results.example2: I'm sorry - I can't work with these continual interruptions. 對不起——干擾不斷，我無法工作。

results.name: a skeptic
results.english: a person who doubts the truth or value of an idea or belief
results.example1: People say it can cure colds, but I'm a skeptic. 人們說它能治感冒，我有些懷疑。
results.example2: to convince the skeptics 說服持懷疑態度的人

results.name: taper off
results.english: to become gradually smaller or weaker, or happen less often
results.example1: Her voice tapered off as she realized everyone was listening. 當她意識到大家都在聽時，她的聲音就越來越小了。
results.example2: Sales have gradually tapered off. 銷售額逐漸下滑。

results.name: influx
results.english: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time
results.example1: Turkey is expecting an influx of several thousand refugees over the next few days. 未來幾天湧入土耳其的難民預計會達幾千人。

results.name: muggy
results.english: When the weather is muggy, it is unpleasantly warm and the air contains a lot of water.

results.name: coincide with
results.english: to happen at or near the same time
results.example1: I timed my holiday to coincide with the children's. 我把我的假期安排在孩子學校放假的時候。
results.example2: If the heavy rain had coincided with an extreme high tide, serious flooding would have resulted. 如果暴雨來臨時潮水洶湧，就會導致嚴重的水災。

results.name: mild
results.english: not violent, severe, or extreme
results.example1: She can't accept even mild criticism of her work. 即使別人對她的作品略有微詞，她也不能接受。
results.example2: He has suffered a mild heart attack - nothing too serious. 他只是輕微的心臟病發作，並不太嚴重。

results.name: a glimmer of light
results.english: a light that glimmers weakly
results.chinese: 閃爍的微光；微弱的亮光
results.example1: We saw a glimmer of light in the distance. 我們看到遠處有一線微光。

results.name: the forefront
results.english: the most noticeable or important position
results.chinese: 最顯要的位置；最重要的地位
results.example1: She was one of the politicians at/in the forefront of the campaign to free the prisoners. 她是身處釋放犯人運動風口浪尖的政治家之一。
results.example2: His team is at the forefront of scientific research into vaccines. 他的小組處於疫苗科研的最前沿。

results.name: boost
results.english: the act of boosting something
results.example1: The lowering of interest rates will give a much-needed boost to the economy. 利率的下調將會給經濟注入急需的推動力。
results.example2: Passing my driving test was such a boost to my confidence. 通過了駕駛執照考試使我自信心大增。

results.name: resurgence
results.english: a new increase of activity or interest in a particular subject or idea that had been forgotten for some time
results.example1: The creation of independent states has led to a resurgence of nationalism. 獨立國家的建立導致了民族主義的復甦。
results.example2: resurgence in demand/popularity/interest 需求的回升／再度流行／重新感興趣

results.name: pre-emptive
results.english: If something is pre-emptive, it is done before other people can act, especially to prevent them from doing something else.
results.chinese: 超前部署的；（尤指）先發制人的
results.example1: The Treasury has decided to raise interest rates as a pre-emptive measure against inflation. 財政部決定加息，以此作為一項防止通貨膨脹的預防性措施。
results.example2: The prime minister authorized a pre-emptive air strike against the rebels. 首相批准了對叛亂分子進行空襲，先發制人。

results.name: thwart
results.english: to stop something from happening or someone from doing something
results.example1: Our holiday plans were thwarted by the airline pilots' strike 因為航空公司機師罷工，我的度假計劃泡湯了。

results.name: in the course of
results.english: the often gradual development of something, or the way something happens, or a way of doing something
results.example1: In the course of (= during) the interview it became clear that he was not the right person for the job. 面試顯示他並不適合這份工作。
results.example2: What would be an appropriate course (of action) in such a situation? 在這種情況下採取甚麽樣的措施才合適呢？

results.name: stringent
results.english: having a very severe effect, or being extremely limiting
results.example1: The most stringent laws in the world are useless unless there is the will to enforce them. 除非能夠堅持嚴格執法，否則即使是世界上最嚴苛的法律也毫無用處。
results.example2: We need to introduce more stringent security measures such as identity cards. 我們需要採取更為嚴格的安全措施，例如發放身份識別卡。

results.name: meal prep container
results.chinese: 自己做菜備餐用的保鮮盒

results.name: rumble
results.english: to make a continuous low sound
results.chinese: 發出隆隆聲；發出轆轆聲；發出低沈連續的響聲
results.example1: Please excuse my stomach rumbling - I haven't eaten all day. 不好意思，我肚子在咕咕叫——我一整天都沒吃東西了。
results.example2: Thunder rumbled in the distance. 雷聲在遠處隆隆作響。

results.name: mediocre
results.english: not very good
results.chinese: 普通的，平庸的，不夠好的
results.example1: The film's plot is predictable and the acting is mediocre. 這部影片的情節都能猜得到，演員的演技也不夠好。
results.example2: Parents don't want their children going to mediocre schools. 家長不想讓自己的孩子上普普通通的學校。

results.name: scrape sth/sb together
results.english: to manage with great difficulty to collect enough of something, especially money, or to find the things or people that you need
results.chinese: 勉強湊足（尤指金錢）；歷經艱難才找到
results.example1: I finally scraped together enough money for a flight home. 我終於湊足了搭機回家的旅費。
results.example2: Do you think we can scrape up a team for Saturday? 你認爲我們可以湊足一支球隊參加星期六的比賽嗎？

results.name: disinfect
results.english: to clean something using chemicals that kill bacteria and other very small living things that cause disease
results.example1: disinfect the toilets/a wound 給廁所／傷口消毒

results.name: denim
results.english: a thick, strong cotton cloth, often blue in colour, used especially for making jeans
results.example1: a denim jacket and jeans 牛仔外套和牛仔褲

results.name: for one last fling
results.english: a short period of enjoyment
results.example1: The girls are going to the beach for one last fling before the end of summer. 姑娘們要去海灘享受夏季結束前最後一段短暫的歡樂時光。

results.name: overhear a conversation
results.english: to hear what other people are saying without intending to and without their knowledge
results.example1: I overheard a very funny conversation on the bus this morning. 今天早上我坐公車時，無意中聽到一段有趣的談話。
results.example2: [ + obj + -ing verb ] He overheard his daughter telling her doll not to be so naughty. 他碰巧聽到女兒對她的毛絨玩具說別那麼淘氣。

results.name: suitor
results.english: a man who wants to marry a particular woman
results.example1: It's the story of a young woman who can't make up her mind which of her many suitors she should marry. 這個故事說的是一位年輕女子拿不定主意該嫁給眾多追求者中的哪一個。

results.name: erotic
results.english: relating to sexual desire and pleasure
results.example1: an erotic film 色情電影
results.example2: erotic dreams/feelings 有關性愛的夢／性衝動的感覺

results.name: mahogany
results.english: a dark red-brown wood used to make furniture
results.example1: a handsome mahogany desk 美觀大方的紅木書桌

results.name: matrimony
results.english: the state of being married

results.name: cork
results.english: a short, cylinder-shaped piece of cork, plastic, or rubber that is put into the top of a bottle, especially a wine bottle, to close it
results.example1: I can't get the cork out of the bottle - can you try? 我拔不出瓶塞——你來試試？

results.name: a terrace
results.english: a flat area of stone or grass outside a house, where people sit and sometimes eat

results.name: undercover
results.english: working secretly using a false appearance in order to get information for the police or government
results.chinese: （爲給員警或政府搜集情報）臥底的，秘密工作的
results.example1: an undercover police operation 警方的秘密行動
results.example2: an undercover detective 便衣偵探，臥底探員

results.name: to rile him
results.english: to make someone angry
results.example1: Don't let her rile you. 不要讓她激怒了你。

results.name: foreplay
results.english: the sexual activity such as kissing and touching that people do before they have sex

results.name: political repression
results.english: the use of force or violence to control a group of people
results.chinese: （尤指透過武力進行的）鎮壓，壓制
results.example1: The political repression in this country is enforced by terror. 這個國家透過恐怖統治來實行政治高壓。

results.name: sewer
results.english: a large pipe, usually underground, that is used for carrying waste water and human waste away from buildings to a place where they can be safely got rid of
results.example1: a sewer pipe 排水管
results.example2: A complicated system of sewers runs under the city. 城市的地底下布有複雜的排水系統。

results.name: a mansion
results.english: a very large, expensive house
results.example1: The street is lined with enormous mansions where the rich and famous live. 街道兩旁是富人及名人的大豪宅。

results.name: marsh
results.english: ground near a lake, a river, or the sea that often floods and is always wet
results.example1: At the mouth of the river is a large area of marsh. 河口處是一大片沼澤地。
results.example2: Rain had been falling steadily all day and the ground had become a marsh. 雨整天下個不停，地面成了一片澤國。

results.name: forensics
results.english: scientific methods of solving crimes, that involve examining objects or substances related to a crime
results.example1: Using cutting-edge forensics, they can analyze material samples for traces of suspicious chemicals.
results.example2: a forensics expert

results.name: defame
results.english: to damage the reputation of a person or group by saying or writing bad things about them that are not true
results.example1: Mr Turnock claimed the editorial had defamed him. 特諾克先生聲稱那篇社論有損他的名譽。

results.name: interrogate
results.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats or violence
results.example1: Thousands of dissidents have been interrogated or imprisoned in recent weeks. 數千名持不同政見者在最近幾周遭到審問或拘禁。

results.name: a rebellious group
results.english: If a group of people are rebellious, they oppose the ideas of the people in authority and plan to change the system, often using force.
results.chinese: （常使用武力）反叛的，造反的，反抗的
results.example1: rebellious groups of southern tribespeople 南方部落／人中的反叛群體

results.name: narcotics
results.english: an illegal drug such as heroin or cocaine
results.chinese: 毒品（如海洛因或古柯鹼）
results.example1: He faces three years in jail for selling narcotics. 他因出售毒品而面臨三年的監禁。

results.name: indecency
results.english: morally offensive behaviour
results.example1: acts of gross indecency 極其下流的動作

results.name: parole board
results.english: permission for a prisoner to be released before their period in prison is finished, with the agreement that they will behave well
results.example1: She hopes to be eligible for parole in three years. 她希望三年後有資格獲假釋。
results.example2: Reynolds was sentenced to life without parole. 雷諾茲被判終身監禁，不得假釋。

results.name: degenerative
results.english: A degenerative illness is one in which the body or a part of the body gradually stops working.
results.example1: a degenerative disease/condition 變性疾病

results.name: opening act
results.english: the preliminary perfor- mance before the main one (for example, opening band at a concert)

results.name: to sit through (sth)
results.english: to endure some- thing you don’t enjoy. It could be that you’re literally sitting, but it can also be used for when you’re standing up.

results.name: word of advice
results.english: a piece of advice

results.name: bang
results.english: to (cause something to) make a sudden very loud noise or noises
results.chinese: 砰砰猛擊，重擊；（使）發出巨響
results.example1: She banged her fist angrily on the table. 她氣憤地一拳打在桌子上。
results.example2: Outside a door was banging in the wind. 外面的一扇門被風吹得砰砰作響。

results.name: through
results.english: having finished using or doing something
results.example1: I've got some work to do but I should be through in an hour if you can wait. 我還有些工作要做，不過一小時內應該可以完成，你看能不能等一下。
results.example2: Are you through with that atlas? 你看完那本地圖冊了嗎？

results.name: fluff sth up
results.english: to make something appear bigger or full of air by hitting or shaking it
results.example1: I'll just fluff up your pillows for you. 我來為你把枕頭拍鬆。
results.example2: ‘to fluff a pillow’ means to give the pillow a more comfortable, rounded shape.

results.name: dread
results.english: to feel extremely worried or frightened about something that is going to happen or that might happen
results.example1: He's dreading the exam - he's sure he's going to fail. 他很擔心考試——他覺得自己肯定過不了。
results.example2: [ + -ing verb ] I'm dreading having to meet his parents. 因為不得不見他的父母，我很害怕。

results.name: veil
results.english: a piece of thin material worn by women to cover the face or head
results.example1: After the ceremony, the bride lifted up her veil to kiss her husband. 儀式過後，新娘撩起面紗親吻她的丈夫。
results.example2: The women wore black veils that covered all but their eyes. 那些女人戴著黑色面紗，把除眼睛之外的所有地方都遮住了。

results.name: to stomp on (sb’s heart)
results.english: to stomp on sth means to step on it with force in order to destroy it. This can be used in a metaphorical sense referring to sb’s heart.

results.name: to have a thing for sb
results.english: to have a crush on someone; to be attracted to someone.

results.name: take the heat off sb
results.english: If someone or something takes the heat off you, he, she, or it reduces the amount of criticism you have to deal with.
results.example1: The deputy's resignation over the scandal has taken some of the heat off his superior. 副手因醜聞而辭職，這使他的上級少受了一些批評。

results.name: chubby
results.english: (especially of children) fat in a pleasant and attractive way
results.chinese: （尤指兒童）圓圓胖胖的，胖乎乎的，豐滿的
results.example1: chubby legs 胖乎乎的腿
results.example2: chubby cheeks 圓嘟嘟的臉蛋

results.name: the folks
results.english: someone's parents
results.example1: I'm going home to see my folks. 我要回家看看我的父母。

results.name: driven
results.english: Someone who is driven is so determined to achieve something or be successful that all of their behaviour is directed towards this aim.
results.chinese: 執著的，鍥而不捨的；奮發努力的
results.example1: Like most of the lawyers that I know, Rachel is driven. 和我認識的大多數律師一樣，瑞秋也是非常執著的。

results.name: steer clear (of sth)
results.english: to keep some dis- tance between you and something (or someone).
results.example1: His parents warned him to steer clear of trouble. 父母告誡他不要惹麻煩。

results.name: (the) chances are
results.english: it’s probably or likely... It’s quite common to ommit the determining article in this phrase. People often say ‘chances are’ instead of ‘the chances are.’
results.example1: Chances are (that) they'll be late anyway. 總之，他們很可能會遲到。

results.name: gag
results.english: to experience the sudden uncomfortable feeling of tightness in the throat and stomach that makes you feel like you are going to vomit
results.example1: Just the smell of liver cooking makes me gag. 用動物肝臟做的菜我一聞就想吐。
results.example2: I tried my best to eat it but the meat was so fatty I gagged on it. 我盡最大的努力想吃了它，但肉太肥了，我還是想吐。

results.name: as in
results.english: for example, to compare

results.name: roll with the punches
results.english: to try to adapt to a difficult situation as there’s no point in trying to fix it because it’s very unlikely we will succeed in doing it.
results.chinese: 渡過一道道難關；克服一連串困難
results.example1: She’s very sad that she broke up with her boyfriend, but she’ll roll with the punches and celebrates her birthday tomorrow.

results.name: maid of honour
results.english: the most important bridesmaid at a marriage ceremony

results.name: it borders on
results.english: it’s almost considered as. We say this when something resembles something else, especially if it’s bad.
results.example1: Her comment bordered on discrimination.

results.name: wind up
results.english: end up, result in a particular way.
results.example1: The first day I ever tried skating I wound up in the hospital.

results.name: well up
results.english: (also: tear up) to slowly start to cry.

results.name: rectum
results.english: the lowest end of the bowels, down which solid waste travels before leaving the body through the anus

results.name: Nordic
results.english: belonging to or relating to Scandinavia, Finland, or Iceland
results.chinese: 來自北歐的；北歐國家的
results.example1: He's a classic Nordic type - tall with blond hair and blue eyes. 他是典型的北歐人——身材高大，金髮藍眼。

results.name: rebuff
results.english: to refuse to accept a helpful suggestion or offer from someone, often by answering in an unfriendly way
results.chinese: 粗暴拒絕；生硬拒絕；斷然拒絕
results.example1: She rebuffed all suggestions that she should resign. 她斷然拒絕了所有勸她辭職的建議。

results.name: the extent of the damage
results.english: area or length; amount
results.example1: From the top of the Empire State Building, you can see the full extent of Manhattan (= the area it covers). 你可以從帝國大廈的頂樓看到曼哈頓全景。
results.example2: We don't yet know the extent of his injuries (= how bad his injuries are). 我們還不知道他的傷勢有多嚴重。

results.name: aggrieved
results.english: unhappy and angry because of unfair treatment
results.chinese: 感到委屈的；憤憤不平的
results.example1: He felt aggrieved at not being chosen for the team. 沒有入選該球隊，他感到很委屈。
results.example2: One aggrieved customer complained that he still hadn't received the book he had ordered several weeks ago. 一位顧客憤憤不平地投訴稱他仍未收到幾週前訂購的書。

results.name: furore
results.english: a sudden excited or angry reaction to something by a lot of people
results.example1: The government's decision to raise taxes has caused a great furore. 政府增稅的決定引起了軒然大波。
results.example2: the furore over his latest film 他新拍的電影引起的轟動

results.name: disinfectant
results.english: a substance that contains chemicals that kill bacteria and is used especially for cleaning surfaces in toilets and kitchens
results.chinese: （尤指用於廁所、廚房表面消毒的）消毒劑，除菌劑

results.name: expat
results.english: Short for expatriate. Someone who does not live in their own country
results.example1: A large community of expatriates has settled there. 已經有一大批僑民在那邊定居了。

results.name: reservist
results.english: a person who is trained as a soldier and is ready to fight in the army if needed
results.chinese: 後備役軍人；預備役軍人

results.name: rack sth up
results.english: to gradually get more points, profits, etc.
results.chinese: 累計（得分或獲利）；累積；聚集
results.example1: He has racked up 450 points in three months. 三個月內，他已經累積了450分。
results.example2: Astronomical profits/losses were racked up by airlines last year. 去年各航空公司累計盈利／虧損達到了天文數字。

results.name: embrace
results.english: to accept something enthusiastically
results.example1: This was an opportunity that he would embrace. 這樣的機會他是求之不得的。

results.name: the newspaper smeared her life
results.english: to publicly accuse someone of something unpleasant, unreasonable, or unlikely to be true in order to harm their reputation
results.example1: She decided to sue for libel after the newspaper smeared her private life. 這家報紙對她的私生活造謠誣衊，她決定告以誹謗罪。

results.name: falsehood
results.english: a lie or a statement that is not correct

results.name: consortium
results.english: an organization of several businesses or banks joining together as a group for a shared purpose
results.chinese: （數家公司或銀行聯合組成的）聯營企業；財團，銀團
results.example1: a consortium of textile manufacturers 紡織企業聯合集團

results.name: outlier
results.english: a person, thing, or fact that is very different from other people, things, or facts, so that it cannot be used to draw general conclusions
results.example1: When you tally up all the votes, those cast by outliers need not be counted. 當你將選票加總的時候，局外人的票數不必計算在內。

results.name: trench
results.english: a narrow hole that is dug into the ground
results.example1: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed. 一名工人在挖壕溝時，由於兩側坍塌而喪生。

results.name: onslaught
results.english: a very powerful attack
results.example1: It is unlikely that his forces could withstand an enemy onslaught for very long. 他的軍隊不大可能長時間抵禦聯軍的強攻。
results.example2: Scotland's onslaught on Wales in the second half of the match earned them a 4–1 victory. 蘇格蘭隊在下半場猛攻威爾斯隊，以4比1贏取勝利。

results.name: funeral rites
results.english: (a usually religious ceremony with) a set of fixed words and actions
results.example1: funeral/marriage/fertility rites 葬禮／婚禮／祈禱人丁興旺的儀式
results.example2: You have to go through an initiation rite before you become a full member. 你得完成入會儀式才能成為正式會員。

results.name: owing to
results.english: because of
results.example1: The concert has been cancelled owing to lack of interest. 由於響應者寥寥，音樂會被取消了。

results.name: outpouring of grief
results.english: an expression of strong feeling that is difficult to control
results.example1: His death at the age of 35 has occasioned an outpouring of grief. 他35歲就英年早逝，令人痛惜不已。

results.name: tribute
results.english: something that you say, write, or give that shows your respect and admiration for someone, especially on a formal occasion
results.chinese: （尤指在正式場合表達敬意的）頌詞，禮物
results.example1: Tributes have been pouring in from all over the world for the famous actor who died yesterday. 昨天這位著名演員去世後，世界各國人士紛紛表示哀悼。
results.example2: floral tributes (= flowers sent to someone's funeral) 葬禮用花

results.name: a letter of condolence
results.english: sympathy and sadness for the family or close friends of a person who has recently died, or an expression of this, especially in written form
results.example1: a letter of condolence 弔唁信
results.example2: Dignitaries from all over the world came to offer their condolences. 世界各國的要人都前來弔唁。

results.name: their names did not figure
results.english: to be, appear, take part, or be included in something
results.example1: Their names did not figure in the list of finalists. 他們的名字沒有出現在決賽選手的名單上。
results.example2: They denied that violence and intimidation had figured prominently in achieving the decision. 他們否認在達成決議的過程中明顯存在暴力和恐嚇手段。

results.name: prolific
results.english: producing a great number or amount of something
results.example1: He was probably the most prolific songwriter of his generation. 他可能是他這一代中最多產的歌曲作家。
results.example2: Rabbits and other rodents are prolific (= have a lot of babies). 兔子和其他囓齒類動物繁殖能力都很強。

results.name: ransom
results.english: a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for someone who has been taken prisoner, or sometimes for an animal
results.example1: a ransom demand/note 索要贖金／勒索贖金的字條
results.example2: They demanded a huge ransom for the return of the little girl whom they had kidnapped. 他們索要钜額贖金作爲放回被綁小女孩的條件。

results.name: a mogul
results.english: an important person who is very rich or powerful
results.example1: movie/media/industry moguls 電影／傳媒／工業巨頭

results.name: stockpile weapons
results.english: to store a large supply of something for future use
results.example1: The rebels have been stockpiling weapons. 叛亂分子一直在儲備武器。

results.name: rancorous
results.english: having or showing a feeling of hate and continuing anger about something in the past
results.example1: a rancorous dispute
results.example2: Government leaders appear increasingly rancorous.

results.name: sexual appetite
results.english: the feeling of wanting or needing something
results.example1: his insatiable sexual appetite 他的性慾無度
results.example2: I've read an excerpt of the book on the Web and it's whetted my appetite (= increased my interest in it). 我在網路上讀了這本書的一個摘錄，結果就把我的胃口吊起來了。

results.name: shattered
results.english: broken into very small pieces
results.example1: Shattered glass lay all over the road. 路上到處都是碎玻璃片。

results.name: timely
results.english: happening at the best possible moment
results.example1: a timely reminder 及時的提醒
results.example2: The change in the exchange rate provided a timely boost to the company's falling profits. 匯率的變動及時緩解了公司利潤下滑的局面。

results.name: economic sanctions
results.english: an official order, such as the stopping of trade, that is taken against a country in order to make it obey international law
results.example1: Many nations have imposed sanctions on the country because of its attacks on its own people. 由於該國發生了對本國人民施暴，許多國家都對其進行制裁。
results.example2: Trade/economic sanctions will only be lifted (= stopped) when the aggressor nation withdraws its troops. 只有侵略國撤軍，貿易／經濟制裁才會解除。

results.name: outpatient
results.english: a person who goes to a hospital for treatment, but who does not stay any nights there
results.example1: an outpatient clinic 門診部

results.name: inpatient
results.english: a person who goes into hospital to receive medical care, and stays there one or more nights while they are being treated

results.name: means
results.english: a method or way of doing something
results.example1: They had no means of communication. 他們沒有通訊方法。
results.example2: We need to find some other means of transportation. 我們需要找其他交通工具了。

results.name: a cosmonaut
results.english: an astronaut (= a person who travels into space) from Russia

results.name: grim
results.english: worrying, without hope
results.chinese: 令人擔憂的，令人沮喪的
results.example1: The future looks grim. 未來一片渺茫。

results.name: pollster
results.english: a person who does opinion polls
results.chinese: 民意調查者，民意測驗經辦人

results.name: annexation
results.english: possession taken of a piece of land or a country, usually by force or without permission
results.example1: The country's annexation of its neighbour caused an outcry.
results.example2: Annexations helped San Jose grow into one of the nation's biggest cities.

results.name: a groundswell of support
results.english: a growth of strong feeling among a large group of people
results.example1: There is a groundswell of opinion against the new rules. 反對這些新規定的呼聲日益高漲。

results.name: succession
results.english: a process in which someone automatically takes an official position or job after someone else
results.example1: His divorce will not prevent the Prince of Wales's succession to the throne. 離婚不會影響威爾士親王繼承王位。
results.example2: North Korea silence on Kim's health raises succession speculation. 北韓對金正恩健康情況不表態，引發接班臆測。

results.name: furlough
results.english: to allow or force someone to be absent temporarily from work
results.example1: After safety concerns, the company furloughed all 4,000 of its employees. 出於安全考慮，該公司強制所有的4000名僱員休假。
results.example2: 60 million Europeans could suffer furloughs, layoffs, or wage cuts. 歐洲恐有6000萬人面臨無薪假、解僱或減薪。

results.name: life form
results.english: any living thing
results.example1: They are searching for intelligent life forms in other solar systems. 他們正在其他太陽系中尋找智慧生物。
results.example2: New Ocean Life-Form Discovered. 印度洋發現神秘新生物

results.name: an expedition
results.english: an organized journey for a particular purpose
results.example1: We're going on a shopping expedition on Saturday. 星期六我們要去購物。
results.example2: Scott died while he was on an expedition to the Antarctic in 1912. 史考特1912年死於南極探險途中。

results.name: stumble upon sth
results.english: to discover something by chance, or to meet someone by chance
results.example1: Workmen stumbled upon the mosaic while digging foundations for a new building. 工人在挖一棟新樓的地基時，偶然發現了那幅鑲嵌畫。
results.example2: A Schmidt Ocean Institute's expedition stumbled upon this giant siphonophore. 施密特海洋研究所的一支探險隊無意間發現這隻巨型管水母。

results.name: organism
results.english: a single living plant, animal, virus, etc.
results.example1: Amoebae and bacteria are single-celled organisms. 變形蟲和細菌是單細胞生物。

results.name: colony
results.english: a group of animals, insects, or plants of the same type that live together
results.chinese: （動物、昆蟲或植物的）群，群落；生物群
results.example1: a colony of ants/termites/bacteria 蟻群／白蟻群／菌落

results.name: drive sth home
results.english: to say something clearly and with a lot of force so that you are certain people understand it
results.chinese: 把…講清楚，使人完全明白
results.example1: She really drove home the message that we need to economize. 她講得很清楚，我們需要節約。
results.example2: The documentary drove home the impact of climate change. 這部紀錄片明確傳達出氣候變遷的衝擊。

results.name: jubilee
results.english: (the celebration of) the day on which an important event happened many years ago
results.chinese: （重要事件的）周年紀念；紀念大慶
results.example1: the Queen's diamond jubilee. 女王登基60周年紀念

results.name: a deserted station
results.english: If a place is deserted, there are no people in it.
results.chinese: 空無一人的，空曠的，空蕩蕩的
results.example1: The coastal resorts are deserted in winter. 冬季海濱勝地遊客稀少。
results.example2: Urban explorers liked to visit the deserted factory. 城市探險家喜歡造訪那座廢棄工廠。

results.name: fill the void
results.chinese: 填補空隙，取代空缺的人事物
results.example1: They tried to describe their attempts to fill the void left by their son's death. 他們竭力想要描述他們曾如何試圖填補兒子死後留下的空虛感。
results.example2: During the coronavirus outbreak, many people are watching esports to fill the void left by professional sports. 在新冠病毒疫情期間，許多人觀看電競比賽來填補職業運動的空缺。

results.name: be to blame for
results.english: to be the reason for something that happens
results.example1: The hot weather is partly to blame for the water shortage. 炎熱的天氣是缺水的原因之一。
