results.example2: Everyone said Philip was to blame for the car accident. 大家都說菲利普是這場車禍的罪魁禍首。

results.name: identical
results.english: exactly the same, or very similar
results.chinese: 完全相同的；極為相似的
results.example1: I've got three identical blue suits. 我有三套完全相同的藍色西裝。
results.example2: The two rooms were virtually identical. 這兩個房間幾乎一模一樣。

results.name: a crossover artist
results.english: used to refer to a musician who has changed to a different style of music, or to their music
results.chinese: （樂師）變換風格的；（音樂）變換風格的
results.example1: a crossover artist/album 改變風格的藝術家／轉型專輯
results.example2: Two researchers from different fields are carrying out a crossover study. 兩名來自不同領域的研究人員正在進行一場跨界研究。

results.name: debunk
results.english: to show that something is less important, less good, or less true than it has been made to appear
results.example1: The writer's aim was to debunk the myth that had grown up around the actress. 作者的目的是為了揭穿圍繞這位女演員的種種傳聞。

results.name: vehicle
results.english: a way of achieving, producing, or expressing something
results.chinese: （實現、產生或表達…的）方法，手段，媒介
results.example1: The conference was seen as an ideal vehicle for increased cooperation between the member states. 那次會議被視為增進成員國之間合作的理想途徑。

results.name: incubator
results.english: a container that has controlled air and temperature conditions in which a weak or premature baby (= one which was born too early) can be kept alive
results.chinese: （用於體弱嬰兒或早產嬰兒護理的）恆溫箱，保育箱

results.name: uproar
results.english: a situation in which a lot of people complain about something angrily or make a lot of noise
results.example1: The book caused an uproar in France. 該書在法國引起了軒然大波。
results.example2: The whole hall was in uproar after the announcement. 宣佈完後，整個大廳一片譁然。

results.name: heated
results.english: excited or angry
results.example1: a heated debate 激烈的爭論
results.example2: Brian and Tina had a heated argument at the restaurant. 布萊恩跟蒂娜在餐廳起了激烈的爭執。

results.name: a bitter pill to swallow
results.english: something that is very unpleasant but must be accepted
results.chinese: 不得不吞的苦果；必須接受的殘酷事實
results.example1: Losing to a younger player was a bitter pill to swallow. 輸給了更為年輕的對手是殘酷的事實。
results.example2: But this latest lesson may be a bitter pill to swallow, as it indicates that quarantines and social distancing must continue well beyond the initial wave of cases, if another round of infections is to be avoided. 但是這個最新的教訓可能是件不得不接受的事實，因為這顯示如果要避免另一波感染的話，檢疫和保持社交距離必須在首波病例之外好好持續下去。

results.name: warfare
results.english: the activity of fighting a war, often including the weapons and methods that are used
results.example1: guerrilla/naval/nuclear/trench warfare 遊擊戰／海戰／核戰／塹壕戰

results.name: get/have a handle on sth
results.english: to understand something or be able to deal with something
results.example1: By coming in early and staying late she started to get a handle on the problem.
results.example2: Luckily, the president has managed to get a handle on the recession. 好在該總統成功掌控了經濟衰退情況。

results.name: context
results.english: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it
results.example1: It is important to see all the fighting and bloodshed in his plays in historical context. 結合歷史背景解讀他戲劇作品中所有的爭鬥和流血事件，這點很重要。
results.example2: This small battle is very important in the context of Scottish history. 這場小戰役在蘇格蘭歷史上非常重要。

results.name: see sth. in context (to)
results.chinese: 把周遭情況列入考慮(context=背景環境)
results.example1: The CEO saw the month's sales in context to those of rival companies. 執行長把本月業績跟競爭公司的情況拿來一起看。
results.example2: It is a marvel that Taiwan managed to, really, have a successful containment, and if we look at a map right now, you know, you can see those 77 cases in context to the countries around it.

results.name: take sth. out of context
results.example1: Some newspapers took the politician's comments out of context. 某些報社斷章取義這位政治人物的言論。

results.name: level out
results.english: If an aircraft levels off/out, it starts to travel horizontally rather than going up or down.
results.example1: The jet levelled off at 10, 000 feet. 飛機在一萬英尺的高度水平飛行。

results.name: pile it on
results.english: to say too much, especially giving too much emphasis
results.chinese: 過多地談論；（尤指）誇張，言過其實
results.example1: You're really piling it on with the compliments tonight, Gareth, aren't you! 你今晚的確恭維過頭了，不是嗎，加雷思？

results.name: proactive
results.english: taking action by causing change and not only reacting to change when it happens
results.chinese: 超前部署的，先發制人的
results.example1: Companies are going to have to be more proactive about environmental management. 公司將對環境管理採取更為積極主動的態度。
results.example2: Some countries are taking a proactive approach to pay equity. 有些國家就同工同酬採取了積極主動的作法。

results.name: all-around
results.english: used to say that a person has many different types of skills and abilities
results.example1: She's a fantastic all-round sportswoman. 她是個非常了不起的全能運動員。
results.example2: The tech firm has a solid all-around strategy to expand abroad. 這家科技公司在向國外拓展方面有可靠、全面的策略。

results.name: draconian
results.english: Draconian laws, government actions, etc. are extremely severe, or go further than what is right or necessary.
results.chinese: （法律、政府行爲等）苛刻的，嚴厲的，嚴酷的
results.example1: He criticized the draconian measures taken by the police in controlling the demonstrators. 他批評了警方在控制示威者時採取了過於嚴厲的措施。
results.example2: The draconian government monitored everything its citizens did. 這個嚴苛的政府監視其公民所做的每件事。

results.name: hard-fought
results.english: achieved after a lot of difficulty or fighting
results.chinese: 艱苦努力得來的；浴血奮戰得來的
results.example1: a hard-fought victory 得來不易的勝利
results.example2: After a hard-fought match, the tennis star eventually won. 經過一場努力拼鬥的比賽後，這位網球明星最後贏了。

results.name: boomerang
results.english: a curved stick that, when thrown in a particular way, comes back to the person who threw it

results.name: far-reaching
results.english: Something far-reaching has a great influence on many people or things.
results.chinese: 影響深遠的；波及廣泛的
results.example1: These new laws will have far-reaching benefits for all working mothers. 這些新法律影響深遠，將惠及所有在職母親。
results.example2: The powerful country has far-reaching influence. 這個強大的國家擁有很深遠的影響力。

results.name: cascade
results.english: to fall quickly and in large amounts
results.chinese: 如瀑布般下落；大量傾瀉
results.example1: Coins cascaded from/out of the fruit machine. 大量硬幣從老虎機中傾瀉而出。
results.example2: The recession has cascaded from country to country across the world. 經濟衰退在全球一國接著一國地傾瀉而來。

results.name: chauffeur
results.english: to drive someone somewhere
results.example1: His mother spoils him terribly and chauffeurs him (around/about) everywhere. 他母親寵他寵得厲害，去哪兒都為他開車。
results.example2: A private jet was used to chauffeur the politician between different cities. 一架私人噴射機被用來載這名政治人物往返不同城市間。

results.name: airspace
results.english: the air or sky above a country that is considered to belong to that country
results.example1: The government claimed that the plane had illegally entered its airspace. 該政府宣稱這架飛機非法進入其領空。

results.name: at the height of
results.english: the time when a situation or event is strongest or most full of activity
results.example1: August is the height of the tourist season. 八月是旅遊旺季。
results.example2: Many people had runny noses at the height of the flu season. 在流感季的高峰期，很多人流鼻水。

results.name: transatlantic
results.english: crossing the Atlantic ocean, or relating to countries on both sides of the Atlantic Ocean
results.chinese: 橫越大西洋的；大西洋兩岸國家的
results.example1: transatlantic flights 橫越大西洋的飛行
results.example2: Tommy took a transatlantic flight from London to New York. 湯米搭乘一架跨大西洋航班從倫敦飛往紐約。

results.name: all told
results.english: as a complete total
results.example1: There were 550 people at the festival all told. 節日慶典上總共有550人。
results.example2: All told, the scientists tried five times to get the experiment right. 這些科學家總共試了五次才實驗成功。

results.name: confine
results.english: to limit an activity, person, or problem in some way
results.example1: Let's confine our discussion to the matter in question, please! 請把討論集中在正題上！
results.example2: People with symptoms should remain confined in their house. 有症狀的人應該限制行動留在家中。

results.name: a flow of
results.english: a regular and quite large number of something
results.example1: There's been a steady flow of visitors. 參觀者絡繹不絕。

results.name: to mount an attack
results.english: to organize and begin an activity or event
results.example1: to mount an attack/campaign/challenge/protest 發動進攻／開展運動／提出挑戰／發起抗議
results.example2: Rescuers are mounitng a mission to save the trapped hikers. 救援人員展開任務拯救受困的登山客。

results.name: take concerted action
results.english: planned or done together for a shared purpose
results.chinese: 一致的；協商好的；共同籌劃的
results.example1: The richer countries of the world should take concerted action to help the poorer countries. 世界上較富有的國家應該共同採取行動來幫助較貧困的國家。
results.example2: The government is launching a concerted effort to combat crimbe. 政府正啟動協力工作，打擊犯罪。

results.name: remedy
results.english: a successful way of curing an illness or dealing with a problem or difficulty
results.chinese: 療法，治療；補救（辦法），糾正（辦法）
results.example1: an effective herbal remedy for headaches 用草藥治療頭痛的有效療法
results.example2: The best remedy for grief is hard work. 排解憂傷的最好辦法就是努力工作。

results.name: tonic
results.english: a liquid medicine that has the general effect of making you feel better rather than treating a particular health problem that you might have

results.name: bleach
results.english: a strong chemical used for cleaning things or removing colour from things

results.name: allot
results.english: to give something, especially a share of something available, for a particular purpose
results.chinese: （尤指將現有的東西）分配；分派
results.example1: [ + two objects ] They allotted everyone a separate desk. 他們給每個人都分配了個人專用的辦公桌。
results.example2: They allotted a separate desk to everyone. 他們給每一個人都單獨配發了桌子。

results.name: bereavement
results.english: the death of a close relation or friend
results.example1: She has recently suffered a bereavement. 她最近剛失去一位親人。
results.example2: bereavement leave  喪假

results.name: onerous
results.english: difficult to do or needing a lot of effort
results.example1: the onerous task of finding a peaceful solution 尋找和平解決方案的艱巨任務
results.example2: She found the duties of motherhood onerous. 她發現做媽媽任務艱巨。

results.name: knock
results.english: the act of something hard hitting a person or thing
results.example1: He received a nasty knock on the head from a falling slate. 一塊石板掉下來，把他的頭重重地砸了一下。
results.example2: reputational knocks 名譽損傷

results.name: resolute
results.english: determined in character, action, or ideas
results.chinese: 堅決的；有決心的；堅定的
results.example1: Their resolute opposition to new working methods was difficult to overcome. 他們堅決反對新的工作方法，很難說服他們。
results.example2: She's utterly resolute in her refusal to apologize. 她斷然拒絕道歉。

results.name: thereby
results.english: as a result of this action
results.example1: Diets that are high in saturated fat clog up our arteries, thereby reducing the blood flow to our hearts and brains. 高飽和脂肪和高膽固醇的飲食容易阻塞我們的動脈，從而減少向心臟和大腦的供血。

results.name: spare
results.english: to prevent someone from having to experience something unpleasant
results.example1: Luckily, I was spared the embarrassment of having to sing in front of everyone. 幸運的是，我躲過了在大家面前唱歌的尷尬。
results.example2: It was a nasty accident - but I'll spare you (= I won't tell you) the gruesome details. 那是一起嚴重的事故——我就不跟你講那些令人毛骨悚然的細節了。

results.name: take pride in sth/sb
results.english: to feel very pleased about something or someone you are closely connected with
results.example1: If you don't take professional pride in your work, you're probably in the wrong job. 如果你對自己的工作沒有職業自豪感，那可能是入錯了行。

results.name: good-humoured
results.english: friendly or in a good mood
results.example1: a good-humoured remark 和善的話
results.example2: The walkers were good-humoured despite the bad weather. 儘管天氣很差，徒步旅行者們卻很開心。

results.name: resolve
results.english: strong determination
results.example1: to weaken/strengthen/test someone's resolve 削弱／增強／考驗某人的決心

results.name: fellow feeling
results.english: an understanding or sympathy that you feel for another person because you have a shared experience
results.example1: There was a fellow feeling between everyone who had lived through the war. 所有經歷過那場戰爭的人之間都會有同病相憐的感覺。

results.name: heartwarming
results.english: (especially of an event, action, or story) seeming to be something positive and good and therefore causing feelings of pleasure and happiness
results.chinese: （尤指事件、行爲或故事）暖人心扉的，感人的
results.example1: a heartwarming tale of triumph over adversity 講述戰勝逆境的感人故事
results.example2: The heartwarming movie was popular with children. 這部溫暖人心的電影很受孩子們的歡迎

results.name: be it A or B
results.example1: Be it shirmp or fish, Kelly loves to eat seafood. 凱莉喜歡吃海鮮，不管是蝦子還是魚。

results.name: relief
results.english: food, money, or services that provide help for people in need
results.example1: an international relief operation 國際救援行動
results.example2: Musicians have raised millions of dollars for famine relief in Africa. 歌星們已經籌集了數百萬英鎊的善款救濟非洲饑民。

results.name: she practises meditation
results.english: the act of giving your attention to only one thing, either as a religious activity or as a way of becoming calm and relaxed
results.example1: prayer and meditation 祈禱與冥想
results.example2: She practises meditation. 她時常靜坐冥想。

results.name: instinctive
results.english: Instinctive behaviour or reactions are not thought about, planned, or developed by training.
results.example1: an instinctive reaction 本能反應
results.example2: Conservationists have an instinctive desire to care for the environment. 保育人士對於環境的關懷有著本能的渴望。

results.name: compassion
results.english: a strong feeling of sympathy and sadness for the suffering or bad luck of others and a wish to help them
results.example1: I was hoping she might show a little compassion. 我當時想她或許會表現出一點點同情心。

results.name: take comfort
results.english: the state of feeling better after feeling sad or worried, or something that makes you feel better in this way
results.example1: I know she goes out a lot at night, but I draw/take comfort from the fact that she's always with friends. 我知道她夜裡經常出去，不過讓我感到寬慰的是她總是與朋友在一起。
results.example2: Wayne took comfort in the fact that he had a holiday booked in a week's time. 韋恩預定了一週後的假期，覺得很舒心。

results.name: applaud
results.english: to say that you admire and agree with a person's action or decision
results.example1: We applaud the family's decision to remain silent over the issue. 我們非常讚賞這一家人對此事保持沉默的決定。
results.example2: Crowds applauded the hero as he collected his award for bravery. 這位英雄因英勇事蹟受獎時，眾人為之喝采。

results.name: set your sights on sth
results.english: to decide to achieve something
results.example1: Jenny has set her sights on winning the competition. 珍妮已決心贏得比賽的勝利。
results.example2: Dr. Park has set his sights on being the new chief surgeon at the hospital. 帕克醫生決心成為這間醫院的新任外科主任。

results.name: pave the way
results.english: If something paves the way for/to something else, it makes the other thing possible.
results.example1: Scientists hope that data from the probe will pave the way for a more detailed exploration of Mars. 科學家希望探測船傳回的數據會為更深入的火星探索提供條件。
results.example2: Working in the newspaper office paved the way for Mandy to become a reporter. 在報社工作的經歷為Mandy舖路，讓她當上記者。

results.name: arguably
results.english: used when stating an opinion or belief that you think can be shown to be true
results.example1: He is arguably the world's best football player. 他可能是世界上最好的足球運動員。
results.example2: Arguably, the drug should not have been made available. 或許這種藥根本就不該上市。

results.name: terrain
results.english: an area of land, when considering its natural features
results.example1: The car handles particularly well on rough terrain. 這種汽車特別適宜在崎嶇不平的地帶行駛。

results.name: outcrop
results.english: a large rock or group of rocks that sticks out of the ground
results.chinese: 露出地面的岩石（或岩層）

results.name: down the road
results.english: in the future
results.example1: Cars that drive themselves are in development now, but a marketable product is a long way down the line. 無人汽車正在開發中，但要拿出有銷路的産品還有很長的路要走。
results.example2: Harry hopes to study at an Ivy League school down the road. 哈利希望未來能進一所常春藤盟校就讀。

results.name: haul
results.english: to pull something heavy slowly and with difficulty
results.example1: They hauled the boat out of the water. 他們把船拉上了岸。
results.example2: She hauled herself up into the tree. 她費勁地爬上了樹。

results.name: come in (handy, useful)
results.english: to be useful for a particular purpose
results.example1: The money will come in handy when I want to travel. 我想去旅遊時，這些錢會派上用場的。
results.example2: Cracking the safe needed an expert, and that's where the master thief came in. 撬開這個保險箱需要高手，那時這名神偷就派上用場了。

results.name: pitfall
results.english: a likely mistake or problem in a situation
results.example1: The store fell into one of the major pitfalls of small business, borrowing from suppliers by paying bills late. 那家商店犯了一個小本生意的大錯，那就是從供應商那裡先賒帳後付錢。
results.example2: There's a video that tells new students about pitfalls to avoid. 有一部影片告誡新生應避免犯哪些錯誤。

results.name: go about sth
results.english: to begin to do something or deal with something
results.example1: [ + -ing verb ] How can we go about solving this problem? 我們怎樣開始來解決這個問題呢？
results.example2: The photographer specializes in taking snapshots of people going about their daily lives. 那名攝影師專門拍攝人們忙於日常生活的快照。

results.name: go at sb
results.english: to attack someone
results.example1: Suddenly, he went at me with a knife. 突然，他手持一把刀子向我撲來。
results.example2: Bill will go at anyone intruding on his property. 比爾會攻擊任何闖入他家的人。

results.name: it's a matter of minutes
results.english: used in expressions describing how small an amount or period of time is
results.chinese: （表示數量或時間之少）大約，左右
results.example1: She complained he had short-changed her, but it was only a matter of a few pence. 她抱怨說他少找了錢，其實只差了幾便士而已。
results.example2: Mickey will arrive at work in a matter of minutes. 米奇將在幾分鐘之內抵達上班的地方。

results.name: playbook
results.english: a set of rules or suggestions that are considered to be suitable for a particular activity, industry, or job
results.example1: Typically, outsiders are brought in to execute a specific playbook, i.e. to solve a particular problem in a particular way.

results.name: nostril
results.english: either of the two openings in the nose through which air moves when you breathe
results.example1: The horses came to a halt, steam streaming from their nostrils. 這些馬停了下來，鼻孔噴著熱氣。

results.name: etiquette
results.english: the set of rules or customs that control accepted behaviour in particular social groups or social situations
results.example1: Social etiquette dictates that men cannot sit while women are standing. （社交）禮儀要求在女士站立時，男士不能入座。
results.example2: Diplomatic etiquette forbids calling for the death of a national leader. 外交禮節禁止公開要求處死國家領導人。

results.name: necessity
results.english: something that you need, especially in order to live
results.example1: We brought only the bare necessities with us.
results.example2: He regarded music as one of life's necessities.

results.name: plunge
results.english: to become lower in value or level very suddenly and quickly
results.example1: The fall in demand caused share prices to plunge. 需求下降導致股價大幅下跌。
results.example2: Carbon dioxide levels in the air have plunged recently. 空氣中的二氧化碳含量近來大幅下降了。

results.name: premature
results.english: happening or done too soon, especially before the natural or suitable time
results.chinese: 過早的；不成熟的；倉促的
results.example1: Frank fell ill and suffered a premature death. 法蘭克生病了，英年早逝。
results.example2: Their criticisms seem premature considering that the results aren't yet known. 鑒於結果尚未知曉，他們的批評似乎為時過早。

results.name: wake-up call
results.english: If something that happens is a wake-up call, it should make you realize that you need to take action to change a situation.
results.example1: For the insurance industry, these floods were a wake-up call. 對保險業來說，這些洪水敲響了警鐘。
results.example2: The recent losses were a wake-up call for the company. 近期的虧損是給該公司的一項警訊。

results.name: (it's) business as usual
results.english: said when things are continuing as they always do, despite a difficult situation
results.example1: While there was a new CO, it was business as uaual. 雖然有了新的執行長，但一切如常。

results.name: claim sb's life
results.english: If a violent event, fighting, or a disease claims someone's life, it kills that person.
results.example1: The war has claimed thousands of lives. 戰爭已奪去了數千人的生命。
results.example2: The fie in the factory claimed dozens of lives. 那場後廠大火奪走了數十條人命。

results.name: enlist
results.english: to ask for and get help or support from someone
results.example1: We enlisted some people to help prepare the food. 我們請了一些人來幫忙做飯。
results.example2: Some volunteers were enlisted to help out at the festival. 有些志工被召募去那個節慶活動幫忙。

results.name: entitle (name)
results.english: to give a title to a book, film, etc.
results.example1: Her latest novel, entitled The Forgotten Sex, is out this week. 她名爲《被遺忘的性別》的最新小說將於本周出版。
results.example2: One of Stephen King's most famous books in entitled Pet Sematary. 史蒂芬金最知名書作之一的書名是《禁入墳場》

results.name: come about
results.english: to happen, or start to happen
results.example1: How did the problem come about in the first place? 當初這個問題是怎麼產生的？
results.example2: Ben's promotion came about through hard work and persistence. 班的升遷來自於努力和堅持。

results.name: verse
results.english: one of the parts that a poem or song is divided into
results.example1: Each verse was sung as a solo and then everyone joined in on the chorus. 每一節都以獨唱形式演唱，然後所有人一同合唱。

results.name: in its entirety
results.english: with all parts included
results.chinese: 作爲一個整體；整個；全面地
results.example1: I've never actually read the book in its entirety. 實際上我從來沒有完整地讀過這本書。

results.name: sensation
results.english: something very exciting or interesting, or something that causes great excitement or interest
results.chinese: 轟動的事件；極有趣之物
results.example1: Their affair caused a sensation. 他們的曖昧關係引起了轟動。
results.example2: The books have been a publishing sensation on both sides of the Atlantic. 這些書在大西洋兩岸的出版界都引起了轟動。

results.name: strike sb (as adj)
results.english: to cause someone to have a feeling or idea about something
results.chinese: 給人以…感覺；讓…覺得；使產生…想法
results.example1: Doesn't it strike you as odd that he never talks about his family? 他從來都不談他的家人，難道不讓你感到奇怪嗎？
results.example2: It strikes poeple as strange that that the man disappeared withouth a trace. 那名男子消失得無影無蹤，人們覺得很奇怪。

results.name: a poignant reminder
results.english: causing or having a very sharp feeling of sadness
results.example1: It is especially poignant that he died on the day before the wedding. 他在婚禮前一天去世了，這令人分外悲痛。
results.example2: Emma received a poignant reminder of her decesed father when she found his pipe in the cupboard. 艾瑪在廚櫃裡找到已故父親的煙斗，讓她十分思念他。

results.name: resilient
results.english: able to quickly return to a previous good condition
results.example1: This rubber ball is very resilient and immediately springs back into shape. 這種橡膠球很有彈性，可以立即恢復原來的形狀。
results.example2: Jamie is more resilient to disease than his friends because he eats a healthy diet. 傑米吃得很健康，所以他比朋友更能扺禦疾病。

results.name: stateside
results.english: related to the US; in or towards the US
results.chinese: 美國的（地）；在美國（的）；去美國（的）
results.example1: a stateside job 在美國的工作
results.example2: Some of the girls dreamed of finding an American husband to transport them stateside (= to the US). 一些女孩子夢想找個美國丈夫把她們帶到美國去。

results.name: shout-out
results.english: an occasion when someone who is talking on the television or radio mentions someone in order to thank them or wish them well
results.chinese: （在電視或電臺節目上，向某人）公開表達致意
results.example1: I want to give a shout-out to my dad, who helped me a lot. 我想向我父親表達致意，他給了我很大幫助。

results.name: she is a big draw
results.english: someone or something that a lot of people are interested in
results.example1: We need someone at the event who'll be a big draw and attract the paying public. 我們需要一個深受大家喜歡的人到場，以吸引人們花錢買票。

results.name: commonality
results.english: the fact of sharing interests, experiences, or other characteristics with someone or something
results.example1: They found a commonality in discussing their experiences. 他們在討論各自的經驗時找到了共通性。
results.example2: There are some commonalities between the different stories. 這些不同的說法之間有一定的共通性。

results.name: culinary delights
results.english: connected with cooking or kitchens
results.example1: the culinary delights (= good food) of Beijing 北京的美味菜餚
results.example2: The bakery sells a lot of unique culinary delights. 那間烘焙坊販售很多獨特的美食點心。

results.name: an extreme makeover
results.english: a set of changes that are intended to make a person or place more attractive
results.chinese: （個人形象的）大革新，改頭換面；（地方的）翻新，改造
results.example1: One of the prizes was a makeover at a top beauty salon. 獎品之一是頂級美容院提供的一項形象重塑服務。

results.name: specialty
results.english: a product that is extremely good in a particular place
results.example1: Oysters are a local specialty of the area. 牡蠣是當地的特産。
results.example2: Paella is a specialty of the house (= a food that is unusually good in a particular restaurant). 西班牙雜燴菜飯是那家飯館的招牌菜。

results.name: meticulous
results.english: very careful and with great attention to every detail
results.chinese: 嚴謹的，一絲不苟的；非常注意細節的
results.example1: Many hours of meticulous preparation have gone into writing the book. 為寫此書，投入了大量時間細心做前期準備。

results.name: handpicked
results.english: Someone who is handpicked has been carefully chosen for a special job or purpose.
results.example1: a handpicked audience 精心挑選的觀眾

results.name: mill
results.english: to crush grain into flour or another substance into powder
results.example1: The grain is still milled locally. 穀物仍然在當地碾磨。
results.example2: Wheat can be milled into flour. 小麥可以磨成麵粉。

results.name: elevated
results.english: raised
results.example1: The doctor said I was to keep my leg elevated. 醫生說我要保持腿部抬高。
results.example2: Maxine was looking at ways to make her tea shop more elevated. 梅可欣正在看有什麼辦法讓他的茶館層次更提升。

results.name: slurp
results.english: to drink a liquid noisily as a result of sucking air into the mouth at the same time as the liquid
results.chinese: 咕嘟咕嘟地喝，出聲地喝
results.example1: I wish you wouldn't slurp your soup like that. 我希望你喝湯時不要發出那種聲音。
results.example2: He slurped down his coffee. 他咕嘟咕嘟地把咖啡喝完了。

results.name: aroma
results.english: a strong, pleasant smell, usually from food or drink
results.chinese: （通常指食物、飲料的）香味，香氣，芳香
results.example1: the aroma of freshly baked bread 剛出爐的麵包的香味
results.example2: a wine with a light, fruity aroma 散發著淡淡果香的酒

results.name: savory
results.english: Savory food is salty or spicy and not sweet in taste.
results.example1: a savoury dish/sauce/flavour 帶鹹味的一道菜／一種調料／一種味道
results.example2: In Britain, a savory dish is often eaten last during a meal. 在英國，鹹菜餚通常是一餐中最後食用的。

results.name: psyche
results.english: the mind, or the deepest thoughts, feelings, or beliefs of a person or group
results.example1: the male psyche 男性心理
results.example2: Peru is a very traditional country, and embedded in its psyche is a love of ceremony. 秘魯是一個非常傳統的國家，這個國家的精神中蘊含著一種對於禮儀的熱愛。

results.name: impediment
results.english: something that makes progress, movement, or achieving something difficult or impossible
results.example1: In a number of developing countries, war has been an additional impediment to progress. 在一些發展中國家，戰爭成了發展的另一阻礙。

results.name: slog through mud
results.english: to travel or move with difficulty, for example through wet, sticky soil or snow, or when you are very tired
results.example1: Despite the rain, they slogged on for another six miles. 儘管下著雨，他們還是又艱難跋涉了六英里路。
results.example2: The soldiers slogged through mud. 士兵們在泥濘中跋涉。

results.name: a morass
results.english: something that is extremely complicated and difficult to deal with and makes any progress almost impossible
results.example1: The morass of rules and regulations is delaying the start of the project. 繁冗的規章制度拖延了專案計劃的啟動。

results.name: bramble
results.english: a wild bush with thorns, that produces blackberries
results.example1: We carefully pushed our way through the low brambles. 我們小心翼翼地走過低矮的黑莓灌木叢。

results.name: myriads of bars
results.english: a very large number of something
results.example1: a myriad of choices 無數種選擇
results.example2: And now myriads of bars and hotels are opening up along the coast. 目前有數不勝數的酒吧和飯店在海邊開張營業。

results.name: painstakingly
results.english: in a way that shows you have taken a lot of care or made a lot of effort
results.example1: She painstakingly explained how the machine worked. 她悉心地解釋這台機器是如何運轉的。

results.name: an imposing mansion
results.english: having an appearance that looks important or causes admiration
results.chinese: 壯觀的，宏偉的；氣宇不凡的
results.example1: an imposing mansion 雄偉壯觀的大廈
results.example2: He was an imposing figure on stage. 他在舞臺上氣度不凡。

results.name: the uninitiated
results.english: people who are without knowledge or experience of a particular subject or activity
results.chinese: 缺乏專門知識的；不知情者；門外漢，外行
results.example1: Michelle, for the uninitiated, is the central female character in Netflix's latest comedy series. 外人有所不知，米雪爾是網飛最新播出的喜劇連續劇中的女主角。

results.name: daunting
results.english: making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something
results.chinese: 使人望之卻步的；使人氣餒的
results.example1: The country was faced with the daunting prospect of overcoming four decades of division. 國家仍然面臨著彌合40年的分裂這一難題。
results.example2: At over 2000 miles in length, hiking the Appalachian Trail is a daunting task. 在逾2000英里長的阿帕拉契山徑健行是件令人卻步的事。

results.name: sprawl
results.english: (especially of a city) to cover a large area of land with buildings that have been added at different times so that it looks untidy
results.chinese: （尤指城市）雜亂無序地擴展，散亂地延伸
results.example1: The refugee camps sprawl across the landscape. 眼前雜亂地散落著許多難民營。
results.example2: Millions of people lived in the sprawling city. 有數百萬人住在這座幅員廣大的城市。

results.name: a haven
results.english: a safe or peaceful place
results.example1: The garden was a haven from the noise and bustle of the city. 這個花園是塊遠離喧囂都市的靜地。
results.example2: They wanted to provide safe havens for the refugees. 他們想爲難民們提供安全的避難場所。

results.name: intrepid
results.english: extremely brave and showing no fear of dangerous situations
results.example1: a team of intrepid explorers 一隊無畏的探險者
results.example2: Intrepid explorers often head to India to go backpacking. 無所張懼的探險家常前往印度自助族行。

results.name: sole
results.english: 唯一的，單一的
results.chinese: My sole objective is to make the information more widely available. 我唯一的目的就是讓更多的人能了解到這些資訊。
results.example1: Horse racing is Charlotte's sole passon in life. 賽馬是夏洛特人生中唯一的喜好。

results.name: medieval
results.english: related to the Middle Ages (= the period in European history from about AD 600 to AD 1500)
results.chinese: 中世紀（約西元600年至1500年間）的，中古時代的
results.example1: a medieval building/painting/town 中世紀建築／畫作／城鎮
results.example2: The medieval castle was now open to the public. 那座中世紀城堡現在對外開放了。

results.name: wake
results.english: an occasion when the family and friends of a dead person meet in order to look at the dead body the night before it is buried, or when they meet after a dead person has been buried to drink and talk about the person's life

results.name: go back a long way
results.english: If people go back a long way, they have known each other for a long time.
results.example1: Donald and Jack go way back as they attended school together. 唐納和傑克相識已久，因為他們一起求學。

results.name: an artisan
results.english: someone who does skilled work with their hands

results.name: ornate style
results.english: having a lot of complicated decoration
results.example1: a room with an ornate ceiling and gold mirrors 有華麗天花板和金框鏡子裝飾的房間
results.example2: The road to the palace was blocked by an ornate set of gates. 通往皇宮的路被一組華美的柵門給擋住了。

results.name: façade
results.english: the front of a building, especially a large or attractive building
results.example1: the gallery's elegant 18th-century façade 美術館建於18世紀典雅的正面

results.name: bittersweet
results.english: containing a mixture of sadness and happiness
results.example1: Frank had a bittersweet feeling as he looked at photographs from his youth. 法蘭克看著自己年輕時的照片，心中百感交集。

results.name: a mundane job
results.english: very ordinary and therefore not interesting
results.example1: Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her. 她對付帳單、購買食物等瑣事不感興趣。
results.example2: Donna wants an exciting job because she is tired of mundane work. 唐娜想要一份刺激的工作，因為她受夠了平凡的工作。

results.name: strand
results.english: a thin thread of something, often one of a few, twisted around each other to make a string or rope
results.example1: She tucked a loose strand of hair behind her ears. 她把一綹鬆下來的頭髮收到耳後。
results.example2: a strand of dental floss 一条牙線

results.name: immerse
results.english: to put something or someone completely under the surface of a liquid
results.example1: The shells should be immersed in boiling water for two minutes. 貝類應在沸水中浸上兩分鐘。
results.example2: The cooked chicken was immersed vinegar before being served. 煮熟的雞肉泡過醋後才上桌。

results.name: portraiture
results.english: the act or art of making portraits
results.chinese: 肖像繪製；肖像畫技法；人像攝影（法）

results.name: backdrop
results.english: a large piece of cloth with buildings, countryside, etc. painted on it, hung at the back of a stage during a performance

results.name: treacherous
results.english: If the ground or sea is treacherous, it is extremely dangerous, especially because of bad weather conditions.
results.chinese: （地面或大海尤因氣候惡劣）極端危險的，凶險的
results.example1: Snow and ice have left many roads treacherous, and drivers are warned to use caution. 冰雪使許多道路危機四伏，汽車司機被告誡要小心駕駛。

results.name: convoy
results.english: a group of vehicles or ships that travel together, especially for protection
results.example1: A convoy of trucks containing supplies was sent to the famine area. 一支滿載補給品的車隊被派往饑荒嚴重的地區。

results.name: in tandem
results.english: at the same time
results.example1: The heart and lungs will be transplanted in tandem. 將同時移植心臟和雙肺。

results.name: slink away
results.english: to walk away from somewhere quietly so that you are not noticed
results.example1: I tried to slink out of the room so that nobody would see me go. 我試圖偷偷溜出房間，免得有人看到我離開。
results.example2: disapproving He usually slinks off (= leaves) at about 3.30. 他通常在下午三點半左右開溜。

results.name: eavesdrop
results.english: to listen to someone's private conversation without them knowing
results.example1: He was eavesdropping on our conversation. 他在偷聽我們談話。

results.name: robe
results.english: a long, loose piece of clothing worn especially on very formal occasions
results.chinese: 長袍，罩袍；（尤指特別正式場合穿的）袍服，禮袍
results.example1: Judges wear black robes when they are in court. 法官在法庭上都身穿黑袍。

results.name: bill
results.english: a formal statement of a planned new law that is discussed before being voted on
results.example1: When a bill is passed in Parliament it becomes law. 一旦某項法案在議會通過，便成為法律。
results.example2: informal The bill was thrown out (= did not go past the first stage of discussion and will not become law). 這項議案被否決了。

results.name: giggle
results.english: to laugh repeatedly in a quiet but uncontrolled way, often at something silly or rude or when you are nervous
results.chinese: （因為感到有趣、窘迫或緊張而）咯咯地笑，傻笑
results.example1: Stop that giggling in the back row! 別在後面傻笑！

results.name: a renegade
results.english: a person who has changed their feelings of support and duty from one political, religious, national, etc. group to a new one
results.chinese: 叛徒；變節者；背叛者；叛教者
results.example1: A band of renegades had captured the prince and were holding him to ransom. 一群叛變分子俘獲了王子，將其扣押索要贖金。

results.name: rebuke
results.english: to speak angrily to someone because you disapprove of what they have said or done
results.example1: I was rebuked by my manager for being late. 我因為遲到而遭到經理的訓斥。

results.name: idolize
results.english: to admire and respect someone very much, often too much
results.example1: She idolized her father. 她十分崇拜她的父親。

results.name: he was scathing about the report
results.english: criticizing someone or something in a severe and unkind way
results.chinese: 嚴厲批評的，尖刻斥責的
results.example1: scathing criticism 嚴厲的批評
results.example2: He was very scathing about the report, saying it was inaccurate. 他嚴厲批評了這份報告，說內容不準確。

results.name: summon
results.english: to increase your courage or strength, especially with an effort
results.chinese: （尤指努力地）鼓起（勇氣），積聚（力氣）
results.example1: It took me six months to summon (up) the courage to ask him out for a drink. 我花了六個月時間才鼓起勇氣約他出去喝一杯。

results.name: to surmount sth
results.english: to deal successfully with a difficulty or problem
results.example1: They managed to surmount all opposition/objections to their plans. 他們設法克服了對他們計劃的所有反對意見。
results.example2: There are still a few technical problems/obstacles/hurdles to be surmounted before the product can be put on sale to the public. 在這個產品對大眾銷售之前，還有一些技術問題要解決。

results.name: shamble
results.english: to walk slowly and awkwardly, without lifting your feet correctly
results.example1: Sick patients shambled along the hospital corridors. 重病患者沿著醫院的走廊蹣跚而行。
results.example2: He was a strange, shambling figure. 他是一個步履蹣跚的怪人。

results.name: stem
results.english: to stop the flow of a liquid such as blood
results.example1: She tied a handkerchief around the wound to stem the flow of blood. 她用手帕綁住傷口來止血。
results.example2: There is increasing urgency inside the White House and among President Donald Trump's Republican allies to blame China over its failure to stem the spread of the disease early on. 白宮及川普陣營愈來愈急迫必須要指責中國沒有及早將新冠病毒的擴散控制好。

results.name: ratchet sth up/down
results.english: to increase/reduce something over a period of time
results.example1: The government was accused of ratcheting up pressure on the health services. 人們指責政府逐步向公共醫療衛生服務施加壓力。
results.example2: Costs have been ratcheted down by as much as 50 percent since 1999. 自1999年以來，成本逐步降低了差不多有50%。

results.name: strip
results.english: to remove, pull, or tear the covering or outer layer from something
results.chinese: 除去，剝除，撕掉（外皮或表層）
results.example1: Because of the pollution, the trees are almost completely stripped of bark. 由於受到污染，樹木的表皮幾乎完全剝落。
results.example2: The paintwork was so bad that we decided to strip off all the paint and start again. 漆面太糟，我們決定鏟去所有油漆，重漆一遍。

results.name: so as not to
results.english: in order not to
results.example1: He did not switch on the light so as not to disturb her. 為了不打擾她，他沒有開燈。

results.name: bash
results.english: to criticize someone severely
results.example1: He kept bashing local government officials. 他不停地抨擊當地政府官員員。
results.example2: Administration officials have been careful not to bash China for non-performance on agriculture purchases. 美國管理層很小心的盡可能不去批評中國在農業採購上沒貢獻這件事上。

results.name: intellectual property
results.english: someone's idea, invention, creation, etc., that can be protected by law from being copied by someone else

results.name: broach a subject
results.english: to begin a discussion of something difficult
results.example1: At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know how to broach the subject with him. 我們最終必須談到錢，但我不知道如何向他提這個問題。
results.example2: Neither side has even broached the subject of Phase Two trade talks. 雙方(美國/中國)都還沒開始第2階段的貿易對談。

results.name: his campaign rhetoric
results.english: speech or writing intended to be effective and influence people
results.example1: How far the president will be able to translate his campaign rhetoric into action remains to be seen. 總統在大選中作出的冠冕堂皇的承諾能夠兌現多少尚待觀察。
results.example2: While Trump has ramped up his rhetoric against China recently, he has been careful not to criticize Chinese President Xi Jinping directly. 當川普淘淘不絕發表他對中國的言論時，他還是一直很小心避開對習近平的直接批評。

results.name: at times
results.english: sometimes
results.example1: You can be really annoying at times, you know. 要知道，你有時很令人惱火。

results.name: genetically modified
results.english: A genetically modified plant or animal has had some of its genes changed scientifically.
results.example1: genetically modified food/crops 基因改造食品／農作物

results.name: rail against
results.english: to complain angrily
results.example1: He railed against/at the injustices of the system. 他強烈譴責該制度的不公正。
results.example2: He(Trump) took the opportunity to rail against both protesters and statues being torn down across America. 他藉機批評抗議人士以及美國各地的雕像被推倒。

results.name: flyover
results.english: an occasion when a group of aircraft flies in a special pattern as a part of a ceremony
results.chinese: 檢閱飛行，機群編隊飛行

results.name: gear (sb/sth) up (for)
results.english: to prepare for something that you have to do, or to prepare someone else for something
results.example1: Politicians are already gearing up for the election. 政治家們已經為大選做起了準備。
results.example2: I'm trying to gear myself up for tomorrow's exam. 我正在努力為明天的考試做準備。

results.name: a consulate
results.english: the office where a consul works
results.example1: the Cuban consulate in Mexico City 駐墨西哥城的古巴領事館

results.name: antitrust
results.english: relating to efforts to prevent companies from working together to control prices unfairly or to create a monopoly (= a single company or group of companies that is the only supplier of something)
results.example1: Tech giants Facebook, Amazon, Apple and Google grilled by congressional antitrust panel. 科技巨擎 Facebook, Amazon, Apple 和 Google 遭國會反托拉斯小組拷問。

results.name: cricketer
results.english: a cricket player

results.name: fencer
results.english: a person who fences as a sport

results.name: frantically
results.english: done in a hurried way and in a state of excitement or confusion
results.example1: I've been working frantically all week to get it finished on time. 我整個星期都在緊張工作，以期能夠按時完成。
results.example2: I got home to find Lara frantically searching for her keys. 我回到家，發現羅拉正在急急火火地找她的鎖匙。

results.name: get your act together
results.english: to start to organize yourself so that you do things in an effective way
results.chinese: 整頓起來；有條理地行事；合理安排
results.example1: She's so disorganized - I wish she'd get her act together. 她做事很沒有條理——我希望她能夠做到有條不紊。
results.example2: The Europeans say that Pakistani authorities now have six months to get their act together to prove that they can properly regulate and license the pilots. 歐洲表示，巴基斯坦當局現在有六個月的時間整頓，講明他們能夠正確地規範飛行員並且核發執照。

results.name: be a tall order
results.english: to be something that is difficult to do
results.chinese: 是件困難的事情；是個離譜的要求
results.example1: Building the bridge in time for the Olympics will be a tall order. 趕在奧運會前及時修好這座橋是一件很難的事。
results.example2: It will be a serously tall order, bearing in mind that the national airline has admitted more than 140 pilots were on dubious licenses- a theird of the total. 這將會是一個非常困難的任務，別忘了這家國有的航空公司已承認有超過140名機師的執照有疑慮-佔總數的三分之一。

results.name: dubious
results.english: thought not to be completely true or not able to be trusted
results.chinese: 半信半疑的，可疑的；不確定的；不可信的
results.example1: These claims are dubious and not scientifically proven. 這些說法未經科學證實，有些可疑。
results.example2: He has been associated with some dubious characters. 他曾經與一些可疑人物有交往。

results.name: figure skating
results.english: a type of skating that involves circular patterns and often includes jumps

results.name: boycott
results.english: to refuse to buy a product or take part in an activity as a way of expressing strong disapproval
results.chinese: 拒絶購買（或參加）；抵制，杯葛
results.example1: People were urged to boycott the country's products. 人們被鼓動起來杯葛那個國家的産品。
results.example2: The union called on its members to boycott the meeting. 工會號召其成員拒絶參加會議。

results.name: the newspapers fanned the public's fears
results.english: to encourage bad emotions or behaviour to get worse
results.example1: The newspapers deliberately fanned the public's fears of losing their jobs. 報紙故意煽動公眾對失業的恐懼心理。
results.example2: Newspapers accused the politician of fanning the flames of racism by making some insensitive comments. 報社指控那名政治人物藉由發表一些缺乏敏感度的評論點燃種族歧視的焰火。

results.name: loot
results.english: (usually of large numbers of people during a violent event) to steal from shops and houses
results.chinese: （通常指在暴力事件中集體）搶劫，洗劫
results.example1: During the riot shops were looted and cars damaged or set on fire. 在暴亂期間商店遭洗劫，汽車被砸壞或燒毀。
results.example2: Some protesters started looting nearby shops. 有些抗議人士開始打劫附近店家。

results.name: dishonor
results.english: to cause someone or something to lose respect
results.chinese: 使丟臉，使蒙受恥辱；羞辱
results.example1: He felt that he had dishonoured his country. 他覺得自己給國家丟了臉。
results.example2: The bad behavior of the student dishonored his school. 那名學生的不良行為讓學校蒙羞。

results.name: assume control
results.english: to take or begin to have responsibility or control, sometimes without the right to do so, or to begin to have a characteristic
results.example1: The terrorists assumed control of the plane and forced it to land in the desert. 恐怖分子控制了飛機，並使其迫降在沙漠中。
results.example2: A hacker assumed control of the website. 一名駭客控制了該網站。

results.name: a gymnast
results.english: a person who is skilled in gymnastics, often someone who competes in gymnastic competitions
results.chinese: 擅長體操的人；體操運動員
results.example1: a great Russian gymnast 卓越的俄羅斯體操運動員

results.name: criminal justice system
results.english: the system in a society by which people who are accused of crimes are judged in court

results.name: reformed church
results.english: to make an improvement, especially by changing a person's behaviour or the structure of something
results.chinese: （尤指透過改變人的行為或事物的構造而）改革，改進，改造
results.example1: Who will reform our unfair electoral system? 誰將改革我們不公正的選舉制度呢？
results.example2: For years I was an alcoholic, but I reformed when the doctors gave me six months to live. 我酗酒多年，但當醫生預計我只能再活六個月時，我就改過自新了。

results.name: weigh in (on)
results.english: to become involved in an argument or discussion in a forceful way
results.example1: Several leading architects weighed in with criticisms regarding the design of the new museum. 幾位著名的建築師加入討論，對新博物館的設計方案提出了批評意見。
results.example2: The science expert weighed in on the debate between the two journalists. 科學專家對兩名記者之間的爭論發表意見。

results.name: a tough/hard sell
results.english: something that is difficult to persuade people to buy or accept
results.chinese: 難以接受的事物；難以被信服的言論
results.example1: Getting people to download the app was a tough sell because it received bad reviews. 要大家去下載那個應用程式並不容易，因為它評價不好。
results.example2: This tax increase is going to be a tough sell to voters. 這次增稅動作對選民來說會是個無法接受的政策。

results.name: slam him
results.english: to criticize
results.example1: Although the reviewers slammed the play, the audience loved it. 儘管評論家們猛烈抨擊該劇，觀眾們還是很喜歡。
results.example2: The soccer coach slammed his players at halftime. 足球教練在中場休息時大罵自己的球員。

results.name: open season
results.english: the period in the year when it is legal to hunt particular animals
results.chinese: （法定的）狩獵期；形容某人成為眾矢之的
results.example1: It is open season for deer in September. 九月是開放狩鹿期。
results.example2: It is open season on the politician after a number of blunders. 在出了一些漏子之後，那名政客成了眾矢之的。

results.name: hurdler
results.english: a person or horse that runs in races where there are hurdles

results.name: infest
results.english: (of animals and insects that carry disease) to cause a problem by being present in large numbers
results.chinese: （動物、害蟲等）大批出沒於，大量滋生
results.example1: The barn was infested with rats. 穀倉裡到處都是老鼠。
results.example2: Cockroaches have infested the restaurant because of poor hygiene. 那家餐廳環境衛生不佳，因此充斥著蟑螂。

results.name: rodent
results.english: any of various small mammals with large, sharp front teeth, such as mice and rats

results.name: slap sth on
results.english: to put or spread a substance over a surface very quickly or roughly
results.chinese: （隨便地）塗上一層，撒上一層；隨意塗抹
results.example1: We want to sell our house, so we've slapped some paint on the outside to make it look better. 我們想賣掉房子，所以就把外面簡單地刷了些漆使其看起來漂亮些。
results.example2: The daler slapped a large price tag on the classic car. 車商在那部經典車上貼了一大張標價。

results.name: glorify
results.english: to describe or represent something in a way that makes it seem better or more important than it really is
results.example1: I didn't like the way the film glorified war/violence. 我不喜歡那部電影美化戰爭／暴力的手法。
results.example2: People accused the president of glorifying violence. 人們指控總統美化暴力。

results.name: to backpedal on ...
results.english: to change an opinion that you had expressed before, or do something different from what you had said you would do
results.chinese: 改變立場；出爾反爾；變卦
results.example1: As soon as I said I thought she was wrong, she started backpedalling. 我一說我覺得她錯了，她就開始變卦。
results.example2: Frank backpedaled on his comment when Sophie confronted him about it. 蘇菲跟法蘭克對質他的發言時，他就改口了。

results.name: judoka
results.english: someone who does judo (= a sport that started in Japan in which people try to throw each other to the ground):
results.example1: To earn first place, judokas have to win five straight matches in a single day.

results.name: stoke
results.english: to encourage bad ideas or feelings in a lot of people
results.chinese: 煽動，激起（不良想法或情感）
results.example1: He's been accused of stoking up racial hatred in the region. 他被控在這地區煽動種族仇恨。
results.example2: The activist stoked her followers with an inspiring speech. 那名社運人士以一番勵志的演說激勵她的追隨者。

results.name: anthem
results.english: a song that has special importance for a particular group of people, an organization, or a country, often sung on a special occasion
results.chinese: 國歌；（團體組織的）頌歌，讚歌
results.example1: The national anthems of the teams are played at the beginning of international football matches. 在重大國際足球賽開賽時，演奏各參賽球隊的國歌。
results.example2: John Lennon's Imagine has become the anthem of peace-lovers all over the world. 約翰‧藍儂的《想像》已成為全世界和平愛好者的頌歌。

results.name: contrast
results.english: to compare two people or things in order to show the differences between them
results.example1: If you contrast some of her early writing with her later work, you can see just how much she improved. 如果你對比一下她的早期作品和後期的作品，就會看出她進步有多大。
results.example2: The abstract art contrasts with the classic paintings in the gallery. 藝廊裡抽象藝術與古典畫作形成對比。

results.name: pre-existing
results.english: existing before something else
results.example1: Sandy is at risk because she has some preexisting health conditions. 珊蒂處境危險，因為她本來就有一些健康狀況。
results.example2: The drug should be used with caution in patients with pre-existing cardiac disease.

results.name: martial art
results.english: a sport that is a traditional Japanese or Chinese form of fighting or defending yourself
results.example1: Kung fu and karate are martial arts. 功夫和空手道都屬於武術。

results.name: white supremacist
results.english: someone who believes that people with pale skin are better than people with darker skin:
results.example1: Both crimes were carried out by white supremacists.
results.example2: The college microbiology student was believed to be a white supremacist.

results.name: division
results.english: the situation in which people disagree about something
results.example1: Disagreements about defence cuts have opened up deep divisions within the military. 在削減國防開支問題上的看法不一導致軍方內部出現了嚴重的分歧。
results.example2: Division within the party will limit its chances in the election. 內訌將會降低該黨在選舉中獲勝的機會。

results.name: sizzle
results.english: to make a sound like food cooking in hot fat
results.chinese: （油炸食物般的）滋滋作響；怒火中燒
results.example1: The sausages are sizzling in the pan. 香腸在平底鍋裡滋滋作響。
results.example2: The comedy show was sizzling with shots at famous celebrities. 那個喜劇節目火力全開，向知名名流開炮。

results.name: it's gonna revive you
results.english: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
results.chinese: （使）甦醒；（使）復原；（使）復興；（使）重新流行
results.example1: A hot shower and a cup of tea will revive you. 沖個熱水澡，喝杯茶，你就會恢復精力的。
results.example2: The prime minister hoped her tax cuts would revive the economy. 總理希望她的減稅措施可以復甦經濟。

results.name: flagging energy
results.english: becoming weaker
results.example1: flagging energy/enthusiasm 漸漸低落的活力／熱情
results.example2: Visitor numbers to the museum are flagging at the moment. 造訪那座博物館的遊客人數目前正在下滑。

results.name: incumbent
results.english: the person who has or had a particular official position
results.example1: the first/last/previous incumbent 第一任／上一任／前任
results.example2: The present incumbent (of the post) is due to retire next month. （此職位的）現任者將於下個月退休。

results.name: triathlete
results.english: someone who competes in a triathlon

results.name: the strife between
results.english: violent or angry disagreement
results.example1: What are the prospects for overcoming the strife between the Christian minority and Muslim majority? 解決基督教少數派和回教多數派之間衝突的前景如何？
results.example2: 20 years of civil strife have left the country's economy in ruins. 20年的內戰使該國經濟滿目瘡痍。

results.name: financial hardship
results.english: (something that causes) difficult or unpleasant conditions of life, or an example of this
results.example1: economic hardship 經濟困難

results.name: a spot on his show
results.english: a short length of time in a show that is given to a particular performer
results.example1: She's doing a regular five-minute spot on his show. 她將在他的節目中表演一段五分鐘的固定節目。

results.name: notably
results.english: especially or most importantly
results.example1: The company is beginning to attract investors, most notably big Japanese banks. 這家公司開始吸引投資者，特別是日本大型金融會社。

results.name: synchronized swimming
results.english: a sport in which a group of people make smooth, attractive movements like dancing in the water at the same time

results.name: swing state
results.english: (in the United States) a state where the number of Democratic and Republican voters is about the same, that has an important influence on the result of the election of the United States President
results.chinese: 搖擺州 (美國大選前兩陣營支持率不相上下)
results.example1: The outcome of the US election will be decided by a small number of swing states that are not decisively Democratic or Republican in their support for the presidential candidates.
results.example2: This election sees familiar swing states such as Ohio, Florida, and Virginia in contention, as well as some new ones such as Utah, Arizona, and Wisconsin.

results.name: shallow
results.english: having only a short distance from the top to the bottom
results.example1: The stream was fairly shallow so we were able to walk across it. 小溪很淺，所以我們可以涉水過去。
results.example2: She told her children to stay in the shallow end (of the swimming pool). 她叫孩子們留在（游泳池的）淺水區。

results.name: against your better judgment
results.english: If something is against your better judgment, you think it would be wiser not to do it.
results.chinese: 違心；明知不可取(依然去做)
results.example1: Against my better judgment, I gave him the job. 我違心地給了他這份工作。
results.example2: Against his better judgement, Bruce agreed to lend his friend some money. 明知道這樣不好，布魯斯還是同意借了朋友一點錢。

results.name: a fraction of
results.english: a small part of something, or a small amount
results.example1: Although sexual and violent crimes have increased by 13 percent, they remain only a tiny/small fraction of the total number of crimes committed each year. 儘管性犯罪和暴力犯罪案件增長了30%，但它們在每年的罪案總數中所佔比例仍然很小。
results.example2: Could you just move a fraction to the right, so I can get by? 你能向右移動一點點，讓我過去嗎？

results.name: zoom
results.english: to move very quickly
results.example1: They got into the car and zoomed off. 他們鑽進汽車一溜煙地開走了。
results.example2: Neil loves to zoom around the countryside on his mountain bike. 尼爾喜歡騎著他的登山車在鄉間四處穿梭。

results.name: a missionary
results.english: a person who has been sent to a foreign country to teach their religion to the people who live there
results.example1: He did missionary work for the Presbyterian Church in Alaska. 他曾在阿拉斯加為基督長老教會做傳教工作。

results.name: canoe
results.english: to travel in a canoe

results.name: goggles
results.english: special glasses that fit close to the face to protect the eyes from chemicals, wind, water, etc.
results.example1: ski goggles 滑雪護目鏡
results.example2: (a pair of) safety goggles （一副）安全護目鏡

results.name: his confidence was dented
results.english: If you dent someone's confidence or pride, you make them feel less confident or proud.
results.chinese: 打擊，損傷（信心或自豪感）
results.example1: His confidence was badly dented when he didn't get the job. 他沒能得到那個工作，自信心受到了沉重的打擊。
results.example2: Some controvrsial tweets dented the celebrity's reputation. 一些惹議推文損害了這位名人的聲譽。

results.name: shortfall
results.english: an amount that is less than the level that was expected or needed
results.example1: The drought caused serious shortfalls in the food supply. 乾旱造成了嚴重的糧食供應短缺。

results.name: brainchild
results.english: an original idea, plan, or invention
results.chinese: 腦力勞動的産物；智力結晶
results.example1: The project was the brainchild of one of the students. 這個計劃是其中的一個學生想出來的。

results.name: trek
results.english: to walk a long distance, usually over land such as hills, mountains, or forests
results.example1: We spent the day trekking through forests and over mountains. 白天我們穿過叢林，翻山越嶺。
results.example2: informal I trekked (= walked a long and tiring distance) all the way into town to meet him and he didn't even turn up. 我大老遠好不容易進城來看他，他卻連面都不露一下。

results.name: snorkelling
results.english: the activity of swimming while using a snorkel
results.example1: We went snorkelling along the Great Barrier Reef. 我們沿著大堡礁浮潛。
results.example2: I saw so many fish when I went snorkeling at Green Island. 我去綠島浮潛的時候看見了很多魚。

results.name: in the pipeline
results.english: being planned
results.example1: The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season. 劇團正在為下一個演出季排練幾個新劇碼。
results.example2: The tech firm has three cell phone models in the pipeline. 這家科技公司有三款手機機型正在研發中。

results.name: here to stay
results.english: If something is here to stay, it has stopped being unusual and has become generally used or accepted
results.chinese: 已被廣泛使用；已為大多數人所接受
results.example1: Blogging is here to stay. 部落格已經廣泛流行。
results.example2: It appears that the trend of streaming movies online is here to stay. 線上串流播放電影的趨勢似乎已成氣候。

results.name: uptake
results.english: the rate or act of taking something in
results.example1: Plants in their growth stage exhibit an increased uptake of nutrients. 植物在其生長階段通常會吸收更多的養分。

results.name: brick-and-mortar
results.english: 實體的；有廠房跟店舖的
results.chinese: existing as a physical building, especially a shop, rather than doing business only on the internet
results.example1: There has been a decline in brick-and-mortar bookstores since the invention of the Kindle. 自Kindle發明後，實體書店越來越少了。
results.example2: brick-and-mortar bookstores

results.name: rafting
results.english: the use of a rubber raft to travel with the current of a river, especially as a sport
results.chinese: （尤指作為一種體育項目的）泛舟
results.example1: The camp offered bicycle tours, river rafting, fishing, and hiking. 營地提供自行車遊覽、河流泛舟、釣魚和登山活動。

results.name: the movie is on track
results.english: making progress and likely to succeed
results.example1: They're on track to make record profits. 他們有望獲得創紀錄的利潤。
results.example2: The movie is on track to smash box office records. 這部電影有望打破票房紀錄。

results.name: an indie movie
results.english: Indie music or films are made by small companies that are not owned by larger companies.
results.chinese: （音樂或電影作品）獨立小公司製作的，獨立製作的
results.example1: an indie movie/film/record label 獨立製作的電影／獨立唱片公司
results.example2: The popularity of indie bands has soared in recent years. 獨立樂團近幾年大受歡迎。

results.name: make a splash
results.english: to become suddenly very successful or very well known
results.example1: Jodie Foster made quite a splash in the film Taxi Driver. 茱蒂•福斯特因電影《計程車司機》而一舉成名。
results.example2: Layla is already making a splash in the world of tennis after winning her first five matches. 蕾拉首五場比賽都獲毀，已在網球界一舉成名。

results.name: captive audience
results.english: a group of people who listen to or watch someone or something because they cannot leave
results.chinese: 鐵粉；不得不觀看的觀眾
results.example1: The stand-up comedian performed for a captive audience. 這位單口喜劇演員為一群入迷的觀眾演出。

results.name: a troll
results.english: an imaginary, either very large or very small creature in traditional Scandinavian stories, that has magical powers and lives in mountains or caves
results.chinese: （斯堪的納維亞地區傳說中的）山精，巨人，侏儒

results.name: jet-skiing
results.english: the activity of using a Jet Ski to travel across water
results.example1: He wanted to go jet-skiing.

results.name: recoup
results.english: to get back money that you have spent or lost
results.example1: It takes a while to recoup the initial costs of starting up a business. 要收回開創新公司投入的先期成本需要一段時間。
results.example2: The gambler recouped his losses in the next game. 這個賭徒在隨後一局中贏回了輸掉的錢。

results.name: bum sb out
results.english: to make someone feel sad or disappointed
results.example1: That comment just bummed me out. 那句評論真讓我失望。
results.example2: Dan's poor attitude often bums his friends out. 丹差勁的態度常常惹惱朋友。

results.name: turn a profit
results.english: to begin to earn a profit
results.example1: He’s been in business five years, but has not yet turned a profit. 他進入這個行業已有五年，但還沒有開始盈利。
results.example2: The company is hoping to turn a profit when it releases a new product aimed at children. 這家公司發表了一項鎖定兒童的產品，希望開始獲利。

results.name: emptiness
results.english: empty space
results.example1: He gazed out over the emptiness of the desert. 他凝視著遠處空曠的沙漠。

results.name: meager
results.english: (of amounts or numbers) very small or not enough
results.example1: a meagre salary 微薄的薪水
results.example2: The prisoners existed on a meagre diet. 那些囚犯靠少得可憐的食物維持生存。

results.name: live off sb/sth
results.english: to use someone or something to provide the money or food that you need to live
results.example1: All his life he had lived off his father. 他一輩子都靠父親生活。
results.example2: They had learned to live off the land (= grow or find their own food). 他們學會了靠土地吃飯。

results.name: on the ropes
results.english: doing badly and likely to fail
results.chinese: 處於困境；即將失敗，即將完蛋
results.example1: I think the business is finally on the ropes. 我覺得這家企業最終要垮掉了。
results.example2: The airline is on the ropes and has to sell off some of its assets. 這家航空公司處境危險，必須低價出售部分資產。

results.name: be keen to
results.english: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much
results.example1: They were very keen to start work as soon as possible. 他們渴望盡早開始工作。
results.example2: Travis is keen to start his new job at a record company. 崔維斯一心想要展開他在唱片公司的新工作。

results.name: jump-start
results.english: to start a car engine by pushing the car or by using jump leads
results.chinese: 助推起動（一台汽車幫助另一台電瓶沒電的汽車發動)
results.example1: The EU is keen to jump-start its ailing tourism sector. 歐盟一心想要力推慘談的觀光業。

results.name: up to speed
results.english: If you are up to speed with a subject or activity, you have all the latest information about it and are able to do it well.
results.chinese: 跟上進度；了解最新情況
results.example1: We arranged for some home tutoring to get him up to speed with the other children in his class. 我們安排了一些家庭輔導，以幫助他跟上班裡其他孩子的進度。
results.example2: Before we start the meeting I'm going to bring you up to speed with the latest developments. 在會議開始之前，我想先向大家介紹一下最新的進展。

results.name: indoctrinate
results.english: to often repeat an idea or belief to someone in order to persuade them to accept it
results.example1: Some parents were critical of attempts to indoctrinate children in green ideology. 有些父母對向孩子灌輸綠色生態意識的意圖提出了批評。
results.example2: They have been indoctrinated by television to believe that violence is normal. 電視節目的灌輸使他們認為暴力行為是正常的。

results.name: submissive
results.english: A submissive person allows themselves to be controlled by other people.
results.example1: He was looking for a quiet, submissive wife who would obey his every word. 他想找一個溫順嫻靜的妻子，對他百依百順。

results.name: emancipation
results.english: the process of giving people social or political freedom and rights
results.chinese: 解放；給予人們政治或社會自由權利
results.example1: women's/female emancipation 婦女／女性解放
results.example2: black emancipation 黑人的解放

results.name: proclamation of independence
results.english: an official announcement
results.example1: to issue a proclamation 發表聲明
results.example2: A bloody civil war followed the proclamation of an independent state. 隨著國家獨立宣言的發表，一場血腥的內戰爆發了。

results.name: exemplify.
results.english: to be or give a typical example of something
results.chinese: 作為…的典範（或範例、典型、榜樣等）；舉例說明
results.example1: This painting perfectly exemplifies the naturalistic style which was so popular at the time. 這幅油畫是那個時期風靡一時的自然主義風格的完美典範。

results.name: unbridled spirit
results.english: not controlled or limited
results.example1: unbridled ambition/enthusiasm/lust 無限的野心／熱情／激情

results.name: merciless
results.english: having or showing no mercy
results.chinese: 冷酷無情的，殘忍的，毫無憐憫之心的
results.example1: There are reports of merciless attacks on innocent civilians. 有報道說無辜平民受到了殘酷無情的襲擊。
results.example2: There was no shelter from the merciless (= very strong) heat. 滾滾熱浪襲下人們無處可躲。

results.name: foe
results.english: an enemy
results.example1: The two countries have united against their common foe. 兩國聯合起來對抗共同的敵人。
results.example2: Foes of the government will be delighting in its current difficulties. 政府的敵人會對政府目前的困難處境幸災樂禍。

results.name: deface
results.english: to damage and spoil the appearance of something by writing or drawing on it
results.example1: He was fined for defacing library books. 他因在從圖書館借來的書上亂寫亂畫而被罰款。
results.example2: The walls of the old building were defaced where people had spray-painted their names. 那棟舊大樓的牆面被破壞，人們用噴漆在上面寫自己的名字。

results.name: oppression of women
results.english: a situation in which people are governed in an unfair and cruel way and prevented from having opportunities and freedom
results.example1: Every human being has the right to freedom from oppression. 每個人都有權不受壓迫。
results.example2: War, famine and oppression have forced people in the region to flee from their homes. 戰爭、饑荒和壓迫迫使這個地區的人逃離自己的家園。

results.name: tolerant
results.english: willing to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with or approve of them
results.example1: The present government is even less tolerant of dissent. 這一屆政府甚至更不能容忍異議。
results.example2: People in Italy are more tolerant of children in public places than in Britain. 與英國相比，在義大利人們對小孩在公共場所活動更為寬容。

results.name: dispel the myth
results.english: to remove fears, doubts, and false ideas, usually by proving them wrong or unnecessary
results.example1: I'd like to start the speech by dispelling a few rumours that have been spreading recently. 我想在演講的開頭先澄清一些近期流傳的謠言。
results.example2: The company issued a statement to dispel some of the rumors surrounding the possible takeover. 公司發表了一份聲明，破除圍繞著潛在收購案的一些謠言。

results.name: rabies
results.english: a serious disease of the nervous system that can cause death. Rabies can be passed on to humans by other animals.
results.example1: Dogs, cats, foxes, and bats can all carry rabies. 狗、貓、狐狸和蝙蝠都可能傳播狂犬病。

results.name: skunk
results.english: a small, black and white North American animal that makes a strong, unpleasant smell as a defence when it is attacked

results.name: accentuate
results.english: to emphasize a particular feature of something or to make something more noticeable
results.chinese: 著重，強調；使明顯，使突出
results.example1: Her dress was tightly belted, accentuating the slimness of her waist. 她裙子的衣帶繫得很緊，凸顯出苗條的腰身。
results.example2: The new policy only serves to accentuate the inadequacy of help for the homeless. 這項新政策更加突顯了政府對無家可歸者的扶助不足。

results.name: sabotage
results.english: to damage or destroy equipment, weapons, or buildings in order to prevent the success of an enemy or competitor
results.chinese: （爲阻止敵人或對手成功而）毀壞，破壞（設備、武器或建築物）
results.example1: The rebels had tried to sabotage the oil pipeline. 叛亂分子曾試圖破壞輸油管道。

results.name: impostor
results.english: a person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others
results.example1: He felt like an impostor among all those intelligent people, as if he had no right to be there. 他感覺自己在所有那些聰明人中間像個冒牌貨——好像自己無權留在那裡。

results.name: synopsis
results.english: a short description of the contents of something such as a film or book
results.chinese: （電影、書籍等的）概要，梗概，提要

results.name: explanatory
results.english: giving an explanation about something
results.example1: There are explanatory notes with the diagram. 圖表附帶注釋。

results.name: agglomeration
results.english: a large group of many different things collected or brought together
results.example1: an agglomeration of various ethnic and religious groupings 不同種族和宗教的人的集會

results.name: cue
results.english: a signal for someone to do something
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] They started washing up, so that was our cue to leave the party. 他們開始洗刷碗碟了，這就是暗示我們該離開派對了。

results.name: pronounced
results.english: very noticeable or certain
results.example1: I'm told I have a very pronounced English accent when I speak French. 有人告訴我說，我在說法語時有明顯的英國口音。
results.example2: She's a woman of very pronounced views which she is not afraid to air. 她是個從不諱言其觀點的女人。

results.name: in a muddle
results.english: an untidy or confused state
results.example1: The documents were in a muddle. 檔雜亂地堆在一起。
results.example2: Whenever I go to Europe I get in a muddle about/over (= become confused about) how much things cost. 我每次歐洲，總是把錢弄得亂糟糟的搞不清。

results.name: divine
results.english: to guess something
results.example1: [ + that ] I divined from his grim expression that the news was not good. 他的表情很嚴肅，我猜不是甚麽好消息。

results.name: it is attenuated by ...
results.english: to make something smaller, thinner, or weaker
results.example1: Radiation from the sun is attenuated by the earth's atmosphere. 地球大氣層減輕了太陽幅射。

results.name: we skim his letter
results.english: to read or consider something quickly in order to understand the main points, without studying it in detail
results.example1: I've only skimmed (through/over) his letter; I haven't read it carefully yet. 我只是大致看了一遍他的來信，還沒有細讀。
results.example2: We've only skimmed the surface of (= considered a small part of) the problem. 我們只是粗淺地討論了一下這個問題。

results.name: longish
results.english: quite long

results.name: the gist
results.english: the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details
results.example1: That was the gist of what he said. 那就是他說話的大意。
results.example2: I think I got (= understood) the gist of what she was saying. 我想我明白她說的話的大意了。

results.name: it fascinates him
results.english: to interest someone a lot
results.example1: Science has always fascinated me. 科學一直令我著迷。
results.example2: Anything to do with planes and flying fascinates him. 一切有關飛機和飛行的東西都令他著迷。

results.name: appealing
results.english: attractive or interesting
results.chinese: 有吸引力的；有感染力的；有魅力的；令人感興趣的
results.example1: The idea of not having to get up early every morning is rather appealing (to me). 每天不用早起，這（對我）很有吸引力。
results.example2: He had a nice smile and an appealing personality. 他的微笑非常迷人，個性也充滿魅力。

results.name: at the end of the day
results.english: something that you say before you give the most important fact of a situation
results.chinese: 最終；到頭來；不管怎麽說
results.example1: Of course I'll listen to what she has to say but at the end of the day, it's my decision. 當然她要說甚麽我也會聽，但最終還是我來作決定。

results.name: figure (that)
results.english: to expect or think that something will happen
results.example1: [ + (that) ] We figured (that) you'd want to rest after your trip. 我們認為旅行之後你一定想休息一下。

results.name: droplet
results.english: a small drop of liquid

results.name: transcribe
results.english: to record something written, spoken, or played by writing it down
results.example1: Recordings of conversations are transcribed and entered into the database. 談話的錄音被轉寫下來並輸入資料庫。

results.name: biodegradable
results.english: able to decay naturally and in a way that is not harmful
results.chinese: 能進行生物降解的；可行生物分解的
results.example1: Biodegradable packaging helps to limit the amount of harmful chemicals released into the atmosphere. 可生物分解的包裝有助於減少排放到大氣層中的有害化學物質的數量。

results.name: peel
results.english: the skin of fruit and vegetables, especially after it has been removed
results.example1: apple peel 蘋果皮
results.example2: The dessert was decorated with strips of lemon peel. 甜點上有些切成絲狀的檸檬皮以作裝飾。

results.name: put a spin on...
results.english: a way of describing an idea or situation that makes it seem better than it really is, especially in politics
results.chinese: （尤指政治上的）加入詮釋，導向陳述
results.example1: They have tried to put a positive spin on the situation. 他們嘗試過將這個局面描述成具有正面意義。
results.example2: This report puts a different spin on the issue. 這篇報導對這個問題作出了全然不同的傾向描述。

results.name: be worth your while
results.english: to be an activity or action that you will get an advantage from
results.example1: It's worth your while taking out travel insurance before you travel. 在旅行前購買旅行保險是值得的。

results.name: hazmat
results.english: abbreviation for hazardous material: a dangerous substance
results.example1: Each volunteer was given a disposable white hazmat suit (= a suit that protects against dangerous substances) 給每個志願者都發了一件危險物品防護服。
results.example2: Over the past two weeks, hazmat crews have been flooded with anthrax false alarms. 在過去的幾個星期裡，危險物品處理隊收到了大量的炭疽病毒假警報。

results.name: pivotal
results.english: central and important
results.example1: a pivotal figure/role/idea 關鍵人物／角色／想法
results.example2: Japan plays a pivotal role in the global economy. 日本在全球經濟中扮演著重要的角色。

results.name: entries for the competition
results.english: a piece of work that you do in order to take part in a competition, or the act of taking part in a competition
results.example1: There have been a fantastic number of entries for this year's poetry competition. 今年的詩歌創作大賽收到的參賽作品很多，令人驚喜。
results.example2: Entry to the competition is restricted to those who have a ticket. 持票者方可參加競賽。

results.name: collective
results.english: of or shared by every member of a group of people
results.example1: collective responsibility/leadership 共同責任／集體領導
results.example2: It took the collective efforts of the entire community to rebuild the town after the quake. 地震過後，動員了全社區的共同努力來重建這座城鎮。

results.name: solidarity
results.english: agreement between and support for the members of a group, especially a political group
results.example1: The situation raises important questions about solidarity among member states of the UN. 當前形勢對聯合國成員國能否團結一致這一重要問題提出了質疑。
results.example2: The purpose of the speech was to show solidarity with the country's leaders. 這場演講的目的是為了表示與國家領導人團結一致。

results.name: instructive
results.english: giving useful or interesting information
results.chinese: 有啟發性的；有教育意義的
results.example1: The instructive video taught Mona how to play the guitar. 這支教學影片教蒙娜怎麼彈吉它。

results.name: underrate
results.english: to fail to understand how skilful, important, etc. someone or something is
results.example1: The company has consistently underrated the importance of a well-trained workforce. 這個公司一貫低估一支訓練有素的員工隊伍的重要性。

results.name: play one's part
results.example1: Nico played his part in the baseball team's victory. 那支棒球隊的勝利，尼可有所貢獻。

results.name: vantage point
results.english: a place, especially a high place, that provides a good, clear view of an area
results.chinese: （尤指較高的）有利地勢；觀察位置
results.example1: From our lofty vantage point, we could see the city spread out below us. 這裡居高臨下，我們可以俯瞰腳下城市的全貌。
results.example2: The top of the hill was a great vantage point to see the city. 那座山丘的山頂是觀看這座城市不錯的地點。

results.name: it's a cliché
results.english: a saying or remark that is very often made and is therefore not original and not interesting
results.chinese: 陳腔濫調，老生常談，老套的話
results.example1: My wedding day - and I know it's a cliché - was just the happiest day of my life. 我結婚那天——我知道這是老生常談——是我一生中最幸福的一天。
results.example2: the movie was criticized for its cliche plot. 那部電影被批評劇情老套。

results.name: line of sight
results.english: the direction in which a person must look in order to see a particular object
results.chinese: 視線（某人看某物的方向）
results.example1: The cannon can be linked to the line of sight of the gunner so that it points in the same direction that he is looking in. 加農炮可與炮手的視線連成一線，因此它所瞄準的方向和炮手觀察的方向一致。

results.name: shady
results.english: sheltered from direct light from the sun
results.example1: We sat on the shady grass for our picnic. 我們坐在陰涼的草地上野餐。

results.name: telesales
results.english: the advertising or selling of goods or services by phone

results.name: a villainous man
results.english: A villainous person or an action is evil.
results.example1: a villainous dictator 殘暴的獨裁統治者

results.name: don a coat
results.english: to put on a piece of clothing
results.example1: He donned his finest coat and hat. 他穿上了他最帥的外套，戴上了他最好的帽子。

results.name: tiara
results.english: a piece of metal in the shape of half a circle decorated with jewels (= precious stones) that is worn on the head by a woman, especially a queen, etc., at very formal social occasions
results.chinese: （尤指女王等地位高的女性在非常正式的場合佩戴的）冕狀寶石頭飾

results.name: sneer at my shoes
results.english: to talk about or look at someone or something in an unkind way that shows you do not respect or approve of him, her, or it
results.example1: She'll probably sneer at my new shoes because they're not expensive. 她也許會取笑我的新鞋子，因爲買得很便宜。
results.example2: [ + speech ] Is that the best you can do? he sneered. 「那就是你最大的能耐了嗎？」他嘲笑著說。

results.name: he warranted a punishment
results.english: to make a particular activity necessary
results.example1: Obviously what she did was wrong, but I don't think it warranted such a severe punishment. 顯然她做得不對，但我認為她不應該受到如此嚴厲的懲罰。
results.example2: It's a relatively simple task that really doesn't warrant a great deal of time being spent on it. 這是一個相對來說比較簡單的任務，不必在上面花費大量的時間。

results.name: diametrically
results.english: completely
results.example1: The two politicians have diametrically opposite points of view/are diametrically opposed. 這兩位政治家的觀點截然相反。

results.name: Antifa
results.english: groups of people who oppose fascism (= a political system based on a very powerful leader, state control, and being extremely proud of country and race, and in which political opposition is not allowed), and who show this using protests and sometimes violence
results.example1: He was involved with Antifa for almost 30 years.
results.example2: She is sympathetic to Antifa's goal of silencing racist extremists.

results.name: exchange words
results.english: to talk to each other for a short time
results.example1: We exchanged a few words as we were coming out of the meeting. 我們走出會議室時匆匆交談了幾句。

results.name: a drunken brawl
results.english: a noisy, rough, uncontrolled fight
results.chinese: （亂哄哄的）毆鬥，閙事 (立法院那種)
results.example1: a drunken brawl 醉酒毆鬥

results.name: break new grounds
results.english: to do or discover something new
results.chinese: 開辟新天地，創新；作出新發現
results.example1: This recovery technique breaks new ground. 這種康復技術是一項創新。

results.name: all-out
results.english: complete and with as much effort as possible
results.chinese: 竭盡全力的，全力以赴的
results.example1: We made an all-out effort to get the project finished on time. 我們全力以赴，力爭按時完成該項工程。

results.name: it rattled me
results.english: to worry someone or make someone nervous
results.example1: The creaking upstairs was starting to rattle me. 樓上發出的吱嘎聲使我開始緊張不安起來。

results.name: melt sth down
results.english: to heat a metal object until it turns to liquid, because you want to use the metal rather than the object
results.example1: They melted down the gold rings and bracelets. 他們將金戒指和金手鐲熔化了。

results.name: train of thought
results.english: a series of connected thoughts or events
results.example1: What amazing train of thought led you from Napoleon to global warming? 是怎樣的思路使你從拿破崙想到全球變暖？
results.example2: The book describes the train of events that led up to the assassination. 這本書描述了導致暗殺的一連串事件。

results.name: impossible to conceive
results.english: to imagine something
