results.example1: [ + question word ] I can't conceive (= it is too shocking to imagine) how anyone could behave so cruelly. 我不能想像有人竟然能做出如此殘酷的事情。
results.example2: [ + that ] I find it hard to conceive (= it is too shocking to imagine) that people are still treated so badly. 人們竟然還受著那樣的虐待，實在令我難以想像。

results.name: terminology
results.english: special words or expressions used in relation to a particular subject or activity
results.example1: scientific terminology 科學術語

results.name: blithely
results.english: happily and without feeling or showing any worry, especially when there is a reason to be worried
results.example1: She blithely agreed to the contract without realizing what its consequences would be.
results.example2: A blithely optimistic 75% of the students believed that they would one day become millionaires.

results.name: a regime
results.english: a particular government or a system or method of government
results.example1: The old corrupt, totalitarian regime was overthrown. 腐敗的舊極權政府被推翻。

results.name: high-profile
results.english: attracting a lot of attention and interest from the public and newspapers, television, etc.
results.chinese: 引人注目的，備受關注的
results.example1: high-profile politicians 備受關注的政治家
results.example2: He resigned from a high-profile job as economic adviser to the president. 他辭去了總統財經顧問這備受矚目的職位元。

results.name: an envoy
results.english: someone who is sent as a representative from one government or organization to another
results.example1: a United Nations special envoy 聯合國特使

results.name: almighty
results.english: (of God) having the power to do everything
results.chinese: （上帝）全能的，萬能的，有無限權力的
results.example1: Almighty God 全能的上帝

results.name: she is erratic
results.english: (UNCERTAIN) moving or behaving in a way that is not regular, certain, or expected
results.chinese: （動作、行爲等）不規則的，不確定的，無計劃的
results.example1: He drove in an erratic course down the road. 他開車忽左忽右地在路上蛇行。
results.example2: She can be very erratic; one day she is friendly and the next she'll hardly speak to you. 她喜怒無常，今天待你很友善，明天又懶得理你。

results.name: on the decline
results.english: when something becomes less in amount, importance, quality, or strength
results.example1: Home cooking seems to be on the decline (= not so many people are doing it). 自己在家做飯的人似乎越來越少了。
results.example2: She seemed to be recovering and then she went into a decline. 她的身體似乎開始恢復了，但後來卻又變得越來越虛弱。

results.name: vouch for sth/sb
results.english: to say that you know from experience that something is true or good, or that someone is honest and has a good character
results.example1: Patricia has checked the reports and can vouch for the accuracy of the information. 派特裡夏已經核對過報告，可以保證資訊的準確性。

results.name: mellow
results.english: smooth and soft, or not too sharp, bright, new, or rough
results.example1: mellow sounds 柔和的聲音
results.example2: mellow autumn sunlight 秋日柔和的陽光

results.name: at the tip of your finger
results.example1: The cloud storage program allows Jenny to keep her work files at the tip of her fingers wherever she is. 雲端儲存程式讓珍妮到哪都能隨手存用工作檔案。

results.name: not utter a word
results.english: to say something or to make a sound with your voice
results.example1: She sat through the whole meeting without uttering a word. 整個會議期間她一言不發。
results.example2: Janice never utters a curse word. 珍妮絲絕不會說罵人的話。

results.name: carnival
results.english: (a special occasion or period of) public enjoyment and entertainment involving wearing unusual clothes, dancing, and eating and drinking, usually held in the streets of a city
results.example1: a Caribbean carnival 加勒比海狂歡節
results.example2: There's a real carnival atmosphere in the streets. 街上真是一片狂歡節的氣氛。

results.name: a small-time theatre
results.english: not very successful or important
results.example1: a small-time crook 不起眼的騙子
results.example2: a small-time theatre 二流劇院

results.name: attempt to rally
results.english: to return to a better condition
results.example1: The nurse said my mother had rallied after a poor night. 護士說，我母親在經歷了情況危急的一夜之後已經開始好轉了。
results.example2: The team played badly in the first half of the game but rallied in the second. 球隊在上半場比賽中表現很糟糕，但在下半場重整旗鼓，表現很好。

results.name: a punter
results.english: a person who gambles (= risks money guessing the result of something)
results.example1: Bookmakers are offering punters odds of 6–1 on the horse Red Devil winning the race. 對那匹叫「紅色魔鬼」的馬，賭馬業者給下注人提出的獲勝賠率是6比1。

results.name: whopping
results.english: extremely large
results.example1: She had a whopping great bruise on her arm. 她胳膊上有一大片瘀傷。
results.example2: The company paid a whopping $10 million fine for polluting the river. 該公司因為污染河川付了驚人的1000萬元罰金。

results.name: a minuscule amount of
results.english: extremely small
results.example1: All she gave him to eat was two minuscule pieces of toast. 她只給他吃了兩小片烤麵包。
results.example2: Brandon put a minuscule amount of effort into the assignment and it showed. 布蘭登投入這項作業裡的努力極少，這點看得出來。

results.name: conjure
results.english: to make something appear by magic, or as if by magic
results.chinese: 用魔法變出；像變魔術般變出
results.example1: In an instant, the magician had conjured (up) a dove from his hat. 魔術師眨眼間便從他的帽子裡變出了一隻鴿子。
results.example2: The waiter seemed to conjure a towel out of nowhere when Michael spilled his drink. 麥可打翻飲料時，服務生彷彿無中生有般變出一條毛巾。

results.name: guinea pig
results.english: a small animal covered in fur with rounded ears, short legs, and no tail, often kept as a pet by children

results.name: wiggle
results.english: to (cause to) move up and down and/or from side to side with small, quick movements
results.example1: He tried wiggling the control stick but nothing happened. 他試著扭動控制杆，可一點用也沒有。
results.example2: Bonnie wiggled the key in the lock to get it to turn and open. 邦妮扭動鎖頭上的鑰匙來轉向、開門。

results.name: a blistering attack
results.english: extremely angry and unkind
results.example1: blistering remarks/sarcasm 猛烈的抨撃／諷刺

results.name: incredulous people
results.english: not wanting or not able to believe something, and usually showing this
results.chinese: 不願相信的；不能相信的；表示懷疑的
results.example1: A few incredulous spectators watched on as Paterson, ranked 23rd in the world, beat the champion. 一些觀眾觀看了世界排名第23位的派特森擊敗世界冠軍，他們簡直不敢相信。

results.name: (sb) turn out
results.english: If people turn out for an event, they go to be there or to watch.
results.example1: Thousands of people turned out to welcome the team home. 成千上萬的人到場歡迎隊伍歸國。

results.name: substantive
results.english: important, serious, or related to real facts
results.chinese: 重要的；嚴肅的；實質性的，本質的
results.example1: Substantive research on the subject needs to be carried out. 需要針對這課題開展實質性的研究。
results.example2: The documents are the first substantive information obtained by the investigators. 這些文件是調查者得到的第一批實質材料。

results.name: a critique
results.english: a report of something such as a political situation or system, or a person's work or ideas, that examines it and provides a judgment, especially a negative one
results.example1: a Marxist critique of neo-liberal policy 以馬克思主義觀點評論新自由政策的文章

results.name: barb
results.english: a remark that is funny but unkind
results.example1: I tried to ignore their barbs about my new jacket. 我努力不去理會他們針對我的新夾克所說的那些連諷帶刺的話。

results.name: jab
results.english: to push or hit something forcefully and quickly, often with a thin or sharp object
results.example1: The doctor jabbed the needle into the dog's leg. 醫生將針頭紮入狗的腿中。
results.example2: Watch out! You nearly jabbed me in the eye with your umbrella! 小心！你的雨傘快戳到我眼睛了！

results.name: he laced into her
results.english: to attack violently, either verbally or physically
results.example1: The foreman violently laced into Jack. 工頭狠狠地抽打傑克。

results.name: drill down
results.english: to look for something on a computer or website by moving from general information to more detailed information
results.chinese: 深層探究（通過電腦或網路，將搜索從對象的概要資訊向具體資訊擴展）
results.example1: Many websites have some form of hyperlink navigation as you drill down. 瀏覽層層網頁時，你會發現很多網頁都有超連結導航。

results.name: tailgate
results.english: to drive too closely behind the vehicle in front

results.name: a bombshell
results.english: a sudden and often unpleasant piece of news
results.chinese: （常指令人不快的）出人意料的消息；爆炸性新聞
results.example1: My sister dropped a bombshell by announcing she was leaving her job. 我姐姐宣佈她要辭職，這讓大家大吃一驚。

results.name: embolden
results.english: to make someone brave
results.example1: Emboldened by drink, he walked over to speak to her. 他借酒壯膽，走上前去與她搭訕。

results.name: a cabal
results.english: a small group of people who plan secretly to take action, especially political action
results.chinese: （尤指策劃政治行動的）陰謀小集團，陰謀團夥
results.example1: He was assassinated by a cabal of aides within his own regime. 他被自己政權內部的幕僚所組成的陰謀集團暗殺了。

results.name: we venturing into the unknown
results.english: to risk going somewhere or doing something that might be dangerous or unpleasant, or to risk saying something that might be criticized
results.example1: She rarely ventured outside, except when she went to stock up on groceries. 她極少冒險外出，除非要去採購雜貨。
results.example2: As we set off into the forest, we felt as though we were venturing (forth) into the unknown. 當我們動身進入那片森林時，感覺自己似乎正在冒險進入一個未知的世界。

results.name: curfew
results.english: a rule that everyone must stay at home between particular times, usually at night, especially during a war or a period of political trouble
results.chinese: （尤指戰爭或政治動盪時期實行的）宵禁，戒嚴
results.example1: to impose/lift a curfew 實行／取消戒嚴
results.example2: He was shot for breaking (= not obeying) the curfew. 他因違反宵禁令而遭到槍擊。

results.name: bespectacled
results.english: wearing glasses
results.example1: a small, bespectacled man in a drab suit 戴著眼鏡、穿著淺褐色西裝的小個子男人

results.name: non-sectarian
results.english: not connected with any specific religion
results.chinese: 不與任何特定宗教有關聯的
results.example1: About 1,500 students attend 23 non-sectarian private schools. 約有1500名學生進入23所非特定宗教學校。

results.name: lay waste the country
results.english: to completely destroy something
results.example1: The bomb laid the city centre to waste. 炸彈將市中心夷爲平地。

results.name: cobble sth together
results.english: to do or make something quickly and not very carefully
results.chinese: 粗製濫造；東拼西湊；匆匆拼湊
results.example1: I just had to cobble this meal together from what I had in the fridge. 我只得用冰箱裡現成的東西湊合這頓飯。

results.name: he is berated for...
results.english: to criticize or speak in an angry manner to someone
results.example1: As he left the meeting, he was berated by angry demonstrators. 他離開會場時遭到了憤怒的示威者責罵。
results.example2: Doctors are often berated for being poor communicators, particularly when they have to give patients bad news. 醫生常常因不善於溝通而遭受指責，特別是當他們必須告訴病人壞消息的時候。

results.name: shy away from sth
results.english: to avoid something that you dislike, fear, or do not feel confident about
results.chinese: （因不喜歡、害怕或缺乏自信而）退縮，躲避，畏避
results.example1: I've never shied away from hard work. 我從未畏避過艱苦的工作。

results.name: a stowaway
results.english: a person who hides on a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle

results.name: welfare
results.english: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money
results.example1: Your taxes pay for welfare benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay. 你交的稅用作諸如失業和醫療等方面的福利救濟。
results.example2: UK After her month's sick leave, she was summoned to see the company's welfare officer. 她休了一個月病假之後，公司的福利主管約見了她。

results.name: a downright disgrace
results.english: (especially of something bad) extremely or very great
results.chinese: （尤指不好的事情）極端的，極大的，十足的
results.example1: I think the way she was treated is a downright disgrace. 我認爲那樣對待她是非常不光彩的。
results.example2: She's being downright unhelpful and obstructive. 她這個人很難相處，而且總喜歡與人作對。

results.name: tank
results.english: to go down in price, value, etc., or to become less successful
results.chinese: （價格、價值）下跌；不如原來成功
results.example1: The state was expecting an increase in tax revenues, but that was before the economy tanked. 政府預期稅收會有所增加，但那是在經濟下跌之前。
results.example2: Car exports in the year to April tanked 23 percent. 汽車出口在到四月份的一年間下跌了23%。

results.name: staunch the flow of
results.english: to stop something happening, or to stop liquid, especially blood, from flowing out
results.example1: The country's asylum laws were amended to staunch the flow/flood of economic migrants. 該國修訂避難法，阻止經濟移民的洪流。
results.example2: Mike pressed hard on the wound and staunched the flow of blood. 麥克使勁壓住傷口，止住了出血。

results.name: genre
results.english: a style, especially in the arts, that involves a particular set of characteristics
results.example1: What genre does the book fall into - comedy or tragedy? 這本書屬於甚麽體裁——喜劇還是悲劇？
results.example2: a literary/musical/film genre 文學體裁／音樂風格／電影類型

results.name: along the lines of sth
results.english: similar in type
results.example1: I was thinking of doing a meal along the lines of that dinner I did for Annie and Dave. 我想做一頓類似那次給安妮和戴夫做的飯菜。
results.example2: They're campaigning for the electoral system to be reformed along the lines of (= so that it becomes similar to) the one in Germany. 他們在爭取仿照德國的選舉制度而對自己進行改造。

results.name: it monetized its users
results.english: to make money from something
results.example1: The problem was how to monetize this kind of social networking site. 問題是如何從這樣的社交媒體網站上賺錢。
results.example2: The free video game monetized its users by adding paid extras. 這個免費電玩藉加入付費加值來從用戶身上獲利。

results.name: elaborate preparations
results.english: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts
results.chinese: 精心計劃（或製作）的；詳盡的；複雜的
results.example1: You want a plain blouse to go with that skirt - nothing too elaborate. 你應該用一件樣式簡單的襯衫來配那條裙子，不要樣式太複雜的。
results.example2: They're making the most elaborate preparations for the wedding. 他們正爲婚禮做極爲精心周到的準備。

results.name: plateau
results.english: a period during which there are no large changes
results.example1: The US death rate reached a plateau in the 1960s, before declining suddenly. 美國的人口死亡率在20世紀60年代進入平穩階段後突然下降。

results.name: impairment
results.english: the act of spoiling something or making it weaker so that it is less effective

results.name: differentials workup
results.english: an intensive diagnostic study especially for medical purposes

results.name: the fabric of our society
results.english: the structure or parts of something
results.chinese: （尤指社會或建築物的）結構，構造
results.example1: the fabric of society 社會結構
results.example2: Unhappiness was woven into the natural fabric of people's lives. 苦惱憂愁原是人們日常生活的一部分。

results.name: in the throes of recession
results.english: experiencing or doing something that is difficult, unpleasant, or painful
results.chinese: 處於…的困境之中；處於…的苦難中；處於…的動盪時期
results.example1: The country is presently in the throes of the worst recession since the Second World War. 該國目前正處於二戰以來最蕭條動盪的時期。
results.example2: He's in the throes of a mid-life crisis that makes him pretty hard to live with. 他正處於中年危機的痛苦時期，很難與他一起生活。

results.name: rupture
results.english: to (cause something to) explode, break, or tear
results.example1: His appendix ruptured and he had to be rushed to hospital. 他突然闌尾穿孔，不得不被緊急送進醫院。
results.example2: figurative This news has ruptured (= violently ended) the delicate peace between the rival groups. 這個消息打破了這些敵對群體間脆弱的和平局面。

results.name: cranial
results.english: of the skull

results.name: grapple with sth
results.english: to try to deal with or understand a difficult problem or subject
results.chinese: 盡力解決；設法對付；盡量克服
results.example1: Today, many Americans are still grappling with the issue of race. 今天，仍有許多美國人還沒有克服種族歧視的觀念。
results.example2: The police force is grappling with a sudden rise in crime. 警方努力因應突然增加的犯罪。

results.name: be buffeted by the waves
results.english: (of wind, rain, etc.) to hit something repeatedly and with great force
results.example1: The little boat was buffeted mercilessly by the waves. 海浪無情地拍打著小船。
results.example2: Heavy waves are buffeting the coastline because of the typhoon. 因為颱風，巨浪沖打著海岸線。

results.name: across the board
results.english: happening or having an effect on people at every level and in every area
results.chinese: 影響到各個領域和階層的；全面的
results.example1: The improvement has been across the board, with all divisions either increasing profits or reducing losses. 情況全面好轉，所有的部門不是盈利增加就是虧損減少。
results.example2: The initiative has across-the-board support. 該行動得到了各方面的支持。

results.name: grassroots.
results.english: involving the ordinary people in a society or an organization
results.example1: grassroots support 基層民眾的支持
results.example2: Andrew has a lot of support from the grassroots members of the party. 安德魯獲得黨內很多基層成員的支持。

results.name: running mate
results.english: in the US, a political partner chosen for a politician who is trying to get elected
results.chinese: （美國政治選舉中的）競選夥伴
results.example1: If a candidate for president wins the election, his/her running mate becomes the vice president. 如果總統候選人贏得選舉，他／她的競選夥伴就成為副總統。

results.name: ticket
results.english: a number of people representing a particular political party in an election
results.chinese: （選舉中某政黨的）候選人名單
results.example1: the Republican/Democratic ticket 共和黨／民主黨候選人名單

results.name: fundraiser
results.english: a person or event involved in collecting money for a particular purpose, especially a charity

results.name: callout
results.english: an occasion when someone is asked to come to a person's home or to a particular place in order to do a job, help someone, etc.
results.chinese: 應召出工（前往某人住宅或特定某處執行某項工作或協助某人）
results.example1: Many plumbers charge double for an emergency callout over the weekend. 許多水管工在週末緊急出工時會收雙倍費用。
results.example2: The mountain rescue service had several callouts last week. 山地救護隊在週末好幾次應召出動。

results.name: be reminiscent of sb/sth
results.english: making you remember a particular person, event, or thing
results.chinese: 使人想起…的；使人回憶起…的
results.example1: That song is so reminiscent of my adolescence. 那首歌勾起了我對青少年時代的無限回憶。
results.example2: The president's speech was reminiscent of one made by Theodore Roosevelt. 這位總統的演說讓人想起老羅斯福做過的一場演講。

results.name: take sb/sth by storm
results.english: to be suddenly extremely successful in a place or with a group of people
results.chinese: 席捲;在(某處)大獲成功；完全征服(一群人)
results.example1: Her performance has taken the critics by storm. 她的表演完全征服了評論界。
results.example2: Jeremy Lin took the world by storm with his performances for the Knicks. 林書豪以他在尼克隊的表現風靡全球。

results.name: twist
results.english: a change in the way in which something happens
results.example1: The story took a surprise twist today with media reports that the doctor had resigned. 媒體報道該醫生已經辭職，使事情在今天有了驚人的轉折。
results.example2: The incident was the latest twist in the continuing saga of fraud and high scandal in banks and stock brokerages. 此事件是銀行和股票經紀公司持續不斷的詐騙和高層醜聞的最新發展。

results.name: he required hospitalization
results.english: the act of taking someone to hospital and keeping them there for treatment
results.example1: Because of the severity of the accident, the patient required hospitalization. 因為事故嚴重，病人須留院治療。

results.name: government handouts
results.english: something such as food, clothing, or money that is given free to someone who has a great need for it
results.example1: I'm not interested in government handouts - all I want is a job. 我不稀罕政府施捨的物品，我想要的是一份工作。

results.name: only to do sth
results.english: used to show that something is surprising or unexpected
results.example1: He spent months negotiating for a pay increase, only to resign from his job soon after he'd received it. 他花了很長時間協商要求提高工資，不料工資剛提高不久卻辭了職。
results.example2: George won some money on the lottery, only to gamble it away again immediately afterwards. 喬治買樂透贏了一些錢，不料之後馬上就賭博輸光了。

results.name: he was evicted
results.english: to force someone to leave somewhere
results.example1: Tenants who fall behind in their rent risk being evicted. 拖欠房租的房客有被趕走的危險。
results.example2: He was evicted from the bar for drunken and disorderly behaviour. 他因為醉酒及暴力滋事被趕出酒吧。

results.name: on top of sth
results.english: in addition to something, especially something unpleasant
results.chinese: 除（尤指令人不快之事）之外（還）
results.example1: We missed our flight, and on top of that we had to wait seven hours for the next one. 我們沒趕上飛機，而且下一班還得再等七個小時。
results.example2: I lost my phone this morning, and on top of that, I got scolded by my boss. 今天早上我的手機不見了，不僅如此，我還被老闆罵。

results.name: take the brunt of sth
results.english: the main force of something unpleasant
results.example1: The infantry has taken/borne the brunt of the missile attacks. 步兵在飛彈襲撃中首當其衝。
results.example2: Small companies are feeling the full brunt of the recession. 小公司飽受經濟不景氣所帶來的壓力。

results.name: lurk in the shadows
results.english: to wait or move in a secret way so that you cannot be seen, especially because you are about to attack someone or do something wrong
results.chinese: （尤指爲攻擊某人或做壞事而）潛伏，隱蔽，悄悄移動
results.example1: Someone was lurking in the shadows. 有人藏在黑影裡。
results.example2: Why are you lurking around in the hallway? 你幹嗎在走廊裡鬼鬼祟祟的？

results.name: teem with sth
results.english: to contain large numbers of animals or people
results.example1: The mall was teeming with shoppers that Saturday. 那個週六，購物中心擠滿了顧客。
results.example2: Even though the rock pool was small, it was teeming with aquatic life. 雖然那座潮池不大，但裡面滿是水生生物。

results.name: edible
results.english: suitable or safe for eating
results.chinese: （無毒而）可以吃的；適宜食用的
results.example1: Only the leaves of the plant are edible. 這種植物僅葉子可食。
results.example2: Those edible mushrooms taste nice if they're boiled. 那些可食用的磨菇煮熟之後很美味。

results.name: sachet
results.english: a small closed container made of paper or plastic, containing a small amount of something, usually enough for only one occasion
results.chinese: （通常內容物僅夠用一次的）小袋，小包
results.example1: a sachet of sugar 一小袋糖

results.name: convalescent
results.english: someone who is getting better after a serious illness or injury
results.example1: a convalescent home/hospital 療養院／康復醫院
results.example2: Ian has gotten over the worst of the disease and is now in the convalescent stage. 伊恩已經度過這個疾病最嚴重的情況，現在處於恢復期。

results.name: physician
results.english: a medical doctor, especially one who has general skill and is not a surgeon

results.name: clog
results.english: to (cause something to) become blocked or filled so that movement or activity is difficult
results.example1: Eating too much fat causes your arteries to clog (up). 攝入過多脂肪會導致動脈栓塞。
results.example2: Leaves are clogging (up) the drain. 樹葉堵塞了下水道。

results.name: shore sth up
results.english: to stop a wall or a building from falling down by supporting it with building materials such as wood or metal
results.example1: Boundary walls have had to be shored up. 邊界牆須用支柱支撐。
results.example2: More soldiers were sent to the town to shore up its defenses. 有更多士兵被派到這座城鎮以穩固防禦。

results.name: visor
results.english: a part of a helmet that can be pulled down to cover the face, or a curved piece of stiff material that is worn above the eyes to give protection from strong light from the sun

results.name: hemorrhage
results.english: a large flow of blood from a damaged blood vessel (= tube carrying blood around the body)
results.example1: a brain hemorrhage 腦溢血
results.example2: The company is hemorrhaging money because the CEO isn't up to the job.那家公司正在大量虧損，因為執行長無法勝任其職。

results.name: first lieutenant
results.english: (the title of) an officer of middle rank in the armed forces
results.example1: first/second lieutenant （美國）中尉／少尉
results.example2: He was promoted to the rank of lieutenant. 他被升為中尉。

results.name: during his tenure
results.english: being the legal owner of land, a job, or an official public position, or the period of time during which you own it
results.example1: During his tenure as dean, he had a real influence on the students. 他當教務長期間，對學生們影響很大。

results.name: deflation
results.english: a reduction of the supply of money in an economy, and therefore a reduction of economic activity, that is often part of an intentional government plan to reduce prices

results.name: long-standing
results.english: having existed for a long time
results.chinese: 由來已久的，長期存在的
results.example1: a long-standing agreement 長期有效的協定

results.name: stalemate
results.english: a situation in which neither group involved in an argument can win or get an advantage and no action can be taken
results.example1: Tomorrow's meeting between the two leaders is expected to break a diplomatic stalemate that has lasted for ten years. 明天兩位領袖之間的會面有望打破長達十年的外交僵局。
results.example2: Despite long discussions, the workers and the management remain locked in stalemate. 儘管進行了長時間的磋商，工人和資方仍僵持不下。

results.name: fall short of expectations
results.english: to fail to reach an amount or standard that was expected or hoped for, causing disappointment
results.example1: August car sales fell short of the industry's expectations. 八月汽車銷量未達到業界的期望。
results.example2: The new gadget that Holly bought fell short of her expectations. 荷莉買的新玩意兒不如她的預期。

results.name: -odd
results.english: used after a number, especially a number that can be divided by ten, to show that the exact number is not known
results.chinese: （尤用於可被10整除的數字後）大約，…多一點
results.example1: I'd say Robert's about 40-odd - maybe 45. 我猜羅伯特大約有40幾歲——也許45歲。
results.example2: Only 20-odd people attended the book-signing event. 只有二十多人參加了簽書會。

results.name: stimulus
results.english: something that causes growth or activity
results.example1: Foreign investment has been a stimulus to the industry. 外國投資促進該產業的發展。
results.example2: The book will provide a stimulus to research in this very important area. 這本書將會對這重要領域的研究起促進作用。

results.name: take sth on
results.english: to accept a particular job or responsibility
results.example1: She took too much on and made herself ill. 她承擔的任務太重，結果病倒了。
results.example2: Edward took on his son's debts to help him out. 艾德華接下了兒子的債務來幫他一把。

results.name: be billed as
results.english: to advertise something with a particular description; to describe someone in a particular way in order to advertise them or make them known
results.example1: The movie was billed as a romantic comedy. 那齣電影被宣傳成浪漫喜劇。
results.example2: The young author was billed as the new Beckett. 這位年輕作家被吹捧為「新貝克特」。

results.name: dethrone
results.english: to remove a king or queen from their position of power
results.chinese: 推翻（國王或女王）;使下臺;被摘冠
results.example1: to beat someone who is the best at something, especially a sport, and become the best yourself （尤指在體育比賽中）打敗，擊敗（頂尖好手）
results.example2: The world champion was dethroned by a young Swedish challenger. 那位世界冠軍被一名年輕的瑞典挑戰者擊敗。

results.name: flagship
results.english: the best or most important product, idea, building, etc. that an organization owns or produces
results.example1: This machine is the flagship in our new range of computers. 這台機器是我們新電腦系列的主打産品。
results.example2: The company's flagship store is in New York. 這間公司的旗艦店在紐約。

results.name: brace yourself for
results.english: to prepare yourself physically or mentally for something unpleasant
results.chinese: （為困難或壞事）使防備；使作準備
results.example1: The passengers were told to brace themselves (= to press their bodies hard against something or hold them very stiff) for a crash landing. 乘客們被告知要做好緊急迫降準備。
results.example2: She told me she had some bad news for me and I braced myself for a shock. 她説有壞消息要告訴我，我已做好了承受打撃的準備。

results.name: head-on
results.english: A head-on accident is one in which the fronts of two vehicles hit each other.
results.chinese: 正面的;（事故）正面相撞的
results.example1: The car crossed the road and hit a truck head-on. 汽車橫越馬路迎頭撞上了一輛卡車。
results.example2: a head-on collision 迎頭相撞

results.name: attorney general
results.english: the top legal officer in some countries, whose job is to provide legal advice to the government and to represent the government
results.chinese: （某些國家的）檢察總長，首席檢察官；司法部長

results.name: it pans slowly across the room
results.english: (of a video camera) to move slowly from one side to another or up and down
results.example1: In the first scene, the camera pans slowly across the room. 在第一個鏡頭裡，攝錄機慢慢搖攝拍出房間的全景。

results.name: shatter the glass
results.english: to (cause something to) break suddenly into very small pieces
results.example1: The glass shattered into a thousand tiny pieces. 玻璃碎成無數塊細小的碎片。
results.example2: His leg was shattered in the accident. 他在事故中腿骨碎裂。

results.name: eyewitness
results.english: a person who saw something happen, for example, a crime or an accident
results.example1: According to an eyewitness account, the thieves abandoned their vehicle near the scene of the robbery. 據一位目擊證人的描述，這幫盜賊在搶劫現場附近棄車潛逃。

results.name: revolutionize
results.english: to completely change something so that it is much better
results.chinese: 使發生革命性劇變；在…方面引起突破性變革
results.example1: Newton's discoveries revolutionized physics. 牛頓的發現使物理學發生了革命性劇變。
results.example2: The Macintosh revolusionized desktop computing. 麥金塔電腦徹底改變了桌上型電腦系統。

results.name: the reporter covered the American election
results.english: to report the news about a particular important event
results.example1: She's covering the American election for BBC television. 她在為英國廣播公司的電視臺報道美國大選。
results.example2: The young reporter was given the job of covering the local council election. 這名年輕的記者被交付報導本地議會選舉的工作。

results.name: firsthand
results.english: If you experience something firsthand, you experience it yourself.
results.example1: Most of the older reporters have experienced war firsthand. 大多數年長的記者都親身經歷過戰爭。

results.name: engage
results.english: to interest someone in something and keep them thinking about it
results.example1: The debate about food safety has engaged the whole nation. 關於食品安全的爭論引起了全國關注。
results.example2: Shops that engage with customers often sell more products. 和顧客建立關係的店家通常銷量較好。

results.name: are you up for promotion?
results.english: intended, suggested, or being considered for something
results.chinese: 計劃要；被建議；正被考慮
results.example1: That house at the end of our road is up for sale again. 我們這條路盡頭的那座房子又要出售了。
results.example2: Are you really up for promotion? 你真的會被提升嗎？

results.name: for a song
results.english: very cheaply
results.example1: She bought the bed for a song at an auction. 她在一次拍賣會上以非常便宜的價格買下了這張床。
results.example2: Because the shop's closing down, most of the stock is going for a song (= being sold very cheaply). 這家商店要關門了，所以大多數存貨都廉價出售。

results.name: logistics
results.english: the careful organization of a complicated activity so that it happens in a successful and effective way
results.example1: We need to look at the logistics of the whole aid operation. 我們需要審視整個援助行動的後勤保障工作。

results.name: plaque
results.english: a substance containing bacteria that forms on the surface of teeth

results.name: a ranger
results.english: a person whose job is to protect a forest or natural park
results.example1: a forest ranger 護林員

results.name: turn to sb/sth
results.english: to ask a person or organization for help or support
results.example1: Without someone to turn to for advice, making the most appropriate choice can be difficult. 在沒有人可以徵求意見的情況下，要作出最恰當的選擇可能會很難。
results.example2: Her family lived a long way away, and she had no one to turn to. 她的家人住得很遠，她無人可以求助。

results.name: a radical politician
results.english: believing or expressing the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change
results.example1: He was known as a radical reformer/thinker/politician. 他是個著名的激進改革者／思想家／政治家。
results.example2: These people have very radical views. 這些人觀點很偏激。

results.name: round-the-clock.
results.english: happening or done all day and all night
results.chinese: 日夜不停的，不分晝夜的
results.example1: He's very sick and needs round-the-clock care. 他的病很重，需要日夜不停的護理。

results.name: once-in-a-lifetime
results.english: A once-in-a-lifetime experience or opportunity is very special because you will probably only have it once.
results.chinese: 一生中難得一次的；千載難逢的；難能可貴的
results.example1: A tour of Australia is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. 澳大利亞之行是一生難得的一次經歷。

results.name: pilgrimage
results.english: a special journey made by a pilgrim
results.example1: Muslims try to make a pilgrimage/go on a pilgrimage to Mecca at least once in their life. 大多數回教徒都設法一生至少去麥加朝聖一次。

results.name: shrine
results.english: a place for worship that is holy because of a connection with a holy person or object
results.example1: Islam's most sacred shrine is at Mecca in Saudi Arabia. 伊斯蘭教最神聖的聖殿位於沙烏地阿拉伯的麥加。

results.name: choreograph
results.english: to plan the combination of movements to be performed in a dance
results.example1: The ballet was choreographed by Ashton.
results.example2: She continues to choreograph new dances for her company, although she rarely performs anymore.

results.name: humility
results.english: the quality of not being proud because you are aware of your bad qualities
results.example1: He doesn't have the humility to admit when he's wrong. 他在自己犯錯的時候不會謙虛地承認。
results.example2: They might be very rich, but it wouldn't hurt them to show a little humility. 他們可能非常富有，但是表現得謙遜一點對他們不會有甚麼害處。

results.name: rekindle their love
results.english: to make someone have a feeling that they had in the past
results.example1: The holiday was a last chance to rekindle their love. 這次休假是使他們重新燃起愛情之火的最後一次機會。

results.name: thrust
results.english: to push suddenly and strongly
results.example1: She thrust the money into his hand. 她把錢塞進他手中。
results.example2: She thrust the papers at me (= towards me). 她把報紙塞給我。

results.name: PPE
results.english: equipment and clothing that protects people from health risks at work
results.chinese: 個人防護設備 (Personal Protective Equipment)
results.example1: PPE must be worn when working with compressed air.
results.example2: Use protective gloves and other PPE, for example when sharps are involved.

results.name: second to sb/sth
results.example1: Liam finished second to Rebecca in the talent show. 黎安在才藝表演上最後只輸給了蕾貝卡。

results.name: a cubicle
results.english: a small space with walls or curtains around it, that is separate from the rest of a room and where you can be private when taking clothes off, etc.
results.chinese: （大房間中分隔出來的）小房間，小隔間
results.example1: a shower cubicle 淋浴間
results.example2: I was getting undressed in one of the cubicles. 我正在其中的一個隔間裡脫衣服。

results.name: the ballot box
results.english: used to refer to elections or other occasions when people officially vote
results.example1: Despite the scandal, the leader's opponents could not win at the ballot box. 儘管出現了醜聞，這位領導人的反對者仍然未能贏得選舉。

results.name: landlord
results.english: a person or organization that owns a building or an area of land and is paid by other people for the use of it
results.example1: The landlord had promised to redecorate the bedrooms before we moved in. 房東承諾在我們搬進去之前會把睡房重新裝修一番。
results.example2: Housing associations are the biggest landlords in this area. 住房協會是本地區最大的房東。

results.name: rite of passage
results.english: an official ceremony or informal activity that marks an important stage or occasion in a person's life, especially becoming an adult
results.chinese: 人生重要階段的儀式；（尤指）成人儀式
results.example1: A bar mitzvah is a rite of passage of Jewish boys. 受戒禮是猶太男孩的人生大事。

results.name: frantic
results.english: almost out of control because of extreme emotion, such as worry
results.example1: Where on earth have you been? We've been frantic with worry. 你到底去哪裡了？我們都擔心死了。

results.name: a sinking feeling
results.english: a feeling that something bad is going to happen
results.example1: I had a sinking feeling when I picked up the bill. 接到帳單時，我有種不祥的預感。

results.name: worrisome
results.english: worrying
results.chinese: 令人著急的；令人擔憂的
results.example1: Alcohol and tobacco consumption by young people is especially worrisome because habits formed early are likely to persist. 年輕人的吸煙飲酒問題特別令人擔心，因為那些早期形成的習慣很可能持續下去。

results.name: a deviant guy
results.english: used to describe a person or behaviour that is not usual and is generally considered to be unacceptable

results.name: get agitated
results.english: to make someone feel worried or angry
results.example1: I didn't want to agitate her by telling her. 我不想告訴她，免得她焦慮。

results.name: a hallmark
results.english: a typical characteristic or feature of a person or thing
results.example1: Simplicity is a hallmark of this design. 簡潔是該設計的一個特點。
results.example2: This explosion bears/has all the hallmarks of (= is likely to have been) a terrorist attack. 這次爆炸帶有恐怖襲擊的所有特徵。

results.name: sidle up
results.english: to walk towards or away from someone, trying not to be noticed
results.example1: Tim sidled up/over to the girl sitting at the bar and asked if he could buy her a drink. 蒂姆悄悄走近坐在吧台前的那位小姐，問是否可以請她喝一杯。
results.example2: She sidled past him, pretending that she had not seen him. 她從他身邊悄悄走過，假裝沒有看見他。

results.name: the very cusp
results.english: the dividing line between two very different things
results.example1: on the cusp of adulthood 即將成年

results.name: a chameleon
results.english: a lizard that changes skin colour to match what surrounds it so that it cannot be seen

results.name: winter sets in
results.english: When something unpleasant sets in, it begins and seems likely to continue in a serious way.
results.chinese: （不好的事）到來，開始（而且可能會持續）
results.example1: If you get bitten by a dog, you have to make sure the wound is cleaned well, or an infection could set in. 如果你被狗咬了，必須確保傷口徹底清理乾淨，否則可能會發生感染。
results.example2: Despair seems to have set in among the team. 整支隊伍似乎都陷入了絕望之中。

results.name: a convicted felon
results.english: to decide officially in a law court that someone is guilty of a crime
results.chinese: （在法庭上）宣判…有罪，證明…有罪
results.example1: He has twice been convicted of robbery/arson. 他兩次被判犯有搶劫罪／縱火罪。

results.name: cold case
results.english: a case (= a series of events investigated by the police) that has not been solved
results.example1: The Police Department began using interns last September to take a fresh look at old, unsolved murder cases, also known as cold cases. 去年九月，警察局開始使用實習生來重新審視那些陳年未破的謀殺案，也就是所謂的懸案。
results.example2: A cold case unit was formed specifically to review and reinvestigate all of the department's unsolved killings, according to police. 警方表示，已經成立了一個懸案小組，專門審查和重新調查該部門所有未解決的謀殺案件。

results.name: infamous crime
results.english: famous for something considered bad
results.chinese: 臭名昭著的，聲名狼藉的
results.example1: The list included the infamous George Drake, a double murderer. 名單中包括臭名昭著的雙重殺人犯喬治‧德雷克。
results.example2: He's infamous for his bigoted sense of humour. 他以那種帶有偏執的幽默感而臭名昭著。

results.name: dyslexia
results.english: a condition affecting the brain that makes it difficult for someone to read and write
results.chinese: （因無法分清字形而造成的）讀寫障礙

results.name: autism spectrum
results.english: a condition that starts in young children and typically causes behaviour that is unusually centred on the self while limiting the development of social and communication skills 孤獨症；自閉症
results.chinese: Autism is four times more common in boys than in girls. 男孩子患自閉症的發病率是女孩子的四倍。

results.name: sobriety tests
results.english: the state of being sober
results.example1: US The police said his car had been weaving all over the road, so they pulled him over and gave him a sobriety test. 警察說他的車在路上一直開得搖搖晃晃的，因此叫他停了下來，幫他做了酒精測試。

results.name: content
results.english: pleased with your situation and not hoping for change or improvement
results.example1: He seems fairly content with (his) life. 他好像對生活相當滿足。
results.example2: [ + to infinitive ] They're content to socialize with a very small circle of people. 他們滿足於只和一小群人交往。

results.name: a beige car
results.english: a pale brown colour

results.name: it made me shudder
results.english: to shake suddenly with very small movements because of a very unpleasant thought or feeling
results.chinese: （因有令人不快的想法或感覺而）戰慄，發抖
results.example1: The sight of so much blood made him shudder. 看到那麽多的血，他不禁渾身顫抖。
results.example2: She shuddered at the thought of kissing him. 她一想到親吻他就禁不住發抖。

results.name: everyone is over the moon
results.english: to be very pleased
results.example1: She was over the moon about/with her new bike. 她得了一輛新腳踏車，快樂極了。

results.name: comb over the place
results.english: to search a place or an area very carefully in order to find something
results.example1: The police combed the whole area for evidence. 警方為了尋找證據搜遍了整個地區。
results.example2: Investigators combed through the wreckage. 調查人員在殘骸中認真搜尋。

results.name: an undergrad who studied...
results.english: an undergraduate

results.name: live in infamy
results.english: the quality of being famous for something considered bad
results.example1: The president described the attack as a day that will live in infamy. 總統將那次襲擊稱為「永遠的國恥日」。

results.name: in custody
results.english: the state of being kept in prison, especially while waiting to go to court for trial
results.chinese: （尤指等候法庭審判期間的）監禁，拘留
results.example1: The suspect is now in custody. 嫌疑犯正被扣押候審。
results.example2: UK You will be remanded in custody until your trial. 你會一直被看押到受審的那一天。

results.name: sth is baffling
results.english: to cause someone to be completely unable to understand or explain something
results.example1: She was completely baffled by his strange behaviour. 她完全被他怪異的舉動弄迷糊了。

results.name: child molestation
results.english: the act of molesting someone (= touching or attacking them in a sexual way)
results.example1: sexual molestation
results.example2: We hope this case will lead to reforms in the way officials deal with molestation accusations.

results.name: gruesome stories
results.english: extremely unpleasant and shocking, and usually dealing with death or injury
results.chinese: （通常用來描述死亡或者傷害）令人厭惡的，恐怖的，可怕的
results.example1: The newspaper article included a gruesome description of the murder. 這篇報導中有一段對謀殺案血淋淋的描述。

results.name: tangled web
results.english: twisted into an untidy mass
results.example1: tangled string 纏結在一起的線
results.example2: She ran a hand through her tangled hair. 她用一隻手梳理她纏在一起的頭髮。

results.name: a con man
results.english: a con artist
results.chinese: 騙子，行騙者；詐騙犯（同 con artist）

results.name: she's worried sick
results.english: very worried

results.name: give them a lot of flak
results.english: strong criticism or opposition
results.example1: She took/caught some flak from her parents about her new dress. 她的新衣服遭到了父母的一通批評。

results.name: a deadbolt
results.chinese: 家裡木門上輔助的那個鎖

results.name: luminol test
results.chinese: 魯米諾實驗，李昌鈺在測試現場是否曾有過血跡的那個技術

results.name: a railway embankment
results.english: an artificial slope made of earth and/or stones
results.example1: a river/road/railway embankment 河堤／路堤／鐵路路堤

results.name: a duct tape
results.english: a long, thin strip of very strong, sticky material that is sold in a roll and is often used for covering holes or other repair jobs
results.chinese: (一種膠帶) 大力膠帶，牛皮膠帶

results.name: windshield
results.english: the window at the front of a car, truck, etc.

results.name: a red streak on his arm
results.english: a long, thin mark that is easily noticed because it is very different from the area surrounding it
results.example1: The window cleaner left dirty streaks on the windows. 擦窗工人在窗戶上留下了一條條污痕。
results.example2: I dye my hair to hide my grey streaks. 我染髮是為了遮住花白的頭髮。

results.name: they get unsettled
results.english: nervous and worried; unable to relax
results.chinese: 焦慮不安的，心緒不寧的
results.example1: Children tend to get unsettled if you continually change their routine. 如果你不斷地去改變孩子們的日常習慣，他們容易變得躁動不安。

results.name: he bolted
results.english: to move very fast, especially as a result of being frightened
results.chinese: （尤指因受到驚嚇而）奔跑，快跑
results.example1: Frightened by the car horn, the horse bolted. 那匹馬受到汽車喇叭的驚嚇，飛奔了起來。

results.name: get ahold of her parents
results.english: to find or communicate with someone
results.example1: I'd like to get ahold of Debbie and talk to her about this. 我想找黛比談談這件事。

results.name: a disturbing discovery
results.chinese: making you feel worried or upset
results.example1: 令人焦慮的，使人憂慮的；讓人心煩的
results.example2: The article described the latest crime figures as disturbing. 這篇文章表示最近的犯罪數目「令人擔憂」。

results.name: she just couldn't place it
results.english: to recognize someone or remember where you have seen someone and how you know them
results.example1: She looks familiar but I can't place her - did she use to work here? 她很面熟，但我記不起來了——她以前在這裡工作過嗎？

results.name: she is ranting
results.english: to speak or shout in a loud, uncontrolled, or angry way, often saying confused or silly things
results.chinese: 怒吼；抱怨；叫嚷；大聲責罵
results.example1: He's always ranting (on) about the government. 他總是抱怨政府。
results.example2: I get fed up with my mother ranting and raving (about my clothes) all the time. 我母親老是（因為我的穿著）對我嘮叨抱怨，我真是受夠了。

results.name: off the hook
results.english: If you are off the hook, you have escaped from a difficult situation.
results.example1: John's agreed to go to the meeting in my place so that gets/lets me off the hook. 約翰答應幫我去開會，這樣我就能脫身了。

results.name: his love is scorned
results.english: to show scorn for someone or something
results.example1: So does he respect the press and media, or does he secretly scorn them? 他究竟是尊重報社和媒體，還是暗地裡蔑視他們？
results.example2: You scorned all my suggestions. 你對我所有的建議都嗤之以鼻。

results.name: they got another scoop to add
results.english: a story or piece of news discovered and published by one newspaper before all the others
results.chinese: 搶先報導的新聞；獨家新聞
results.example1: The paper managed to secure a major scoop and broke the scandal to the world. 這家報紙設法搶先報道了重要的獨家新聞，把這件醜聞公諸於世。

results.name: he calls their house with taunts
results.english: to intentionally annoy and upset someone by making unkind remarks to them, laughing unkindly, etc.
results.example1: The other kids used to taunt him in the playground because he was fat and wore glasses. 其他孩子以前經常在操場上嘲笑他，因為他長得胖，還戴眼鏡。

results.name: a piece of clockwork
results.english: a system of springs and wheels that you wind (= turn) with a key or handle to make some clocks, toys, and other devices operate
results.example1: a clockwork train/mouse 發條玩具火車／老鼠

results.name: charred bones
results.english: burned and black
results.example1: charred meat 烤焦的肉
results.example2: The charred body of a man was found by police in a burned-out car last night. 警方昨晚在一輛燒毀的汽車裡發現了一具燒焦的男屍。

results.name: pelvis
results.english: the bones that form a bowl-shaped structure in the area below the waist at the top of the legs, and to which the leg bones and spine are joined

results.name: femur
results.english: the long bone in the upper part of the leg

results.name: a debutante
results.english: a rich young woman who, especially in the past in Britain, went to a number of social events as a way of being introduced to other young people of high social rank
results.chinese: （尤指舊時英國）初次踏足社交界的上流社會年輕女子
results.example1: a debutantes' ball 初次在社交舞會露面

results.name: in the complex
results.english: a large building with various connected rooms or a related group of buildings
results.example1: a shopping/sports and leisure complex 購物／運動休閒中心
results.example2: US They live in a large apartment complex. 他們住在一幢大型的公寓樓裡。

results.name: acquaintance
results.english: a person that you have met but do not know well
results.chinese: 相識的人，熟人；泛泛之交
results.example1: a business acquaintance 在生意上打過交道的人

results.name: a precursor to generosity
results.english: something that happened or existed before another thing, especially if it either developed into it or had an influence on it
results.example1: Sulphur dioxide is the main precursor of acid rain. 二氧化硫是形成酸雨最重要的先決條件。
results.example2: Biological research has often been a precursor to medical breakthroughs. 生物學研究往往是醫學突破的先驅。

results.name: you touched upon it just a second ago
results.english: to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject
results.chinese: （說話或寫作時）簡略提到，觸及
results.example1: The talk was about educational opportunities for adults, and the speaker also touched upon sources of finance. 該講座談的是成人的教育機會，講者也提到了資金來源問題。

results.name: they do this in a nefarious way
results.english: (especially of activities) morally bad
results.example1: The company's CEO seems to have been involved in some nefarious practices/activities. 公司主管看來曾牽涉一些罪惡勾當。

results.name: it's an endorphin
results.english: a chemical naturally, released in the brain to reduce pain, that in large amounts can make you feel relaxed or full of energy

results.name: to get tenfold out of it
results.english: ten times as big or as much
results.example1: a tenfold increase 十倍的增長

results.name: get walloped
results.english: to hit someone hard, especially with the flat part of the hand or with something held in the hand
results.example1: She walloped him across the back of the head. 她在他的後腦勺上猛敲了一下。

results.name: weigh it out to see whether or not
results.english: to measure an amount of something
results.example1: Will you weigh out two kilograms of flour for me please? 請給我稱兩公斤麵粉好嗎？

results.name: egalitarian
results.english: believing that all people are equally important and should have the same rights and opportunities in life
results.chinese: 平等主義的；主張人人平等的
results.example1: an egalitarian society 奉行平等主義的社會
results.example2: The party's principles are basically egalitarian. 這個黨的基本原則是人人平等。

results.name: she is a little bit nutty
results.english: crazy, silly, or strange
results.example1: She's got some nutty idea about setting up a school for cats. 她有個怪異的念頭，想創辦一所貓咪學校。

results.name: it's very difficult to juggle
results.english: to succeed in arranging your life so that you have time to involve yourself in two or more different activities or groups of people
results.chinese: 盡力同時應付（兩種或兩種以上不同的活動或人）
results.example1: Many parents find it hard to juggle children and a career. 許多父母發現一邊照顧孩子一邊忙事業很難應付。

results.name: domestic violence
results.english: the situation in which someone you live with attacks you and tries to hurt you
results.example1: victims of domestic violence 家庭暴力的受害者
results.example2: domestic violence against women 女性遭受的家庭暴力

results.name: a shred of evidence
results.english: a very small amount of something
results.example1: There's still a shred of hope that a peace agreement can be reached. 達成和平協議仍存有一絲希望。
results.example2: There isn't a shred of evidence to support her accusation. 沒有絲毫證據支持她的指控。

results.name: cadaver dogs
results.english: a dead human body

results.name: the car doesn't look ransacked or anything
results.english: to search a place or container in a violent and careless way
results.example1: The burglars ransacked the house but found nothing valuable. 竊賊把房子翻了個底朝天，但沒有找到任何值錢的東西。
results.example2: I ransacked the cupboard for my ski boots. 我在櫥櫃裡翻來翻去找我的滑雪靴。

results.name: the code engraved on the keys
results.english: to cut words, pictures, or patterns into the surface of metal, stone, etc.
results.chinese: 在（金屬、石頭等）上雕刻（字、圖案等）
results.example1: The jeweller skilfully engraved the initials on the ring. 珠寶商很巧妙地把名字的首字母刻在了戒指上。
results.example2: The bracelet was engraved with his name and date of birth. 手鐲上刻有他的名字和出生日期。

results.name: a locksmith
results.english: a person who repairs and/or makes locks and supplies keys

results.name: a tenant
results.english: a person who pays rent for the use of land or a building

results.name: a huge disparity
results.english: a lack of equality or similarity, especially in a way that is not fair
results.example1: the growing disparity between rich and poor 正在加劇的貧富懸殊

results.name: it's like the strokes of luck keep coming here
results.english: something that happens or succeeds suddenly because of luck, intelligence, etc.
results.example1: By a stroke of luck, someone else was walking along the trail and heard my shouts for help. 幸運的是，剛好有人從小徑經過，聽到我的呼救。

results.name: a reddish stain on the carpet
results.english: slightly red in colour
results.chinese: 略帶紅色的；微紅的；淡紅的
results.example1: Nicky's got reddish-blond hair. 尼基的頭髮是微微發紅的亞麻色。

results.name: beyond a shadow of a doubt
results.english: If you know or believe something beyond a shadow of a doubt, you are certain that it is true.
results.example1: He is responsible beyond a shadow of a doubt. 毫無疑問，這應該由他負責。

results.name: a heinous crime
results.english: very bad and shocking
results.chinese: 極其惡劣的，令人震驚的
results.example1: a heinous crime 令人髮指的罪行

results.name: a frazzle
results.english: a state of being very tired in a nervous or slightly anxious (= worried and nervous) way after a lot of mental or physical effort
results.example1: She's worn herself to a frazzle (= made herself very tired and nervous) trying to meet the deadline. 為了能如期完成，她把自己弄得筋疲力盡。

results.name: she manages to round up some friends
results.english: to find and bring together a group of animals or people
results.example1: The cowboys rounded the cattle up. 牛仔們將牛趕到一起。
results.example2: I'll just go and round up Andrew and Patrick for the meeting. 我去把安德魯和派翠克找來一起開會。

results.name: The squeaky wheel gets the grease
results.english: loudness gets attention
results.chinese: 形容最吵的東西才能引起最多人注意

results.name: the police rule him out as a person of interest
results.english: to decide or say officially that something is impossible or will not happen, or that something or someone is not suitable
results.example1: The police haven't yet ruled out murder. 警察尚未排除謀殺的可能性。
results.example2: I won't rule out a June election. 我不排除六月份進行選舉的可能性。

results.name: the door pull strap on the driver's side door
results.chinese: 車子內側門把上的一條帶子

results.name: a reservoir
results.english: a place for storing liquid, especially a natural or artificial lake providing water for a city or other area

results.name: the only inference police can really make is ...
results.english: a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have
results.example1: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties. 他們被警告可能會受到猛烈的空襲，由此推斷會有許多人員傷亡。
results.example2: His change of mind was recent and sudden, the inference being that someone had persuaded him. 他最近突然改變了主意，估計是有人說服了他。

results.name: He has a violent streak
results.english: an often unpleasant characteristic that is very different from other characteristics
results.example1: Her stubborn streak makes her very difficult to work with sometimes. 她固執的性格有時候使人很難和她共事。
results.example2: You need to have a competitive streak when you're working in marketing. 你做行銷工作時需要有競爭意識。

results.name: he corroborates Steve's story
results.english: to add proof to an account, statement, idea, etc. with new information
results.example1: Recent research seems to corroborate his theory. 最新研究似乎證實了他的理論。

results.name: his curiosity is super piqued about ...
a miraculous journey
results.english: very effective or surprising, or difficult to believe
results.chinese: 奇跡般的；令人驚奇的；不可思議的
results.example1: The diet promised miraculous weight loss. 有人保證說按照這個食譜進餐就會有非凡的減肥效果。
results.example2: Well, you've made a miraculous recovery since last night! 哇，才一個晚上你便奇跡似地康復了！

results.name: traverse
results.english: to move or travel through an area
results.example1: Stanley traversed the continent from west to east. 斯坦利自西向東穿越了整個大陸。
results.example2: Bounded on the east by Lake Winnebago, the county is traversed by the Wolf and Fox rivers. 該縣東臨溫納貝戈湖，沃爾夫河和福克斯河穿縣而過。

results.name: boil down to sth
results.english: If a situation or problem boils down to something, that is the main reason for it.
results.chinese: （形勢或問題）主要原因在於，歸結為
results.example1: The problem boils down to one thing - lack of money. 問題歸結為一點——缺錢。

results.name: he confided to her that...
results.english: to tell something secret or personal to someone who you trust not to tell anyone else
results.example1: [ + that ] He confided (to her) that his hair was not his own. 他（向她）透露他的頭髮是假髮。
results.example2: [ + speech ] My husband doesn't know yet, but I'm going to leave him, she confided. 「我丈夫還不知道，但我就要離開他了。」她傾訴道。

results.name: animosity
results.english: strong dislike, opposition, or anger
results.example1: Of course we're competitive, but there's no personal animosity between us. 我們固然是競爭對手，但我們之間並沒有私怨。
results.example2: In spite of his injuries, he bears no animosity towards his attackers. 儘管受了傷，但他對襲擊他的人也沒有任何怨恨。

results.name: go into high gear
results.english: to be or become very active, exciting, or productive
results.chinese: 變得非常活躍（或興奮、高效）
results.example1: The movie really goes into high gear when Williams appears on screen. 當威廉姆斯出現在銀幕上時，這部電影真的進入了高潮。

results.name: in captivity
results.english: the situation in which a person or animal is kept somewhere and is not allowed to leave
results.example1: All the hostages, when released from captivity, looked remarkably fit and well. 人質被釋放時看上去居然都很健康。
results.example2: Animals bred in captivity would probably not survive if they were released into the wild. 在樊籠裡飼養的動物如果被放歸到野生環境中很可能無法生存。

results.name: he has been languishing in jail
results.english: to exist in an unpleasant or unwanted situation, often for a long time
results.example1: After languishing in obscurity for many years, her early novels have recently been rediscovered. 她的早期小說在沈寂多年後最近被重新發掘出來。
results.example2: He has been languishing in jail for the past 20 years. 過去的20年中他一直在監獄裡苦熬。

results.name: a den
results.english: a room in a house or apartment, used for activities not involving work
results.example1: The kids are watching TV in the den. 孩子們正在活動室裡看電視。

results.name: clasp of a bracelet
results.english: a small metal device that is used to fasten a belt, bag, or a piece of jewellery
results.chinese: （皮帶、手提包或首飾的）鉤子，扣子，扣環

results.name: the door was smudged
results.english: dirty or not clear
results.example1: The signature was smudged and impossible to decipher. 簽名被弄得模糊一片，無法辨認。

results.name: a pitcher of beer
results.english: a container for holding liquids that has a handle and a shaped opening at the top for pouring
results.example1: a milk/water pitcher 奶杯／水罐
results.example2: a pitcher of beer/water/lemonade 一壺啤酒／水／檸檬汁

results.name: a dustpan
results.english: a flat container with a handle into which you brush dust and dirt

results.name: a pickax
results.english: a tool for breaking hard surfaces, with a long wooden handle and a curved metal bar with a sharp point

results.name: the cleats of ...
results.english: a small, pointed part on the bottom of some shoes used for particular sports or activities to stop you from sliding

results.name: circumstantial evidence
results.english: containing information, especially about a crime, that makes you think something is true but does not completely prove it
results.chinese: （尤指關於犯罪）間接的，按情況推測的
results.example1: circumstantial evidence 間接證據
results.example2: The case against her was circumstantial. 對她不利的論據是推測而來的。

results.name: I was not cut out for a boxer
results.english: to not be the right type of person for something
results.example1: I'm not cut out for an office job. 我根本就不是坐辦公室的料。

results.name: the Psychology Faculty
results.english: a group of departments in a college that specialize in a particular subject or group of subjects
results.example1: the Psychology/Law Faculty 心理學系/法學院
results.example2: UK the Faculty of Science 理學院

results.name: make a distinction between...
results.english: a difference between two similar things
results.example1: There's a clear distinction between the dialects spoken in the two regions. 這兩個地區的方言有著明顯的不同。
results.example2: This company makes no distinction between the sexes. 這間公司男女平等。

results.name: as a nation
results.english: a country, especially when thought of as a large group of people living in one area with their own government, language, traditions, etc.
results.example1: All the nations of the world will be represented at the conference. 會上將有各國代表。
results.example2: The Germans, as a nation, are often thought to be well organized. 作為一個民族，德國人常常被認為很有組織紀律性。

results.name: novelty
results.english: the quality of being new and unusual
results.example1: The novelty of these toys soon wore off and the children became bored with them. 孩子們對這些玩具的新鮮感很快就消失了，開始厭倦起來。
results.example2: In Britain in the 1950s, television still had novelty value. 在20世紀50年代的英國，電視機曾經是一種新奇的事物。

results.name: that's unnerving
results.english: to make someone feel less confident and slightly frightened
results.chinese: 使緊張；使缺乏信心；使恐懼
results.example1: I think it unnerved me to be interviewed by so many people. 這麽多人來面試我，讓我很緊張。

results.name: inventively
results.english: very good at thinking of new and original ideas
results.example1: He is very inventive, always dreaming up new gadgets for the home. 他很有發明才能，總是能憑空想像出一些新的家用小裝置。

results.name: she is a knockout
results.english: a person or thing that looks, sounds, etc. extremely attractive
results.example1: Your sister's a real knockout! 你的妹妹真令人著迷！

results.name: a horrendous crime
results.english: extremely unpleasant or bad
results.example1: a horrendous accident/tragedy/crime 可怕的事故／悲劇／罪行
results.example2: horrendous suffering/damage 極大的痛苦／破壞

results.name: she is bubbly
results.english: (especially of a woman or girl) attractively full of energy and enthusiasm
results.chinese: （尤指女子）活潑的，熱情奔放的
results.example1: She's a very bubbly character. 她是個充滿活力的女孩。

results.name: she is vivacious
results.english: A vivacious person, especially a woman or girl, is attractively energetic and enthusiastic
results.example1: He brought along his wife, a vivacious blonde, some 20 years his junior. 他帶著妻子，一位活潑迷人的金髮美女，比他年輕大約20歲。

results.name: she is glamorous
results.english: attractive in an exciting and special way
results.chinese: 有魅力的；令人嚮往的；富於刺激的；獨特的
results.example1: a glamorous woman/outfit 迷人的女子／華麗的套裝
results.example2: a glamorous job 令人嚮往的工作

results.name: a trendy hotel
results.english: modern and influenced by the most recent fashions or ideas
results.chinese: 時髦的；受新潮思想影響的
results.example1: a trendy nightclub 時髦的夜總會
results.example2: He writes for some trendy magazine for the under-30s. 他替一本以30歲以下讀者為對象的時尚雜誌撰稿。

results.name: after-hours spots
results.english: If you drink in a bar after hours, you drink alcohol at a time when it is not allowed by law.
results.chinese: 在違禁時間，在正常營業時間之外
results.example1: The police are trying to stop after-hours drinking. 警方正設法禁止在違禁時間內飲酒。

results.name: cause a disturbance
results.english: to break the law by fighting or behaving extremely noisily in public

results.name: he has an inkling that...
results.english: a feeling that something is true or likely to happen, although you are not certain
results.example1: [ + that ] I didn't have the slightest inkling that she was unhappy. 我根本不知道她不高興。
results.example2: He must have had some inkling of what was happening. 他當時對發生的事一定有所了解。

results.name: a Jane Doe
results.english: a female John Doe
results.chinese: 無名女士，某女（對應John Doe，某男）

results.name: a John Doe
results.english: a name used in a law court for a person whose real name is kept secret or is not known
results.chinese: 無名氏，某甲（訴訟程序中對需保密或不知姓名的當事人假設的稱呼）

results.name: a hardened detective
results.english: used to describe someone who has had a lot of bad experiences and as a result no longer gets upset or shocked
results.example1: hardened detectives/reporters 老練的偵探／記者

results.name: he is deceased
results.english: dead
results.example1: the recently deceased Member of Parliament 最近去世的議員

results.name: they do polygraphs
results.english: a piece of electronic equipment used to try to discover if someone is telling lies

results.name: nothing could pan out on it
results.english: to develop in a particular way or in a successful way
results.example1: We'll have to see how things pan out. 我們要看看事情如何發展。
results.example2: Their attempt to start a new business didn't pan out. 他們試圖開展新的事業，但沒有成功。

results.name: an airtight club
results.english: completely closed so that no air can get in or out
results.chinese: 密封的，氣密的，不透氣的
results.example1: Biscuits will stay crisp if you keep them in an airtight container. 如果裝在密封容器裡，餅乾就會保持酥脆。

results.name: a bouncer
results.english: someone whose job is to stand outside a bar, party, etc. and either stop people who cause trouble from coming in or force them to leave
results.chinese: （酒吧、聚會等僱用的）保安，保鏢

results.name: a hunch
results.english: an idea that is based on feeling and for which there is no proof
results.example1: [ + that ] I had a hunch that you'd be here. 直覺告訴我，你會來。
results.example2: Sometimes you have to be prepared to act on/follow a hunch. 有時候你要有心理準備依直覺行事。

results.name: it's incinerated
results.english: to burn something completely
results.example1: to incinerate waste 焚燒廢棄物
results.example2: The spacecraft and its crew were incinerated by the billion-degree temperatures generated by the fireball. 太空船以及全體太空人被火球產生的十億度的高溫化為了灰燼。

results.name: he concurs and says...
results.english: to agree or have the same opinion
results.example1: The new report concurs with previous findings. 新報告與先前的調查結果一致。
results.example2: [ + that ] The board concurred that the editor should have full control over editorial matters. 董事會贊同主編應該對編輯事務全權負責。

results.name: I canvassed this area...
results.english: to try to discover information or opinions by asking people
results.example1: The council has been canvassing local opinion/local people to get their thoughts on the proposed housing development. 地方議會一直在調查當地民眾的意見，以了解他們對擬建的住宅區的看法。

results.name: his anguish
results.english: extreme unhappiness caused by physical or mental suffering
results.chinese: （肉體或精神上的）極度痛苦，劇痛，悲痛
results.example1: His anguish at the outcome of the court case was very clear. 得知案件的庭審結果，他痛苦欲絕，這是顯而易見的。
results.example2: In her anguish she forgot to leave a message. 萬分悲痛之中，她忘了留個口信。

results.name: she is a stunner
results.english: a person or thing that is very beautiful, especially a woman
results.chinese: 魅力十足的人；（尤指）美女；非常漂亮的東西
results.example1: The new administrator in accounts is a real stunner. 會計部的新主管是個真正的美女。

results.name: the eternal sunshine
results.english: lasting forever or for a very long time
results.example1: The company is engaged in the eternal search for a product that will lead the market. 該公司一直在尋找可以引領市場的産品。
results.example2: Will you two never stop your eternal arguing! 你們倆永遠也爭吵不完！

results.name: so goofy
results.english: silly
results.example1: That was a real goofy thing to do. 做那種事情實在是太蠢了。
results.example2: I like Jim, but he's a little goofy. 我喜歡吉姆，但是他有點傻乎乎的。

results.name: it seems unfathomable
results.english: impossible to understand
results.chinese: 無法理解的；難以理解的
results.example1: For some unfathomable reason they built the toilet next to the kitchen. 不知道爲甚麽，他們把洗手間建在廚房隔壁。

results.name: his estranged wife
results.english: to cause someone to no longer have a friendly relationship with another person or other people
results.example1: Her lifestyle estranged her from her parents. 她的生活方式使她跟父母越來越疏遠。

results.name: that's merciful
results.english: someone who is merciful is willing to be kind to and forgive people who are in their power
results.example1: God is merciful, said the priest. 「上帝是仁慈的，」神父說道。
results.example2: a merciful ruler 仁慈的統治者

results.name: a solemn burden
results.english: serious and without any humour
results.example1: a solemn face/voice 嚴肅的臉／聲音
results.example2: Everyone looked very solemn. 大家看起來都很嚴肅。

results.name: a ligature
results.english: a thread or wire used for tying something, especially a blood vessel
results.chinese: （用於緊縛的）帶子；（尤指捆紮血管的）結紮線，縛線
results.example1: Ligatures are used in surgery to stop the flow of a bleeding artery. 在外科手術中結紮線用於防止動脈血管出血。

results.name: her embattled ex
results.english: having a lot of problems or difficulties
results.example1: an embattled government 危機四伏的政府
results.example2: embattled teachers 焦頭爛額的老師

results.name: huzzah!
results.part: exclamation old use or humorous (also huzza)
results.english: used to express excitement, pleasure, or approval
results.example1: Huzzah! I found it! 好啊！我找到了！

results.name: the most telling injuries I saw
results.english: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks
results.chinese: 反映真實情況的；顯露內心活動的
results.example1: a telling comment 發自內心的評論

results.name: her shins
results.english: the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot
results.example1: She has a nasty bruise on her shin. 她的脛部有一塊嚴重的瘀傷。

results.name: he was in an altercation
results.english: a loud argument or disagreement
results.example1: According to witnesses, the altercation between the two men started inside the restaurant. 據目擊者說，兩人之間的口角是在餐廳內開始的。

results.name: sweep Kelly off her feet
results.english: to make someone become suddenly and completely in love with you
results.chinese: 使（某人）為之傾倒，使（某人）徹底愛上
results.example1: The first time he met her, he was completely swept off his feet. 他對她一見傾心。

results.name: A morph into B
results.english: to gradually change one image into another, or combine them, using a computer program
results.chinese: （使）圖像變形；對（圖像）進行合成處理
results.example1: The video showed a man morphing into a tiger. 影片裡一名男子變成了一隻老虎。

results.name: he is militant
results.english: active, determined, and often willing to use force
results.chinese: 激進的；行動積極的；好戰的，好鬥的
results.example1: militant extremists 激進好鬥的極端分子
results.example2: The group has taken a militant position on the abortion issue and is refusing to compromise. 這個團體在墮胎問題上採取強硬立場，不肯妥協。

results.name: obsessive-compulsive disorder
results.english: (abbreviation OCD) a mental illness that causes a person to do something repeatedly for no reason

results.name: he is possessive
results.english: Someone who is possessive in his or her feelings and behaviour towards or about another person wants to have all of that person's love and attention and will not share it with anyone else.
results.chinese: 獨佔欲強的，佔有欲強的
results.example1: a possessive mother 獨佔欲很強的母親
results.example2: Her boyfriend was getting too possessive so she finished with him. 她的男友佔有欲越來越強，所以她和他分手了。

results.name: he is closing in on her
results.english: to gradually get nearer to someone, usually in order to attack them
results.chinese: （通常指為了進攻）慢慢圍上來，包圍，逼近
results.example1: The advancing soldiers closed in on the town. 前進的士兵一步步包圍了城鎮。
results.example2: The hunt chased the fox until it was too tired and weak to run and then closed in for the kill. 獵狐隊一直把狐狸追得精疲力竭跑不動了，然後再包圍上去捕殺。

results.name: a scumbag
results.english: a very unpleasant person who has done something dishonest or unacceptable
results.chinese: 卑鄙小人；混帳東西，混蛋

results.name: David peeled off into the night
results.english: When vehicles, people, or animals peel away/off, they separate from the group or structure they were part of and move away in a different direction.
results.example1: One motorbike peeled away from the formation and circled round behind the rest. 一輛機車脫離了車隊，在其他車後面繞行。

results.name: she left David for good
results.english: Forever

results.name: a fierce attack
results.english: physically violent and frightening
results.example1: a fierce attack/battle 猛烈的進攻／激烈的戰鬥
results.example2: Two men were shot during fierce fighting last weekend. 上週末的激戰中兩人遭受槍擊。

results.name: a cadet
results.english: a student in the armed forces or the police

results.name: he is very evasive
results.english: answering questions in a way that is not direct or clear, especially because you do not want to give an honest answer
results.chinese: 迴避的；推託的；閃爍其辭的
results.example1: The Minister was her usual evasive self, skilfully dodging reporters' questions about her possible resignation. 部長還是保持顧左右而言他的一貫風格，當記者問及她是否可能辭職時，她駕輕就熟地避而不答。

results.name: for the time being
results.english: for a limited period
results.example1: Leave the ironing for the time being - I'll do it later.暫且先別燙衣服——我晚些時候來做。

results.name: she was smitten with him
results.english: having suddenly started to like or love something or someone very much
results.chinese: 突然迷上的，突然愛上的
results.example1: The story's about a man smitten with love for his wife's cousin. 故事講的是一位男子突然愛上了他妻子的表妹。
results.example2: He was so smitten by her that he promised to move to Argentina to be near her. 他對她太著迷了，以至於承諾要搬到阿根廷去待在她身邊。

results.name: he is very manipulative
results.english: A manipulative person tries to control people to their advantage.
results.chinese: 試圖控制他人的，有控制慾的
results.example1: Even as a child she was manipulative and knew how to get her own way. 她還是個孩子的時候就喜歡控制他人，知道如何達到目的。

results.name: pacify us
results.english: to cause someone who is angry or upset to be calm and satisfied
results.example1: He pacified his crying child with a bottle. 他用奶瓶來哄自己哭鬧的孩子。
results.example2: It was difficult for the police to pacify the angry crowd. 警方難以使憤怒的人群平靜下來。

results.name: they flat-out denied it
results.english: completely; used for emphasis
results.example1: When I asked him about it, he flat-out denied it. 當我問起他這件事時，他矢口否認。

results.name: gravel
results.english: small, rounded stones, often mixed with sand
results.example1: a gravel path 石子路

results.name: the advantages eluded her
results.english: If something that you want eludes you, you do not succeed in achieving it.
results.chinese: 使達不到；使做不成；使不能實現
results.example1: The gold medal continues to elude her. 金牌依舊和她無緣。
results.example2: They had minor breakthroughs but real success eluded them. 他們獲得了一些小的突破，但沒有獲得真正的成功。

results.name: a straight-A student
results.english: getting the best results in all examinations
results.chinese: 在所有考試中贏得最好成績的
results.example1: She had always been a straight-A student until she met him. 在遇見他之前，她的成績一直是最好的。

results.name: bitterly resented the rule
results.english: to feel angry because you have been forced to accept someone or something that you do not like
results.example1: She bitterly resented her father's new wife. 她對她父親新娶的妻子恨之入骨。
results.example2: [ + -ing verb ] He resents having to explain his work to other people. 他討厭非要向人們解釋他的工作。

results.name: the rage will boil over
results.english: If a difficult situation or negative emotion boils over, it cannot be controlled any more and people start to argue or fight.
results.chinese: （形勢或負面情緒）失去控制，爆發

results.name: she snuck out in the middle of the night
results.english: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly
results.chinese: 偷偷地走，潛行；偷帶，偷拿
results.example1: I managed to sneak in through the back door while she wasn't looking. 我趁她不注意從後門偷偷溜了進來。
results.example2: Jan doesn't have a ticket but I thought we might sneak her in. 簡沒有票，但我想我們或許可以把她偷偷帶進去。

results.name: an immaculate garden
results.english: perfectly clean or tidy
results.example1: dressed in an immaculate white suit 身穿潔白的套裝
results.example2: an immaculate garden 潔淨的花園

results.name: Apple Inc. acquired Mobeewave Inc.
results.english: to get something
results.example1: He acquired the firm in 2008. 他於2008年收購了這家公司。

results.name: she is disbarred
results.english: to make someone unable to continue working as a lawyer, especially because they have done something wrong
results.chinese: （尤指因犯錯誤而）取消…的律師資格

results.name: it stuck out to him
results.english: to be easy to notice or remember because of being unusual or different
results.chinese: 因其特殊不同而引人注意或記住

results.name: before he goes completely off the grid
results.english: to be in a place far away from services most people use every day.
results.chinese: 遠離大多數人平常有的服務，他們通常不使用供電設備，而且他們自己種植食物

results.name: it starts to get concerning
results.english: making you feel slightly worried
results.example1: The increase in crime in the area is very concerning. 該地區犯罪率的上升十分令人擔憂。

results.name: in the thick of sth
results.english: in the most active or dangerous part of a particular situation or activity
results.chinese: 在…的最激烈時，在…的最危險時刻
results.example1: He was always right there, in the thick of it when the fighting started.當戰鬥打響時，他總是在最危險的地方。
results.example2: She loves being in the thick of the action. 她喜歡在行動最緊張的地方。

results.name: the speech set the tone for the conference
results.english: to establish a particular mood or character for something
results.example1: The governor's speech set the tone for the whole conference.
results.example2: The good financial news set an optimistic tone for the year.

results.name: he dissects it
results.english: to examine or consider something in detail
results.example1: He's the kind of person who watches a movie and then dissects it for hours. 他是那種看完電影還要仔細分析上好幾個小時的人。

results.name: it is emblematic of power
results.english: representing a particular person, group, or idea
results.example1: A sword is emblematic of power gained by violence. 劍象徵著藉由暴力獲取的權力。

results.name: dutiable goods
results.english: If good are dutiable, duty must be paid on them.

results.name: ubiquitous spread of English
results.english: seeming to be everywhere
results.chinese: 普遍存在的，似乎無處不在的
results.example1: The Swedes are not alone in finding their language under pressure from the ubiquitous spread of English. 不僅僅是瑞典人感覺到了自己的語言正承受著英語無處不在所帶來的壓力。
results.example2: The mobile phone, that most ubiquitous of consumer-electronic appliances, is about to enter a new age. 作爲使用最普遍的消費電器，行動電話將進入一個新時代。

results.name: she pampers her dog
results.english: to give someone special treatment, making that person as comfortable as possible and giving them whatever they want
results.chinese: 細心照顧，精心護理；縱容，嬌慣
results.example1: She pampers her dog with the finest steak and salmon. 她讓她的狗吃上好的牛排和鮭魚，太嬌慣了。
results.example2: Why not pamper yourself after a hard day with a hot bath scented with oils? 一天辛苦工作以後為甚麼不善待一下自己，在散發著精油芳香的水裡泡個熱水澡呢？

results.name: sling your bag
results.english: to throw or drop something carelessly
results.example1: Don't just sling your bag on the floor! 別把你的袋子隨便扔在地板上！
results.example2: If any of the letters aren't interesting just sling them in the bin. 那些信中哪一封沒意思的就扔進垃圾桶好了。

results.name: some interesting tidbits
results.english: a small piece of interesting information, or a small dish of pleasant-tasting food
results.example1: Our guide gave us some interesting tidbits about the history of the castle. 導遊告訴我們一些有關這個城堡歷史的趣聞。
results.example2: Grandma always has a few tidbits for the children if they're visiting at lunchtime. 孩子在午飯時間去看望奶奶時，她總有一些美味小吃給他們吃。

results.name: it was unbelievable elation
results.english: a state of extreme happiness or excitement
results.chinese: 興高采烈；喜氣洋洋；歡欣鼓舞
results.example1: There's a sense of elation at having completed a race of such length. 跑完那麼長距離的賽程，歡欣之情會油然而生。

results.name: a vulgar joke
results.english: rude and likely to upset or anger people, especially by referring to sex and the body in an unpleasant way
results.example1: It was an extremely vulgar joke. 那是個極為下流的笑話。

results.name: he groped her
results.english: to touch someone's body in order to get sexual pleasure, usually when the person does not like it
results.example1: He groped me as I was going to the bar. 我走向吧檯時，他暗中摸了我一下。

results.name: a forcible contact
results.english: happening or done against someone's wishes, especially with the use of physical force
results.example1: There's a law to protect refugees from forcible return to countries where they face persecution. 有法律保護難民，以免他們被強行遣返回國遭受迫害。

results.name: we were not privy to that conversation
results.english: to be told information that is not told to many people
results.example1: I was never privy to conversations between top management. 高層管理者之間的對話我從不知情。

results.name: in the not-too-distant future
results.english: quite soon
results.example1: They plan to have children in the not-too-distant future. 他們打算在不遠的將來要孩子。

results.name: delusions
results.english: belief in something that is not true
results.example1: [ + that ] He's under the delusion that he will be promoted this year. 他懷有自己今年會得到晉升的錯覺。

results.name: a barrage of emails
results.english: a great number of complaints, criticisms, or questions suddenly directed at someone
results.chinese: 連珠發炮的（投訴、批評或質問），接二連三的…
results.example1: The TV station has received a barrage of complaints about the amount of violence in the series. 電視臺收到了一連串的投訴，批評電視劇中的暴力鏡頭太多。
results.example2: He faced a barrage of questions over his handling of the problem. 就該問題的處理方式，他受到了接二連三的質問。

results.name: he's doing it covertly
results.english: secretly, or in a hidden way
results.chinese: 秘密地；隱蔽地；偷偷摸摸地
results.example1: Terrorists have been operating covertly in England. 恐怖分子已在英格蘭秘密活動。

results.name: misfortune
results.english: bad luck, or an unlucky event
