results.chinese: 不幸；厄運；不幸事故；災難
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] That was the worst film I've ever had the misfortune to see. 那是我不走運看過的最糟糕的電影。
results.example2: She suffered a good deal of misfortune over the years. 多年來她遭受了巨大的不幸。

results.name: he is very jittery
results.english: nervous
results.chinese: 緊張不安的；心煩意亂的
results.example1: He felt all jittery before the interview. 面試前他感到非常緊張。

results.name: the dog is tethered
results.english: tied to a post or fixed to the ground with a rope or chain
results.example1: a tethered goat
results.example2: tethered balloon rides

results.name: his bond is revoked
results.english: to say officially that an agreement, permission, a law, etc. is no longer in effect
results.example1: The authorities have revoked their original decision to allow development of this rural area. 當局原來決定允許開發這一鄉村地區，但現在他們已經收回成命。

results.name: a bench warrant
results.english: A bench warrant is generally issued for failure to appear in court, or failure to appear for jury duty.
results.chinese: 拘補令 (該到法庭的時間沒出現的那種)

results.name: a psychiatric patient
results.english: of or relating to the study of mental illness
results.example1: psychiatric treatment 精神病治療
results.example2: a psychiatric patient 精神病人

results.name: he hoodwinked me
results.english: to deceive or trick someone
results.example1: He hoodwinked us into agreeing. 他騙取我們的同意。

results.name: masterful
results.english: If an action is masterful, it is very skilful.
results.example1: a masterful performance 精湛的表演

results.name: he was penalized
results.english: to punish someone for breaking a rule
results.example1: He was penalized early in the game for unsportsmanlike conduct. 他在比賽開始後不久因危險動作而受到處罰。

results.name: she is vengeful
results.english: expressing a strong wish to punish someone who has harmed you or your family or friends
results.chinese: 圖謀報復的；意圖復仇的
results.example1: She sprayed red paint all over his car in one last vengeful act before leaving him for good. 在徹底離開他之前，她用紅漆塗花了他的車作為最後的報復。

results.name: she talked my head off
results.english: to talk to someone for a long time, usually loudly
results.example1: She talked my head off. 她對我喋喋不休地說了半天。

results.name: a burgundy colored car
results.english: a dark reddish-purple colour, like the colour of red wine

results.name: face with pockmarks
results.english: a small hollow on your skin that is left after a spot caused by a disease, such as chickenpox or smallpox, has healed
results.chinese: （水痘、天花等痊癒後留下的）痘痕，麻點，麻子
results.example1: a face covered with pockmarks 滿是麻子的臉

results.name: debris
results.english: broken or torn pieces of something larger
results.example1: Debris from the aircraft was scattered over a large area. 飛機殘駭散落在一片很大的區域。

results.name: a decoy
results.english: something or someone used to trick or confuse other people or animals into doing something, especially something dangerous
results.chinese: 誘餌，圈套；用作誘餌的人
results.example1: They used a girl hitch-hiker as the decoy to get him to stop. 他們用一名搭便車的女孩子作誘餌讓他停車。

results.name: raunchy
results.english: connected with sex in a very clear and obvious way
results.example1: a raunchy novel 色情小說

results.name: a grumpy person
results.english: easily annoyed and complaining
results.chinese: 脾氣壞的，易生氣的；愛抱怨的
results.example1: I hadn't had enough sleep and was feeling kind of grumpy. 我睡眠不足，所以感到有點煩躁。
results.example2: a grumpy old man 脾氣不好的老人

results.name: some pet peeves
results.english: something that especially annoys you
results.example1: Weak coffee is one of my pet peeves.

results.name: a cog in a/the machine
results.english: a member of a large organization whose job, although necessary, makes them feel as if they are not important
results.chinese: （大機構中的）小職員；不可或缺但無足輕重的人，小人物
results.example1: I decided to set up my own business because I was tired of just being a cog in a machine. 我決定創立自己的公司，因為我厭倦了在大公司中做個微不足道的小人物。

results.name: a resourceful person
results.english: skilled at solving problems and making decisions on your own
results.example1: She's a very resourceful manager. 她是一位非常有智謀的經理。

results.name: trajectory
results.english: the curved path that an object follows after it has been thrown or shot into the air
results.example1: the trajectory of a bullet/missile 子彈／飛彈的彈道

results.name: the fighting is unabated
results.english: without becoming weaker in strength or force
results.chinese: 未減弱的；不鬆勁的；勢頭不減的
results.example1: The fighting continued unabated throughout the night. 整個晚上戰鬥一直很激烈。

results.name: head the dog off
results.english: to force someone or something to change direction
results.example1: I tried to head the dog off by running towards it. 我朝著狗跑去，試圖把它攆走。

results.name: a backing track
results.english: music, singing or dancing that supports the main tune, performer, etc.
results.example1: a backing track 伴奏曲
results.example2: backing vocals/singers 伴唱/伴唱歌手

results.name: a pastoral scene
results.english: A pastoral piece of art, writing, or music represents the pleasant and traditional features of the countryside.
results.chinese: （藝術品、文章或音樂）描寫鄉村生活的，鄉村風情的
results.example1: The painting depicts an idyllic pastoral scene of shepherds watching over their grazing sheep. 這幅畫裡牧羊人看守著吃草的羊群，呈現出田園詩般的鄉村風情。

results.name: the Texas panhandle
results.english: a long, thin piece of land joined to a larger area
results.chinese: （與較大區域相連的）狹長區域
results.example1: the Texas panhandle 德州的狹長地帶

results.name: an auteur
results.english: a film director who has a lot of influence on the making of their films, so that they can be considered as their author
results.chinese: （具有自己獨特風格的）電影導演
results.example1: auteurs, such as Jean-Luc Godard or Lars von Trier 具有自己獨特風格的電影導演，如尚盧•高達和拉斯·馮·提爾

results.name: a synthesizer
results.english: an electronic keyboard instrument that can produce and combine a large range of recorded sounds, often in order to copy other musical instruments or voices
results.chinese: 電子音響合成器，電聲合成器

results.name: the missions in eastern Europe
results.english: a group of people whose job is to increase what is known about their country, organization, or religion in another country or area, or the place where such people are based
results.example1: More funds are needed to establish trade missions in eastern Europe. 需要更多的資金在東歐建立貿易代表團。
results.example2: The Methodist mission is situated in one of the poorest parts of the city. 循道衛理佈道團設於這個城市最貧窮的地區之一。

results.name: liturgical text
results.english: relating to (a particular set of) the words, music, and actions used in ceremonies in some religions, especially Christianity
results.example1: He has taught classes on liturgical worship.
results.example2: Pope Pius V published the liturgical text that would be used to celebrate Mass for the next 400 years.

results.name: his basketball career nerver materialized
results.english: If an idea or hope materializes, it becomes real.
results.example1: She was promised a promotion but it never materialized. 他們承諾過會擢升她，但卻從未兌現。
results.example2: Her hopes of becoming a painter never materialized. 她當畫家的願望一直未實現。

results.name: there had been a lot of friction between them
results.english: disagreement or unfriendliness caused by people having different opinions
results.chinese: （觀點不同者之間的）摩擦，不和
results.example1: There's a lot of friction between my wife and my mother. 我妻子和我母親之間有很多齟齬。
results.example2: Politics is a source of considerable friction in our family. 政治問題在我們家是矛盾的一大根源。

results.name: a police informant
results.english: someone who gives information to another person or organization
results.chinese: 告密者，線人，舉報者；提供消息者
results.example1: a police/secret informant 警方／秘密線人
results.example2: Our survey is based on information from over 200 informants. 我們的調查以兩百多人提供的資訊為基礎。

results.name: it's agonizing to her
results.english: causing extreme physical or mental pain
results.chinese: 使人十分痛苦的；折磨人的
results.example1: an agonizing death 痛苦的死亡

results.name: semblance
results.english: a situation or condition that is similar to what is wanted or expected, but is not exactly as hoped for
results.example1: The city has now returned to some semblance of normality after last night's celebrations. 昨晚的慶典過後，這座城市似乎恢復了平日的樣子。
results.example2: He was executed without even the semblance of a fair trial. 甚至連點像樣的公正審判都沒有，他就被處死了。

results.name: third party culpability
results.english: the fact that someone deserves to be blamed or considered responsible for something bad
results.example1: After the accident, the company refused to accept culpability.
results.example2: third party culpability 第三方罪責

results.name: found dismembered
results.english: to cut, tear, or pull the arms and legs off a human body
results.example1: The police found the dismembered body of a young man in the murderer's freezer. 警方在兇手的冰箱裡發現了一具被肢解的年輕男性的屍體。

results.name: a corpse
results.english: a dead body, usually of a person

results.name: he was intubated
results.english: to put a tube into a hollow organ or tube-shaped structure in the body in order to keep it open, remove liquid for testing, or give a drug
results.example1: Doctors had to intubate to help her breathe. 醫生不得不採用插管來幫助她呼吸。
results.example2: intubated patients 插管的病人

results.name: she is flirtatious
results.english: behaving as if you are sexually attracted to someone, especially not in a serious way
results.example1: She's very flirtatious. 她十分輕佻。
results.example2: a flirtatious relationship 打情罵俏的關係

results.name: scandalous stories
results.english: making people shocked and upset
results.example1: scandalous stories 醜聞事件
results.example2: It's scandalous that we do so little to prevent homelessness. 我們無法有效解決無家可歸的問題，這真丟臉。

results.name: sth is fishy
results.english: seeming dishonest or false
results.example1: There's something fishy going on here. 這裡的情況有點不大對頭。

results.name: an imprint
results.english: an occasion when an object presses on something and leaves a mark
results.example1: The button had left an imprint on my arm. 這顆鈕扣在我的手臂上留下了一個印痕。

results.name: napalm
results.english: a substance containing petrol that burns strongly and is used in bombs, especially to destroy areas of plants so that enemy soldiers cannot hide

results.name: lethal weapons
results.english: able to cause or causing death; extremely dangerous
results.example1: Three minutes after the fire started, the house was full of lethal fumes. 起火三分鐘後，房子裡充滿了致命的毒氣。
results.example2: In the car the police found guns, knives, and other lethal weapons (= weapons that can kill). 員警在車裡找到了槍支、刀具及其他一些兇器。

results.name: sth is riddled with sth
results.english: to make a lot of holes in something
results.example1: The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets. 高射炮炮彈把機翼打得千瘡百孔。

results.name: he is invincible
results.english: impossible to defeat or prevent from doing what is intended
results.chinese: 不可戰勝的；無法阻擋的
results.example1: Last year the company seemed/looked invincible but in recent weeks has begun to have problems. 該公司去年似乎無往不勝，但近幾周開始出現問題了。

results.name: he's taunting us
results.english: to intentionally annoy and upset someone by making unkind remarks to them, laughing unkindly, etc.
results.example1: The other kids used to taunt him in the playground because he was fat and wore glasses. 其他孩子以前經常在操場上嘲笑他，因為他長得胖，還戴眼鏡。

results.name: misdemeanours
results.english: an action that is slightly bad or breaks a rule but is not a crime
results.chinese: 不正當的行為，不檢點的舉止
results.example1: sexual/youthful misdemeanours 不檢點的性行為／青年人的不端行為
results.example2: Every week, as children, we were beaten for some minor misdemeanour. 我們小時候每週都因為一些小過錯而挨打。

results.name: in essence
results.english: relating to the most important characteristics or ideas of something
results.example1: In essence, both sides agree on the issue. 從本質上說，雙方在這個問題上的意見是一致的。

results.name: it's grainy
results.english: If photographs are grainy, they are not clear because the many black and white or coloured dots that make up the image can be seen.

results.name: a tipster
results.english: a person who gives information to people, usually in exchange for money, especially about the likely winner of a race or competition, or who gives information to an official organization, especially about someone who has done something wrong
results.chinese: （尤指向政府機構告發犯罪者的）舉報者，告密者
results.example1: All the tipsters were wrong about the gold medal winner. 所有的勝率預測者都弄錯了金牌得主。
results.example2: An anonymous tipster has leaked confidential government information to the press. 一個匿名的洩密者向媒體透露了政府機密。

results.name: he is giddy
results.english: dizzy, feeling silly, happy, and excited and showing this in your behaviour
results.example1: She was giddy with excitement. 她激動得飄飄然的。

results.name: a tenet
results.english: one of the principles on which a belief or theory is based
results.example1: It is a tenet of contemporary psychology that an individual's mental health is supported by having good social networks. 當代心理學的一個基本理念就是個人的心理健康有賴於良好的社交圈。

results.name: tug at the heartstrings
results.english: to cause strong feelings of love or sympathy
results.example1: It's the story of a lost child - guaranteed to tug at the heartstrings. 這是一個關於走失兒童的故事——肯定能打動人心。

results.name: revel in sth
results.english: to get great pleasure from a situation or an activity
results.example1: She's revelling in her newly found freedom. 她縱情享受著剛剛得來的自由生活。
results.example2: He revelled in his role as team manager. 他從擔任球隊教練這個工作中獲得了很大樂趣。

results.name: a quip
results.english: a humorous and clever remark
results.example1: It was Oscar Wilde who made the famous quip about life mimicking art. 是奧斯卡‧王爾德說出了關於人生是在師法藝術的妙語。

results.name: he is intransigent
results.english: refusing to change your opinions or behaviour
results.chinese: 固執的，不妥協的，不讓步的
results.example1: Unions claim that the management continues to maintain an intransigent position. 工會稱資方繼續堅持拒不讓步的立場。

results.name: flowers were drooping
results.english: to bend or hang down heavily
results.example1: The flowers were drooping in the heat. 花朵在熱浪中垂下了頭。
results.example2: I can see you're tired because your eyelids have started to droop. 我能看出你累了，你的眼睛都快睜不開了。

results.name: we conjecture last week that...
results.english: to guess, based on the appearance of a situation and not on proof
results.example1: We'll never know exactly how she died; we can only conjecture. 我們永遠也不會知道她究竟是怎麽死的，只能猜測。
results.example2: [ + that ] He conjectured that the company would soon be in financial trouble. 他推測該公司不久就會陷入財務危機。

results.name: he is inconsolable
results.english: so sad or disappointed that it is impossible for anyone to make you feel better
results.chinese: 傷心欲絕的；極度沮喪的；無法慰藉的
results.example1: They were inconsolable after the death of their young son. 幼子夭亡後他們傷心欲絕。

results.name: an outburst
results.english: a sudden forceful expression of emotion, especially anger
results.example1: a violent outburst 強烈情感的爆發
results.example2: Her comments provoked an outburst of anger from the boss. 她的評論惹得老闆勃然大怒。

results.name: he is grilled
results.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time
results.example1: After being grilled by the police for two days, Johnson signed a confession. 被警方審問了兩天後，約翰遜在供狀上簽字認罪。
results.example2: Her parents would grill her about where she'd been. 她父母會盤問她到哪裡去了。

results.name: he hit the jackpot
results.english: to win the largest prize in a competition or game
results.example1: to have a big success or make a big profit, usually through luck （通常指憑運氣）獲得巨大成功，獲得巨大利潤
results.example2: He seems to have hit the jackpot with his new invention. 他似乎憑著他的新發明獲得了巨大成功。

results.name: PTSD
results.english: Post-traumatic stress disorder
results.chinese: 創傷後壓力症候群 (戰爭、交通事故)

results.name: unconditional love
results.english: complete and not limited in any way
results.example1: the unconditional love that parents feel for their children 父母對自己孩子毫無保留的愛
results.example2: We demand the immediate and unconditional release of all political prisoners. 我們要求立即無條件釋放所有的政治犯。

results.name: he flew into a rage
results.english: to suddenly become very angry
results.example1: I asked to speak to her boss and she just flew into a rage. 我要求跟她的老闆談話，結果她勃然大怒。

results.name: a pistol
results.english: a small gun that is held in and fired from one hand
results.example1: a loaded pistol 上膛手槍
results.example2: an automatic pistol 自動手槍

results.name: he caved
results.english: to agree to something that you would not agree to before, after someone has persuaded you or threatened you
results.example1: After protests from customers, the company caved and removed the item from its stores. 在顧客們進行抗議後，公司妥協了，從貨架上拿下了這件商品。
results.example2: I knew he'd cave if they offered him more money. 我就知道如果他們給他更多錢，他會妥協的。

results.name: warped minds
results.english: strange and unpleasant
results.example1: I shouldn't really laugh about the accident - it's my warped sense of humour! 我真不應該覺得這起意外有什麼可笑——是我的幽默感短路了！
results.example2: In their warped minds I was to blame for my own victimization. 他們心理扭曲，認為我遭受了傷害只能自己怪自己。

results.name: he was lying in wait for sb
results.english: to hide, ready to attack
results.example1: The gunmen were lying in wait when Mr Predit came out of the hotel. 當普雷迪特先生走出那家飯店時那些槍手正埋伏在周圍。

results.name: a hefty fine
results.english: large in amount, size, force, etc.
results.chinese: （數額、尺寸、力量等）大的，可觀的
results.example1: a hefty bill/fine 巨額帳單／罰款
results.example2: Her salary will go up by a hefty 13 percent. 她的薪水將會猛增13%。

results.name: a levy on alcohol
results.english: an amount of money, such as a tax, that you have to pay to a government or organization
results.example1: They imposed a five percent levy on alcohol. 他們對酒品徵收5%的稅。

results.name: an invasive insect
results.english: moving into all areas of something and difficult to stop
results.example1: an invasive disease 侵入性疾病
results.example2: They treated the cancer with non-invasive methods/surgery (= not cutting into the body). 他們用無創方法／手術治療癌症。

results.name: mosquitoes breed
results.english: to keep animals for the purpose of producing young animals in a controlled way
results.example1: Terriers are bred for their fighting instincts. 交配繁殖梗狗是為了保持它們好鬥的本性。
results.example2: His main income comes from breeding cattle. 他的主要收入來自養牛。

results.name: foothold
results.english: a strong first position from which further progress can be made
results.example1: We are still trying to get/gain a foothold in the Japanese market. 我們仍然力爭在日本市場取得一席之地。

results.name: a final ruling
results.english: a decision
results.example1: The court has made a final ruling on the case that the companies acted illegally. 法庭對此案作出終審判決，判涉案公司違法經營。

results.name: things were about to unravel
results.english: If you unravel a mysterious, unknown, or complicated subject, you make it known or understood, and if it unravels, it becomes known or understood.
results.chinese: 揭開，弄清 (謎團或複雜問題)
results.example1: We have a long way to go before we unravel the secrets of genetics. 在揭開遺傳學之謎前，我們還有很長的路要走。

results.name: a soiled diaper
results.english: dirty
results.example1: soiled clothes 弄髒的衣服

results.name: incriminating details
results.english: to make someone seem guilty, especially of a crime
results.chinese: 使（某人）看似有罪；連累，牽連
results.example1: A secret report incriminating the company was leaked last week. 一份顯示這家公司有罪的秘密報告上星期洩露了出來。
results.example2: He refused to say anything on the grounds that he might incriminate himself. 由於有可能將自己牽連進去，他拒絕談論任何事情。

results.name: heighten the suspicion
results.english: to increase or make something increase, especially an emotion or effect
results.chinese: （使）（尤指某種情緒或效果）增強，加強
results.example1: The strong police presence only heightened the tension among the crowd. 大批員警出現只會使人群更加緊張。

results.name: she was complicit in assiting him
results.english: involved in or knowing about a crime or some activity that is wrong
results.example1: She was accused of being complicit in her husband's death. 她被指控涉嫌導致她丈夫的死亡。

results.name: good at knitting
results.english: the activity of knitting something, or a thing that is being knitted
results.example1: I'm hopeless at knitting. 我怎麼也學不會編織。
results.example2: She takes her knitting with her everywhere. 她去哪裡都隨身帶著編織的東西。

results.name: babble
results.english: to talk or say something in a quick, confused, excited, or silly way
results.chinese: 牙牙學語，含糊不清地說；興奮地說；胡言亂語
results.example1: The children babbled excitedly among themselves. 孩子們聚在一起，興奮地說個沒完沒了。
results.example2: She was babbling something about her ring being stolen. 她含糊不清地說著話，好像是說她的戒指被人偷了。

results.name: defecate
results.english: to pass the contents of the bowels out of the body

results.name: urinate
results.english: to pass urine from the body

results.name: a cot
results.english: a small bed for a baby or young child with high bars around the sides so that the child cannot fall out

results.name: his lip is crusty
results.english: having a hard outer layer
results.example1: fresh, crusty bread 新鮮的脆皮麵包

results.name: he is a constable
results.english: a British police officer of the lowest rank
results.chinese: （英國最低級別的）警衛，保安官

results.name: in earnest
results.english: When something begins in earnest, it has already started but is now being done in a serious and complete way.
results.example1: The election campaign has begun in earnest. 競選宣傳活動正式開始了。

results.name: sth gets underway
results.english: to begin
results.example1: The film festival gets underway on 11 July . 電影節於7月11日開幕。

results.name: a kennel
results.english: a small, usually wooden, shelter for a dog to sleep in outside

results.name: a hearth
results.english: the area around a fireplace or the area of floor in front of it
results.example1: A bright fire was burning in the hearth. 壁爐裡熊熊的爐火在燃燒。

results.name: a saucepan
results.english: a deep, round pan with straight sides, usually with a handle and a lid, used for cooking things over heat

results.name: brain tissue
results.english: a group of connected cells in an animal or plant that are similar to each other, have the same purpose, and form the stated part of the animal or plant
results.example1: brain/lung/muscle/fat tissue 腦／肺／肌肉／脂肪組織
results.example2: His face is covered with scar tissue where he was badly burned. 他臉上嚴重燒傷的地方滿是疤痕。

results.name: to augment sth
results.english: to increase the size or value of something by adding something to it
results.example1: He would have to find work to augment his income. 他可能不得不找一些工作來增加收入。

results.name: an archetype
results.english: a typical example of something, or the original model of something from which others are copied
results.example1: The United States is the archetype of a federal society. 美國是典型的聯邦制社會。

results.name: some ideas bubble up
results.english: to rise to the surface or become obvious
results.example1: She laughs, a tinkling musical child’s laugh, bubbling up out of her. 她笑了，發出清脆悅耳的童聲歡笑。
results.example2: Interesting ideas about education and healthcare are bubbling up all over the country. 有關教育和醫療有意思的想法在全國各地湧現出來。

results.name: along with...
results.english: in addition to someone or something else
results.example1: California, along with Florida and Hawaii, is among the most popular US tourist destinations. 除了佛羅裡達和夏威夷之外，加利福尼亞也是人們最常光顧的美國旅遊勝地。

results.name: back to square one
results.english: If you are back to square one, you have to start working on a plan from the beginning because your previous attempt failed completely.
results.example1: If this doesn't work we're back to square one. 如果這樣行不通，我們只好從頭開始。

results.name: misstep
results.english: a mistake
results.example1: His opponents are watching very carefully for him to make a misstep. 他的對手都在非常小心地觀察著他，希望他什麼時候走錯一步。

results.name: her will
results.english: an official statement of what a person has decided should be done with their money and property after their death
results.example1: Have you made a will yet? 你立遺囑了嗎？
results.example2: She left me some money in her will. 她在遺囑中留給我一些錢。

results.name: he is on the up (and up)
results.english: Someone who is on the up (and up) is honest and can be trusted.

results.name: a devout Christian
results.english: believing strongly in a religion and obeying all its rules or principles
results.chinese: 虔誠的，忠實於某宗教的
results.example1: a devout Buddhist/Christian/churchgoer 虔誠的佛教徒／基督教徒／教徒

results.name: a platonic relationship
results.english: A platonic relationship or emotion is loving but not sexual.
results.chinese: （戀愛或感情）純精神而無性愛的，柏拉圖式的
results.example1: She knew he was attracted to her, but preferred to keep their relationship platonic. 她知道他喜歡她，但她更願意與他保持純友誼的關係。

results.name: a sinister appearance
results.english: making you feel that something bad or evil might happen
results.example1: The ruined house had a sinister appearance. 那棟倒塌的房子外觀給人一種不祥之感。
results.example2: A sinister-looking man sat in the corner of the room. 一個神情陰險的男子坐在房間的角落裡。

results.name: willow branches
results.english: a tree that grows near water and has long, thin branches that hang down, or wood from this tree

results.name: a submerged body
results.english: to go below or make something go below the surface of the sea or a river or lake
results.chinese: （使）潛入水中，（使）沒入水中；浸沒
results.example1: The submarine submerged when enemy planes were sighted. 潛艇發現敵機後馬上下潛。
results.example2: She was taken to hospital after being submerged in an icy river for 45 minutes. 她在冰冷的河水中浸了45分鐘後被送進了醫院。

results.name: the name is embossed on the card
results.english: to decorate an object, especially with letters, using special tools that make a raised mark on its surface
results.chinese: 在…表面上用浮雕圖案裝飾；（尤指）在…上壓印浮凸字體
results.example1: She handed me a business card with her name neatly embossed on it. 她遞給我一張名片，上面簡潔地凸印著她的名字。

results.name: fractured nose
results.english: If something hard, such as a bone, fractures, or is fractured, it breaks or cracks.
results.chinese: （使）（骨頭等硬物）破裂，（使）斷裂，（使）折斷
results.example1: She fractured her skull in the accident. 她在事故中顱骨骨折。
results.example2: Two of her ribs fractured when she was thrown from her horse. 她從馬上摔下來，折斷了兩根肋骨。

results.name: it's seeping through the chair
results.english: to move or spread slowly out of a hole or through something
results.example1: Pesticides are seeping out of farmland and into the water supply. 殺蟲劑正從農田中滲出，進入供水系統。
results.example2: figurative Given the intense secrecy of the arms business, information only seeps out in company literature. 由於軍火貿易極度保密，只能從公司的資料中獲得一點蛛絲馬跡。

results.name: through a sieve
results.english: a tool consisting of a wood, plastic, or metal frame with a wire or plastic net attached to it. You use it either to separate solids from a liquid, or you rub larger solids through it to make them smaller
results.example1: Pass the sauce through a sieve to remove any lumps. 用篩子濾去醬汁中的殘渣。

results.name: a car axle
results.english: a bar connected to the centre of a circular object such as a wheel that allows or causes it to turn, especially one connecting two wheels of a vehicle

results.name: they try to spook him into confessing
results.english: to frighten a person or animal
results.example1: Seeing the police car outside the house really spooked them. 看到房子外面的警車，真把他們嚇了一大跳。

results.name: a pathologist
results.english: an expert in the study of diseases, especially someone who examines a dead person's body and cuts it open to discover how they died

results.name: to sift through all his papers
results.english: to make a close examination of all the parts of something in order to find something or to separate what is useful from what is not
results.example1: The police are sifting the evidence very carefully to try and find the guilty person. 員警正在非常仔細地檢查證據，試圖找出罪犯。
results.example2: After my father's death, I had to sift through all his papers. 父親去世後，我必須查看整理他的所有文件。

results.name: an archaeologist
results.english: someone who studies the buildings, graves, tools, and other objects of people who lived in the past

results.name: it is a charm
results.english: an object or saying that is thought to have magical powers, such as the ability to bring good luck
results.example1: He keeps a rabbit's paw as a lucky/good luck charm. 他保留著一隻兔爪作為能帶來好運的護身符。

results.name: she is jilted
results.english: to finish a romantic relationship with someone suddenly and unkindly
results.example1: He jilted her for his best friend's sister. 他甩了她轉而追求他好朋友的姐姐。

results.name: pardon
results.english: If someone who has committed a crime is pardoned, that person is officially forgiven and their punishment is stopped.
results.example1: Large numbers of political prisoners have been pardoned and released by the new president. 新總統赦免並釋放了一大批政治犯。

results.name: an endocrinologist
results.english: a doctor or scientist who specializes in endocrinology

results.name: to reframe the story
results.english: to change the way something is expressed or considered
results.example1: She is trying to reframe the debate about the care of vulnerable children. 對於照顧弱勢兒童的爭論，她試圖換一種方式來表達。

results.name: incessant noise
results.english: never stopping, especially in an annoying or unpleasant way
results.chinese: 連續不斷的，沒完沒了的
results.example1: incessant rain/noise/complaints 沒完沒了的雨／噪音／抱怨

results.name: sth is in overdrive
results.english: a state of great activity, effort, or hard work
results.example1: The official propaganda machine went into overdrive when war broke out. 戰爭爆發後，官方的宣傳機器開始加速運作。
results.example2: The cast was in overdrive, rehearsing for the first performance. 全體演員正為首演加倍努力排練。

results.name: he coined the term xxx
results.english: to invent a new word or expression, or to use one in a particular way for the first time
results.chinese: 創造（新詞或新的表達方式）；首次使用（某一詞語）
results.example1: Allen Ginsberg coined the term flower power. 艾倫•金斯堡創造了 flower power（權力歸花）這個說法。

results.name: to lobby for sth
results.english: to try to persuade a politician, the government, or an official group that a particular thing should or should not happen, or that a law should be changed
results.chinese: 遊說，試圖說服（政客、政府或官方團體）
results.example1: Small businesses have lobbied hard for/against changes in the tax laws. 小公司極力遊說支援／反對修改稅法。
results.example2: [ + obj + to infinitive ] They have been lobbying Congress to change the legislation concerning guns. 他們一直在遊說國會修改涉槍法律。

results.name: an odor
results.english: a smell, often one that is unpleasant
results.example1: Inside the room there was the unmistakable odour of sweaty feet. 房間裡有一股明顯的臭腳汗味。
results.example2: figurative The odour of hypocrisy hung about everything she said. 她說的每句話都假惺惺的。

results.name: the story doesn't add up
results.english: If a situation does not add up, there is no reasonable or likely explanation for it.
results.example1: Why would she disappear the day before her holiday? It just doesn't add up. 她為甚麼會在假期的前一天不見蹤影了呢？這不合情理呀。

results.name: unwittingly
results.english: in a way that is done without knowing or planning
results.example1: I apologize for any anxiety which I may, unwittingly, have caused.
results.example2: Unwittingly, I may have given a misleading impression in my interviews.

results.name: a headstrong child
results.english: very determined to do what you want without listening to others
results.chinese: 任性的，固執的，剛愎自用的
results.example1: She was a headstrong child, always getting into trouble. 她是個任性的孩子，老是惹麻煩。

results.name: they crave attention
results.english: to have a very strong feeling of wanting something
results.chinese: 渴望，熱望；難以抑制的渴求
results.example1: Many young children crave attention. 許多小孩子渴望得到關注。

results.name: a morgue
results.english: a building, or a room in a hospital, etc. where dead bodies are kept before they are sent to be buried or burned, sometimes so that they can be examined

results.name: it was very horrific
results.english: very bad and shocking
results.chinese: 極其可怕的；令人震驚的
results.example1: a horrific accident/crime 極其可怕的意外事故／駭人的罪行
results.example2: horrific injuries 極為嚴重的傷勢

results.name: a transgender person
results.english: used to describe someone who feels that they are not the same gender (= sex) as the physical body they were born with, or who does not fit easily into being either a male or a female
results.example1: a transgender woman/man 跨性別女子／男子

results.name: to disown sb
results.english: to make it known that you no longer have any connection with someone that you were closely connected with
results.example1: It's a story set in the last century about a girl whose parents disowned her when she married a foreigner. 這是發生在上個世紀的故事，講述的是一個女孩因嫁給外國人父母與她斷絕關係的事。

results.name: a Taser
results.english: a brand name for a weapon that gives someone a small electric shock and makes them unable to move for a short time, sometimes used by police
results.chinese: 泰瑟槍（一種槍，其射出的小物體可使人受到少量電擊，致其短時間內不能移動）

results.name: by nightfall
results.english: the time in the evening when it becomes dark
results.example1: When nightfall came, we were still waiting for the electricity to come back on.
results.example2: since you aren't taking a flashlight, make sure you're back at camp by nightfall.

results.name: they were drenched in sweat
results.english: to make someone or something extremely wet
results.example1: A sudden thunderstorm had drenched us to the skin. 突如其來的雷陣雨把我們淋透了。
results.example2: The athletes were drenched in/with sweat. 運動員的汗水濕透了衣服。

results.name: this place is arid
results.english: very dry and without enough rain for plants
results.example1: The desert is so arid that nothing can grow there. 沙漠中極其乾旱，寸草不生。

results.name: a scrubby landscape
results.english: covered with short trees and bushes
results.example1: a scrubby landscape 樹叢繁盛的景色

results.name: a craggy coastline
results.english: having many crags
results.chinese: 多峭壁的，多岩石的；陡峭的；崎嶇的
results.example1: a craggy coastline 陡峭崎嶇的海岸線

results.name: rust-colored
results.english: of the colour or colours described
results.example1: rust-coloured rocks 赤褐色的岩石
results.example2: a saffron-coloured scarf 金黃色的圍巾

results.name: a monastery
results.english: a building in which monks live and worship

results.name: famed for
results.english: famous or known to many people
results.example1: It's a city famed for its ski slopes and casinos. 這座城市以其滑雪場和賭場聞名。
results.example2: the famed Chinese strategist Sun Tzu 中國著名的軍事戰略家孫子

results.name: a rock-hewn church
results.english: to cut a large piece out of rock, stone, or another hard material in a rough way
results.example1: The monument was hewn out of the side of a mountain. 這座紀念碑是在山的一側鑿刻出來的。

results.name: a respite
results.english: a useful delay before something unpleasant happens
results.chinese: 暫緩；短暫的延緩；喘息（時間）
results.example1: Their teacher was away, so they had a day's respite before their essays were due. 他們的老師外出，所以他們交論文的期限往後拖了一天。

results.name: shed light
results.english: to produce tears, light, blood, etc.
results.example1: She shed a few tears at her daughter's wedding. 她在女兒的婚禮上流下淚來。
results.example2: So much blood has been shed (= so many people have been badly hurt or killed) in this war. 這場戰爭造成了慘重的傷亡。

results.name: the mayhem continued
results.english: a situation in which there is little or no order or control
results.example1: With 20 kids running around and only two adults to supervise, it was complete mayhem. 20個孩子到處亂跑卻只有兩個大人看管，完全是一片混亂。

results.name: she keeps a watchful eye on him
results.english: paying careful attention and ready to deal with problems
results.example1: Under the watchful eye of their mother, the two boys played on the beach. 那兩個男孩在海灘玩耍，他們的母親隨時看著他們。
results.example2: She keeps a watchful eye on her boyfriend. 她把男朋友盯得緊緊的。

results.name: a thorny tree
results.english: having thorns
results.example1: a thorny rose bush 帶刺的玫瑰叢

results.name: a prowling dog
results.english: to move around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard, such as an animal does when hunting
results.example1: There have been reports of a masked man prowling in the neighbourhood. 有人報告說有一個蒙面人在附近出沒。
results.example2: At night, adult scorpions prowl the desert for (= trying to catch) insects. 在夜晚，成年蠍子在沙漠裡潛行覓食昆蟲。

results.name: a vulture
results.english: a large bird with almost no feathers on its head or neck, that eats the flesh of dead animals

results.name: an ethno-nationalist
results.english: relating to the study of different societies and cultures, combined with another area of study
results.chinese: （與對不同社會和文化的研究有關，常與另一表示研究領域的詞語連用）
results.example1: an ethno-musicologist (= someone who studies the music of different societies and cultures) 一位民族音樂學者
results.example2: an ethno-nationalist 種族民族主義者

results.name: the violence spilled over into the commnunities
results.english: If an activity or situation spills over, it begins to affect another situation or group of people, especially in an unpleasant or unwanted way.
results.chinese: （尤指令人不快地）波及，擴散，影響
results.example1: I try not to let my work spill over into my life outside the office. 我努力不讓我的工作影響到辦公室之外的生活。
results.example2: The conflict threatens to spill over into neighbouring regions. 衝突可能會波及到鄰近地區。

results.name: extrajudicial
results.english: done without the permission of or without using the official legal system
results.example1: There have been numerous extrajudicial executions of civilians. 出現了大量針對平民的非法處決事件。

results.name: credible reports
results.english: able to be believed or trusted
results.example1: They haven't produced any credible evidence for convicting him. 他們沒有拿出任何可信的證據來給他定罪。
results.example2: The story of what had happened to her was barely (= almost not) credible. 關於她的遭遇的說法不大可信。

results.name: gravely
results.english: seriously
results.example1: gravely ill
results.example2: Hassan glanced at his watch, pursed his lips, and nodded gravely.

results.name: a perpetrator
results.english: someone who has committed a crime or a violent or harmful act
results.example1: The perpetrators of the massacre must be brought to justice as war criminals. 大屠殺的參與者必須被當作戰犯繩之以法。

results.name: the glistening water
results.english: to shine by reflecting light from a wet or smooth surface
results.chinese: （因潮濕、油亮或光滑的表面反光而）閃光，閃耀，閃亮
results.example1: The grass glistened in the early-morning dew. 清晨，小草頂著露珠晶瑩發亮。
results.example2: His eyes glistened with tears. 他的眼裡閃著晶瑩的淚花。

results.name: a carnivore
results.english: an animal that eats meat
results.example1: Lions and tigers are carnivores. 獅子和老虎是肉食性動物。
results.example2: humorous I made mostly vegetarian food but put a couple of meat dishes out for the carnivores (= people who eat meat). 我做的主要是素菜，不過還準備了幾道葷菜給吃肉的人。

results.name: consume
results.english: to eat or drink, especially a lot of something
results.example1: He consumes huge amounts of bread with every meal. 他每一餐都要吃掉大量的麵包。

results.name: a seasoned hunter
results.english: having a lot of experience of doing something and therefore knowing how to do it well
results.example1: a seasoned traveller 經驗豐富的旅行者
results.example2: a seasoned campaigner for human rights 經驗豐富的人權活動家

results.name: foul play
results.english: a criminal act that results in serious damage or injury, especially murder
results.example1: It is not clear what caused the explosion, but the police do not suspect foul play. 還不清楚是甚麽引起了爆炸，但警方沒有懷疑是謀殺。

results.name: alligators hibernate
results.english: (of some animals) to spend the winter sleeping
results.example1: The turtle hibernates in a shallow burrow for six months of the year. 這種龜每年會在淺地洞裡冬眠六個月。

results.name: discount the possibility
results.english: to decide that something or someone is not worth considering or giving attention
results.example1: You shouldn't discount the possibility of him coming back. 你不應該排除他回來的可能性。

results.name: a pair of waders
results.english: rubber boots that cover the whole leg to keep a person dry in water
results.example1: The fishermen put on their waders. 漁民們穿上了高筒防水膠靴。

results.name: scoop up a pair of paints
results.english: to lift something or someone with your hands or arms in a quick movement
results.example1: She scooped the children up and ran with them to safety. 她一把抱起孩子們，帶著他們奔向安全地帶。
results.example2: I scooped up my belongings into my handbag. 我匆忙把自己的東西塞進包裡。

results.name: a football jock
results.english: a person who is extremely enthusiastic about sport

results.name: the church is intact
results.english: complete and in the original state
results.chinese: 完整無缺的；未經觸動的
results.example1: The church was destroyed in the bombing but the altar survived intact. 教堂在轟炸中被毀，但神壇卻完好無損。

results.name: mossy
results.english: covered with moss (= a small plant that grows in wet places)
results.example1: a mossy tree/rock/lawn
results.example2: They sat together on the mossy tree-trunk.

results.name: algae coated
results.english: very simple, usually small plants that grow in or near water and do not have ordinary leaves or roots

results.name: this evidence was planted
results.english: to put something firmly and strongly in a particular place
results.example1: My brother planted himself on the sofa in front of the television. 我哥哥坐在電視機前的沙發上。
results.example2: He planted a kiss on her forehead/a blow on his opponent's jaw. 他在她的額頭上吻了一下／一拳打在對手的下巴上。

results.name: a crusade
results.english: a long and determined attempt to achieve something that you believe in strongly
results.chinese: （為理想或信念而奮鬥的）運動
results.example1: They have long been involved in a crusade for racial equality. 他們長期以來一直致力於爭取種族平等的運動。
results.example2: a moral crusade against drugs 反毒品的正義運動

results.name: she will be the beneficiary
results.english: a person or group who receives money, advantages, etc. as a result of something else
results.example1: Her wife was the chief beneficiary of her will. 她丈夫是她的遺囑的主要受益人。

results.name: pinch pennies
results.english: to spend as little money as possible
results.example1: When we were first married we had to pinch pennies just to get by. 我們剛結婚時不得不精打細算以勉強維持生計。

results.name: a torrid affair
results.english: involving strong emotions, especially those of sexual love
results.example1: a torrid romance 熾烈的愛情

results.name: a grieving widow
results.english: feeling very sad because someone has died
results.chinese: （因某人去世而）悲痛的，傷心的，悲傷的
results.example1: grieving relatives 悲痛的親屬們

results.name: a new hubby
results.english: husband
results.example1: She speaks fondly of Richard Moreland, hubby number one, whom she still sees regularly. 她說起理查‧莫蘭德——她的第一任丈夫時，仍一往情深，到現在還經常跟他見面。

results.name: arraignment
results.english: a legal process in a law court where someone is accused of a particular crime and asked to say if they are guilty or not
results.example1: She was in custody last night awaiting arraignment.
results.example2: Their arraignments were postponed a month while the men retained solicitors.

results.name: my rib cage
results.english: the structure in the body formed by the ribs (= bones in the chest that protect the heart, lungs and other organs)

results.name: profanities
results.english: an offensive or obscene word or phrase
results.example1: It was the song's opening line, a series of profanities, that caused the record to be banned on the radio station. 正是因為這首歌的第一句使用了一連串的髒話，導致這張唱片在電台被禁播。

results.name: he is cussing at me
results.english: to say words that are not polite because you are angry

results.name: crack the case
results.english: to find a solution to a problem
results.example1: They cracked the code and read the secret message. 他們破譯了密碼，讀取了密電。
results.example2: UK I've been trying to solve this problem all week, but I still haven't cracked it. 整個星期我一直在試圖解決這個問題，但還是不得要領。

results.name: the place is off the beaten track
results.english: in a place where few people go, far from any main roads and towns
results.example1: The farmhouse we stayed in was completely off the beaten track. 我們住的農舍非常偏僻。

results.name: a trailblazer
results.english: the first person to do something or go somewhere, who shows that it is also possible for other people
results.example1: Orville and Wilbur Wright were aviation trailblazers. 奧維爾‧萊特和威爾伯‧萊特是航空領域的先驅。

results.name: sheep herding
results.english: to make animals move together as a group
results.example1: An old woman was herding the goats. 一位老婦人正在山坡上放牧山羊。

results.name: a multitude of problems
results.english: a large number of people or things
results.example1: The city has a multitude of problems, from homelessness to drugs and murder. 這個城市存在著很多問題，從無家可歸到吸毒和謀殺，不勝枚舉。
results.example2: This case has raised a multitude of questions. 這個案例引出了許多問題。

results.name: elucidate
results.english: to explain something or make something clear
results.example1: I don't understand. You'll have to elucidate. 我不懂，你得解釋一下。
results.example2: The reasons for the change in weather conditions have been elucidated by several scientists. 已經有好幾位科學家對天氣狀況變化的原因作過解釋。

results.name: the data is spotty
results.english: bad in some parts
results.chinese: （質量）參差不齊的，有好有壞的
results.example1: She has a fairly spotty work record. 她的工作業績時好時壞。
results.example2: Sales have picked up a little but they're still spotty. 銷售有所好轉，但仍然起伏不定。

results.name: a trampoline
results.english: a piece of sports equipment that you jump up and down on, consisting of a piece of strong material joined by springs to a frame
results.chinese: 蹦床，彈翻床（一種體育器械）

results.name: she is energy personify
results.english: to be a perfect example of something
results.example1: These louts personify all that is wrong with our society today. 從這些粗魯的傢夥身上可以看到我們當今社會的一切歪風邪氣。

results.name: she is irritable
results.english: becoming annoyed very easily
results.example1: Be careful what you say - he's rather irritable today. 說話小心點——他今天脾氣很大。
results.example2: Don't disturb me again, she said in an irritable (= angry) voice. 「不要再打擾我，」她煩躁地說。

results.name: it's inexplicable
results.english: unable to be explained or understood
results.example1: For some inexplicable reason, he's decided to cancel the project. 由於某種無法解釋的原因，他決定取消這個專案。

results.name: his face was blotchy
results.english: If someone's skin is blotchy, it is covered in marks, usually temporary ones, that are not regular in shape
results.example1: He'd been crying and his face was all blotchy.
results.example2: She has wispy red hair and blotchy skin.

results.name: The suspense is killing me
results.english: the feeling of excitement or nervousness that you have when you are waiting for something to happen and are uncertain about what it is going to be
results.example1: She kept him in suspense for several days before she said that she would marry him. 她讓他焦慮地等了好幾天，才告訴他願意嫁給他。
results.example2: The suspense is killing me (= I am extremely eager to know what is going to happen). 真是急死我了。

results.name: she's been haunted
results.english: showing signs of suffering or severe anxiety
results.example1: He had a haunted look about him. 他面帶焦慮不安的神情。

results.name: his crotch
results.english: the part of your body where your legs join at the top, or the part of trousers or underwear that covers this area

results.name: outrun
results.english: to move faster or further than someone or something
results.example1: The men easily outran the police officer who was chasing them. 小偷跑得很快，輕而易舉地甩掉了追趕他們的員警。

results.name: relive their past
results.english: to remember clearly an experience that happened in the past
results.example1: Whenever I smell burning, I relive the final moments of the crash. 一聞到東西燒焦的味道，我就覺得好像又回到了那次撞車事故中最後幾分鐘的場景中。

results.name: in the penitentiary
results.english: a state or federal prison

results.name: it's wedged between the bars
results.english: to put something into a very small or narrow space, so that it cannot move easily
results.example1: Her shoe came off and got wedged between the bars. 她的鞋掉了下來，卡在欄杆中間。
results.example2: I was standing waiting for a bus, wedged between (= fixed between and unable to move away from) two old ladies and their bags of shopping. 我正站著等公共汽車，夾在兩位上了年紀的女士和她們的購物袋中間，動彈不得。

results.name: alimony
results.english: a regular amount of money that a law court orders a person to pay to his or her partner after a divorce (= the legal ending of a marriage)
results.chinese: （離婚後法院判決一方支付給另一方的）贍養費，生活費

results.name: a tox screen
results.english: tox for toxicology

results.name: accidental asphyxiation
results.english: the condition of being unable to breathe, usually resulting in death
results.example1: homicidal/accidental asphyxiation
results.example2: The cause of death was asphyxiation from smoke inhalation.

results.name: a crook
results.english: a very dishonest person, especially a criminal or a cheat
results.example1: These politicians are just a bunch of crooks. 這些政客不過是一幫騙子。

results.name: she is a socialite
results.english: someone, usually of high social class, who is famous for going to a lot of parties and social events
results.example1: a wealthy socialite 富有的社交界名流

results.name: those well-heeled
results.english: rich people
results.example1: The shop attracted a loyal following among the well-heeled. 這家商店吸引了一批有錢的忠實顧客。

results.name: the Fed
results.english: a police officer or other officer who represents the central government
results.chinese: 聯邦調查局官員；聯邦政府官員
results.example1: The Feds completely screwed up the arrest. 聯邦調查局官員把這次逮捕行動徹底搞砸了。

results.name: a chilling story
results.english: frightening
results.chinese: 令人恐懼的，令人不寒而慄的
results.example1: a chilling tale 令人毛骨悚然的故事
results.example2: The monument stands as a chilling reminder of man's inhumanity to man. 紀念碑聳立著，寒氣逼人，提醒著人們人類對自己同類的慘無人道。

results.name: they are in the crosshairs
results.english: two thin wires crossing each other in a gun or other device, which you use to help you aim at something
results.chinese: （槍支或其他儀器上説明瞄準的）十字絲，十字瞄準線
results.example1: A sniper had them in his crosshairs. 一個狙擊手瞄準了他們。
results.example2: The poster showed his face in the crosshairs of a rifle. 那張海報裡，他的臉被放在步槍瞄準線上。

results.name: a mistress
results.english: a woman who is having a sexual relationship with a married man
results.example1: Edward VII and his mistress, Lillie Langtry 愛德華七世和他的情婦莉莉‧蘭翠

results.name: get busted
results.english: When the police bust a person, they arrest them, or when they bust a building or a place, they arrest people in it who they believe are breaking the law.
results.chinese: 逮捕；突擊搜查（建築物等）並逮捕疑犯
results.example1: The police busted him because they think he's involved with a terrorist group. 警方認為他與恐怖團夥有牽連而逮捕了他。

results.name: he is callous
results.english: unkind, cruel, and without sympathy or feeling for other people
results.chinese: 冷酷無情的；無同情心的，麻木不仁的
results.example1: It might sound callous, but I don't care if he's homeless. He's not living with me! 這也許聽起來很無情，可我並不在乎他是否無家可歸。他又不是和我住在一起！

results.name: a camouflage jacket
results.english: the use of leaves, branches, paints, and clothes for hiding soldiers or military equipment so that they cannot be seen against their surroundings
results.example1: a camouflage jacket 迷彩夾克衫

results.name: hitch a ride
results.english: to get a free ride in someone else's vehicle as a way of travelling
results.example1: They hitched a lift to Edinburgh from a passing car. 他們搭乘一輛過路的車到了愛丁堡。

results.name: wage a battle
results.english: to fight a war or organize a series of activities in order to achieve something
results.chinese: 發動（戰爭）；組織，籌備（活動）
results.example1: Doesn't the president need Congress' permission to wage war on another country? 想必總統須得到國會的許可才能對他國發動戰爭吧？
results.example2: They've been waging a long campaign to change the law. 他們為修改這一法律已組織發起了一場持久的運動。

results.name: a cunning man
results.english: Cunning people are clever at planning something so that they get what they want, especially by tricking other people, or things that are cleverly made for a particular purpose.
results.example1: a cunning plan/ploy 詭詐的計劃／花招
results.example2: He's a very cunning man. 他爲人十分狡猾。

results.name: a liaison officer
results.english: communication between people or groups who work with each other
results.example1: He blamed the lack of liaison between the various government departments. 他指責各個政府部門之間缺乏溝通。
results.example2: The police have appointed a liaison officer to work with the local community. 警方已指派了一名聯絡官與當地社區進行合作。

results.name: an escort
results.english: a person who goes with another person as a partner to a social event
results.chinese: （通常指異性的）社交聚會陪伴者
results.example1: But I can't go to the dance without an escort, she protested. 「但是沒有舞伴我不能去參加舞會，」她抗議道。

results.name: a wily person
results.english: (of a person) intelligent, having a very good understanding of situations, possibilities, and people, and often willing to use tricks to achieve an aim
results.example1: a wily politician 狡猾的政客

results.name: come up against sth
results.english: to have to deal with a problem
results.example1: If you come up against difficulties, let me know and I'll help out. 要是你遇到困難，告訴我，我會幫忙的。

results.name: a sordid apartment
results.english: dirty and unpleasant
results.example1: There are lots of really sordid apartments in the city's poorer areas. 該市的落後地區有很多極其骯髒的公寓。

results.name: a minor
results.english: someone who is too young to have the legal responsibilities of an adult
results.example1: He was accused of having sex with a minor. 他被指控與一名未成年人發生性關係。

results.name: he wooed her
results.english: If a man woos a woman, he gives her a lot of attention in an attempt to persuade her to marry him.
results.example1: He wooed her for months with flowers and expensive presents. 他用鮮花和昂貴的禮物追求了她好幾個月。

results.name: block it out
results.english: to stop yourself from thinking about an unpleasant memory because it upsets you
results.example1: He's trying to block out memories of the accident. 他努力不去回想那場事故。

results.name: a despicable person
results.english: very unpleasant or bad, causing strong feelings of dislike
results.example1: He's a despicable human being! 他是個令人厭惡的人！
results.example2: It was despicable of her to lie about her friend. 她就朋友的事說謊實在可憎。

results.name: molest
results.english: to touch or attack someone in a sexual way against their wishes
results.chinese: 調戲；猥褻；對…進行性騷擾
results.example1: The girl had been molested frequently by her stepfather from the age of eight.從八歲起這個女孩就經常受到她繼父的性騷擾。
results.example2: The man had previously been arrested several times for molesting young boys. 那名男子以前曾因猥褻男童多次被捕。

results.name: lewd acts
results.english: (of behaviour, speech, dress, etc.) sexual in an obvious and rude way
results.chinese: 淫穢的，色情的，猥褻的，下流的
results.example1: Ignore him - he's being lewd. 別理他——他是個色鬼。
results.example2: a lewd suggestion 下流的建議

results.name: her relationship is convoluted
results.english: very twisted
results.example1: a very convoluted route/knot 曲折盤旋的路線／纏繞的繩結

results.name: she forged his signature
results.english: to make an illegal copy of something in order to deceive
results.example1: a forged passport 偽造的護照
results.example2: A number of forged works of art have been sold as genuine. 一些藝術贋品已被當作真品出售。

results.name: she is accused of bigamy
results.english: the crime of marrying a person while already legally married to someone else
results.example1: In court, he admitted that he had committed bigamy. 在法庭上，他承認犯了重婚罪。

results.name: a civil/criminal court
results.english: relating to private arguments between people or organizations rather than criminal matters
results.example1: The matter would be better dealt with in the civil court rather than by an expensive criminal proceeding. 這事最好在民事法庭處理，而不要進行昂貴的刑事訴訟。

results.name: she came across well on TV
results.english: to behave in a way that makes people believe that you have a particular characteristic
results.chinese: 表現得，讓人覺得，給人以…印象
results.example1: She comes across really well (= creates a positive image) on television. 她在電視上給人的印象真的很不錯。
results.example2: He comes across as a bit of a bore in interview. 採訪中他表現得有點令人厭煩。

results.name: he is on death row
results.english: in prison and waiting to be killed as a punishment for a crime

results.name: her significant other
results.english: a person with whom someone has a romantic or sexual relationship that has lasted for some time and that is likely to last longer
results.chinese: 至關重要的另一位（指配偶或伴侶）
results.example1: She lives with her significant other in London. 她和她的另一半住在倫敦。
results.example2: Friends, neighbours and significant others are all welcome. 歡迎所有人：朋友、鄰居和配偶伴侶。

results.name: a good argument
results.english: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
results.chinese: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
results.example1: [ + that ] Her husband was not convinced by her argument that they needed a bigger house. 她提出理由說他們需要一個比較大的房子，但是她的丈夫沒有被說服。
results.example2: I don't think that's a very strong/convincing/powerful argument. 我認為這個論點不太站得住腳／令人信服／有說服力。

results.name: chickenpox
results.english: an infectious disease that causes a slight fever and red spots on the skin
results.example1: Chickenpox common among children. 兒童患上水痘很常見。

results.name: in those elements
results.english: the weather, usually bad weather
results.example1: We decided to brave the elements and go for a walk (= go for a walk despite the bad weather). 我們決定冒著風雨去散步。

results.name: a man without remorse
results.english: a feeling of sadness and being sorry for something you have done
results.example1: He felt no remorse for the murders he had committed. 他對自己犯下的一樁樁謀殺罪行毫無悔意。
results.example2: After the argument, she was filled with remorse. 爭吵過後，她懊悔不已

results.name: a brazen way
results.english: obvious, without any attempt to be hidden
results.chinese: 毫不隱瞞的，明目張膽的
results.example1: brazen cheating 明目張膽的作弊行為
results.example2: He told me a brazen lie. 他恬不知廉恥地向我撒謊。

results.name: they were joined at the hip
results.example1: My best friend from high school and I did everything together – we were joined at the hip. 我上高中時最好的朋友和我曾經做什麼事情都一起，那時我們倆形影不離。
results.example2: Whenever you see Sarah, you know Lucy isn’t far away – they’re joined at the hip, those two! 你一看到莎拉，就知道露西肯定在不遠的地方，她們倆真是密不可分！

results.name: an enabler
results.english: something or someone that makes it possible for a particular thing to happen or be done
results.chinese: （使某事可能發生或完成的）賦能者，提供條件者
results.example1: Information technology is an enabler, but not the whole solution. 資訊科技使解決問題成為可能，卻不是問題的解決辦法。

results.name: I'm codependent
results.english: involved in a relationship in which one person helps to cause another person's alcohol problem, drug addiction, etc. because they have a strong emotional need themselves
results.example1: A lot of codependent people will put up with their friends or lovers doing drugs.
results.example2: It is never easy to disengage from a codependent relationship.

results.name: his demeanour
results.english: a way of looking and behaving
results.chinese: 外表；風度；行為；神態舉止
results.example1: There was nothing in his demeanour that suggested he was anxious. 從外表上看，他沒有任何焦慮的神態。
results.example2: She has the demeanour of a woman who is contented with her life. 從神態上看，她對自己的生活很滿足。

results.name: something is deceptive
results.english: making you believe something that is not true
results.chinese: 有欺騙成分的，騙人的；造成假像的
results.example1: It's deceptive - from the outside the building looks small, but inside it's very big. 這是一種錯覺——從外面看這棟建築物很小，但內部空間卻相當大。

results.name: she loved it from the word go
results.english: from the start of something
results.example1: The bridge-building project had problems with funding right from the word go. 這個造橋工程從一開始資金就有問題。

results.name: she pulled away
results.english: If you pull away from someone who is holding you, you suddenly move your body backwards, away from them.
results.example1: She pulled away just as he was about to kiss her. 他正要吻她時她避開了。

results.name: he became unhinged
results.english: mentally ill
results.chinese: 精神失常的，神經錯亂的
results.example1: I sometimes think that your mother is a little unhinged. 有時我覺得你母親有點兒不太正常。

results.name: make towards sth/sb
results.english: to go in the direction of something or someone
results.example1: He made towards the door, but stopped and turned to face me. 他向門口走去，但又停了下來，轉身看著我。

results.name: few entries in his diary
results.english: a separate piece of information that is recorded in a book, computer, etc.
results.example1: They've updated a lot of the entries in the most recent edition of the encyclopedia. 在最新版百科全書中他們更新了很多條目。
results.example2: As his illness progressed, he made fewer entries in his diary. 隨著病情加重，他日記記得越來越少。

results.name: a blessing in disguise
results.english: something that seems bad or unlucky at first, but results in something good happening later
results.example1: Losing that job was a blessing in disguise really. 失去那份工作真是因禍得福。

results.name: a sergeant
results.english: a soldier of middle rank
results.example1: Sergeant Lewis/Tom Lewis 路易斯軍士／湯姆·路易斯軍士
results.example2: [ as form of address ] Dismiss the men, Sergeant. 軍士，解散部下吧。

results.name: the car abandoned on this interstate
results.english: involving two or more of the states into which some countries such as the US are divided
results.example1: the interstate highway system 州際公路系統
results.example2: interstate road transport costs 州際公路運輸成本

results.name: the tire has been blow out
results.english: If a flame blows out or you blow it out, it stops burning when a person or the wind blows on it.
results.example1: After dinner she blew out the candles. 晚飯後她吹滅了蠟燭。
results.example2: The sudden breeze made the candles blow out. 突然的一陣微風吹滅了蠟燭。

results.name: it's punctured
results.english: to make a small hole in something, or to get a small hole in something
results.example1: She had used a screwdriver to puncture two holes in the lid of a paint tin. 她用螺絲起子在顏料罐的蓋子上戳了兩個洞。
results.example2: The knife went through his ribs and punctured his lung. 刀子穿過他的肋骨刺穿了他的肺。

results.name: the whole scene was staged
results.english: to arrange and perform a play or show
results.example1: The local drama group is staging a production of the musical Grease. 當地劇團正在演出音樂劇《油脂》。

results.name: he's lawyered up
results.english: to employ a lawyer to help you when you are in a situation that may involve you being charged with (= officially accused of) a crime
results.example1: He hasn't even lawyered up, and thinks he can represent himself in court and take custody of the kids.

results.name: more blood smeared on the car
results.english: to spread a liquid or a thick substance over a surface
results.example1: The children had smeared peanut butter all over the sofa. 孩子們把花生醬抹得沙發上到處都是。
results.example2: Can you explain why the front of your car is smeared with blood? 你能解釋一下爲甚麽你的汽車前部沾有血跡嗎？

results.name: a crawl space
results.english: a space in a part of a house, especially under the bottom floor, that is not high enough for a person to stand in
results.chinese: （建築物內，尤指地板下面高度不夠人直立行走的）爬行空間

results.name: the report exonerated him
results.english: to show or state that someone or something is not guilty of something
results.chinese: 證明…無罪；宣佈…無罪；使免受責備
results.example1: The report exonerated the crew from all responsibility for the collision. 報告證明機組人員對飛機相撞事件不負任何責任。

results.name: the evidence has been tampered with
results.english: to touch or make changes to something that you should not, usually without enough knowledge of how it works or when you are trying to damage it
results.example1: I could see immediately that the lock had been tampered with. 我一下子就看出鎖已被人動過了。

results.name: a sandbar
results.english: a long raised area of sand below the surface of the water, especially where a river enters the sea, usually formed by moving currents

results.name: pessimistic
results.english: thinking that bad things are more likely to happen or emphasizing the bad part of a situation
results.example1: The tone of the meeting was very pessimistic. 會議的氣氛非常悲觀。
results.example2: The doctors are pessimistic (= not hopeful) about his chances of recovery. 醫生對他康復的可能性都表示悲觀。

results.name: driftwood
results.english: wood that is floating on the sea or brought onto the beach by the sea
results.chinese: 漂流木，浮木（在海上漂浮或被海水沖上岸的木頭）

results.name: they get divorced very amicablely
results.english: relating to behaviour between people that is pleasant and friendly, often despite a difficult situation
results.chinese: 心平氣和的；不傷和氣的
results.example1: His manner was perfectly amicable, but I felt uncomfortable. 他表現得極為友善，但我卻感覺很彆扭。

results.name: at the hospice
results.english: a hospital for people who are dying, especially from cancer
results.chinese: （尤指癌症末期患者的）臨終醫院，善終醫院，安養院

results.name: Pisces
results.english: the 12th sign of the zodiac, relating to the period 20 February to 20 March, represented by two fish, or a person born during this period

results.name: Scorpio
results.english: the eighth sign of the zodiac, relating to the period 23 October to 21 November and represented by a scorpion, or a person born during this period

results.name: a military rucksack
results.english: a backpack noun

results.name: evade
results.english: to avoid or escape from someone or something
results.example1: The police have assured the public that the escaped prisoners will not evade recapture for long.  警方向大眾保證，逃犯很快就會再次落網。
results.example2: [ + -ing verb ] He can't evade doing military service forever. 他不可能永遠逃避兵役。

results.name: it turned out to be fruitless
results.english: If an action or attempt to do something is fruitless, it is unsuccessful or produces nothing of value.
results.example1: All diplomatic attempts at a peaceful solution to the crisis have been fruitless. 所有試圖和平解決這場危機的外交努力都毫無成效。

results.name: a reciprocating saw
results.chinese: 一種電鋸，反覆運動的那種

results.name: dote on the baby
results.english: to love someone completely and believe they are perfect
results.example1: He dotes on the new baby. 他對剛出生的孩子非常寵愛。

results.name: she was love-struck
results.english: so in love with someone that it is difficult to behave as usual or even think of anything else except the person you love
results.chinese: 熱戀的；被愛情衝昏頭腦的
results.example1: Look at me, I'm behaving like a love-struck teenager! 看看我的樣子，簡直就像個熱戀中的孩子！

results.name: fruition
results.english: an occasion when a plan or an idea begins to happen, exist, or be successful
results.example1: None of his grand plans for a TV series ever came to fruition. 他拍攝一部電視連續劇的諸般偉大計劃無一實現。

results.name: sth was whisked away
results.english: to take something or someone somewhere else suddenly and quickly
results.example1: Our coffees were whisked away before we'd even finished them. 我們的咖啡還沒有喝完就被匆匆拿走了。
results.example2: We only had half an hour to see her before she was whisked off to some exotic location. 在她被匆匆送往國外某地之前，我們只有半個小時時間和她會面。

results.name: a clandestine plan
results.english: planned or done in secret, especially describing something that is not officially allowed
results.chinese: （尤指從事不被官方允許的活動）秘密的，暗中的，私下的
results.example1: The group held weekly clandestine meetings in a church. 這個團體每星期都在教堂舉行秘密集會。
results.example2: He has been having a clandestine affair with his secretary for three years. 他和秘書私通已有三年了。

results.name: he moonlighted as a mechanic
results.english: to work at an extra job, especially without telling your main employer
results.chinese: （尤指瞞著僱主）從事第二職業，兼職
results.example1: A qualified teacher, he moonlighted as a cabbie in the evenings to pay the rent. 他是個有執教證書的教師，晚上兼職開計程車以賺錢付房租。

results.name: wads of cash
results.english: a number of usually flat and/or small objects pressed tightly together
results.example1: a wad of banknotes 一疊鈔票
results.example2: She used a wad (= a mass) of tissues to wipe away the blood. 她用一團紙巾擦掉了那些血。

results.name: she asked him point-blank
results.english: Point-blank shooting is done from a gun that is fired from extremely close to the target or when almost touching it.
results.example1: Two bullets were fired into the car at point-blank range. 兩顆子彈近距離射進了轎車。
results.example2: a point-blank shot 近距離開槍

results.name: their steadfast denials
results.english: staying the same for a long time and not changing quickly or unexpectedly
results.chinese: 長期不變的；堅定的，不動搖的
results.example1: a steadfast friend/ally 忠實的朋友／盟友
results.example2: The group remained steadfast in its support for the new system, even when it was criticized in the newspapers. 這個團體始終堅定不移地支持新體制，即使遭到報紙批評的時候也毫不動搖。

results.name: on her own free will
results.english: the ability to decide what to do independently of any outside influence
results.example1: No one told me to do it - I did it of my own free will. 沒有人讓我這麽做——是我自己決定做的。

results.name: she hided underneath the tonneau cover
results.chinese: pick-up truck 敞開的區域。它可以用於乘客或貨物

results.name: he juxtaposes A with B
results.english: to put things that are not similar next to each other
results.chinese: 把（不同的事物）並置，把…並列
results.example1: The exhibition juxtaposes Picasso's early drawings with some of his later works. 展覽同時展出了畢卡索早期的畫作和他的一些晚期作品。

results.name: deception
results.english: the act of hiding the truth, especially to get an advantage
results.example1: He was found guilty of obtaining money by deception. 他騙取錢財的罪名被判成立。

results.name: he'd have had ample time to do this
results.english: more than enough
results.example1: You'll have ample opportunity to ask questions after the talk. 演講結束後你們會有足夠的時間提問。
results.example2: There's ample evidence that the lawyer knew exactly what she was doing. 有充分的證據顯示，該律師十分清楚她自己在做甚麼。

results.name: they recanted their story
results.english: to announce in public that your past beliefs or statements were wrong and that you no longer agree with them
results.chinese: 公開宣佈放棄（以前的信仰）
results.example1: After a year spent in solitary confinement, he publicly recanted (his views). 在被單獨監禁了一年後，他公開宣佈放棄（他的觀點）。

results.name: deforestation
results.english: the cutting down of trees in a large area, or the destruction of forests by people
results.chinese: 大面積砍伐森林；人為毀林
results.example1: Deforestation is destroying large areas of tropical rain forest. 濫伐森林毀掉了大面積的熱帶雨林。

results.name: greenhouse gas
results.english: a gas that causes the greenhouse effect, especially carbon dioxide
results.chinese: 溫室氣體（尤指二氧化碳）

results.name: photosynthesis
results.english: the process by which a plant uses the energy from the light of the sun to produce its own food

results.name: a venture
results.english: a new activity, usually in business, that involves risk or uncertainty
results.chinese: （有風險的）企業；投機活動；商業冒險
results.example1: She advised us to look abroad for more lucrative business ventures. 她建議我們去國外尋找更有利可圖的商業機會。
results.example2: There are many joint ventures between American and Japanese companies. 有許多美日合資企業。

results.name: a moratorium
results.english: a stopping of an activity for an agreed amount of time
results.example1: a five-year worldwide moratorium on nuclear weapons testing 全球為期五年的核武器試驗中止期

results.name: beef sth up
results.english: to make something stronger or more important
results.example1: We need to find some new players to beef up the team. 我們要招納幾個新隊員，加強全隊的實力。
results.example2: The company has plans to beef up its production. 公司計劃擴大生產。

results.name: it encroaches on/upon my rights
results.english: to gradually take away someone else's rights, or to take control of someone's time, work, etc.
results.chinese: 逐步侵犯（權利）；慢慢侵佔（時間）；逐漸干擾（工作）
results.example1: What the company is proposing encroaches on the rights of individuals. 公司打算做的這件事侵犯了個人的權利。
results.example2: I resent it that my job is starting to encroach on my family life. 我的工作開始佔據本來屬於我家庭生活的時間，我很討厭這一點。

results.name: he just landed a job
results.english: to get or achieve something good, especially in a way that seems easy or unexpected
results.chinese: （尤指輕而易舉或意外地）獲得，得到，贏得
results.example1: He landed a senior editorial job. 他剛剛輕而易舉地得到了一份資深編輯的工作。

results.name: the group has made strides to ...
results.english: an important positive development
results.example1: The West made impressive strides in improving energy efficiency after the huge rises in oil prices during the 70s. 70年代石油價格大幅上漲之後，西方國家在提高能源使用效率方面有了顯著進步。
results.example2: The group has made strides to expand internationally. 這個集團在拓展國際市場方面獲得很大的進展。

results.name: to underpin his argument
results.english: to give support, strength, or a basic structure to something
results.chinese: 支撐；加強；鞏固；構成（基礎）
results.example1: He presented data to underpin his argument. 他提供了一些數據來支持他的論點。
results.example2: When restoring the building, the first priority was to underpin the exterior walls by adding wooden supports along the foundations. 修復這座建築物時，首先要做的是沿著地基給外牆增加木支撐。

results.name: he is spunky
results.english: used to describe a man who is sexually attractive
results.chinese: （尤指男性）吸引人的；性感的；有魅力的

results.name: skid marks
results.english: black marks made by the tyres of a car when it starts or stops moving very quickly
results.chinese: （汽車開動或緊急煞車時輪胎在地面留下的）煞痕
results.example1: There were skid marks on the road where a car had braked suddenly. 一輛汽車突然煞車，在路上留下了緊急煞車的煞痕。

results.name: as far as
results.english: concerned

results.name: a monolingual dictionary
results.english: speaking or using only one language
results.chinese: 只使用一種語言的，單語的
results.example1: This is a monolingual dictionary. 這是一本單語詞典。

results.name: dementia
results.english: a medical condition that affects especially old people, causing the memory and other mental abilities to gradually become worse, and leading to confused behaviour
results.example1: The most common form of dementia is Alzheimer's disease. 最常見的癡呆病是阿茲海默症。

results.name: nevertheless
results.english: despite what has just been said or referred to
results.example1: I knew a lot about the subject already, but her talk was interesting nevertheless. 關於這個話題我已經知道很多，但她的報告聽起來還是很有趣。

results.name: stage fright
results.english: Actors or performers who have stage fright are nervous because they are about to perform.
results.example1: He decided at an early age that he wanted to be an actor, but nevertheless suffered from stage fright in his first school productions.

results.name: he was consumed with jealousy
results.english: to have so much of a feeling that it affects everything you do
results.example1: He was consumed with jealousy. 他心裡滿是嫉妒。
results.example2: As a teenager, I was consumed by passion for the boy next door. 十幾歲時，我對隔壁的男孩非常著迷。

results.name: they menaced us
results.english: If someone or something menaces a person or thing, he, she, or it threatens seriously to harm it.
results.example1: Hurricane Hugo menaced the eastern coast for a week. 颶風「雨果」威脅東海岸長達一週。

results.name: a useful adjunct
results.english: something added or connected to a larger or more important thing
results.example1: I hoped I would find the computer course a useful adjunct to my other studies. 我希望上了這門電腦課程後，會使其他科目的學習如虎添翼。

results.name: he is demented
results.english: unable to think or act clearly because you are extremely worried, angry, or excited by something
results.chinese: 憂慮失常的；瘋狂的；昏了頭的，懵了的
results.example1: She was nearly demented with worry when her son didn't come home. 當兒子沒有回家時，她幾乎要急瘋了。

results.name: a penchant
results.english: a liking for, an enjoyment of, or a habit of doing something, especially something that other people might not like
results.example1: a penchant for melodrama/skiing/exotic clothes 偏愛通俗劇／滑雪／奇裝異服
results.example2: Her penchant for disappearing for days at a time worries her family. 她喜歡不時失蹤幾天，這讓她的家人非常擔心。

results.name: the misuse of power
results.english: an occasion when something is used in an unsuitable way or in a way that was not intended
results.example1: This new computer system is completely unnecessary and a misuse of taxpayers' money. 這個新的電腦系統完全沒有必要，是濫用納稅人的錢。
results.example2: the misuse of power/drugs 濫用權力／藥物

results.name: attention span
results.english: the length of time that someone can keep their thoughts and interest fixed on something
results.chinese: 集中力時間（指將心思和興趣集中於某一事物的時間長度）
results.example1: Young children have quite short attention spans. 小孩子的集中力時間很短。

results.name: he is illiterate
results.english: unable to read and write
results.example1: A surprising percentage of the population is illiterate. 人口中文盲的比例令人吃驚。

results.name: a side hustle
results.english: a piece of work or a job that you get paid for doing in addition to doing your main job
results.example1: Here are some ideas for a side hustle. 以下是一些關於副業的想法。
results.example2: The series is designed to inspire hard-working corporate employees to start a side hustle if they are interested in eventually starting a business. 本系列旨在激勵勤奮工作的企業雇員，如果有興趣最終創業，可以開始考慮副業。

results.name: market capitalization
results.english: also market capitalization
results.example1: the total value of a company's shares on a stock market:
results.example2: The company has a total market capitalization of about $14.3 billion.

results.name: a smattering of people
results.english: a very small amount or number
results.example1: There's only a smattering of people who oppose the proposal. 只有極少數人反對該提議。

results.name: she had two miscarriages
results.english: an early, unintentional end to a pregnancy when the baby is born too early and dies because it has not developed enough
results.example1: The amniocentesis test carries a significant risk of miscarriage. 羊膜穿刺測試很可能會造成流產。
results.example2: I had two miscarriages before I gave birth to my daughter. 生我女兒之前，我曾兩度流產。

results.name: when she conceived
results.english: to become pregnant, or to cause a baby to begin to form
results.example1: Do you know exactly when you conceived? 你知道自己懷孕的確切時間嗎？
results.example2: The baby was conceived in March, so will be born in December. 這孩子是3月份懷上的，所以會在12月出生。

results.name: she is groggy
results.english: weak and unable to think clearly or walk correctly, usually because of tiredness or illness
results.chinese: （通常因疲憊或生病而）頭腦昏沉的，眩暈無力的，行走不穩的
results.example1: I felt a little bit groggy for a couple of days after the operation. 手術後幾天我都覺得有點頭昏乏力。

results.name: exterminate
results.english: to kill all the animals or people in a particular place or of a particular type
results.example1: Once cockroaches get into a building, it's very difficult to exterminate them. 一旦屋裡有了蟑螂，就很難徹底消滅。
results.example2: Millions of Jewish people were exterminated in concentration camps in the Second World War. 二戰期間，幾百萬猶太人在集中營被集體屠殺。

results.name: she is demented
results.english: unable to think or act clearly because you are extremely worried, angry, or excited by something
results.chinese: 憂慮失常的；瘋狂的；昏了頭的，懵了的
results.example1: She was nearly demented with worry when her son didn't come home. 當兒子沒有回家時，她幾乎要急瘋了。

results.name: they have a rendezvous
results.english: an arrangement to meet someone, especially secretly, at a particular place and time, or the place itself
results.example1: We have a rendezvous for next week, don't we? 我們下周有個約會，是不是？
results.example2: The lovers met at a secret rendezvous in the park. 戀人們在公園中偷偷約會。

results.name: snuff sth out
results.english: to cause something to end suddenly
results.example1: The country has been able to celebrate the return of its independence so brutally snuffed out in 1940. 該國於1940年被無情地剝奪了獨立地位，如今終於可以慶祝自己重獲獨立。

results.name: a good pull
results.english: something that attracts people
results.example1: How can we persuade people to come to the meeting? A glass of wine is quite a good pull. 「我們怎麼才能說服人們來開會呢？」「請他們喝杯酒效果會相當不錯。」

results.name: his book bombed
results.english: to fail
results.example1: Her last book really bombed. 她最近這本書一敗塗地。

results.name: valuation
results.english: the act of deciding how much money something might be sold for or the amount of money decided on
results.example1: You can receive a home loan of up to 95 percent of the official valuation of the property. 你可以獲得高達該房產官方估價95%的購房貸款。

results.name: a holistic approach
results.english: dealing with or treating the whole of something or someone and not just a part
results.example1: My doctor takes a holistic approach to disease. 我的醫生採用了一種全面性的治療方法。
results.example2: Ecological problems usually require holistic solutions. 生態問題通常需要全面性的解決方法。

results.name: it sapped her energy
results.english: to make someone weaker or take away strength or an important quality from someone, especially over a long period of time
results.chinese: （尤指經過一段很長的時間）使傷元氣；削弱；使耗盡
results.example1: Constant criticism saps you of your confidence. 不間斷的批評會消磨信心。
results.example2: Taking care of her dying mother had sapped all her energy. 照顧臨終的母親耗盡了她的全部精力。

results.name: shock and grief
results.english: very great sadness, especially at the death of someone
