results.chinese: （尤指某人之死引起的）悲痛，悲傷，悲哀
results.example1: Her grief at her son's death was terrible. 喪子之痛使她肝腸寸斷。
results.example2: newspaper pictures of grief-stricken relatives 報紙上刊登的悲痛欲絕的親屬的照片

results.name: a bloodbath
results.english: an extremely violent event in which a large number of people are killed
results.example1: Is there nothing that the outside world can do to prevent a bloodbath? 外界難道就不能採取任何行動來阻止大屠殺嗎？

results.name: inoculation
results.english: the action of inoculating someone (= giving them a weak form of a disease as protection against it), or something such as an injection that is given in this way
results.example1: After inoculation with the 2nd vaccine the animals' temperature will go up.
results.example2: He received a cholera inoculation.

results.name: to reinvigorate public compaigns
results.english: to make something stronger, or more exciting or successful again
results.chinese: 給恢復強大；使更為興奮（或成功）
results.example1: Lower interest rates could reinvigorate consumer spending and the struggling housing market. 更低的利率可能會重振消費和疲軟的住房市場。

results.name: hold the glasses aloft
results.english: in the air or in a higher position
results.example1: We held our glasses aloft. 我們高舉酒杯。

results.name: they shelled the hospital
results.english: to fire shells at something
results.example1: They were under orders to shell the hospital and the town hall. 他們奉命炮轟醫院和市政廳。

results.name: the glass is opaque
results.english: preventing light from travelling through, and therefore not transparent or translucent
results.example1: opaque glass/tights 不透明的玻璃／連褲襪

results.name: a disastrous conflict
results.english: extremely bad or unsuccessful
results.example1: Such a war would be disastrous for the country. 這樣一場戰爭會給國家帶來災難性的後果。
results.example2: This decision will have a disastrous impact on foreign policy. 這個決定將對外交政策產生極為不利的影響。

results.name: a grisly assault
results.english: extremely unpleasant, especially because death or blood is involved
results.chinese: （尤指因涉及死亡或流血而）恐怖的，可怕的
results.example1: The 55-year-old Canadian had suffered a grisly death. 這位55歲的加拿大人死得很慘。
results.example2: a grisly murder 可怕的謀殺案

results.name: an orthodox Christians
results.english: (of religious people) having more traditional beliefs than other people in the same religious group
results.example1: orthodox Christians/Jews/Muslims 正統派基督教徒／猶太教徒／穆斯林

results.name: diaspora
results.english: the spreading of people from one original country to other countries
results.chinese: （一國人口向其他國家的）流散，大移居

results.name: the name keeps cropping up in the story
results.english: to happen or appear unexpectedly
results.chinese: 意外發生；冒出；突然出現
results.example1: Her name keeps cropping up in conversation. 談話中不斷提到她的名字。

results.name: I'm still mystified by that
results.english: to confuse someone by being or doing something very strange or impossible to explain
results.example1: I was mystified by her decision. 她的決定使我迷惑不解。
results.example2: Most Americans are totally mystified by the English game of cricket. 大多數美國人似乎完全搞不懂英國的板球運動是甚麼一回事。

results.name: beat yourself up
results.english: to blame or criticize yourself, usually in a way that is unfair or unnecessary
results.example1: If you fail, don't beat yourself up; just try again. 如果你失敗了，不要過分怪罪自己，大不了再試試。

results.name: he is articulate
results.english: able to express thoughts and feelings easily and clearly, or showing this quality
results.chinese: 能表達清楚的，善於表達的；口齒伶俐的，有口才的
results.example1: an intelligent and highly articulate young woman 聰明過人且口齒伶俐的年輕女子
results.example2: She gave a witty, entertaining, and articulate speech. 她的演講機智幽默、引人入勝、明確有力。

results.name: close to hysteria
results.english: extreme fear, excitement, anger, etc. that cannot be controlled
results.example1: One woman, close to hysteria, grabbed my arm. 一個近乎歇斯底里的女人捉住了我的手臂。
results.example2: Tabloid hysteria about the murders has increased public fears. 小報對於這些兇殺案歇斯底里般的報道增加了民眾的恐懼。

results.name: a sadistic man
results.english: getting pleasure, sometimes sexual, by being cruel to or hurting another person
results.example1: sadistic behaviour/pleasure
results.example2: a sadistic serial murderer

results.name: he's still on the loose
results.english: If a dangerous person or animal is on the loose, that person or animal is free to move around a place and harm people.
results.example1: Brewer escaped from prison last year and has been on the loose ever since. 布魯爾自去年越獄後一直在逃。

results.name: his string of horrific attacks
results.english: a series of related things or events
results.example1: What do you think of the recent string of political scandals? 你怎麼看最近一連串的政治醜聞？
results.example2: He had a string of top-20 hits during the 80s. 80年代，他創作了一系列打入排行榜前20名的熱門作品。

results.name: carnage
results.english: the violent killing of large numbers of people, especially in war
results.example1: The Battle of the Somme was a scene of dreadful carnage. 索姆河戰役是一片可怕的大屠殺慘象。

results.name: they are so perverse
results.english: strange and not what most people would expect or enjoy
results.example1: Jack was being perverse and refusing to agree with anything we said. 傑克一意孤行，我們說甚麼他都反對。
results.example2: She took a perverse pleasure in hearing that her sister was getting divorced. 有悖常理的是，她聽說她妹妹要離婚時竟幸災樂禍。

results.name: a $30 ante
results.english: an amount of money that each person must risk in order to be part of a game that involves gambling
results.example1: a $30 ante 30美元的賭注

results.name: he nudged me
results.english: to push something or someone gently, especially to push someone with your elbow (= the middle part of your arm where it bends) to attract the person's attention
results.example1: The children were giggling and nudging each other. 孩子們咯咯地笑著，互相推來推去。
results.example2: He nudged the cat off the sofa so that he could sit down. 他把貓輕輕推下沙發，這樣自己可以坐下來。

results.name: it was excruciating
results.english: extremely boring or embarrassing
results.chinese: 極其乏味的；極其令人厭煩的；極度尷尬的
results.example1: excruciating boredom 極其無聊
results.example2: His confession, when it came, was excruciating. 他終於承認時讓人感到十分尷尬。

results.name: I can't fathom her
results.english: to understand someone or why someone acts as they do
results.example1: I can't fathom her at all. 我一點也搞不懂她。

results.name: apprehend
results.english: to catch and arrest someone who has not obeyed the law
results.example1: The police have finally apprehended the killer. 警方終於抓住了兇手。

results.name: he decapitated her
results.english: to cut off the head of a person

results.name: a morbid collection
results.english: too interested in unpleasant subjects, especially death
results.chinese: （尤指對死亡等）病態的，著迷的
results.example1: a morbid fascination with death 對死亡的病態迷戀

results.name: he was subdued
results.english: If a person is subdued, they are not as happy as usual or they are quieter than usual.
results.example1: He seemed a bit subdued at lunch - is he all right? 午飯時他顯得有點悶悶不樂——他沒事吧？

results.name: a harrowing scene
results.english: extremely upsetting because connected with suffering
results.example1: a harrowing story 令人悲傷的故事
results.example2: For many women, the harrowing prospect of giving evidence in a rape case can be too much to bear. 對很多女性來說，一想到要提供遭受強姦的證據就讓人難以忍受。

results.name: a fanatic
results.english: a person who has very extreme beliefs that may lead them to behave in unreasonable or violent ways
results.example1: religious fanatics 宗教狂熱分子

results.name: crumbs
results.english: a very small piece of bread, cake, or biscuit

results.name: a gurney
results.english: a light bed on wheels, used to move patients in a hospital

results.name: cybercrime
results.english: crime or illegal activity that is done using the internet

results.name: they were scurrying
results.english: to move quickly, with small, short steps
results.example1: The mouse scurried across the floor. 老鼠從地板上咻地溜過。
results.example2: The noise of the explosion sent everyone scurrying back into their homes. 聽到爆炸聲，每个人都急忙跑回家去。

results.name: a salacious book
results.english: causing or showing a strong interest in sexual matters
results.example1: a salacious book/joke/comment 淫穢書籍／玩笑／評論

results.name: a blow-by-blow story
results.english: A blow-by-blow description contains every detail and action of an event.
results.chinese: 極為詳細的，一五一十的
results.example1: You'll have to tell me about your night out with Sam - I want a blow-by-blow account! 你得給我講講你和山姆晚上出去的事——我要知道所有的細節！

results.name: her selfies
results.english: a photograph that you take of yourself , usually with a mobile phone. Selfies are often published using social media.
results.example1: He posted a series of close-up selfies on his Instagram yesterday. 他在自己的Instagram網頁上登出了一系列自拍照。

results.name: in a compromising situation
results.english: causing damage to the reputation of someone, especially making known that they have had a sexual relationship with someone who is considered unsuitable
results.chinese: （尤指桃色事件）有損聲譽的，有失體面的
results.example1: Photographs were published of her in a compromising position/situation with her bodyguard. 她與保鏢的不光彩照片被登了出來。

results.name: he gave her an ultimatum
results.english: a threat in which a person or group of people are warned that if they do not do a particular thing, something unpleasant will happen to them. It is usually the last and most extreme in a series of actions taken to bring about a particular result
results.example1: He gave her an ultimatum - she could either stop seeing Peter and come back to him or it was divorce. 他向她下了最後通牒——她要麽不再見彼得，回到他身邊，要麽離婚。
results.example2: On Wednesday night the UN issued its toughest ultimatum to date, demanding that all troops withdraw from the city. 星期三晚上，聯合國發出了迄今爲止最強硬的最後通牒，要求所有部隊從該城撤出。

results.name: a steamy scene
results.english: sexually exciting or including a lot of sexual activity
results.example1: a steamy love scene 火辣的性愛場面
results.example2: His new novel is advertised as his steamiest yet. 他的新小說被宣傳為他迄今為止最為色情的一部。

results.name: I spruced myself up
results.english: to make someone or something cleaner and tidier or to improve his, her, or its appearance generally
results.example1: I thought I'd have a shave and generally spruce myself up for the interview. 我想我要刮一下鬍子，穿戴整齊去面試。
results.example2: They've employed an advertising agency to spruce up the company image. 他們請了一家廣告公司來打造公司的形象。

results.name: a juggernaut
results.english: a large powerful force or organization that cannot be stopped
results.chinese: 不可抗拒的強大力量（或組織）

results.name: to ward off evil spirits
results.english: to prevent someone or something unpleasant from harming or coming close to you
results.example1: In the winter I take vitamin C to ward off colds. 冬天我服用維他命C以預防感冒。
results.example2: She was given a magic charm to ward off evil spirits. 她得到了一個魔法護身符，可以驅鬼避邪。

results.name: to stave off these difficult decisions
results.english: to stop something bad from happening, or to keep an unwanted situation or person away, usually temporarily
results.chinese: （通常指暫時地）擋住，阻止，避開；延緩
results.example1: We were hoping to stave off these difficult decisions until September. 我們希望將這些難以抉擇的事延緩到九月份。

results.name: I'm not making much headway
results.english: to make progress or get closer to achieving something
results.example1: I'm trying to learn to drive, but I'm not making much headway (with it). 我想學開車，可是進步緩慢。
results.example2: Little headway has been made so far in the negotiations. 談判至今未有所進展。

results.name: an economic prognosis
results.english: a statement of what is judged likely to happen in the future, especially in connection with a particular situation
results.example1: I was reading a gloomy economic prognosis in the paper this morning. 今天早上我在看報紙上某一篇悲觀的經濟預測文章。

results.name: streetscape
results.english: used to form nouns referring to a wide view of a place, often one represented in a picture
results.example1: landscape （陸上）風景
results.example2: seascape 海景

results.name: she began dabbling in drugs
results.english: to take a slight and not very serious interest in a subject, or try a particular activity for a short period
results.example1: He first dabbled in politics when he was at law school. 他在法學院上學時首次接觸政治。
results.example2: She dabbled with drugs at university. 她在大學裡沾上了毒品。

results.name: ragtag friends
results.english: untidy and not similar or organized
results.example1: The village was guarded by a ragtag group of soldiers. 這個村莊由一群雜牌軍士兵把守著。
results.example2: He arrived with a ragtag collection of friends. 他帶著一些三教九流的朋友來了。

results.name: his wayward daughter
results.english: doing only what you want and often changing your behaviour in a way that is difficult to control
results.chinese: （尤指某人的行為）反覆無常的，任性的，難以管束的

results.name: he sniffed her clothing
results.english: to smell something by taking air in through your nose
results.example1: He sniffed his socks to see if they needed washing. 他嗅了嗅自己的襪子，看是否需要洗了。
results.example2: Dogs love sniffing each other. 狗喜歡相互嗅聞。

results.name: a tumultuous event
results.english: very loud, or full of confusion, change, or uncertainty
results.chinese: 吵鬧的，喧嘩的；騷亂的，混亂的
results.example1: The former president appeared to tumultuous applause and a standing ovation. 前總統出場時，人們起立鼓掌，歡呼聲經久不息。
results.example2: After the tumultuous events of 1990, Europe was completely transformed. 經歷了1990年的一系列動盪和騷亂事件後，歐洲發生了劇變。

results.name: it was sheer torment
results.english: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain
results.example1: Waiting for the result of the medical tests was sheer torment. 等待醫療檢查的結果簡直就是一種折磨。
results.example2: He spent the night in torment, trying to decide what was the best thing to do. 他在痛苦中渡過了那個晚上，思量著最好該怎麼做。

results.name: she had this radiance again
results.english: happiness, beauty, or good health that you can see in someone's face
results.chinese: 喜氣洋洋；容光煥發；光彩照人
results.example1: He was struck by the radiance of her smile. 她燦爛的笑容令他著迷。

results.name: an aimless life
results.english: without any clear intentions, purpose, or direction
results.chinese: 無目的的，無目標的，無方向的
results.example1: She said that her life seemed aimless after her children left home. 她說孩子離開家後，她的生活好像沒有了目標。

results.name: he smacked a couple of the kids
results.english: to hit someone or something forcefully with the flat inside part of your hand, producing a short, loud noise, especially as a way of punishing a child
results.chinese: （尤指作爲懲戒孩子的方式）掌摑，打
results.example1: I never smack my children. 我從來不打孩子。
results.example2: I'll smack your bottom if you don't behave yourself. 如果你表現不好，我就打你屁股。

results.name: gag
results.english: to put a gag on someone's mouth
results.example1: He was bound and gagged and left in a cell for three days. 他被綁起來，嘴裡塞了布，扔在一間小囚室中關了三天。

results.name: it flustered people
results.english: to make someone upset and confused, especially when they are trying to do something

results.name: a duffel bag
results.english: a tube-shaped cloth bag with a circular bottom and a thick string at the top that is used to close it and carry it

results.name: an odyssey
results.english: a long, exciting journey
results.example1: The film follows one man's odyssey to find the mother from whom he was separated at birth. 這部影片講述了一名男子尋找生下自己後就失散的母親的漫長曲折的歷程。
results.example2: figurative a spiritual odyssey 精神探索

results.name: she was in an agony
results.english: extreme physical or mental pain or suffering
results.example1: She lay there screaming in agony. 她躺在那裡痛苦地大聲尖叫。
results.example2: I was in an agony of suspense. 我懸著一顆心，備受煎熬。

results.name: they are defiant
results.english: proudly refusing to obey authority
results.example1: a defiant attitude/gesture 挑釁的態度／姿態
results.example2: The protesters blocking the entrance to the offices remained defiant this morning. 堵在辦公室入口的抗議者今天早晨態度依然強硬。

results.name: a dignified silence
results.english: controlled, serious, and calm, and therefore deserving respect
results.chinese: 莊重的，端莊的；有尊嚴的
results.example1: a tall, dignified woman 端莊的高個女人
results.example2: He has maintained a dignified silence about the rumours. 關於那些謠言他很有尊嚴地保持著沉默。

results.name: her maniacal boyfriend
results.english: A maniacal cry or laugh is loud and wild.
results.example1: He suddenly exploded into maniacal laughter. 他突然發出一陣狂笑。

results.name: it caused devastation
results.english: damage and destruction
results.example1: If disease is allowed to spread, it will cause widespread devastation. 如果疾病蔓延開來，將造成大範圍的災難性後果。
results.example2: The storm left behind it a trail of devastation. 風暴過後，留下了一片狼藉。

results.name: relentless heat
results.english: continuing in a severe or extreme way
results.chinese: 持續嚴厲的；持續強烈的
results.example1: relentless criticism/pressure 不斷的嚴厲批評／施壓
results.example2: relentless heat 持續高溫

results.name: a buffoon
results.english: a person who does silly things, usually to make other people laugh
results.example1: Doesn't he get tired of playing the buffoon in class? 老在班裡充當小丑，他難道不感到厭倦嗎?

results.name: ghoulish faces
results.english: ugly and unpleasant, or frightening
results.chinese: 醜惡的；令人憎惡的；可怕的
results.example1: ghoulish faces 猙獰可怕的臉

results.name: this one is in a different league
results.english: to be much better than something or someone else
results.example1: Our last hotel was good but this was in a different league. 我們上次住的飯店不錯，但這間飯店更好。

results.name: raw
results.english: Feelings or qualities that are raw are natural and difficult to control.
results.chinese: （感情、品質）等處於自然狀態的，強烈的，粗獷的
results.example1: We were struck by the raw energy/power of the dancers' performances. 舞蹈演員們那粗狂奔放、富有激情的表演給我們留下了很深的印象。
results.example2: Her emotions are still a bit raw after her painful divorce. 經歷過那段痛苦的離婚後，她的情緒仍然無法平靜下來。

results.name: a juror
results.english: a member of a jury

results.name: that fateful morning
results.english: having an important and usually negative effect on the future
results.chinese: 對未來有重大（負面）影響的
results.example1: the fateful day of President Kennedy's assassination 甘迺迪總統遇刺的災難性的一天
results.example2: He made the fateful decision to send in the troops. 他作出了派遣部隊這個影響重大的決定。

results.name: satanic rituals
results.english: connected with worshipping Satan
results.example1: a satanic cult/practice/rite 撒旦崇拜祭儀

results.name: a hamlet
results.english: a small village, usually without a church

results.name: a summer fete
results.english: a public event, often held outside, where you can take part in competitions and buy small things and food, often organized to collect money for a particular purpose
results.chinese: 露天遊樂會；義賣遊樂會
results.example1: a summer fete 夏季義賣會
results.example2: They're holding the village fete on the green. 他們正在公共草地上舉行村莊遊樂會。

results.name: the song stands the test of time
results.english: If something stands the test of time, it is still popular, strong, etc. after a long time.
results.example1: Which songs from the last year will stand the test of time? 去年有哪些歌將禁得起時間的考驗呢？

results.name: It's a great solace to me
results.english: help and comfort when you are feeling sad or worried
results.example1: When his wife left him, he found solace in the bottle (= drank alcohol). 妻子離開他之後，他借酒消愁。
results.example2: Music was a great solace to me. 音樂對我來說是一種很好的慰藉。

results.name: he slugged her
results.english: to hit someone hard with the fist (= closed hand)
results.example1: She slugged him and he fell against the bar. 她猛地打了他一拳，他撲倒在櫃檯上。

results.name: she was battering the door
results.english: to hit and behave violently towards a person, especially a woman or child, repeatedly over a long period of time, or to hit something with force many times
results.chinese: 接連猛打（尤指婦女、兒童）
results.example1: He was battered to death with a rifle butt. 他被人用槍托連續猛打致死。
results.example2: He was battering (at/on) the door with his fists and howling. 他不停地用拳頭砸門，邊砸邊吼。

results.name: a few details trickle in
results.english: to arrive or move somewhere slowly and gradually, in small numbers
results.chinese: 緩慢而零星地進入／離開／返回（等等）
results.example1: Gradually people trickled back into the theatre for the second half. 漸漸地，人們開始三三兩兩地回到劇院看下半場。

results.name: an astounding story
results.english: very surprising or shocking
results.chinese: 令人震驚的；使人驚駭的
results.example1: an astounding fact/decision/revelation 令人震驚的事實／決定／揭示
results.example2: an astounding (= very great) victory/achievement/success 令人驚嘆的勝利／成就／成功

results.name: the body would have to be exhumed
results.english: to remove a dead body from the ground after it has been buried

results.name: a chance for resuscitation
results.english: the act of bringing someone or something back to life or waking them
results.example1: The patient suffered a cardiac arrest and died, despite an attempt at resuscitation. 儘管醫生進行了努力搶救，但病人還是心跳停止去世了。

results.name: it's a figurative use
results.english: (written abbreviation fig.) (of words and phrases) used not with their basic meaning but with a more imaginative meaning, in order to create a special effect
results.example1: Of course, she was using the term massacre in the figurative sense. 當然，她是在用「屠殺」這個詞的比喻義。

results.name: the errors were staggering
results.english: very shocking and surprising
results.example1: It costs a staggering $50,000 per week to keep the museum open to the public. 維持博物館對外開放所需的支出每週竟高達五萬美元。

results.name: substandard
results.english: below a satisfactory standard
results.example1: substandard housing/accommodation 不符合標準的住宅／住處
results.example2: substandard work/goods 做得不合格的工作／不合格的商品

results.name: it's a requisite
results.english: an important necessary thing
results.example1: A good book is a requisite for long journeys. 一本好書是長途旅行必備之物。
results.example2: Self-esteem, self-judgment and self-will are said to be the three requisites of independence. 自尊、自量和堅持自我據說是自立的三個必備條件。

results.name: studded with stars
results.english: If something is studded with many objects of the same type, those objects are arranged regularly across it, or across the surface of it.
results.example1: a baked ham studded with cloves 點綴著丁香的烤火腿
results.example2: Elaine looked up at the black, velvety sky studded with tiny, twinkling stars. 伊萊恩抬頭看著漆黑的、絲絨般的天空，閃閃繁星點綴其中。

results.name: a quirky sense of humour
results.english: unusual in an attractive and interesting way
results.example1: He was tall and had a quirky, off-beat sense of humour. 他個子高高的，有一種獨特的、另類的幽默感。

results.name: my inclination is ...
results.english: a feeling that you want to do a particular thing, or the fact that you prefer or are more likely to do a particular thing
results.example1: [ + to infinitive ] My own inclination would be to look for another job. 我個人傾向另外找一份工作。
results.example2: We should be basing our decisions on solid facts, not inclinations and hunches. 我們應根據可靠的事實作出決定，而不是根據個人愛好和直覺。

results.name: Down's syndrome
results.english: a genetic condition in which a person is born with learning difficulties and particular physical characteristics

results.name: tenacious opposition
results.english: holding tightly onto something, or keeping an opinion in a determined way
results.example1: The baby took my finger in its tenacious little fist. 那個嬰兒用他的小拳頭緊緊攥著我的手指。
results.example2: There has been tenacious local opposition to the new airport. 當地人一直堅決反對建這個新機場。

results.name: a stopgap
results.english: something intended for temporary use until something better or more suitable can be found
results.example1: Hostels are used as a stopgap until the families can find permanent accommodation. 那些家庭住進永久居所之前，住旅舍通常只是權宜之計。
results.example2: We might have to employ someone temporarily as a stopgap measure until we can hire someone permanently. 在找到人填補這個空缺之前，我們可能得先暫時僱個人頂一下。

results.name: life expectancy in Europe
results.english: the length of time that a living thing, especially a human being, is likely to live
results.example1: Life expectancy in Europe increased greatly in the 20th century. 歐洲人的預期壽命在20世紀大幅增長。

results.name: she fronts a company
results.english: to lead an organization or group of musicians
results.chinese: 領導（機構）；擔任（領唱或領奏）
results.example1: She fronts a large IT company. 她領導一家大型 IT 公司。

results.name: she mustered the courage to ask him
results.english: to produce or encourage something such as an emotion or support
results.chinese: 鼓起（勇氣）；激起（某種感情或支持）
results.example1: She managed to muster the courage to ask him to the cinema. 她終於鼓起勇氣請他去看電影。
results.example2: The team will need all the strength they can muster to win this game. 球隊必須傾盡全力才能贏得這場比賽。

results.name: snail mail
results.english: letters or messages that are not sent by email, but in the post
results.example1: We agreed the deal online, but we'll have to wait for snail mail to get the paperwork. 我們在網上達成了交易，但是還得等平信寄來書面文件。

results.name: they marvel at the view
results.english: to show or experience great surprise or admiration
results.example1: We paused to marvel at the view. 我們停下來，感歎景色之美。
results.example2: [ + that ] I often marvel that humans can treat each other so badly. 人們竟可對他人如此惡劣，我時常感到驚詫不已。

results.name: he'll be paralyzed
results.english: unable to move or act
results.example1: The accident left her paralysed from the waist down. 這次意外導致她腰部以下癱瘓。
results.example2: The government seems paralysed by/with indecision. 政府優柔寡斷，似乎一直未見有所行動。

results.name: the onset of winter
results.english: the moment at which something unpleasant begins
results.chinese: （指不愉快的事情）的開始，發作
results.example1: the onset of winter 冬季的開始
results.example2: The new treatment can delay the onset of the disease by several years. 新的治療方法可以把疾病開始的時間延後幾年。

results.name: deflate a tire
results.english: If something that has air or gas inside it deflates, or is deflated, it becomes smaller because it loses the air or gas.
results.example1: to deflate a balloon/tyre 給氣球／輪胎放氣

results.name: a depraved mind
results.english: morally bad or evil
results.chinese: 道德敗壞的，墮落的，惡毒的
results.example1: a depraved character/mind 不良品質／思想
results.example2: Someone who can kill a child like that must be totally depraved. 用那種方式殺害兒童的人一定是個惡毒至極的傢夥。

results.name: he was enraged
results.english: to cause someone to become very angry
results.example1: Plans to build a new nightclub in the neighbourhood have enraged local residents. 在附近地區新建一家夜總會的計劃激怒了當地居民。
results.example2: He was enraged at the article about him. 關於他的那篇報道使他大爲光火。

results.name: it's stippling
results.english: the activity of drawing or painting using small spots or marks

results.name: a far-fetched story
results.english: very unlikely to be true, and difficult to believe
results.example1: a far-fetched idea/story 牽強的意見／難以置信的故事

results.name: her shirt was bunched up
results.english: If material bunches up, or if someone bunches it up, it moves into tight folds.
results.example1: Your shirt's all bunched up at the back. 你的襯衣後面都是褶。

results.name: she despises guns
results.english: to feel a strong dislike for someone or something because you think that that person or thing is bad or has no value
results.example1: The two groups despise each other. 這兩個團體互相鄙視。
results.example2: She despised him for the way he treated her sister. 他那樣對待她姐姐，讓她感到很厭惡。

results.name: there are specks
results.english: a very small mark, piece, or amount
results.example1: He'd been painting the door and there were specks of paint all over the floor. 他在幫門上漆，弄得地板上到處都是油漆斑點。
results.example2: There's not a speck of (= not any) dust/dirt in their house. 他們的房子裡一塵不染。

results.name: it's orchestrated by me
results.english: to arrange something carefully, and sometimes unfairly, so as to achieve a wanted result
results.example1: Their victory was largely a result of their brilliantly orchestrated election campaign. 他們的勝利主要歸功於他們的選舉活動策劃得非常成功。

results.name: her knee was propped up on the table
results.english: to lift and give support to something by putting something under it
results.example1: He was sitting upright in his hospital bed, propped up by pillows. 他靠著枕頭，直挺挺地坐在醫院的病床上。
results.example2: There were the usual bunch of drinkers propped up at (= leaning against) the bar. 有一群常客斜靠在吧臺上。

results.name: an outstretched hand
results.english: reaching out as far as possible
results.example1: He ran up to her, his arms outstretched. 他張開雙臂向她跑去。
results.example2: She put some pesos into the little girl's outstretched hand. 她將幾披索放進小女孩伸出的手裡。

results.name: Polaroid
results.english: a brand name for a camera that takes a picture and prints it after a few seconds, or a photograph taken with this type of camera
results.chinese: 拍立得一次成像照相機；拍立得照片
results.example1: Did you take these with a Polaroid? 你是用拍立得相機拍的這些照片嗎？
results.example2: Please send us your Polaroids and the best ones will be published. 請你把拍立得照片寄給我們，我們挑最好的發表。

results.name: it's perplexing
results.english: to confuse and worry someone slightly by being difficult to understand or solve
results.example1: The disease has continued to perplex doctors. 這種疾病仍然困擾著醫生。

results.name: spatter
results.english: to drop small drops of liquid, etc. on a surface, or (of liquid) to fall, especially noisily, in small drops
results.example1: The bikes spattered them with mud. 腳踏車濺了他們一身泥漿。
results.example2: They could hear raindrops spattering on the roof of the car. 他們可以聽見雨滴劈裡啪啦打在車頂上的聲音。

results.name: a predominant part
results.english: more noticeable or important, or larger in number, than others
results.chinese: 占主導地位的；占絕大多數的；顯著的
results.example1: Research forms the predominant part of my job. 研究是我工作中的重要部分。
results.example2: Dancers have a predominant role in this performance. 在這場表演中，舞蹈演員發揮主導作用。

results.name: it disparages her
results.english: to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not respect or value him, her, or it
results.example1: The actor's work for charity has recently been disparaged in the press as an attempt to get publicity. 該演員爲慈善事業所做的工作近來被報紙說成是想出名。

results.name: vile policy
results.english: unpleasant, immoral, and unacceptable
results.example1: This vile policy of ethnic cleansing must be stopped. 這項罪惡的種族清洗政策必須被制止。

results.name: a flurry of phone calls
results.english: a sudden, short period of activity, excitement, or interest
results.example1: The prince's words on marriage have prompted a flurry of speculation in the press this week. 本周王子就結婚問題所說的話引起新聞界一片猜測。
results.example2: a flurry of activity 一陣忙亂

results.name: she was livid
results.english: extremely angry
results.example1: He was livid when he found out. 他發現真相後非常氣憤。

results.name: she was floored
results.english: to surprise or confuse someone so much that they are unable to think what to say or do next
results.example1: I didn't know what to say - I was completely floored. 我不知道說甚麽——我完全被弄糊塗了。

results.name: sleep on it
results.english: to wait before making a decision
results.chinese: 沒有馬上做決定，還必須要時間思考
results.example1: Don’t give me an answer now – sleep on it and tell me whenever you’re ready.

results.name: profuse apologies
results.english: produced or given in large amounts
results.example1: She was admitted to St Mary's Hospital with profuse bleeding. 她因大量出血被送入聖瑪麗醫院。
results.example2: The company accepted blame and sent us profuse apologies. 這家公司擔下了責任，一再向我們道歉。

results.name: they demeaned her
results.english: to cause someone to become less respected
results.example1: The entire family was demeaned by his behaviour. 全家人都因他的行為而蒙羞。
results.example2: I wouldn't demean myself by asking my parents for money. 我絕不會向父母要錢，我可丟不起那臉。

results.name: a conspirator
results.english: someone who conspires with other people to do something

results.name: psychopathy
results.english: the condition of being a psychopath
results.example1: Dr. Hare created one of the most authoritative models for detecting psychopathy. 黑爾博士創建的模型是檢測精神病態最權威的模型之一。

results.name: should never been cremated
results.english: to burn a dead person's body, usually as part of a funeral ceremony

results.name: from outward appearances
results.english: relating to how people, situations, or things seem to be, rather than how they are inside
results.example1: The outward appearance of the building has not changed at all in 200 years. 這幢大樓的外觀200年裡絲毫未變。
results.example2: To all outward appearances everything was fine, but under the surface the marriage was very shaky. 表面看來一切都很好，但實際上這段婚姻很不穩固。

results.name: a small abrasion under her chin
results.english: the process of rubbing away the surface of something
results.example1: There seems to have been some abrasion of the surface. 表面好像有些磨損。

results.name: recreation
results.english: the act of making something exist or happen again
results.example1: a recreation of one of the most famous events in history 歷史上最著名事件之一的再現

results.name: an inquest is held
results.english: an official process to discover the cause of someone's death
results.example1: An inquest is always held if murder is suspected. 如果懷疑是謀殺，總要驗屍調查。

results.name: put it in a nutshell
results.english: using as few words as possible
results.example1: Well, to put it in a nutshell, we're lost. 嗯，一句話，我們迷路了。

results.name: vernacular
results.english: the form of a language that a particular group of speakers use naturally, especially in informal situations
results.example1: The Spanish I learned at school is very different from the local vernacular of this Mexican village. 我在學校裡學的西班牙語與我現在住的這個墨西哥村子裡所說的本地方言差別非常大。
results.example2: Many Roman Catholics regret the replacing of the Latin mass by the vernacular. 很多天主教徒認為用方言代替拉丁語做彌撒是件很讓人惋惜的事。

results.name: a loud whack
results.english: the action of hitting someone or something noisily
results.example1: He gave the ball a whack with his stick. 他用球棒猛擊了一下球。

results.name: the throbbing pain
results.english: If a part of your body throbs, you feel pain in it in a series of regular beats.
results.example1: His head throbbed, and his body ached. 他的頭陣陣作痛，身上也痛。
results.example2: The throbbing pain in his leg was becoming unbearable. 他的腿陣陣作痛，越來越難以忍受。

results.name: a searing pain
results.english: If something, such as a feeling or temperature, is described as searing, it is extreme.
results.example1: A searing pain shot up her arm. 她的手臂忽覺一陣火辣刺痛。
results.example2: The race took place in the searing heat. 賽跑在酷熱中進行。

results.name: a life full of angst
results.english: strong worry and unhappiness, especially about personal problems
results.chinese: （尤指對私人問題的）焦慮，煩憂
results.example1: All my children went through a period of late-adolescent angst. 我所有的孩子在青春期後期都經歷過一段焦慮不安的時光。

results.name: 5 nunchuks in a bag
results.english: a weapon used in traditional Japanese martial arts, consisting of two sticks joined at one end by a chain or rope

results.name: a tax fiddle
results.english: something dishonest that someone does in order to get money or other advantages
results.chinese: （為獲得金錢或其他利益而做的）不誠實行為
results.example1: a tax fiddle 偷稅行為
results.example2: Everyone suspected they were on the fiddle (= cheating). 大家都懷疑他們在搞欺詐。

results.name: a veritable mess
results.english: used to describe something as another, more exciting, interesting, or unusual thing, as a way of emphasizing its character
results.chinese: 十足的，不折不扣的；名副其實的
results.example1: My garden had become a veritable jungle by the time I came back from holiday. 我度假回來的時候，我的花園簡直是雜草叢生。
results.example2: The normally sober menswear department is set to become a veritable kaleidoscope of colour this season. 色調通常都比較暗淡的男裝部這一季將會成為名副其實的色彩萬花筒。

results.name: that was drop​ped in his lap
results.english: to make someone responsible for a job or a problem, without any warning
results.example1: He put the matter off entirely, essentially dumping it in the lap of the incoming governor.

results.name: he's marshaled an army
results.english: to bring together or organize people or things in order to achieve a particular aim
results.example1: The fighting in the city followed reports of the rebels marshalling their forces in the countryside. 叛軍在郊外集結力量的消息傳出後，城內發生了戰鬥。
results.example2: The company is marshalling its forces/resources for a long court case. 這家公司正集中力量／資源打一場曠日費時的官司。

results.name: seemingly
results.english: according to the facts that you know
results.example1: The factory closure is seemingly inevitable. 看來，工廠關閉勢在難免。
results.example2: Seemingly, she's gone to live with another man. 看樣子，她去和另外一個男人同居了。

results.name: reckoning
results.english: a calculation that you make
results.example1: By my reckoning, we should arrive in ten minutes. 我算了一下，再過10分鐘我們就該到了。

results.name: he was bludgeoned
results.english: to hit someone hard and repeatedly with a heavy weapon
results.example1: The two boys had been mercilessly bludgeoned to death. 那兩個男孩被殘忍地重撃致死。

results.name: a sense of closure
results.english: the feeling or act of bringing an unpleasant situation, time, or experience to an end, so that you are able to start new activities
results.example1: a sense of closure 解脫感
results.example2: to achieve/reach closure 獲得／達到解脫

results.name: forge ahead
results.english: to suddenly make a lot of progress with something
results.chinese: 突然進展神速；迅猛發展
results.example1: The organizers are forging ahead with a programme of public events. 組織者搞的一個公共活動計劃進展神速。

results.name: to express those sentiments
results.english: a thought, opinion, or idea based on a feeling about a situation, or a way of thinking about something
results.example1: Nationalist sentiment has increased in the area since the bombing. 爆炸案發生以來，該地區的民族主義情緒開始高漲。
results.example2: I don't think she shares my sentiments. 我認爲她不同意我的觀點。

results.name: a ravine
results.english: a deep narrow valley with steep sides

results.name: a grove of trees
results.english: a group of trees planted close together
results.example1: olive/orange/lemon groves 橄欖／柑橘／檸檬樹林

results.name: a ferocious dog
results.english: frightening and violent
results.chinese: 兇猛的，兇惡的；激烈的；可怕的
results.example1: a ferocious battle 激烈的戰鬥
results.example2: She's got a ferocious (= very bad) temper. 她的脾氣極為暴躁。

results.name: a crematorium
results.english: a building where dead people's bodies are burned, usually as part of a funeral ceremony

results.name: a heavy caseload
results.english: the amount of work that someone, especially a doctor or lawyer, has to do in a period of time
results.chinese: 工作量；個案總量；（醫生的）病例數；（律師的）承辦案件數
results.example1: a heavy caseload 繁重的工作量

results.name: sporadic gunfire
results.english: happening sometimes; not regular or continuous
results.chinese: 偶爾發生的；陣發性的；斷斷續續的
results.example1: a sporadic electricity supply 不穩定的電力供應
results.example2: More than 100 people have been killed this year in sporadic outbursts of ethnic violence. 今年有超過100人在零星爆發的種族暴力中喪生。

results.name: standstill
results.english: a condition in which all movement or activity has stopped
results.example1: The runaway bus eventually came to a standstill when it rolled into a muddy field. 失控的大巴士駛入了泥濘的田裡，最後停了下來。
results.example2: Fighting and shortages have brought normal life to a virtual standstill in the city. 戰火和物資短缺使這座城市的日常生活陷於癱瘓。

results.name: the variant
results.english: something that is slightly different from other similar things
results.example1: There are many colas on the market now, all variants on the original drink. 現在市場上有多種可樂，都跟最初的差別不大。
results.example2: There are four variants of malaria, all transmitted to humans by a particular family of mosquitoes. 瘧疾有四個變種，都是透過一種特殊的蚊子傳播給人。

results.name: some mutations
results.english: a permanent change in an organism, or the changed organism itself
results.example1: Environmental pressures encourage genes with certain mutations to persist and others to die out.
results.example2: These plants carry the mutation for red flowers.

results.name: complacency
results.english: a feeling of calm satisfaction with your own abilities or situation that prevents you from trying harder
results.example1: What annoys me about these girls is their complacency - they seem to have no desire to expand their horizons. 這些女孩讓我生氣的是她們的自滿想法——她們似乎根本沒有擴展知識面的願望。
results.example2: There's no room for complacency if we want to stay in this competition! 我們要是想在競爭中立足就絕不能自滿！

results.name: she is wired
results.english: to connect a piece of electrical equipment with wires so that it will work
results.chinese: 為（電子設備）接上電線（或導線）
results.example1: The stereo wasn't working because it hadn't been wired up correctly. 立體聲音響不響了，因為電線沒有接好。
results.example2: Nearly one home in ten across the country is wired up to receive TV via cable. 該國有近十分之一的家庭透過電纜接收電視訊號。

results.name: suffice
results.english: to be enough
results.example1: I'm taking $400 - I think that should suffice. 我帶了400美元——我覺得應該夠了。

results.name: harness
results.english: to control something, usually in order to use its power
results.example1: There is a great deal of interest in harnessing wind and waves as new sources of power. 人們對開發利用風和波浪這些新能源非常感興趣。

results.name: pictorial
results.english: shown in the form of a picture or photograph
results.example1: The exhibition is a pictorial history/record of the town in the 19th century. 此次展覽會採用圖片形式重現了該鎮19世紀的歷史。

results.name: artistic
results.english: relating to art
results.example1: the artistic director of the theatre 劇院美術指導
results.example2: artistic endeavours 藝術探索

results.name: indebted
results.english: owing money
results.example1: indebted countries 負債國
results.example2: The company is heavily indebted. 這家公司債台高築。

results.name: impetus
results.english: something that encourages a particular activity or makes that activity more energetic or effective
results.example1: The recent publicity surrounding homelessness has given (a) fresh impetus to the cause. 最近圍繞無家可歸者的宣傳對這項事業是一股新的推動力。

results.name: it's something of a lull
results.english: a short period of calm in which little happens
results.example1: There has been a lull in the fighting. 戰鬥中出現了一段間歇。
results.example2: a lull in the conversation/traffic 談話的間歇／交通低谷

results.name: the letter is succinct
results.english: said in a clear and short way; expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words
results.example1: Keep your letter succinct and to the point. 信一定要寫得簡明扼要。

results.name: this could backfire
results.english: (of a plan) to have the opposite result from the one you intended
results.chinese: （計劃）產生適得其反的結果，產生反效果
results.example1: Her plans to make him jealous backfired on her when he started dating her best friend. 她原本想令他妒嫉，沒想到最後他卻和她最好的朋友好上了。

results.name: arcane details
results.english: mysterious and known only by a few people
results.chinese: 神秘的；秘密的；晦澀難懂的
results.example1: He was the only person who understood all the arcane details of the agreement. 他是唯一能看懂協議中所有那些晦澀難懂的繁縟條文的人。
results.example2: This argument may seem arcane to those not closely involved in the world of finance. 對於那些不諳金融界事務的人而言，這種觀點如同天書。

results.name: a rhetorical question
results.english: Rhetorical speech or writing is intended to seem important or influence people.
results.chinese: 詞藻華麗的；浮誇的；修辭的
results.example1: repetition, that tedious rhetorical device 重覆，一種枯燥乏味的修辭伎倆

results.name: he is not the gregarious type
results.english: (of people) liking to be with other people
results.example1: Emma's a gregarious, outgoing sort of person. 艾瑪是個喜歡交際、性情爽直的人。

results.name: she's not in the fire chad
results.english: the piece that you remove when you make a hole in a piece of paper or card
results.chinese: 孔屑（在卡片、紙張上打孔時掉下的紙屑）

results.name: it looks super cryptic
results.english: mysterious and difficult to understand
results.chinese: 神秘的，隱秘的；有隱義的；費解的
results.example1: I got a cryptic text message from Sam. 我收到山姆寄來的一條含義隱晦的簡訊。

results.name: the ramifications of your suggestion
results.english: the possible results of an action
results.chinese: 可能的後果；衍生結果；派生影響
results.example1: Have you considered all the ramifications of your suggestion? 你考慮過你的建議可能帶來的各種後果嗎？

results.name: maybe that was just a fluke
results.english: something good that has happened that is the result of chance instead of skill or planning
results.example1: The first goal was just a fluke. 第一個進球只是僥倖命中。

results.name: the one we alluded to last week
results.english: to mention someone or something without talking about him, her, or it directly
results.example1: She mentioned some trouble that she'd had at home and I guessed she was alluding to her son. 她提到家中有些麻煩事，我猜她是指她的兒子。

results.name: his world revoled around her
results.english: to move or cause something to move around a central point or line
results.example1: The earth revolves around the sun. 地球圍繞太陽轉。
results.example2: The gun turret revolved until the gun was aimed at the advancing soldiers. 炮塔旋轉著，最後炮口瞄準了正在前進的士兵。

results.name: a great delicacy
results.english: something especially rare or expensive that is good to eat
results.chinese: （尤指稀有昂貴的）美食，美味，佳餚
results.example1: In some parts of the world, sheep's eyes are considered a great delicacy. 羊眼在世界某些地方被認為是一種難得的美味佳餚。

results.name: the medics were on scene
results.english: someone who does medical work in the military

results.name: Corporal Kelly richards
results.english: a person of low rank in the army or the air force
results.example1: Corporal Green/Sam Green 格林/山姆·格林下士
results.example2: [ as form of address ] Thank you, Corporal. 謝謝您，下士。

results.name: a russian crime syndicate
results.english: a group of people or companies who join together in order to share the cost of a particular business operation for which a large amount of money is needed
results.chinese: 聯盟；私人聯合會；企業聯合組織
results.example1: A syndicate of banks is/are financing the deal. 一個銀行聯盟將為這筆交易提供資金。

results.name: their home had been burglarized
results.english: to enter a building illegally and steal things
results.example1: When they got back from their holiday they found that their home had been burglarized. 他們度假回來時發現家中被盜了。

results.name: someone who had a fued with her brother
results.english: an argument that has existed for a long time between two people or groups, causing a lot of anger or violence
results.example1: a family feud 家族世仇
results.example2: a ten-year-old feud between the two countries 兩國間長達十年的不和

results.name: prepare for a showdown
results.english: an important argument that is intended to end a disagreement that has existed for a long time
results.chinese: 決定勝負的大辯論；攤牌
results.example1: The president is preparing for a showdown with Republicans over his plans to reform the economy. 總統正在作準備，打算就他的經濟改革計劃和共和黨人最後放手一搏。
results.example2: Millions of dollars were spent on lawyers in a courtroom showdown between the two companies. 兩家公司在法庭的最後一戰光在律師身上就花了數百萬美元。

results.name: to rat out your friend
results.english: to not be loyal to someone, especially by giving away secret information about them, or to fail to do something that you said you would do
results.example1: You can't rat your teammates out. 你不可以出賣你的隊友們
results.example2: He's going to rat me out. 他將要告我密

results.name: our dear departed friends
results.english: dead
results.example1: We will always remember our dear departed friends. 我們將永遠懷念那些離世的好友。

results.name: criminal mischief
results.english: damage or harm
results.example1: criminal mischief 刑事毀壞

results.name: to find the proverbial smoking gun
results.english: as used in a proverb or other phrase
results.example1: The players pointed the proverbial finger at themselves as the ones needing to improve. 這些球員簡直就是在對自己豎中指，其實他們才是需要提高的人。

results.name: smoking gun
results.english: information that proves who committed a crime
results.example1: The tape recordings provided prosecutors with the smoking gun they needed to prove he'd been involved in the conspiracy. 錄音帶爲檢察官們提供了他們所需要的確鑿證據，證明他參與了這陰謀。

results.name: the linchpin of this entire investigation
results.english: the most important member of a group or part of a system, that holds together the other members or parts or makes it possible for them to operate as intended
results.chinese: 核心，中樞，關鍵（人物或部分）
results.example1: Woodford is the linchpin of the British athletics team. 伍德福德是英國田徑隊中的核心人物。

results.name: coerce
results.english: to persuade someone forcefully to do something that they are unwilling to do
results.example1: The court heard that the six defendants had been coerced into making a confession. 法庭在審理中發現六名被告曾受到迫供。

results.name: a contagious girl
results.english: A contagious feeling spreads quickly among people.
results.example1: Fear is contagious. 恐懼是會傳染的。

results.name: collide
results.english: (especially of moving objects) to hit something violently
results.example1: The two vans collided at the crossroads. 兩輛貨車在十字路口相撞。
results.example2: It was predicted that a comet would collide with one of the planets. 預計一顆彗星將與某行星相撞。

results.name: a locket
results.english: a small piece of jewellery that opens to show a small picture or piece of hair, usually worn on a chain around a person's neck
results.chinese: 盒式吊墜（內有圖片或頭髮，常墜在項鏈上）

results.name: I smothered her
results.english: to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe
results.example1: They threatened to smother the animals with plastic bags. 他們威脅要用塑膠袋把這些動物悶死。

results.name: wait for the case to be adjudicated
results.english: to act as judge in a competition or argument, or to make a formal decision about something
results.chinese: 擔任裁判；判決，裁定，裁決
results.example1: He was asked to adjudicate on the dispute. 人們請他來對這場爭端作出裁定。
results.example2: [ + two objects ] The game was adjudicated a win for Black. 布萊克被裁定贏得比賽。

results.name: my name is a mouthful
results.english: a word or phrase that is difficult to pronounce or that has a lot of syllables
results.chinese: 冗長而拗口的詞（或片語），難讀的詞（或片語）
results.example1: I've always called myself Henny because it's less of a mouthful than Henrietta. 我總是叫自己「亨尼」，因為它不像「亨麗埃塔」那麼拗口。

results.name: sth is germane
results.english: Ideas or information that is germane to a particular subject or situation is connected with and important to it.
results.chinese: （想法、訊息等）有密切關係的，有重要意義的
results.example1: Her remarks could not have been more germane to the discussion. 她的說話跟這次討論密切相關。

results.name: the incarnation of sth
results.english: an extreme example, in human form, of a particular characteristic or type of behaviour
results.chinese: （特定特徵或行為類型的）化身
results.example1: He was the incarnation of evil (= was extremely evil). 他是邪惡的化身。
results.example2: She's the incarnation of everything I hate about politics. 她是我所痛恨的一切醜陋的政治事物的化身。

results.name: she lived on supplements
results.english: something that is added to something else in order to improve it or complete it; something extra
results.example1: The doctor said she should be taking vitamin supplements. 醫生說她應該服用維生素補充劑。
results.example2: The money I get from teaching eveningnight classes provides a supplement to my main income. 我晚上教課所賺的錢可以補充我的主要收入。

results.name: sth is virulent
results.english: A virulent disease or poison is dangerous and spreads or affects people very quickly.
results.example1: A particularly virulent strain of flu has recently claimed a number of lives in the region. 一場有致命殺傷力的流感最近在這個地區奪去了許多人的生命。

results.name: arsenic
results.english: a chemical element that is very poisonous, often used to kill rats

results.name: a drawn-out death
results.english: lasting longer than is usual or necessary
results.example1: This dispute has been a long drawn-out affair. 此次爭端曠日持久。

results.name: a thriller
results.english: a book, play, or film that has an exciting story, often about solving a crime
results.chinese: （常指關於偵破罪案的）驚悚小說（或戲劇、電影）
results.example1: It's described here as a taut psychological thriller. 該作品在這處被稱為結構嚴密的心理驚悚小說。

results.name: gout
results.english: a painful disease that makes the joints (= places where two bones are connected), especially the feet, knees, and hands, swell

results.name: fairness
results.english: the quality of treating people equally or in a way that is right or reasonable
results.example1: He had a real sense of fairness and hated injustice. 他極富正義感，厭惡不義之事。
results.example2: The ban on media reporting has made some people question the fairness of the election (= ask whether it was fair). 媒體報道遭禁，一些人因而開始質疑選舉的公正性。

results.name: be on the prowl
results.english: to be moving around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard
results.example1: There was a fox on the prowl earlier. 早些時候有隻狐狸出沒於此。

results.name: a tendency that can pervert our faith
results.english: to change something so that it is not what it was or should be, or to influence someone in a harmful way
results.chinese: 侵害；歪曲；使走上邪路，使變壞
results.example1: Her ideas have been shamelessly perverted to serve the president's propaganda campaign. 為了配合總統的宣傳活動，她的想法被無恥地曲解了。
results.example2: The history teacher tried to pervert (= persuade into unacceptable sexual activity) the boys by showing them pornographic magazines. 這名歷史教師給男學生看色情雜誌，想引他們走上歧途。

results.name: checkered shirts
results.english: having a pattern of squares in two or more colours
results.chinese: 有不同顏色格子圖案的
results.example1: red and white chequered tablecloths 紅白格子桌布

results.name: cyanide
results.english: an extremely powerful poison that can kill people

results.name: reenact the crime
results.english: If you re-enact an event, you try to make it happen again in exactly the same way that it happened the first time, often as an entertainment or as a way to help people remember certain facts about an event.
results.chinese: 使重現；使重新發生；再次進行
results.example1: Police officers re-enacted the crime in an attempt to get witnesses to come forward. 員警重現了犯罪的經過，目的是讓目擊證人主動站出來。

results.name: dismay
results.english: a feeling of unhappiness and disappointment
results.example1: Aid workers were said to have been filled with dismay by the appalling conditions that the refugees were living in. 據說援助人員看到難民所處的惡劣生活環境時都感到非常難過。
results.example2: The fans watched in/with dismay as their team lost 42–11. 球迷們鬱悶地看著自己的球隊以42比11的比分輸掉了比賽。

results.name: make sb's skin crawl
results.english: If someone or something makes your skin crawl, you think they are very unpleasant or frightening.
results.chinese: （因令人不快或恐懼而）使人起雞皮疙瘩
results.example1: Just thinking about the way he had touched her made her skin crawl. 只要一想到他觸摸她的方式，就讓她渾身起雞皮疙瘩。

results.name: he flubbed
results.english: to fail or make a mistake, especially when performing
results.example1: He really flubbed badly by not catching the ball. 他沒能接住球，犯了大錯。
results.example2: Sheila flubbed her lines in the second act. 希拉在第二幕時念錯了臺詞。

results.name: bondage porn
results.english: the activity of tying parts of a person's body so that they cannot move in order to get or give sexual pleasure
results.chinese: （為獲得性快感的）捆綁式性交
results.example1: They were into (= they liked) bondage. 他們有捆綁式性交的癖好。
results.example2: bondage gear 捆綁式性交器具

results.name: pornography
results.english: books, magazines, films, etc. with no artistic value that describe or show sexual acts or naked people in a way that is intended to be sexually exciting
results.chinese: 淫穢作品；色情書刊（或電影等）
results.example1: hard(-core) (= very detailed) porn 赤裸裸的色情作品
results.example2: soft(-core) (= not very detailed) porn 非露骨的色情作品

results.name: a killing spree
results.english: a short period of doing a particular, usually enjoyable, activity much more than is usual
results.chinese: （常指過分的）玩樂；短暫的放縱
results.example1: I went on a drinking/shopping/spending spree on Saturday. 我星期六痛痛快快地喝了一通／瘋狂採購了一番／揮霍了一番。
results.example2: 20 people were shot dead in the city, making it the worst killing spree since the riots. 20人在市內被槍殺，這是暴動以來最可怕的殺戮行爲。

results.name: a snuff film
results.english: A snuff film is a genre or video that purports to show scenes of actual homicide.

results.name: what are you insinuating?
results.english: to suggest, without being direct, that something unpleasant is true
results.example1: [ + (that) ] Are you insinuating (that) I'm losing my nerve? 你是在暗示我膽怯了嗎？
results.example2: What are you insinuating, Daniel? 丹尼爾，你究竟在影射甚麼？

results.name: an arch nemesis
results.english: Someone's nemesis is a person or thing that is very difficult for them to defeat.

results.name: a jumpsuit
results.english: a piece of clothing that covers both the upper body and the legs

results.name: it shackles me
results.english: If you are shackled by something, it prevents you from doing what you want to do.
results.example1: The country is shackled by its own debts. 這個國家正爲其債務所困。

results.name: his final monologue in a play
results.english: a long speech by one person
results.chinese: （一個人的）滔滔不絕的話，長篇大論
results.example1: disapproving He subjected me to a monologue on his last stay in hospital. 他向我滔滔不絕地講述了他上次住院的經歷。

results.name: Her body had been mutilated
results.english: to damage something severely, especially by violently removing a part
results.example1: Her body had been mutilated beyond recognition. 她的屍體嚴重毀損，根本無法辨認。
results.example2: Self-hatred apparently drove her to mutilate her own face. 顯然是自我憎恨驅使她自毀面容。

results.name: mountain-esque
results.english: like or in the style of someone or their work
results.example1: Leonardo-esque 李奧納多（達文西）風格的
results.example2: Working there was like being trapped in a Kafkaesque nightmare. 在那裡工作就像是陷入了卡夫卡筆下的惡夢之中。

results.name: you look peaky
results.english: slightly ill, often looking pale
results.chinese: 面帶病容的；憔悴的；蒼白的
results.example1: You look a bit peaky, love, are you all right? 親愛的，你看起來有點憔悴，你沒事吧？

results.name: the riveted courtroom
results.english: to not be able to stop looking at something because it is so interesting or frightening
results.chinese: （因感到有趣而）目不轉睛地看；（因害怕而）動彈不得，呆若木雞
results.example1: It was an amazing film - I was absolutely riveted. 那部電影太精彩了——我完全被吸引住了。
results.example2: He pulled out a gun and I was riveted to the spot (= so frightened that I could not move). 他拔出了槍，我簡直被嚇呆了。
